text: a 9 mm nodular opacity is seen at the left lung base (series 3:8).few additional small ground-glass nodules are seen at both lung bases.there are trace bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis.coarse calcifications are seen in the breasts bilaterally.coronary artery calcifications are seen.the spleen is enlarged, consistent with underlying diagnosis of aml.focus of calcification in the spleen may reflect prior granulomatous disease.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, stomach, small bowel, and colon demonstrate no acute findings.colonic diverticula are seen without evidence for inflammation.the kidneys are atrophic bilaterally.multiple right parapelvic renal cysts are seen.small hypodensities arising from the left kidney may also represent cysts.no free intraperitoneal air is seen.numerous anterior abdominal wall varices are seen.coarse calcifications in the anterior abdominal subcutaneous fat and gluteal subcutaneous fat likely represent injection granulomas.
summary: nodular opacities in the left lower lung with additional small ground-glass opacities bilaterally may represent infection.chest ct recommended for further assessment given infectious symptoms.abdominal wall varices of indeterminate etiology.splenomegaly.coronary artery calcification.acute findings were discussed with dr.___ by dr.___ by telephone at 6:54 p.m.on ___.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, with associated atelectasis.however, underlying infection cannot be excluded.the liver demonstrates diffuse low attenuation without focal mass lesion.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder demonstrates a thickened wall, similar to ultrasound performed earlier the same day.in addition, there is low attenuation material in the gallbladder, likely sludge.the pancreas and right adrenal gland are unremarkable.there are two tiny calcifications within the left adrenal gland without associated mass lesion.the spleen is enlarged measuring up to 16.4 cm.two 1.5-cm splenules are noted in the splenic hilum.the kidneys are symmetric without evidence of hydronephrosis or stones.the opacified stomach and intra-abdominal loops of small bowel are unremarkable.oral contrast does not make it to the large bowel, however, the intra-abdominal loops of large bowel are unremarkable.the appendix is not definitely visualized, but there are no secondary signs of appendicitis.there is mild diffuse stranding in the subcutaneous fat and mesentery and a small amount of fluid in the right paracolic gutter consistent with generalized edema.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: small phlegmonous density anterior to the left sacroiliac joint and possibly continuous with the joint space, with pockets of gas within the left iliacus, piriformis and gluteus minimus muscles with associated rarefaction of the posterior left iliac bone, highly suspicious for septic arthritis of the left sacroiliac joint and associated osteomyelitis.small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.underlying pneumonia cannot be excluded.low attenuation of the liver is likely related to acute hepatitis or generalized edema.gallbladder sludge not seen on ultrasound, but may be related to fasting state.gallbladder wall thickening is likely related to diffuse edema rather than acute cholecystitis.splenomegaly.small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.findings were discussed at the time of interpretation via telephone with dr.___ ___ 1:53 pm ct abdomen w/o contrast; ct pelvis w/o contrast clip # ___ reason: please do abd/pelvic ct with po and pr contrast to eval for admitting diagnosis: hypotension ______________________________________________________________________________ final report (cont) ___ ___ and in person with drs.___ ___ and ___ ___ on ___.

text: bilateral pleural effusions have slightly increased since ___.a large hiatal hernia, and peri-fissural right upper lobe opacity are unchanged.the liver has a persistantly nodular contour and stable mild central biliary dilation.the noncontrast appearance of the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands is unremarkable.a subcentimeter hypodensity in the lower pole of the left kidney is too small to characterize.no ascites or adenopathy is seen.the stomach and small bowel are normal caliber and appearance without any evidence of wall thickening or obstruction.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal process.left adenexa remains slightly enlarged for age, but is not changed since ___.consider follow-up pelvic ultrasound in 12 months to reassess if no other cross-sectional studies are performed in the interim.persistant nodular cirrhotic liver slight increase in bilateral pleural effusions.

text: a pacemaker is in situ and the tip is seen in the right atrium.the lung bases are normal.below the diaphragm, some scattered foci of high density are seen in the liver consistent with granulomas.a larger area of low attenuation is seen in the right lobe of the liver in the dome in segment vii, which measures 4 cm in transverse x 4 cm in ap diameter.no other focal lesions identified.however this lesion and the liver were not fully evaluated as this is a non- contrast study.in relation to the gallbladder, multiple areas of high attenuation are seen consistent with cholelithiasis.the spleen is unremarkable.the adrenals are normal.the kidneys are unremarkable.the pancreas is atrophic.some subcentimeter retroperitoneal lymph nodes are noted that are not pathological by size criteria.an ivc filter is in situ.note is made of some vascular calcifications.the bowel where visualized is normal.no evidence of any mass lesions.some high attenuation is seen in the midline in the rectus muscle.this was also seen on the previous ct from ___ and is relatively unchanged.no significant free fluid.
summary: mass in the right lobe of the liver in segment vii, which may represent metastasis, incompletely characterized on this non-contrast ct and further imaging evaluation is advised.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.ivc filter in situ.grade i anterolisthesis of l4 on l5.pacemaker in situ.

text: ct abdomen: there is a large amount of free fluid within the peritoneal cavity.this fluid has not changed in amount compared with previous ct scan from ___.again are noted bilateral hypodense collections in the retroperitoneum consistent with hematomas.in the right side, the hematoma measures approximately 15 x 12 cm.this hematoma on the previous exam measured 16 x 13 cm in size.a catheter is noted within this collection.in the left posterior pararenal space, there is another hematoma that measures approximately 10 x 4.4 cm.this hematoma on the previous scan measured approximately 12 x 8 cm in size.an ivc filter is noted above the renal veins.both kidneys are enhancing symmetrically.both kidneys excrete contrast in normal fashion.there is gallbladder wall edema, most likely related to the presence of free fluid in the peritoneal cavity.the liver and spleen are unremarkable.the pancreas is normal.there is no biliary dilatation.there are multiple rib fractures in both right and left posterior hemithoraces.there is a 4.8 x 3.8 mm aneurysm of the infrarenal abdominal aorta.in addition, there is extensive calcification of both the aorta and iliac arteries.
summary: bilateral retroperitoneal hematomas.marked decrease in size of the left hematoma.mild decrease in size of the right hematoma.large amount of free fluid in the peritoneal cavity.infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm with extensive calcification of the aorta and iliac arteries.inferior vena cava filter above the renal veins.multiple rib fractures.left acetabular fracture and fracture of the superior pubic rami.bilateral pleural effusions, worse on the right than on the left, with atelectasis of the right lower lobe.diffuse calcification of the left coronary artery.

text: at the lung bases, there is increased ground- glass opacity which could be due to either expiration, or mild fluid overload.there is no pleural effusion or consolidation.the heart appears slightly enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.evaluation of intra-abdominal organs is somewhat limited given the lack of intravenous contrast material.there is a tiny calculus layering dependently within an otherwise normal- appearing gallbladder.there is no gallbladder distention or other evidence of cholecystitis.the liver, pancreas, spleen, kidneys, adrenal glands, stomach and duodenum are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.there is no fluid collection that would represent retroperitoneal hematoma.the abdominal aorta demonstrates atherosclerotic calcification, without aneurysmal dilatation.
summary: no retroperitoneal hematoma.mild inflammatory changes in the right groin consistent with prior catheterization.no focal hematoma.no acute abnormalities in the abdomen or pelvis.tiny calculus in the gallbladder without evidence of acute cholecystitis.mild ground-glass opacities at the lung bases could represent expiratory phase of imaging, or mild fluid overload.

text: the liver, gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.a 10x7mm round lipoma is visualized in the pancreatic head (2:73).there is no free gas or free fluid in the abdomen.there is no retroperitoneal, mesenteric or omental lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval resolution of pulmonary infiltrate and multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules.resolution of right pleural effusion with residual small left pleural effusion and pericardial effusion.no intra-abdominal or pelvic abscess.sacral spina bifida.

text: the right colon is surgically absent.the descending and sigmoid colon and rectum are unremarkable.the rectum has some stool within it.the bladder contents are unremarkable.the prostate demonstrates coarse central calcifications.
summary: two new wedge-shaped hypoenhancing regions in the periphery of the liver, probably infarcts, one at the inferior tip and the other in the inferior aspect of segment ivb.persistent fluid collection around the liver consistent with evolving hematoma, unchanged in size from the prior examination.no new fluid collections are identified.status post splenectomy with persistent splenic vein thrombosis and a residual splenule, unchanged.interval improvement in the bilateral pleural consolidations and effusions.right colectomy and end ileostomy without complications.

text: the visualized lung bases again demonstrate moderate bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, not significantly changed since the prior exam.previously noted centrilobular nodules are present, although less conspicuous on current exam.small pericardial effusion is slightly increased in size.absence of intravenous contrast limits evaluation of the abdominal parenchymal organs and vasculature.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and pancreas are unremarkable.note is again made of layering dense material within the gallbladder, most consistent with vicarious excretion of contrast.the gallbladder is again noted to be distended, without evidence of acute cholecystitis.midline surgical incision and staples are again noted.previously seen locules of gas in the anterior abdominal wall have resolved.marked calcification of the abdominal aorta and its branches is unchanged.there is no free intraperitoneal air.there is a moderate amount of free fluid within the abdomen, not significantly changed from prior exam.in some areas, there is layering density, likely representing layering blood.residual contrast material is seen within the colon.
summary: slight interval increase in size of right inguinal hematoma, which tracks slightly into the anterolateral right thigh.continued evidence of recent intraperitoneal bleeding is most likely related to recent surgery.no definite evidence of new intraperitoneal bleeding.no change in quantity of intraperitoneal fluid.unchanged moderate bilateral pleural effusions, and slight increase in small pericardial effusion.decreased prominence of centrilobular nodules at the lung bases, though these are only partially imaged.above findings discussed with dr.___ at 9:00 p.m.on ___.

text: liver enhances homogeneously, without focal lesion.there is no biliary ductal dilatation or ascites.there are tiny foci of ___, in the common hepatic duct and in the left lobe of the liver, consistent with history of recent ercp.there is a single tiny gallstone within the gallbladder, but the gallbladder is not distended and there is no wall thickening.the pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.stomach and intra- abdominal loops of bowel are normal.there has been prior right hemicolectomy, and anastomotic site in the right lower quadrant is normal in appearance, without evidence of obstruction.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically, with unchanged appearance of left upj obstruction, with moderate left-sided hydroureteronephrosis.there is no free intraperitoneal air, free fluid, or abnormal intra-abdominal lymphadenopathy.no discrete fluid collection or abscess is present.evaluation of the vasculature is slightly limited, as this study is not specifically tailored for angiographic detail.known stenosis/occlusion of the celiac axis and sma origins is redemonstrated.the ___ appears patent, and slightly enlarged, possibly due to increased collateral flow secondary to other stenoses.
summary: no evidence of abscess or other signs of infection in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.cholelithiasis, without evidence of cholecystitis.tiny foci of ___, ___ expected finding given recent ercp.unchanged appearance of left upj obstruction, with moderate left-sided hydronephrosis.above findings discussed with dr.___ at 6:00 p.m.on ___.

text: the lung bases are clear.the liver demonstrates no focal lesion or biliary dilatation.the gallbladder demonstrates gallstones, but there is no wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.the spleen is normal in size and appearance.the pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance with and excrete contrast symmetrically.in the lower pole of right kidney, there is a well-circumscribed subcentimeter hypodensities too small to characterize, likely represents a cyst.the aorta, ivc, portal vein and their major branches all appear patent.no lymphadenopathy is seen.no free air is noted.in the left upper abdominal wall, there is an 8 x 3 cm fluid collection in the same area of the previously described hematoma as per the operative note from ___.the current fluid collection appears decreased in size from the prior study, although the fluid does track around loops of jejunum.the fluid within the abdominal wall is relatively well organized while the fluid around the jejunum is not well delineated.additionally, the loop of jejunum around which the fluid gathers appears thickened.there is no evidence of obstruction as contrast is able to pass down into the colon.ill-defined area of hypodensity in the left upper quadrant amongst loops of bowel measures approximately 3.0 x 2.1 cm (se2a:im29).it is unclear whether this represents tracking fluid, post surgical change, or residual/recurrent disease.additionally, in the lower midline abdominal wall, there is a 19 x 16 mm fluid collection likely within the prior surgical site.the colon demonstrates diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: no evidence of obstruction or perforation.left upper abdominal wall fluid collection may represent postoperative changes, although superinfection cannot be ruled out; this also applies to the lower midline, ventral abdominal wall fluid collection.thickened loop of jejunum may represent infectious, inflammatory, or post-operative changes, although neoplastic recurrence cannot be ruled out.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.fibroid uterus with degenerated fibroid again seen.

text: in the visualized lung, there is a small left-sided pleural effusion.bilateral dependent atelectasis is noted.in the visualized heart, there is significant coronary artery calcification.the liver is normal without focal lesions.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands are normal.there is scattered focal fatty infiltrates of the pancreas, but without acute abnormality.the right kidney is slightly horizontally rotated, but there is no evidence of renal stone or hydronephrosis in either side.prompt excretion of iv contrast is noted bilaterally.the stomach and duodenum are unremarkable.there is no free fluid, air or lymphadenopathy in the intra-abdominal cavity.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal process.no intra-abdominal fluid collection to suggest abscess.fibroid uterus.significant vascular calcification along the descending aorta and its major branches.small left-sided pleural effusion.

text: the visualized bases of the lungs demonstrate bilateral atelectatic changes.otherwise, significant atherosclerotic calcifications are visualized at the coronary arteries.evaluation of the abdominal structures is limited due to lack of iv contrast.however, multiple, at least three, hypodensities are seen in the liver though difficult to delineate, are consistent with the patient's known history of metastases to liver (2:8, 17), and are more conspicuous than on ct from ___ .otherwise, the gallbladder is not distended with no evidence of stones.the spleen, visualized loops of small and large bowel, bilateral kidneys, and bilateral adrenal glands are within normal limits.a dudodenal diverticulum is noted.a small splenule is visualized.there is no free fluid or free air throughout the abdomen.no evidence of hemorrhage.the pancreas is within normal limits.atherosclerotic calcifications are present in the abdominal aorta, but the aorta is of normal caliber and contour.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.

text: lung bases are clear.again seen are small bilateral pleural effusions and moderate pericardial effusion, unchanged.stable pleural parenchymal scarring is noted within the lingular lobe likely representing post-radiation changes.patient is status post left mastectomy.within the limitations of a non-contrast exam, no focal lesion is identified within the liver.previously identified portal venous gas is not appreciated on today's exam.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, pancrease, kidneys are unremarkable.compared to the prior exam from ___, there is a marked to complete resolution of the previously described intramural gas within the stomach wall.the intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.small umbilical hernia is identified.no intra-abdominal free air is detected.small amount of abdominal ascites is present.small stable retroperitoneal lymphnodes are present, which do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.

text: there is no pelvic free fluid or lymphadenopathy.foley catheter is seen within the bladder.patient is status post hysterectomy.
summary: no evidence of bowel obstruction or other acute pathology.significant fecal loading of the colon.small hiatal hernia.

text: a nasogastric tube terminates within the stomach.there is a small hiatal hernia (2:36).non-contrast enhanced images of the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel appear normal.numerous non-enlarged mesenteric and paraaortic lymph nodes are seen.there is moderate calcification of the abdominal aorta.a focal outpouching at the infrarenal portion (2:72) is difficult to evaluate due to lack of calcification and iv contrast,likely reflects a focal, small, sacular aneurysm.
summary: moderate bibasilar dependent atelectasis with focal consolidations, which may represent aspiration.enlarged pretracheal lymph node, likely reactive.numerous mesenteric and paraaortic lymph nodes.small sacular aneurysm of the infrarenal portion of the aorta, measuring 2.6 cm in transverse diameter (on coronal image).follow-up ultrasound in 6 months can be performed to assess stability, given the lack of comparison studies.small hiatal hernia.fat-containing left inguinal hernia.

text: a moderate amount of fluid is present in the pelvis.the rectum, distal ureters, bladder, adnexa are unremarkable.a cyst is seen in the lower uterine segment.this is likely a nabothian cyst.subcutaneous fat stranding present in the abdomen and back regions consistent with edema.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: fluid collection in the mid-abdomen concerning for an abscess.this is amenable to percutaneous drainage.large bilateral pleural effusions.ascites.extensive subcutaneous edema.lower uterine cystic lesion, likely representing a nabothian cyst.recommend correlation with ultrasound.

text: ct of the lungs with iv contrast: small 2mm pulmonary nodules in the right upper lobe and left lower lobe are stable since ___.otherwise, the lungs are clear bilaterally.there is no hilar, mediastinal, or axillary lymphadenopathy.again seen is dense calcification of the aortic root, unchanged.the heart size is normal.
summary: vague area of hypoenhancement at the periphery of the spleen may represent a small infarct.otherwise, no other areas of infarct noted.stable splenomegaly.

text: at the lung bases, pulmonary ground glass opacities have largely resolved, with some residual scattered disease that may represent edema, atelectasis, or consolidation.bilateral pleural effusions have also nearly resolved, with a persistent small effusion on the left.relative hypoattenuation of the blood pool relative to the intraventricular septum is consistent with anemia.
summary: improvement in pulmonary opacities and bilateral effusions.this most likely reflects edema, although superimposed atelectasis and/or infection may also be present.persistent large-volume ascites.massive splenomegaly.

text: there is right lower lobe atelectasis.consolidation with air bronchograms at the left lower lobe may represent atelectasis versus infiltrate.the liver is remarkable for a right biliary stent and multiple surgical clips.small amount of air is seen within the left biliary tree.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and small bowel loops are within normal limits.the kidneys are atrophic.small calcification at the mid left kidney may represent a vascular calcification or a nonobstructing renal stone.feeding tube is seen with the tip in the third portion of the duodenum.there is diffuse bowel wall thickening involving the terminal ileum extending into the ascending and portions of the transverse colon.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.diffuse peritoneal fluid of low attenuation is consistent with ascites.there is no free air.
summary: left lower lobe consolidation with air bronchograms, which may represent pneumonia or atelectasis.ascites.no focal fluid collections to suggest an abscess.left renal calcification, which may represent a vascular calcification or nonobstructing renal stone.nonspecific thickening of the terminal ileum extending into the right end part of the transverse colon.possible causes include infectious colitis, ischemia, or third-spaced fluid.status post biliary stenting with small amounts of air in the left hepatic ducts.extensive destruction of lower thoracic vertebral bodies, status post vertebroplasty.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis in both lower lobes.there is extensive calcification in the aortic annulus and both coronary arteries.evaluation of the solid abdominal organs is limited without iv contrast.no gross hepatic or splenic lesions are identified.clips are seen in the right upper quadrant from prior cholecystectomy.the study cannot evaluate for dilatation of the intrahepatic ducts without iv contrast.there is massive inflammatory stranding surrounding the pancreas.no definite fluid collections are seen.multiple surgical drains are seen in the right upper quadrant.there is no evidence of oral contrast leak.there is a small air bubble lateral to the descending portion of the duodenum.there is a moderate amount of free fluid seen in the abdomen in the left paracolic gutter.this demonstrates attenuation values of simple fluid.there is also some fluid around the spleen.the kidneys are small and atrophic appearing, with a rounded exophytic structure which is isodense to renal parnechyma.the adrenal glands are normal.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.
summary: severe inflammatory changes surrounding the pancreas.small bilateral pleural effusions, moderate amount of fluid in the left paracolic gutter, and extensive subcutaneous edema.this study cannot evaluate for pancreatic necrosis (no iv contrast).small air bubble seen lateral to the descending portion of the duodenum, likely due to surgical drains.diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.no evidence of intra-abdominal abscess.rounded, 15 mm exophytic left renal nodule.further evaluation with ultrasound or mri is reccommended to exclude a renal mass.

text: the distal ureters, bladder, rectum, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there are multiple bilateral inguinal lymph nodes, the largest in the right groin measuring 2.1 x 0.9 cm.this is a nonspecific finding and these nodes do not meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.the osseous structures reveal no suspicious or sclerotic lesions.there is a soft tissue defect in the skin of the back at the level of the sacrum.stranding is present within the subcutaneous tissues, consistent with edema.this is likely the site of the patient's known pilonidal cyst infection.the soft tissue defect does not extend down to the bone.
summary: bilateral cavitary nodular pulmonary opacities, not significantly changed from ___.these are likely consistent with septic emboli.no intra-abdominal fluid collections.

text: there is marked peripancreatic stranding and fluid which is more prominent on the current study, and consistent with the patient's history of pancreatitis.following contrast administration, there is a stable area of hypoenhancement involving the pancreatic neck and portions of the adjacent pancreatic body and head, which is consistent with pancreatic necrosis.the majority of the pancreatic body, tail, and uncinate process enhance normally.no focal or organized fluid collections are identified.there is a small amount of free fluid noted throughout the abdomen.there is an 8-mm filling defect within the splenic vein (501b:48), likely representing a tiny non-occlusive splenic vein thrombus.the smv and portal veins are patent.no splenic artery pseudoaneurysms are identified.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, and large bowel are normal in appearance.again noted is thickening of the duodenal wall involving the first through third portions, likely secondary to adjacent reactive pancreatic inflammation.numerous low-density lesions are noted within the kidneys bilaterally, which are unchanged from the prior study, many of which are too small to characterize.again noted is an indeterminate exophytic cystic lesion of the upper pole of the left kidney measuring 3 cm in diameter.no hydronephrosis is noted bilaterally.there is no free air in the abdomen.the jejunum and ileum are normal in appearance with no evidence of obstruction.
summary: no definite pulmonary embolism identified.limited evaluation of the subsegmental branches on the left and the segmental and subsegmental branches of the right pulmonary arteries secondary to bolus timing.progression of marked edema and peripancreatic stranding, consistent with patient's history of pancreatitis.focal area of hypoenhancement involving the pancreatic neck and portions of the body and head, most suggestive of pancreatic necrosis.no organized fluid collections identified.indeterminate 3 cm cystic lesion exophytic off the upper pole of the left kidney in addition to multiple bilateral renal cysts, which are redemonstrated.a renal ultrasound or mri may be obtained for further characterization as previously recommended on an outpatient basis.small left pleural effusion and adjacent airspace disease, most likely representing atelectasis.an 8 mm filling defect within the splenic vein which may represent a tiny nonocclusive splenic vein thrombosis.

text: there is bilateral dependent atelectasis, left greater than right, and associated small pleural effusions.the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the gallbladder is full of high density material, likely relating to excretion of contrast post- cath.the kidneys are atrophic and contain both large and small simple renal cysts.the large and small bowel are adequately visualized and show no areas of inflammation, obstruction, or wall thickening.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.there is no evidence of a retroperitoneal hematoma.
summary: no evidence of intra-abdominal, pelvic, or retroperitoneal hematoma.hematoma located over the right groin containing air likely represented to post-surgical changes.on a non-contrast study active extravasation to this region cannot be determined.as no pre-op study was performed, cannot state whether or not this collection is larger or smaller.fluid is seen tracking throughout the subcutaneous tissues of the left thigh but there is no deep thigh muscle hematoma.these findings were discussed with the clinical house staff.

text: there is atelectasis at the lung bases bilaterally.this appears not significantly changed compared with the prior examination.again demonstrated, is a large hiatal hernia.the ng tube is coiled within the hernia and does not pass below the hemidiaphragm.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, large and small bowel are unremarkable.again demonstrated is splenomegalty.the left kidney is slightly atrophic.there is symmetric excretion of contrast from both kidneys.there is a 3 cm simple cyst in the lowrer pole of the right kidney.there is a small cortical defect at the mid-portion of the right kidney with fatty tissue present consistent with an angiomyolipoma.there are several rounded hypodense lesions associated with the left kidney.these likely represent simple renal cysts.however, in the lower pole of the left kidney, there is an ovoid hypodense lesion with a subtle degree of central enhancement.though this may represent a simple renal cyst, its appearance is not entirely characteristic.there is no free fluid in the abdomen.there is no significant retroperitoneal mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
summary: there is a large hiatal hernia containing a coiled ng tube.splenomegaly.bilateral renal cysts.the cystic structure at the lower pole of the left kidney is not clearly meeting criteria for a simple renal cyst.due to its single internal septaion it can be classified as a bosniak type ii, and is most probably benign.sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.no inflammatory changes noted throughout the bowel loops.

text: innumerable 1 - 4 cm metastases involve the entire liver and have markedly progressed since ___.the spleen, adrenals, pancreas, and kidneys are unremarkable.stable sub 5 mm well circumscribed hypodense lesions in the periphery of both kidneys likely represent cysts, although are too small to be characterized.the abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable without evidence of pneumatosis, free air or obstruction.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal nodes do not meet ct size criteria for enlargement.
summary: marked progression in size of innumerable liver metastases since ___.otherwise little change.

text: there are moderate bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar atelectasis.note is made of pacemaker leads.an ng tube is seen entering the stomach.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.two small high-attenuation foci are noted in the right kidney and may represent hyperdense cysts.a tiny nonobstructing calculus is noted in a mid pole calix of the left kidney.nonspecific perinephric stranding is seen bilaterally.bowel loops are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no evidence of a retroperitoneal hematoma.note is made of extensive vascular calcifications.

text: the massively distended, air-filled sigmoid colon is similar in appearance.there is a smooth transition in the rectosigmoid junction with fluid-filled rectum.small amount of fecal material is noted in the rectum.fecal loading in the proximal colon is again noted.loops of small bowel are normal in size and patent with oral contrast.there is no pneumatosis or portal venous gas.the normally distended bladder is noted with an asymmetric, smooth outpouching herniating into the left inguinal region.the uterus is not well visualized.artifacts from bilateral hip prostheses obscuring evaluation of the deep pelvic structures.marked vascular calcification is noted along the aorta and its major branches.no free air, fluid, lymphadenopathy is noted in the pelvis.

text: the uterus, which contains a small amount of endometrial fluid, is unchanged.there is slight fat stranding surrounding the sigmoid colon in the upper pelvis, superior and posterior to the uterus with slight fat stranding, representing probable diverticulitis.this appearance is best seen on series 2, image 38.otherwise, the colon is unremarkable.again, as previously noted, the appendix is not identified.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy or free fluid.
summary: likely sigmoid diverticulitis, without abscess.slightly larger small bilateral pleural effusions.

text: minimal pleural effusion is seen in the right, which has decreased significantly as compared to the previous study.no pleural effusion seen on the left.patchy ground-glass opacity is seen in the right middle lobe which is new as compared to the previous study.large amount of ascites is seen in the abdomen which has increased considerably compared to the previous study.liver shows lobulated contour, findings which are consistent with cirrhosis.linear calcifications are seen at the lvel of the posterior liver capsule, within the right lobe.no evidence of intrahepatic bile dilatation is seen.within the limitations of this non-contrast study, the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenals and kidneys are within normal limits.a splenorenal shunt is noted.nasogastric tube is seen with its distal tip in the second portion of the duodenum.mild dilatation of a number of jejunal loops up to 3.2 cm in diameter, without definitive transition point.mild wall edema is possible and likely related to existing ascitis.diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon and descending colon is noted.no evidence of retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is seen.diffuse subcutaneous edema (i.e.anasarca) is noted.diffuse arteriosclerosis of abdominal aorta is seen.

text: bilateral lower thoraces show new or increased moderate pleural effusions with adjacent compressive atelectasis.focal opacities in the right lateral lower lobe and lingula may represent atelectasis versus infection, however malignancy is not necessarily excluded.emphysema.the visualized heart shows moderate stable amount of pericardial effusion.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, and pancreas are unremarkable.bilateral adrenal glands are within normal limits.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis or renal calculi.oral contrast terminates in the left lower quadrant, distal to that the bowel loops are relatively ___.however, there is slight decrease in size of some of the previously seen small bowel loops.this likely represents resolving small bowel obstruction.a nasogastric tube terminates within the stomach lumen (300b:16).mild mesenteric edema is noted which is likely post-surgical.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.the patient is status post aortobifemoral bypass graft which appears widely patent.mild adjacent fluid and stranding is noted which might be post-surgical.no loculated fluid collections are identified.there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification of native abdominal and iliac branches.portions of the pelvis are incompletely evaluated due to streak artifact from bilateral hip hardware.within this limitation, the bladder, distal ureters, rectum, and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.bilateral total hip arthroplasties are noted.multilevel degenerative changes are noted within the visualized thoracolumbar spine.

text: the included portions of the lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis.no pleural effusion is seen.within the abdomen, there are circumferential wall thickening and adjacent fat stranding involving the ascending colon (2:47).a few foci of air are not clearly intraluminal (2:47) and may represent a small contained perforation.no organized fluid collection or evidence of abscess formation is seen.a small amount of fluid is seen tracking along the right paracolic gutter into the pelvis.no evidence of obstruction.there is a porcelain gallbladder.the liver, spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the right kidney contains a 4-mm hyperdensity in the lower pole, likely representing a non-obstructing stone.the left kidney demonstrates significant changes which appear chronic.there is complete cortical atrophy with cystic changes and dilated pelvis.a 12 mm stone is present in the inferior portion.a left-sided ureter is not clearly identified.the bladder appears unremarkable.there are coarse prostatic calcifications.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are seen.there are vascular calcifications.no concerning osseous lesion is seen.
summary: circumferential wall thickening and inflammation involving the ascending colon near the hepatic flexure.this may be related to recent procedure with possible intramural hematoma.small foci of air, which appear extraluminal, may represent contained perforation.no evidence of organizing fluid collection or abscess.bibasilar atelectasis.chronic-appearing left renal cortical atrophy with large cystic formations and dilated pelvis could be secondary to chronic upj obstruction.porcelain gallbladder for which non-emergent surgical consultation recommended.

text: two nodules at the right lung base, one along the pleural surface and one nodule at the left lung base are unchanged from the prior study.no new nodules are present.there are no pleural effusions.the coronary arteries are calcified.evaluation of the solid organs of the upper abdomen is limited without intravenous contrast.air within the intrahepatic biliary system is again seen consistent with biliary stent.the air-filled biliary ducts are predominantly in the left hepatic lobe and appear slightly dilated when compared to the prior study.the biliary stent itself is stablely positioned.no obvious new focal hepatic lesions are seen.no gross abnormalities are identified in the spleen or adrenal glands.the pancreatic body and tail are atrophied.the mass in the region of the porta/pancreatic head is unchanged in size and appearance.the gallbladder is not seen.several renal cysts are unchanged.the visualized loops of small bowel are normal and there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there is no lymphadenopathy.multiple collateral vessels are seen around the spleen and stomach consistent with portal hypertension.the duodenal stent is stablely positioned and contrast freely passes through to the distal bowel loops.there is no interval change in the infrarenal aortic aneurysm which measures 3.5 x 3.2 cm and there is no evidence of extravasation.an axial bifemoral bypass graft is seen.multiple diverticula are noted in the sigmoid colon with no evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: slight interval distention of air-filled bile ducts.the biliary stent and duodenal stent are stablely positioned and the duodenal stent is patent.stable appearance of mass in the region of the porta/pancreatic head.stable infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.stable bibasilar pulmonary nodules.collateralization of vessels around the stomach and spleen consistent with portal hypertension.this is unchanged from the prior study.calcified coronary arteries.

summary: no evidence of aortic or intraabdominal injury.fracture of the left eighth rib.large central right-sided lung mass which encases the right main stem bronchus.there are also several enlarged mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes.these findings are consistent with the patient's known history of lung cancer.two low-attenuation lesions within the liver consistent with metastases.prominent adrenal glands with a focal area of low attenuation in the left adrenal gland, concerning for adrenal metastases.right main stem bronchus intubation.

text: pelvic small and large bowel loops, prostate, and bladder are unremarkable.there is no lymphadenopathy or ascites.
summary: interval placement of two pigtail catheters connecting the pancreatic pseudocyst to the stomach.development of surrounding fat-stranding, wall thickening and enhancement, and internal hyperattenuating fluid material mixed with air within the pseudocyst suggesting infection.atrophy of the pancreatic parenchyma and stable appearance of dilatation of the pancreatic duct.stable appearance of multiple splenic lesions, which are likely benign but low grade metastatic disease or lymphoma cannot be excluded.

text: within the pelvis located superior to the bladder is an area of mottled density containing both soft tissue and air.this is located just above the patient's hartmann pouch and the ___ ___- ___ drain runs directly through this area.there is contrast within the rectum.at this point, it was decided to insert a small catheter into the patient's rectum, followed by infusion of dilute contrast.when this was performed, it was noted that contrast not only flowed into the patient's hartmann pouch but also flowed superiorly around the area of mottled density and adjacent to several small bowel loops.the findings are consistent with a large stool ball located centrally within the pelvis surrounded by contrast due to anastomotic breakdown of the patient's hartmann pouch.
summary: anastomotic breakdown along the left superior region of the patient's hartmann pouch denoting the presence of a large stool ball within the pelvis, as described above.probable small bowel ileus.

text: diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon without evidence of diverticulitis is again visualized.there is trace free fluid in the pelvis.otherwise, there is no free air throughout the pelvis.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.the bladder and prostate are within normal limits.again visualized is a thrombus at the indwelling infrarenal ivc catheter, slightly decreased in extent compared to the prior exam.there is, however, evidence of new thrombus in the left common iliac vein.thrombus throughout bilateral common femoral veins below the pelvic inlet is again visualized which appears to now extend into the external iliac veins bilaterally.

text: patchy airspace disease is seen at both lung bases.the recently placed vsd closure device is noted.there are also trace bilateral pleural effusions.there is a small amount of perihepatic along with perisplenic ascites.a percutaneous cholecystostomy tube is positioned within a relatively decompressed gallbladder.there are areas of hyperdensity noted within the perihepatic space along the right lateral abdomen, findings compatible with hematoma (likely from recent intervention).the spleen is normal in size.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation.a nasogastric tube is present within the stomach.there is a large amount of contrast material retained within the stomach, with subsequent streak artifact in the upper abdomen.the pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are grossly unremarkable on this non-contrast exam.there is some calcified plaque in the abdominal aorta.there is no extraluminal gas seen.small and large bowel loops are normal in caliber.some low-density and high-density fluid is noted tracking along the right paracolic gutter, also likely sequelae from recent procedure.

text: there is an ill-defined hematoma within the right gluteus maximus with approximate measurements of 5 x 2 cm.there is stranding in the subcutaneous tissue overlying this, and a focus of heterotopic ossification (2; 42).there is redemonstration of a comminuted overriding, medially angulated intertrochanteric right femoral fracture.there is marked degenerative change of the visualized lumbar spine with compression deformity of l5 as well as decreased vertebral body heights at l4 and l3.there is grade 1 anterolisthesis of l4 on l5.there is marked facet degenerative change of the visualized lumbar spine.evaluation of the pelvic organs is limited by lack of intravenous contrast; however within these limitations, a foley catheter lies within the bladder with air seen within the bladder as well.the visualized aorta is normal in caliber but markedly calcified.there is a 4 x 3 cm cystic structure to the left of the rectum.
summary: ill-defined hematoma within the right gluteus maximus.cystic structure within the pelvis.this should be correlated for surgical history, and if the patient still has her ovaries, this should be further evaluated with pelvic ultrasound to exclude malignancy.redemonstration of intertrochanteric right femoral fracture.marked degenerative change of the visualized lumbar spine.

text: prostate and urinary bladder appear unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymph nodes are present.the large bowel displays moderate-to-severe colonic diverticulosis with no findings of acute diverticulitis.trace amount edema/fluid is noted within the left anterior pararenal space.
summary: marked extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation to 1.6 cm with mild-to-moderate intra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation with high-density material within the distal cbd with pancreatitis in the head and neck, raising the question of gallstone pancreatitis.consultation with ercp service is recommended.the gallbladder is moderately distended without other secondary findings of acute cholecystitis noted.known metastatic lung cancer with partially visualized probable metastases within the right lower lobe and left lower lobe.small left pleural effusion and trace right pleural effusion.periosteal reaction in femoral shafts likely secondary to hypertrophic pulmonary osteoarthropathy.moderate-to-severe colonic diverticulosis with no findings of acute diverticulitis.no pneumoperitoneum.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear.there are no pleural effusions.there is a fairly large volume of ascites within the abdomen which has increased in the interval.the liver has a somewhat nodular contour, in keeping with cirrhosis.allowing for the limitations of a non-contrast exam, no liver masses are identified.the gallbladder is not seen.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear grossly normal.note is made of extensive vascular calcifications involving the abdominal aorta and its major branches.limited evaluation of the bowel is unremarkable.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis at the lung bases.no pericardial effusion.heterogenous, loww attenuation material containing a few locules of gas representing the surgicel is seen at the superior and anterior pole of spleen with no evidence of underlying splenic hematoma or infarct.the liver, adrenal glands, pancreas are normal in appearance.the gallbladder is fluid filled.visualized loops of bowel are normal caliber.there is a trace amount of ascites.the proximal aorta and proximal limbs of the aortobifem graft are demonstrated and enhance normally.there is retrograde perfusion of into the native iliac arteries.the native aorta is thrombosed.there is asymmetric renal perfusion with relative decreased enhancement seen in the left kidney.the left renal vein is suddenly curtailed as it approaches the midline and appears to drain through an enlarged, left lumbar vein collateral.both the left renal vein and proximal portion of the draining collateral are filled with partially occlusive thrombus.the right renal vein enhances normally.the renal arteries enhance normally.there are no lytic or sclerotic bone lesions.
summary: no evidence of splenic hematoma or laceration.partially occlusive thrombus fills the left renal vein and which is sharply curtailed as it approaches midline.drainage is via an enlarged left lumbar collateral which is also partially thrombosed.asymmetric renal enhancement with relative decreased enhancement of the left kidney.findings were discussed with dr.___ of the vascular surgery team at approximately 5:30 p.m.on ___.

text: the lung bases are unremarkable.there is cardiomegaly, with the inferior aspect of a pacemaker imaged in the right ventricle.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, large bowel and small bowel appear unremarkable on this non-contrast ct study.there is no lymphadenopathy, free fluid, or free air.the kidneys demonstrate no evidence of nephrolithiasis or hydronephrosis.a left-sided renal cyst near the interpolar region laterally is unchanged (3:38).

text: ct abdomen: there is diffuse anasarca.midline skin staples from recent abdominal surgery are present.there are moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent compressive atelectasis, similar to the ___ study.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.the patient is status post splenectomy.a percutaneous drain is present in the post-splenectomy site.just superior to the percutaneous drain in the left upper quadrant, there is a thin, curvilinear configuration of fluid just beneath the diaphragm, which measures approximately 8.5 cm (transverse) x 0.8 cm (cc) x 6.7 cm (ap).it measures simple fluid density and portions of it appear to be in continuity with the free fluid within the intraperitoneal cavity.suture material is noted along the fundus of the stomach.a percutaneous gj tube is in place, the tip ending in the proximal small bowel.a plastic biliary stent is also in place.the adrenal glands, kidneys, and liver are within normal limits.there is no extra-hepatic biliary dilation.mild central intrahepatic biliary dilation persists.multiple small calcified gallstones are again noted within the gallbladder.multiple punctate hyperdensities are again noted throughout the pancreas, consistent with chronic pancreatitis.in addition, the body and head of the pancreas continues to enhance.the tail is not well seen; however, when compared to the prior outside hospital cts and mrs ___ ___, the tail was not well seen on either of these studies either.there is a moderate amount of ascites, similar in amount to the outside hospital study of ___.mild peritoneal enhancement is present.while there is a small amount of free fluid within the retroperitoneum, no discrete fluid collection is seen.there is mild bowel wall thickening, likely secondary to the ascites.
summary: remaining head and body of the pancreas continues to enhance.the tail is not well visualized; however, the pancreatic tail was not well seen the outside hospital mri and ct of ___, either.calcifications throughout the remaining pancreas are consistent with history of chronic pancreatitis.moderate amount of intraperitoneal free fluid, stable since ___.thin, curvilinear configuration of fluid in the post-splenectomy site; is unclear whether this is an actual separate fluid collection or in continuity with the free fluid within the abdomen.it measures simple fluid density and could represent a small post-operative seroma versus ascites tracking into the post-splenectomy site.percutaneous abdominal drain ending in the left upper quadrant ends inferiorly to the above described fluid.small amount of retroperitoneal fluid, likely related to diffuse anasarca, without a discrete fluid collection.moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent compressive atelectasis, stable.biliary stent and percutaneous gj tube are in place.cholelithiasis.

text: there has been interval development of interstitial thickening of the dependent portions of the visualized lower lobes, probably due to volume overload.there are dense coronary artery calcifications.evaluation of the abdominal organs is limited by the non-contrast technique.there is a nasogastric tube terminating in the stomach.tiny punctate calcification of the right lobe of the liver is unchanged and may represent old granulomatous disease or prior insult.the gallbladder is decompressed.the pancreas is atrophic.as before, there are dense abdominal arterial atherosclerotic calcifications including of the renal arteries.curvilinear calcific densities at the right renal lower pole are unchanged and probably represent vascular calcifications.there is no hydronephrosis.a 2.2 x 1.5 cm nodule of the left adrenal gland is stable and not fully characterized on this non-contrast examination.the right adrenal gland is unremarkable.the bowel loops are decompressed.there is no obstruction.oral contrast passes freely through to the rectum.the left iliopsoas muscle is expanded with a heterogeneous mixed-density collection consistent with retroperitoneal hematoma which extends down into the left groin.on maximal axial dimension, it measures 7.3 x 9.0 cm.there is no free intraperitoneal gas or fluid.
summary: large left retroperitoneal hematoma involving the iliopsoas extends down into the left groin.unchanged nodular enlargement of the left adrenal gland is incompletely characterized on this non-contrast ct.interstitial thickening of the dependent lung bases suggest volume overload.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 7:50 p.m.on ___.

text: visualized lung bases are clear.there is minimal bibasilar atelectasis.there is no consolidation or effusion.within limits of the non-contrast study, the liver appears unchanged.there is no new intrahepatic ductal dilatation.patency of the hepatic arteries, veins, and portal veins cannot be assessed on this non-contrast study.there is a mild amount of perihepatic ascites adjacent to the posterior liver margin, unchanged from prior study.inferior to the porta hepatis, there is an enlarged low-density simple fluid collection measuring up to 4.5 x 7.2 cm (2:34).the low density suggests this is not hemorrhage, but rather more likely simple fluid.the fluid collection in the splenectomy bed, drained by a pigtail catheter, has resolved.there is no residual fluid collection in the region of the drainage catheter.the kidneys, adrenal glands, and pancreas appear unremarkable.there is no hydronephrosis.there is no pancreatic ductal dilatation.the stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.retained contrast is seen within the colon.a nasoenteric tube is seen in post-pyloric position.
summary: resolution of fluid collection in splenectomy bed, with no residual collection seen surrounding the tip of the drainage catheter.enlarged, thin-rimmed simple fluid collection inferior to the porta hepatis.given low density, this is unlikely to represent hemorrhage.within the limits of non-contrast study, the liver appears unchanged.there is no new biliary ductal dilatation.

text: the lung bases are clear.tiny nodular opacity at the left lung base anteriorly may represent a tiny pulmonary nodule.heart and pericardium are unremarkable.there is left-sided intrahepatic pneumobilia, related to the prior surgery.there is a percutaneous transhepatic biliary drain with its pigtail within the hepatic hilum, unchanged from the prior study.multiple surgical clips from prior cholecystectomy and revision procedures.there remains extensive inflammatory stranding involving the surgical bed, adjacent hepatic flexure of the colon, and omentum anteriorly, not significantly changed from the prior study.there is no organized fluid collection or abscess.the fluid collection at the level of the pancreatic tail is slightly decreased in size compared to the prior study.tiny amounts of free air in the abdomen anteriorly, also present on the prior study.no evidence of significant intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.no evidence of bowel obstruction.contrast passes into the distal small bowel and colon.stable right adrenal adenoma.atrophic native kidneys.
summary: stable appearance of the perihepatic inflammatory process, involving the surgical bed, hepatic flexure, and omentum.no organized abscess/fluid collection.interval decrease in size in the small fluid collection adjacent to the pancreatic tail.no evidence of bowel obstruction.right adrenal adenoma.probable tiny left lower lobe pulmonary nodule.

text: the lung bases are clear bilaterally.heart size is normal.patient is status post subtotal colectomy and ileosigmoid anastomosis for a prior cecal volvulus.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, pancreas, bladder are within normal limits.the bowel is malrotated and there is a transposition of normal configuration of the superior mesenteric vein and artery with the superior mesenteric vein to the left of the superior mesenteric artery.this configuration, however, is stable since the previous study of ___.however, at this time, there is no evidence of acute volvulus.there is no free air.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.there is periportal edema within the liver, nonspecific.otherwise, the liver is normal in appearance.
summary: again seen are findings consistent with malrotation, but no evidence of acute volvulus.stable appearance of mildly distended loops of the distal ileum proximal to the ileosigmoid anastomosis.no evidence of obstruction with contrast passing through to the colon.colonoscopy is a more sensitive study in the setting of melena.continued large amount of fecal material within the sigmoid colon and rectum.periportal edema, nonspecific finding, but could represent fluid overload/resuscitation or underlying liver disease.free fluid in the pelvis, which is slightly more than expected for normal physiologic fluid.findings are non-specific but could be secondary to a ruptured ovarian cyst.

text: mild dependent atelectasis is seen in the lung bases.no evidence of pericardial or pleural effusion.small hiatal hernia.note is made of atherosclerotic disease in the coronary arteries.the lack of iv contrast limits evaluation of the solid parenchymal organs.the liver is grossly unremarkable.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands and kidneys appear normal.mild atherosclerotic disease is seen in the abdominal aorta which is normal in course and caliber.no evidence of abdominal lymphadenopathy.small bowel loops are decompressed and are unremarkable.no evidence of free fluid or free air.
summary: no significant polyp or mass identified (greater than 1 cm).extensive colonic diverticulosis, predominantly in the sigmoid colon.the sensitivity of ct colonography for polyps greater than 1 cm is 85-90%.the sensitivity for polyps 6-9 mm is about 60-70%.flat lesions may be missed with ct colonography.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at approximately 5:00 p.m.on ___.

text: the uterus is surgically absent.wall thickening is again seen within the bladder and rectum, consistent with post-radiation changes.there is a foley catheter in the bladder.the soft tissue structure in the right pelvis measuring 3.0 x 2.7 cm is unchanged since the previous study, likely represents the right ovary.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.there is diffuse edema in the subcutaneous soft tissues.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions in the visualized osseous structures.

text: diffuse low-density lesions within the liver consistent with metastases are increased in both size and number.the largest confluent metastatic lesion in segment ii/iii has increased, now measuring 4.4 x 3.9 cm.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, stomach, and intra- abdominal loops of bowel are normal.kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.tiny bilateral hypodensities remain too small to be definitively characterized, but likely represents small renal cysts.there is no free air, free fluid, or abnormal intra-abdominal lymphadenopathy.

summary: multiple fluid collectionsa asribed..infection within these collections cannot be confirmed or ruled out.normal appearance of aorta, without aneurysmal dilatation or evidence of leak.anasarca with extensive subcutaneous edema, ascites, and large bilateral pleural effusions.

text: extensive intraperitoneal ascites is again seen tracking through the inguinal canals into the scrotal sac.a foley catheter is present within a partially distended bladder.rectum, bladder and prostate are within normal limits.there are no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes.soft tissue edema is again identified.
summary: no evidence of contrast extravasation or large hematoma within the abdomen or pelvis to explain the patient's drop in hematocrit.persistent pleural effusions with bibasilar atelectasis.stable appearance of hepatic abscess/bile collections within segments iv and ii of the liver.slight decrease in size of the right liver lobe collection with a new drainage catheter in place.slight interval decrease in abundant ascites tracking into the pelvis and scrotum.

text: moderate-sized bilateral layering pleural effusions are present.bibasilar compressive atelectasis is also identified.coronary artery calcifications are visualized.nasogastric tube is seen with tip terminating in the antrum of the stomach.there is a large amount of ascites present.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas, stomach, and loops of large and small bowel all appear unremarkable on this non-contrast-enhanced ct.within the kidneys bilaterally, small non- obstructing renal calculi are present.the largest renal calculus within the left kidney is present within the mid pole and measures 7 mm.within the left kidney, the largest renal calculus is within the lower pole and measures 4 mm.extensive calcifications and atherosclerotic disease are seen within the aorta and iliac arteries.a stent is present within the inferior vena cava.no free air is present.
summary: large amount of ascites and anasarca.moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions with bibasilar compressive atelectasis.heterogeneous appearance of the psoas muscles bilaterally with appearance most consistent with bilateral hematomas.superinfective process cannot be excluded.non-obstructing bilateral renal calculi.

text: in the visualized lower thorax, the lungs are clear.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.contrast is seen in the esophagus.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenals, and kidneys appear normal.the spleen is top normal in size.the patient is status post hartmann's procedure.there is no abnormal small bowel dilatation.multiple retroperitoneal lymph nodes are again seen, appearing slightly decreased in size.for example, a left paraaortic node at the level of the inferior pole of the kidneys, previously measuring 15 x 13 mm today measures 12 x 8 mm.the abdominal aorta demonstrates mild atherosclerotic calcification.it is normal in caliber and course.

text: the pelvic bowel loops demonstrate equivocal thickening of the descending colon in a concentric pattern.although this may be due to decompressed bowel, if there is clinical concern for focal colitis or colonic neoplasm, a colonoscopy is recommended.the prostate and bladder are normal in appearance.there is no ascites or lympadenopathy.there is a small subcutaneous nodule to the right of the umbilicus.query whether this is a location of subcutaneous injections.bone windows reveal a bone island in the left ischium, and degenerative changes of the hips and lumbar spine.
summary: biliary and pancreatic obstruction secondary to chronic pancreatitis and obstructing stones.an ercp is recommended for further evaluation, treatment, and to exclude a neoplastic etiology.several equivocal foci of colonic wall thickening of the descending and sigmoid colon.if there is clinical concern for colitis or colonic neoplasm, a colonoscopy is recommended.right diaphragmatic plaques.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, rectum and adnexal structures are unremarkable.suture chain at the level of the rectum and the distal sigmoid colon is noted (2:71).no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are seen.there is no free air or free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: stomach is markedly distended and fluid filled.proximal loops of small bowel are dilated up to 4 mm.distal loops of small bowel are collapsed, compatible with small bowel obstruction.transition point is likely in the lower mid abdomen.bowel wall enhancement is maintained.there is no evidence of pneumatosis or portal venous gas at this time.bilateral consolidations at the lung bases, likely reflect aspiration and/or infection in the appropriate clinical setting.multiple hepatic cysts, unchanged.multiple renal hypodensities, some of which are too small to characterize, likely cysts.
