text: there is a small right pleural effusion and associated right lower lobe atelectasis.there is no pericardial effusion.there are new air bubbles located within the rf ablation site superiorly.more inferiorly within the ablation site, the site demonstrates soft tissue attenuation.more inferiorly at the site of the previous collection, there is a small amount of fluid within internal air bubbles located immediately posterior to the existing drainage catheter.no fluid is seen beyond the catheter.the cutaneous fistula access sites appear to have less inflammatory stranding about them.the small residual collection anterior to the psoas is now nearly completely resolved.a small low density area anterior to morison's pouch is not significantly changed in appearance.there is equivocal slight hyperemia about the rf ablation site.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and small and large bowel loops are unremarkable.
summary: new air bubbles in rf ablation site, worrisome for continued infection at the ablation site.drainage catheter remains in position anterior and inferior to the ablation site, but given continued drainage output, is likely draining the area effectively.the majority of the ablation site is filled with soft tissue density.continued followup is recommended.potential drainage could be attempted when the collection liquefies.small right pleural effusion, improved since ___.other small residual retroperitoneal fluid collections, unchanged or slightly smaller.

text: the prostate is mildly enlarged.the bladder and distal ureters are normal.bowel loops are unremarkable.bone windows show no suspicious lesions.
summary: wall thickening of the body of the stomach.the finding is nonspecific and may represent gastritis and/or neoplasm.upper endoscopy is recommended for complete evaluation.soft tissue lesion indenting the posterior right lobe of the liver demonstrates no contrast enhancement on this examination.the finding is therefore unlikely to represent malignancy, and could represent old hematoma from prior trauma.follow-up ct in 3 months is recommended to ensure stability of this finding.normal appearance to the tail of the pancreas on contrast examination.no evidence for a mass.

text: the lung bases are clear, without evidence of pleural effusion or focal consolidation.again noted are three tiny low attenuation lesions within the liver, too small to characterize and they remain unchanged from the prior study.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands and kidneys appear unremarkable.there is post surgical change noted within the infrarenal aorta, currently measuring 3.2 x 2.9 cm.the evaluation is limited due to lack of iv contrast.also noted is a nonstrangulated hernia of the left lateral abdominal wall, measuring approximately 6.2 cm in its opening.contrast is noted distally, without evidence of obstruction.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.there is no significant mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: there is a nonstrangulated hernia of the left lateral abdominal wall.postoperative appearance of previously described infrarenal aortic aneurysm.there are three tiny low attenuation lesions noted within the liver, too small to characterize but remain stable from the prior exam.

text: respiratory motion is seen at the lung bases.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left with associated bibasilar atelectasis.no focal consolidations are seen.the heart is enlarged.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, and adrenals are unremarkable in appearance.the pancreas and kidneys are atrophic.the intra-abdominal large and small bowel are unremarkable.in the left lower quadrant the renal transplant is visualized.assessment of function is not possible on this non-iv contrast enhanced study.no perinephric fluid collections or masses are seen.no significant fat stranding is seen around the renal transplant in the left lower quadrant.in the right lower quadrant there is a large amount of mesenteric fat stranding.the pancreatic transplant is poorly visualized due to lack of iv contrast, but is discernible.there is a small amount of free fluid in this area.in addition, there appears to be an ill-defined inflammatory collection measuring approximately 5.5 x 2.2cm with a few pockets of air within it.no definite wall is seen on this non- iv enhanced study.a small amount of ascites is also seen within the abdomen.this collection anterior to the pancreas was visualized on ultrasounds of ___ and ___, but not clearly seen on the ultrasound of one day prior.
summary: there appears to be an ill-defined collection anterior to the pancreatic transplant measuring approximately 5.5 x 2.2 cm which contains a few pockets of air within it.there is a significant amount of mesenteric fat stranding seen in this area.no enhancing wall around the collection is identified on this non- iv contrast enhanced study.this may represent a phlegmon or abscess anterior to the pancreatic transplant, possibly due to pancreatitis.small bilateral effusions with associated atelectasis.small amount of ascites.findings were discussed with dr.___ and dr.___.

text: again noted is a rim-enhancing fluid collection in the presacral space with a drainage catheter well positioned in the collection.this measures 3.2 x 1.4 cm in largest axial dimension (previously 5.2 x 3.9cm).there is stable surrounding inflammatory change, and there is no new fluid collection.fluid tracking in the mesentery of the left lower quadrant (2a:7) has decreased.again noted is a right lower quadrant ileostomy.there has been interval decrease in size of fluid collection deep to the ostomy site, now measuring 2.1 x 0.6 cm (previously 2.6 x 1.8cm).a focus of gas is seen in the bladder, likely from recent foley placement.per request of the surgical team, catheter evaluation was performed.the catheter was flushed with approximately 10 cc of sterile saline x2.the catheter flushed easily and initially clear aspirate was removed followed by purulent fluid, totaling approximately 25-30 cc.limited repeat scan through the area of abscess was performed demonstrating interval reduction in size, with greatest axial dimension of 2.4 x 0.9 cm.
summary: rim-enhancing presacral fluid collection with drainage catheter in good position.we were able to flush and aspirate back easily and therefore recommend more aggressive catheter management with flushing and aspiration at least three times a day.in addition, the drainage bag was exchanged for a jp bulb.this was discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of study interpretation.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear.no pleural or pericardial effusions.the liver is unremarkable, without focal lesions.the patient is post cholecystectomy.no intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric enhancement without hydronephrosis or focal lesions.no abdominal or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy or free fluid.notably, the markedly thickened loops of colon have resolved since the prior ct of ___.no evidence of intra-abdominal collections to explain reported infection.note is made of a small fat-containing umbilical hernia.
summary: no ct findings to explain reported leukocytosis.interval resolution of colonic wall thickening.

text: there is generalized anasarca noted.note is made of ascites.two subcentimeter low-attenuation lesions are seen in the left lobe of the liver which are too small to characterize.the spleen is normal.the pancreas is normal.the adrenals and kidneys are unremarkable apart from a subcentimeter simple cyst in the lower pole of the right kidney.the bowel where visualized is normal.no significant lymphadenopathy.
summary: multiple lung nodules, which may represent metastases or infection.however, no definite primary cancer identified.open wound in left upper back and over the thoracic spine.however, no drainable collection identified.bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right and left loculated.ascites.no suspicious sclerotic lesions seen in the bones.however, ct is not specific for evaluating bony metastases.

text: the transplanted kidney within the left hemipelvis enhances and excretes contrast.the pancreatic transplant is visible within the right hemipelvis.the urinary bladder, seminal vesicles are grossly normal.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.no free fluid or air is present.
summary: no evidence of any abnormal fluid collections within the abdomen.no acute pathology to account for the patient's symptoms.three stable-appearing ventral abdominal wall hernias containing small bowel.

text: uterus, adnexa, urinary bladder, and large bowel appear unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged pelvic sidewall or inguinal lymph nodes are identified, with trace amount of free fluid noted within the cul-de-sac, likely physiologic.
summary: limited non-contrast examination with no evidence of metastatic disease.

text: there is slight improvement in bilateral lower lobe consolidations.areas of ground-glass opacity and background interstitial opacities remain present.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.assessment of the solid abdominal organs is limited without iv contrast.allowing for the limitations, the liver, spleen, pancreas, and gallbladder are unchanged since the prior study.there is no new free intraperitoneal air.there has been interval placement of linear dense material in each nephrectomy bed, consistent with the fibrin net placed surgically.there has been reduction in size of the large right nephrectomy bed hematoma.some internal fat density material is present in the right nephrectomy collection.attenuation values of the collection is mixed but lower in density than on the prior study, when it had the appearance of solid hematoma.the left flank collection is slightly larger, currently measuring up to 8.4 cm in greatest dimension (previously measuring up to 6.1 cm).there has been reduction in internal density of the hematoma.although multiple areas of high-density clot are present, the majority of the collection appears lower in density.several small internal air bubbles are present within both collections which could simply be postoperative.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is a large volume of stool throughout the colon.
summary: post-surgical changes in both nephrectomy beds with fibrin net placement.decreased size of right nephrectomy bed hematoma.slight increase in size of fluid collection in left nephrectomy site.high-density internal areas likely represent residual clot.the collection is lower in hounsfield units than on the prior study and is likely due to combination of hematoma and fluid.results were discussed with dr.___ on the afternoon of ___.

text: at the lung bases, there is mild dependent atelectasis, but no consolidation or pleural effusion.there is no pericardial effusion.calcification of coronary arteries is again noted.in the abdomen, evaluation of solid organs is limited in the absence of iv contrast.however, the gallbladder remains distended, without wall thickening, wall edema, or pericholecystic fluid to suggest acute cholecystitis.a small gallstone again layers dependently at the gallbladder fundus.the liver, pancreas, spleen, stomach, duodenum, adrenal glands, and kidneys are grossly unremarkable.no radiopaque calculi or other obstructing lesion is identified.extensive atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta and its branches is stable.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.
summary: no abnormalities in the abdomen or pelvis to explain pain.stably distended gallbladder without evidence of acute cholecystitis.no change in enlarged common bile duct without visualized stone or other obstructive lesion.extensive atherosclerotic calcification.

text: there are multiple low-density lesions within the liver measuring less than 1 cm, which are too small to characterize, but most likely represents a small hepatic cyst.the spleen, gallbladder, and pancreas are normal in appearance.the adrenal glands are mildly hyperenhancing, but normal in size.multiple low-density lesions are noted within the kidneys, which are too small to characterize, but most likely represents a small renal cysts.there is atherosclerotic calcification of the descending aorta.there is no free fluid or free air within the abdomen.
summary: 11.6 x 4.8 cm intramuscular hematoma involving the left gluteal muscles with evidence of active extravasation.nearly non-displaced fractures of the left clavicle, at the head and distal aspects, first rib on the left anteriorly, and third and fourth ribs on the left posteriorly.deformities of the second and fourth left ribs laterally, which likely represent fractures of indeterminate chronicity.5-mm nodule in the left lower lobe.a followup ct chest is recommended in 12 months if the patient has no risk factors for malignancy.if risk factors for malignancy exist, a followup ct may be obtained in ___ months.hyperenhancing adrenal glands which may be related to hypotension or shock.clinical correlation is recommended.these findings were communicated to the trauma team and reported to the ed dashboard on ___ at time of image interpretation.

text: right-sided pleural effusion has nearly completely resolved.there is a minor amount of atelectasis at the right base.no pulmonary nodules or focal areas of opacification are seen within the visualized lung bases.the patient is status post left hepatic lobectomy.the focal fluid collection along the medial edge of the right lobe of the liver is still present, but decreased in size from prior study.it currently measures 7.1 x 2.8 cm, previously measuring 10.9 x 4.0 cm.gas remains present within this collection, and a surgical ___ is noted to be situated adjacent to this collection but not actually within it.the tip of the ___ is located inferiorly and posterior to segment viii of the liver.no focal intrahepatic mass lesions are identified.portal vein thrombosis extending proximally into the superior mesenteric vein is again seen.again noted is recanalization of flow with multiple collateral anastomoses in the region of the portal vein and superior mesenteric vein.there is no evidence of intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.patient is status post cholecystectomy.bilateral simple cysts within both kidneys are stable in appearance.there is stable mild splenomegaly, with the spleen currently measuring 13.2 cm.the adrenal glands are unremarkable.small cysts within the pancreatic head are stable in appearance from previous study.the remainder of the pancreas continues to enhance homogeneously, without evidence of ductal dilatation or focal mass.a post-pyloric tube remains present, with its tip in the distal duodenum.the stomach and duodenum are unremarkable.the patient is status post hepatojejunostomy and partial small bowel resection with jejunostomy.intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are otherwise unremarkable.there is no free air, and no free fluid.
summary: interval decrease in size of focal fluid collection along the antero- medial aspect of the right lobe of the liver.surgical ___/tube is seen adjacent to this fluid collection, but does not appear to enter this collection, and the tip is located in the subdiaphragmatic area to the collection.slight interval decrease in portal venous and superior mesenteric thrombus.there is recanalization, and flow remains present in multiple portal venous and mesenteric venous collaterals.

text: evaluation of the bladder is incomplete due to underdistension and previously noted mass at the left ureteral orifice is not clearly identified.the prostate appears prominent at 5.2 x 4.0 cm.otherwise, the rectum and sigmoid colon are within normal limits.there is no free fluid or free air in the pelvis.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: diffuse metastatic disease as noted by multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules with the greatest being a right middle lobe nodular density measuring 2.5 x 1.8 cm, enlarged lymph node adjacent to the aorta, innumerable metastatic lesions in the liver, soft tissue thickening along the left kidney, and bowel wall thickening along the splenic flexure at the transverse colon.additionally, there is increased prominence of the right adrenal gland to 1.9 x 1.6 cm.chest findings are not fully evaluated, with likely right hilar involvement partially imaged.dedicated chest ct is recommended in a non-urgent setting for further characterization of full extent of metastatic disease in the chest.

text: there are calcifications seen in the uterus.there is air seen in the bladder which is prolapsed.a foley catheter is also present in the bladder.small amount of free fluid is seen in the pelvis.
summary: small bowel obstruction with a transition point seen in the mid ileum.small amount of free fluid is identified.tiny focus of free air is also seen on two images.dilated esophagus.no evidence of pulmonary embolus.aspiration of oral contrast.

text: there has been interval increase in the size of the bilateral pleural effusions.progressive atelectasis/consolidation is noted at the lung bases.again appreciated is infected, walled off pancreatic necrosis now measuring 11.7 x 7 cm, previously 15 x 8.8 cm.the recently inserted pancreatic drain has been removed with some residual locules of gas within the collection.there is a smaller fluid collection within the lesser sac which measures 3.8 x 2.5 cm, previously 4.8 x 3.2 cm.this likely communicates with the larger collection.there is some enhancing pancreatic tissue noted particularly within the head and neck junction as well as within the tail.the splenic vein is attenuated as it passes behind the pancreatic necrosis.there is an ng tube, which is coiled multiple times within the stomach.there has been interval increase in the amount of ascites, which tracks within the mesentery and extends into a colon containing left inguinal hernia.small locules of subcutaneous emphysema are noted within the anterior abdominal wall, this is likely iatrogenic and related to the recent removal of the drainage catheter.there is diffuse anasarca.the remainder of the exam is unchanged from ___.
summary: interval increase in the amount of ascites and the bilateral pleural effusions as well as the consolidation/atelectasis at the lung bases.the ng tube is coiled within the stomach multiple times.there is infected walled off pancreatic necrosis.although decreasing in size, the collection is amenable to re-drainage.dr.___ discussed this finding with dr.___ ___ at the time of reporting at 4:25 pm and it was agreed upon that drainage insertion would be performed on ___.

text: moderately large bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis have increased since prior exam.there is no pericardial effusion.the patient is status post percutaneous biliary drain placement.the drain enters between the right sixth and seventh lateral ribs, is coiled within the proximal common bile duct, extends through the duodenum and terminates in the proximal jejunum.the patient is also status post duodenal stent placement.contrast within the biliary tree, as well as multiple small foci of central pneumobilia are consistent with the recent procedure.there are are undrained left liver lobe ducts.the gallbladder is relaxed, but remains thick walled.the pancreas is atrophic and incompletely evaluated due to significant peripancreatic fat stranding.multiple clips in the epigastrium are consistent with patient's prior vagotomy.there remains a small sliding hiatal hernia.soft tissue density surrounding the patient's celiac axis is unchanged since prior exam, again raising the possibility for malignant involvement versus panniculitis.the spleen is not enlarged.the adrenal glands and kidneys are stable.the patient is status post billroth ii.compared with prior exam there is increased gaseous distention mainly within the cecum and transverse colon.left lower quadrant spigelian hernia containing normal sigmoid colon and fluid is also unchanged.a large amount of intra-abdominal ascites may be slightly increased compared with prior exam.the patient is status post repair of an infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.all mesenteric vessels enhance normally.
summary: status post percutaneous biliary drain and duodenal stent placement without evidence of intra-abdominal free air.slight interval increase in abdominal ascites.interval increase in gaseous distention of transverse colon and cecum.significant interval increase in bilateral pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis.stable peripancreatic stranding and lack of enhancement of the pancreas, again raising the possibility of pancreatitis in this clinical setting.stable ill-defined soft tissue around the celiac axis raises the possibility for malignant infiltrating tumor.status post repair of abdominal aortic aneurysm without evidence of leaks.stable left lower quadrant spigelian hernia containing sigmoid colon and fluid.prostatic enlargement with foley catheter in place.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 11:45 a.m.on ___.

text: no hematoma is identified in the patient's pelvis and lower extremities.the appearance of the pelvis is stable compared to the exam of ___.foley catheter and air are noted in the bladder.multiple calcifications in the pelvis and iliac region are unchanged.gastrojejunostomy tube is again noted.there is no free fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.a right-sided sacral decubitus ulcer is again identified.there is mild subcutaneous edema throughout the left lower extremity.no demonstrable fluid collections are identified.the right hip prosthesis is stable.there is a healed right tibial fracture.degenerative changes of the lower lumbar spine and hips are noted.
summary: no evidence of hemorrhage within the pelvis or lower extremities to explain the patient's hematocrit drop.

text: there is no evidence of free air, free fluid, or fluid collection in the upper abdomen.the pancreas is not enlarged, and has the appearance unchanged since prior study without evidence of peripancreatic fluid or fat stranding.there is hypoattenuation of the pancreas, unchanged.this is non- specific but might suggest chronic pancreatitis.there is tiny liver lesion in the left lobe, unchanged since prior study, too small to characterize.there is no intrahepatic ductal dilatation.bladder is unremarkable.there is mild dilatation of the common bile duct, measuring up to 1 cm, unchanged since prior study.spleen, right adrenal gland, and right kidney are unremarkable.there is 2-cm left adrenal nodule, probably adenoma, unchanged since prior study.there is left-sided metallic density posterior to the left adrenal gland.there is hypodensity with indentation of the contour in the left kidney, unchanged since prior study, probably due to prior pyelonephritis.the visualized portions of large and small intestines are within normal limits.there is no significant lymphadenopathy.
summary: no specific findings to suggest acute pancreatitis on ct scan.please correlate with lab values.unchanged hypoattenuating pancreas, which can be due to chronic pancreatitis.unchanged left adrenal nodule, probably adenoma.unchanged mild dilatation of common bile duct.low-density liver lesion on the left too small to characterize.small amount of free fluid in the lower pelvis, probably within physiologic range.the wet read was provided to ed dashboard.

text: the patient is status post right hemicolectomy and sigmoidectomy.the rectum, bladder, uterus, and bilateral adnexa are unremarkable.there is a pelvic fluid collection which measures 3.4 x 5.4 cm best seen on (4:77), also with evidence of organization with a hyperenhancing wall.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval organization of multiple intra-abdominal fluid collections with largest in a horseshoe configuration seen within the anterior abdominal cavity extending down to the pelvis and tracking up the pericolic gutters.infection of these fluid collections, cannot be excluded.multiple other fluid collections, including perisplenic, low pelvic, and left upper quadrant fluid collections.interval worsening of left pleural effusion with some components of loculation along the left major fissure and associated left lower lobe atelectasis.no pulmonary embolism or signs of superimposed pneumonia.these findings were discussed by dr.___ with dr.___ ___ 4 p.m.on ___.

text: there is a foley catheter in the bladder.the uterus is unremarkable.there is mild sigmoid diverticulosis.
summary: uncomplicated cecal bascule, observed with 180 rotation, but without obstruction.this appearance raises the possibility that recent symptoms could related to transient torsion of the bascule.no evidence of free air.

text: air is seen through to the rectum.the sigmoid colon is unremarkable.the bladder, uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.there are phleboliths within the pelvic veins.bone windows show normal osseous structures.
summary: abdominal aortic aneurysm with interval placement of graft.there is hematoma surrounding the surgical bed but no evidence of acute/active leak or extravasation.the surrounding hematoma does not appear liquid and therefore is not drainable.bilateral dilated renal pelves unchanged from the previous examination.no hydronephrosis.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.

text: within the visualized portions of the lung bases, again seen are innumerable pulmonary metastases.the largest of these measures 1.8 x 2.8 cm (series 2, image 12) and appears increased in size from the time of the previous examination.the visualized portions of the heart and pericardium appear unchanged.the liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the patient is status post placement of a percutaneous nephrostomy tube within the right kidney.there is an expected amount of fluid within ___ pouch.a tiny stone is seen within the interpolar region of the left kidney.the ureters are prominent bilaterally.the left ureter measures approximately 1 cm in diameter distally.the right ureter measures approximately 1.1 cm distally.an ivc filter is in place.there are calcifications within the abdominal aorta consistent with atheromatous disease.the large and small bowel loops are normal in caliber, and there is no abnormal bowel wall thickening.no free air and no free fluid within the abdomen.multiple small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: increased size and number of innumerable pulmonary metastases.status post percutaneous nephrostomy within the right kidney.tiny left renal stone.bilateral ureteral dilatation is likely related to persistent iliac chain nodes bilaterally, seen on prior ct.no evidence of intra-abdominal abscess or fluid collections.no fluid collection adjacent to the right lower quadrant stimulating device.this result was discussed with the clinical provider at the time of interpretation.

text: the rectum is moderately distended with stool.the sigmoid, and large bowel is unremarkable.there is a very small amount of free fluid in the deep pelvis, which attenuates slightly greater than simple fluid.the uterus and adnexa are unchanged with incidental note of small lower uterine segment fibroids or nabothian cysts.a foley catheter is in situ a collapsed bladder.there is some nonspecific stranding in the subcutaneous tissues.there was no evidence for retroperitoneal hematoma, or hemorrhage.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage or other explanation for hematocrit drop.

text: there is bibasilar atelectasis.there are no pleural effusions.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, kidneys, adrenals and pancreas are unremarkable.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification of the aorta and splenic artery.there are 2 abdominal aortic aneurysms, the first of which is seen just distal to the origin of the renal arteries measuring 3.5 x 3.3 cm.the second aneurysmal dilation seen just before the bifurcation measuring 3.4 x 3.3 cm.there is no free air.intraabdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.
summary: large right ileopsoas hemorrhage extending into the pelvis along the right iliac fossa.sigmoid diverticula without evidence of diverticulitis.extensive atherosclerotic calcifications.abdominal aortic aneurysm as described above.results were discussed with dr.___ immediately following the study completion.

text: there is a large fat- containing right inguinal hernia.sigmoid colonic diverticulosis is present without evidence of inflammatory change.the uterus and adnexa appear within normal limits.a foley catheter in place within a collapsed bladder.there is a slight amount of stranding in the right inguinal region, presumably at the site of catheterization as the overlying skin is deflected by pressure bandage, but no hematoma is identified.
summary: no evidence of intraperitoneal or retroperitoneal hematoma.retention of contrast within the renal cortices bilaterally, a finding that is suggestive of atn.segmental lack of enhancement of thinned areas of renal cortex bilaterally likely relates to chronic scarring/vascular occlusion.cardiomegaly, coronary artery calcifications and pulmonary edema.small bilateral pleural effusions.sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.

text: the bladder, rectum, sigmoid colon appear within normal limits.again, a large volume of pelvic ascites is noted.
summary: large volume of intra-abdominal and pelvic ascites.shrunken nodular liver consistent with cirrhosis.no acute intra-abdominal or pelvic findings.

text: again noted are nodular opacities within the left lung base, difficult to further evaluate due to motion.these are noted on ct of ___.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.
summary: subtle wall thickening of the transverse and descending colon, which may be due to hypo-albuminemia versus early colitis.cirrhosis with inhomogeneous liver enhancement, can not exclude underlying liver lesions.new small amount of perisplenic fluid.splenomegaly and esophageal varices consistent with portal hypertension.

text: the liver and gallbladder appear unremarkable.the spleen, kidneys, adrenal glands, pancreas, stomach, and large and small bowel loops appear unremarkable.the descending aorta and its tributaries appear patent.the inferior vena cava is unremarkable.there is no ascites or free air.sigmoid colon and rectum appear unremarkable.the bladder is fluid filled and appears to be intact.the prostate and rectum are normal.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.the surrounding soft tissue structures appear unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of organ injury or acute fractures or dislocations.lytic sclerotic bone encompassing the right transverse process, right pedicle and lamina and part of the vertebral body.the bone lesion also has a soft tissue component protruding into the spinal canal and causing spinal canal compression at this level.the differential diagnosis of this lesion includes a giant cell tumor or an aneurysmal bone cyst.less likely would be a hemangioma.the lesion is amenable to biopsy.remote non-united fractures of the posterior aspect of the left ninth and tenth ribs.

text: there is persistent tree-in-___ opacity surrounding enlarged bronchiectatic airways in the medial segment of the right lower lobe, without significant change.a stable 4-mm nodule is seen in the right lower lobe.there is a small hiatal hernia.there is no abnormal fluid collection or hematoma throughout the abdomen and pelvis.study is essentially unchanged when compared to ___.small hepatic/splenic granuloma.non-contrast evaluation of the solid organs is unchanged, otherwise.a small left adrenal adenoma is noted.renal calcifications, left more so than right, with an exophytic mass projecting off of either kidney, both of which have attenuation measurements not entirely compatible with simple cysts.these are relatively unchanged however, when compared to mri of the abdomen dated ___.small gallstone within the decompressed gallbladder.bowel loops are decompressed.there are numerous diverticula, without inflammation, as well as surgical material in the right lower quadrant from prior appendectomy.there is no free air or free fluid.prostate is slightly enlarged.there are notable degenerative changes of the spine, with superior endplate compression fractures at l1 and l4, unchanged.
summary: no retroperitoneal hematoma or fluid collection to explain the patient's drop in hematocrit.4-mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule close to a focal area of bronchiectasis and inflammation.recommend surveillance.nephrolithiasis.cholelithiasis.diverticulosis.hyperdense exophytic bilateral renal masses, which are unchanged in morphology from mri of ___, which revealed simple cysts.1 cm left adrenal adenoma.

text: rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, and prostate are all unremarkable.the patient has a foley catheter.
summary: no evidence of acute intra-abdominal process.consolidative process in the right lower lobe consistent with pneumonia versus atelectasis; sequelae of aspiration could also be considered particularly noting historical circumstances.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, uterus and bladder are unremarkable.a previously noted cystic lesion above the bladder has resolved.no free fluid or lymphadenopathy is seen.a 10 mm soft tissue nodule posterior to the right gluteus muscles measures 10 x 8 mm, previously 9 x 10 mm.
summary: further interval increase in size of lytic lesion in the left humeral head, highly concerning for metastatic lesion.interval decrease in right lower lobe pulmonary nodule.stable size of target lesion within the left axilla.multiple stable osseous lesions in lumbar spine and pelvis.resolution of left adnexal cyst.the oncology table has been updated.

text: a foley balloon is present within a collapsed bladder.
summary: large ventral hernia(s) containing loops of both small and large bowel, likely site of transition point for high-grade bowel obstruction.while there are no definite signs of ischemia by ct, early ischemia cannot be excluded.the exact transition point is difficult to assess secondary to lack of progression of oral contrast material but appears within the hernia sac itself possibly at the site of a second smaller satellite hernia off the major hernia sac.

text: the bases of the lungs are seen with ground- glass opacity in the right lower lobe, incompletely evaluated in this study, and linear atelectasis.allowing for noncontrast technique, the liver, gallbladder, spleen and pancreas appear unremarkable.adrenal glands are mildly full without focal nodule identified.in the left kidney, there is a 3 mm punctate calcification in the upper pole, representing a nonobstructing renal calculus.there is a small exophytic hypodensity, measuring 1 cm in diameter, in the upper pole, incompletely evaluated.the right kidney appears grossly normal.there is no hydronephrosis.the visualized stomach and small bowels are normal.there are scattered lymph nodes, but none of them are pathologically enlarged.
summary: no evidence of bowel obstruction.no pneumoperitoneum or pneumatosis.moderate stool in the colon.ground-glass patchy opacity in the right lung base, incompletely evaluated, likely related to infectious or inflammatory etiology.tiny non-obstructing left renal stone.additional left renal hypodense lesion too small to characterize.

text: there is progression of bibasilar linear atelectasis since the prior study.in addition, there are multiple patchy opacities at both bases, which may represent developing pneumonia.alternatively, these could be foci of atelectasis.there is new interstitial pulmonary edema at the visualized lung bases, and a new small left pleural effusion.the liver and biliary tree appear stable.the gallbladder remains distended.no definite stones are seen.however, multiple gallstones and sludge were seen on the abdominal u/s of ___.there is a small hiatal hernia.the ng tube terminates within the body of the stomach.peripancreatic inflammatory changes and peripancreatic fluid collection have expanded in size, with further extension into the mesenteric fat and gerota's fascia, as well as greater fluid accumulation in the paracolic gutters.the pancreas enhances uniformly, without evidence of necrosis.the splenic, superior mesenteric and portal veins appear patent.the adrenal glands and kidneys are stable in appearance.no dilated loops of small or large bowel are seen.there is no free air.
summary: worsening peripancreatic inflammatory changes.interval enlargement of the peripancreatic fluid collection.new patchy bibasilar pulmonary opacities, consistent with developing pneumonia vs atelectasis.new interstitial pulmonary edema and a small left pleural effusion.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions with bilateral lower lobe compressive atelectasis which is increased compared with the prior exam.
summary: marked urinary bladder wall thickening with perivesical stranding is concerning for urinary infection.please correlate clinically.no signs of pyelonephritis.small volume abdominal ascites which could be related to recent surgery.dilated proximal jejunum without definite transition point to suggest obstruction.findings may be due to adynamic ileus.small bilateral pleural effusions with compressive lower lobe atelectasis, increased from prior exam.fluid collection in the left lower quadrant as detailed above is most compatible with a postoperative seroma.please note superinfection cannot be excluded.sesha

text: there is a calcified fibroid uterus.a foley catheter is present within the bladder.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or deep pelvic nodes are identified.bone windows demonstrate evidence of healed right inferior pubic ramus fracture.there is endplate sclerosis at the l4-5 level with multiple rounded defects in the superior endplate of l4 and inferior endplate of l3.
summary: no psoas abscess identified.no other intra-abdominal abscess or focal fluid collection is identified.innumerable cysts in both kidneys, likely sequela of end-stage renal disease and hemodialysis.extensive atherosclerosis.endplate sclerosis with rounded endplate defects at the l3-4 level.correlation with outside imaging studies is recommended.

text: an intra-abdominal right lower quadrant transplant kidney is visualized.there is a ureteral stent extending from the renal pelvis into the predominantly collapsed urinary bladder.evaluation of the renal parenchyma is limited given lack of intravenous contrast.there is no significant hydronephrosis.surrounding the kidney, there is a small amount of free fluid, likely similar in degree as seen on previous ultrasound.in addition, there is a moderate amount of subcutaneous fluid deep to the surgical staples and in the anterior right abdominal wall.there is no definite evidence of organized fluid collection or abscess.lack of intravenous contrast limits evaluation of the solid abdominal viscera and vasculature.there is a small right pleural effusion.there is subcutaneous stranding of the soft tissues extending superiorly from the incision to the level of the anterior eighth rib.trace pericardial fluid or minimal pericardial thickening is present.a partially imaged central venous catheter is seen, the tip terminating at the inferior cavoatrial junction.a catheter traversing the anterior abdominal subcutaneous tissues and entering the peritoneal cavity is evident consistent with reported vp shunt.coronary artery calcifications are evident.the heart is normal in size.there is compressive atelectasis on the right and linear strands of atelectasis or scarring bilaterally at the bases.the native kidneys demonstrate innumerable hypodense lesions.in addition, there are scattered high-density lesions which may represent hemorrhagic or proteinaceous cyst.there are scattered renal calcifications on the left greater than right, measuring up to 8 mm in the mid left kidney.there is no hydronephrosis.the liver also demonstrates innumerable low-density lesions with the lesions larger than 1 cm measuring near water density in hounsfield units.these likely represent multiple cysts.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, and pancreas are grossly unremarkable.atherosclerotic calcifications are present within the normal caliber infrarenal abdominal aorta as well as iliac arteries.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.multiple diverticula are seen within the sigmoid colon without surrounding inflammatory changes.severe degenerative changes are present within the left hip with complete loss of joint space and osseous fusion of the femoral head and acetabulum.this is possibly post-traumatic or post infectious as it is an asymmetric finding.significant facet arthropathy is noted in the lower lumbar spine.there are no suspicious osseous lesions.
summary: right lower quadrant intraperitoneal transplant with surrounding small perinephric fluid collection.unorganized fluid in the right anterior/lateral abdominal wall subcutaneous tissues.polycystic kidney and liver disease with scattered small hemorrhagic or proteinaceous cysts and non-obstructing renal calculi.evaluation is limited for solid enhancing lesions given lack of intravenous contrast.

text: a 1.0 x 0.9 cm region of low attenuation adjacent to the falciform ligament (image 3:51) is consistent with focal fat.the gallbladder, spleen, and pancreas demonstrate no focal lesions.adrenal masses measure 2.3 x 2.5 cm on the right and 1.4 x 1.2 cm on the left.numerous low-attenuation masses are located in both kidneys.these measure up to 2.8 x 2.6 cm in the left upper pole and 2.1 x 1.9 cm in the right interpolar region.no hydronephrosis is present.multiple enlarged retroperitoneal lymph nodes measure up to 1.3 cm in retrocaval and 1.7 cm in left periaortic locations in short axis.mesenteric lymph nodes measure up to 1.3 cm in short axis.imaged portions of the small and large bowel are not dilated.
summary: findings consistent with extensive metastatic disease, including pulmonary nodules, bilateral adrenal masses, and bilateral renal masses.lymphadenopathy in mediastinal, right greater than left hilar, retroperitoneal, and mesenteric locations, consistent with nodal spread of neoplastic disease.bronchoscopic biopsy is recommended.cavitary pulmonary nodule in the posterior segment of the right upper lobe, suspicious for primary lung carcinoma.please see the differential discussion in the prior chest cta report for less likely considerations.right upper lobe pulmonary interstitial thickening, suspicious for lymphangetic spread.subtle sclerosis in the t4 vertebral body.while indeterminate, osseous metastasis is not excluded.if there will be a change in clinical management, then a bone scan may be helpful.wedge-shaped peripheral opacity in the right middle lobe, evolving since the prior chest cta.second evolving process in the right upper.while these may be secondary to infection, the morphology of the right middle lobe opacity raises the possibility of a pulmonary infarct.aberrant right subclavian artery.

text: there is a 6.4 x 5.0 cm, increased attenuation collection in the left lower abdominal wall with attenuation characteristics consistent with hemorrhage.the inferior epigastric vein is seen to run through this hematoma, however, no active extravasation is identified.no fluid-fluid levels are seen.there is an arterial line present in the left femoral artery.there is a foley catheter in the bladder.the rectum and sigmoid colon are collapsed.evaluation is slightly limited in this region secondary to significant beam hardening artifact.in the right lower pelvis, there is a 1.8 x 3.5 cm collection with increased attenuation values (37-50 hounsfield units), adjacent to the upper rectum on the right, that could represent a second small hematoma.

text: there is a small right pleural effusion, slightly decreased in the interval since the prior study.there is discoid atelectasis at the lung bases, not significantly changed since the previous exam.there are two internal/external biliary drains identified which are unchanged in position since the previous study.pneumobilia has resolved.there is persistent intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, the overall degree of which may be slightly increased since the previous exam.the previously seen biloma at the lateral aspect of the right lobe of the liver is no longer identified.since the previous exam, there has been development of a moderate amount of free fluid in the abdomen which surrounds the liver and spleen and extends into the right paracolic gutter.there are new soft tissue nodular densities within the omentum consistent with peritoneal studding.the peritoneum appears irregularly thickened along the surface of the liver and there is a new enhancing soft tissue mass adjacent to the lateral most biliary drain along the thoracic wall, concerning for new tumor deposit in this location.the adrenal glands, pancreas and spleen are stable.both right and left kidneys enhance symmetrically and demonstrate prompt excretion of contrast.there is a simple renal cyst in the left kidney, unchanged since the prior exam.the visualized loops of large and small bowel in the abdomen are unremarkable.contrast has passed freely to the level of the sigmoid colon.no bowel wall thickening or dilatation is identified.there are multiple prominent aortocaval lymph nodes which are new since the previous exam.no free air is seen within the abdomen.
summary: interval progression of disease with new ascites and peritoneal studding.no discrete abscess collections identified.no interval change in the position of two internal/external biliary drains with perhaps slight interval increase in degree of intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.

text: a 4-mm subpleural left lower lobe pulmonary nodule (2:4) is slightly increased in size compared to ___.no additional pulmonary nodules are identified.there is minimal bibasilar dependent atelectasis.coronary artery calcifications are noted.the liver is grossly unremarkable, without focal lesions.there is central biliary duct dilatation, not significantly changed compared to the prior study from ___.also unchanged is prominence of the common duct, measuring up to 12 mm.the gallbladder is distended, as before, and contains an unchanged 4 mm stone within the dependent portion of the fundus.there is no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.the portal vein is patent.the spleen is unremarkable.dilatation of the main pancreatic duct to 5 mm is not significantly changed.the pancreas is somewhat atrophic, as before.no focal pancreatic lesions are identified.the adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys are atrophic bilaterally with multiple small hypodensities that are too small to characterize but not significantly changed in appearance compared to the prior study.the stomach and proximal small bowel are unremarkable.there are fluid-filled loops of mid-to-distal small bowel, predominantly in the pelvis, measuring up to 1.9 cm.fluid is also seen throughout the colon.there is no evidence of bowel wall thickening or hypoenhancement of the bowel wall to suggest bowel ischemia.possible hyperenhancement of the colonic mucosa could be related to colitis, either infectious or inflammatory in etiology.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.small mesenteric lymph nodes measuring up to 7 mm (4b:203) do not meet ct size criteria and are not significantly changed compared to the prior study.

text: there is residual hematoma within the pelvis, the largest collection of which is adjacent to the left acetabulum measuring approximately 2.8 x 7.5 cm in size.the bladder is generally collapsed, with a foley catheter in place.there is a small amount of fluid surrounding the bladder.additionally, at the right paramedian abdominal wall, there is thickening in the region of the omentum/rectus muscles, which probably represents a combination of hemorrhage and postoperative change.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy evident.examination of the osseous structures shows no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.examination of the vasculature shows no evidence of thrombus within the common femoral veins or ivc.

text: there is trace pelvic free fluid.suture material is noted within the recto-colonic junction from prior surgical anastomosis with minimal free fluid/stranding surrounding the anastomotic loop.the bladder, prostate and seminal vesicles are within normal limits.retroperitoneal, mesenteric and pelvic lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias are noted.visualized osseous structures show no focal lytic or sclerotic lesions suspicious for malignancy.compression deformity at the l3, l1 and t12 vertebral bodies are unchanged from the prior examination.mild anasarca is noted.

text: limited imaging of the lung bases demonstrates no abnormalities.there is an unchanged small pericardial effusion.coronary stents are seen in place.there is ct evidence of anemia.since the prior examination, there has been a marked increase in portal venous gas now diffusely within the left and right hepatic lobes near the dome of the diaphragm.due to the fact that no iv contrast was given, assessment of the vasculature cannot be performed.there is a calcified granulomata seen within the spleen.extensive vascular calcification is demonstrated involving the renal arteries and branches, splenic artery, and enteric vasculature and aorta.the gallbladder is present.there is no ascites, lymphadenopathy, or free intraperitoneal gas.the contours of the pancreas, adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys are atrophic bilaterally.there is unchanged bilateral nephrolithiasis.again seen is thickening of the right colon and the proximal portion of the transverse colon as seen on prior examination.it is difficult to assess for pneumatosis given the lack of oral contrast.the small bowel is poorly opacified.
summary: ascending colitis as seen on the prior examination.there has been, however, a marked increase in portal venous gas since the prior examination suspicious for colonic ischemia.due to the lack of oral contrast, it is difficult to assess for pneumatosis.ct evidence of anemia.small pericardial effusion, unchanged.right lower quadrant transplant kidney.trace pelvic free fluid, which may be physiologic.these findings were discussed with the transplant fellow at completion of the examination.

text: the lung bases demonstrate moderate- sized bilateral pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis.allowing for the limitations of a non-contrast study, the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal.atherosclerotic changes of the aorta.the right kidney demonstrates a 3 cm exophytic lesion in the lower pole not fully characterized.multiple bilateral tiny hypodensities not fully characterized.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is seen.no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.diffuse colonic diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.bilateral moderately sized pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.right renal hypodense focus not fully characterized.ultrasound is recommended for further evaluation.

text: extensive pericardial calcifications are again identified.these are stable in comparison to ___; however, if further imaging is required, echocardiography could be obtained.there is minimal hypoventilatory change of the left lung base.the lack of intravenous contrast limits evaluation for the abdominal viscera for a focal lesion.two right lower quadrant transplant kidneys are identified, the medial kidney is the newer transplant kidney and measures 11.2 cm in length.no exophytic or parenchymal lesion is identified; however, evaluation is limited without the use of intravenous contrast.two stents are identified, that correlate to the history of stent placement for renal artery stenosis.there is mild hydronephrosis.just lateral to this kidney is an atrophic right lower quadrant transplant kidney.the native kidneys are atrophic.the transplanted pancreas within the left lower quadrant is unremarkable.the non-contrast appearance of the liver, spleen, and adrenals is normal.the native pancreas is markedly atrophic.there is a prominent loop of bowel adjacent to the anastomosis in the left lower quadrant.the small bowel and colon are otherwise normal in caliber.there are multiple retroperitoneal lymph nodes.a lymph node that lies between the aorta and inferior vena cava (2:40 and 301b:31) has increased in size in comparison to ___ ct, and now measures 5.1 cm in length x 1.5 cm in width x 0.9 cm in depth.there are additional retroperitoneal lymph nodes that are not pathologically enlarged by size criteria.there is stranding and soft tissue density in the midline anterior abdominal wall.there are small vessels calcifications within the abdomen.
