text: patient is status post whipple surgery with evidence of a roux-en-y hepaticojejunostomy, gastrojejunostomy.clips are noted in the gallbladder fossa and in the region of the pancreatic head.the non-contrast appearance of the liver, spleen, adrenal glands is unremarkable.bilateral renal parapelvic and cortical cysts are better assessed on prior contrast-enhanced ct exam.the pancreas is atrophic in appearance with the known pancreatic lesion not clearly seen.there is haziness along the root of the mesentery which may reflect post-surgical changes versus mesenteric panniculitis.the stomach is distended with contrast seen within the duodenum appearing unremarkable.there is mild dilation of a proximal loop of jejunum seen on series 2, image 44 in the left hemiabdomen though distal to this point, this loop appears to communicate with the stomach in a side-to-side fashion.the jejunojejunostomy anastomosis appears unremarkable.the small bowel loops appear nonobstructed with contrast seen entering the large bowel.contrast is seen mixed with stool in the transverse colon and note is made of a contrast-filled tract extending from the transverse colon through the anterior abdominal wall on series 2, image 32.at this level, there is an open wound, which appears to be draining contrast mixed with fecal material.locules of gas in the anterior abdominal wall likely related to surgical incision site.there is no pneumoperitoneum.the large bowel downstream contains a moderate amount of fecal residue though is otherwise unremarkable.
summary: status post recent whipple surgery with changes compatible with roux-en-y hepaticojejunostomy and gastrojejunostomy.contrast-filled tract extending from the transverse colon through the abdominal wall suggestive of olocutaneous fistula.small volume ascites.no definite abdominal abscess.findings d/w dr.___ at the time of initial review.sesha

text: there is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: left inferior rib fractures without evidence of splenic injury.findings consistent with cirrhosis.mild splenomagly.hypodense lesion in right lobe of liver, unchanged compared to the prior study which demonstrated a hemangioma.

text: the urinary bladder, rectum, uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.no dilatation or wall thickening is seen within small and large bowel.there is no evidence of free air within the abdomen.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: bulky periportal, periceliac, and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy concerning for lymphoma.large amount of intra abdominal fluid is consistent with patient's history of peritoneal dialysis with no evidence of intra abdominal abscess.

text: an oval loculated fluid collection measuring 4.4 (ap) x 3.1 (tv) x 2.3 (cc) has decreased in size from the prior exam, located just anterior to the rectum.this fluid collection continues to demonstrate what appears to be a hematocrit level, likely representing a resolving hemorrhagic fluid collection.remaining loops of bowel appear within normal limits.small amount of gas is seen within the bladder, likely due to prior instrumentation.the bladder otherwise is unremarkable.seminal vesicles, prostate are within normal limits.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy seen.ill defined hypodense area causing expansion of the right gluteus medius and minimus muscles has decreased in size from the prior exam.again this may reflect a resolving hematoma, edema, or contusion.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: two small fluid collections surrounding the stomach, one anterior to the stomach adjacent to a suture site, and the second located just superior to the stomach and inferior to the left lobe of the liver.both of these fluid collections likely represent postoperative seromas and are not amenable to image-guided drainage due to their small size.interval decrease in size of loculated hemorrhagic/proteinaceous fluid collection within the pelvis.interval decrease in size of ill-defined hypodensity in the right gluteus minimus and medius muscles causing muscle expansion.this may represent resolving intramuscular hematoma, contusion, or edema.status post closure of the abdominal wall with interval decrease in extent of mesenteric stranding.small bowel loops are unremarkable.slight interval increase in size of small left pleural effusion and new right pleural effusion.continued left lower lobe atelectasis.dfddp

text: a percutaneous biliary drainage tube and a periportal drain are present.the previous biloma has resolved.there is no evidence of intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, and faint fat stranding but no focal fluid collection in the porta hepatis.a percutaneous jejunostomy tube is also present.adjacent to the jejunostomy tube, there is a fluid collection which extends medially and superiorly adjacent to loops of small bowel and measures 85 x 62 mm in its largest dimension.there is diffuse mesenteric fat stranding and a small amount of fluid tracking within the bilateral pericolic gutters.the adrenal glands, kidneys, and spleen are unremarkable.there is no free air within the abdomen.the pancreas is atrophic.there are calcifications of the abdominal aorta.
summary: mid abdominal fluid collection adjacent to the percuteneous jejunostomy tube.this could represent an abscess versus a pancreatic pseudocyst, and was not seen on ___.no evidence of biliary ductal dilatation and no fluid collections adjacent to the porta hepatis.

text: the small pulmonary nodule of 14 mm in diameter at the right base is unchanged.the lung bases are otherwise clear.the liver, spleen, and pancreas are unremarkable.the patient is status post cholecystectomy with surgical clips in the porta hepatis.there is an ng tube passing into the distal stomach.the right kidney is absent.the left kidney is unremarkable and shows a faint nephrogram from the small amount of administrated iv contrast.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.there is no free air.no mesenteric lymphadenopathy is detected.there is some diffuse fat stranding consistent with edema.
summary: diffuse mesenteric and subcutaneous edema.unremarkable appearance of small bowel and colon on this examination with no wall thickening.stable appearance of right lower lobe pulmonary nodule.we recommend continued surveillance.bladder full, although foley catheter in position.status post cholecystectomy and right nephrectomy.

text: included views of the lung bases demonstrate mild dependent atelectasis.trace bilateral pleural effusions are present (2:6).there is no pericardial effusion.the heart size is normal.the liver demonstrates mild periportal edema (2:15).the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, right kidney, stomach, and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are normal.the left kidney has striated nephrogram (601b:31, 27), concerning for pyelonephritis.focal areas cortical thinning may reflect prior infectious or ischemic insult.no renal abscess is present.the kidneys otherwise enhance symmetrically, with contrast seen within both ureters.there is no hydronephrosis.the bladder appears normal.the rectum and intrapelvic loops of small and large bowel are within normal limits.the uterus is normal.no adnexal masses are detected.there is trace intrapelvic free fluid, within physiological limits.no intrapelvic lymphadenopathy is detected.
summary: striated appearance of the left kidney, concerning for pyelonephritis in the setting of fever and dysuria.no fluid collections or abscesses are detected.trace bilateral pleural effusions.

text: the urinary bladder and rectum appear unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid or pelvic lymphadenopathy.bone windows demonstrate no evidence of suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
summary: there is non-obstructive ventral hernia noted, not significantly changed from the prior study.there is a 3.7 x 2.7 cm fat containing lesion within the left adrenal gland, which most likely represents a myelolipoma.there are several tiny pulmonary nodules at the lung bases bilaterally, nonspecific.if further evaluation is desired, chest ct would be helpful.

text: the liver demonstrates no focal lesions and is normal in attenuation.the hepatic vasculature, including the portal veins, are widely patent.there is mild intrahepatic ductal dilatation, similar in appearance to prior study.pneumobilia has resolved.the gallbladder is surgically absent.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.the renal parenchyma demonstrates symmetric enhancement.there is a small hypodense lesion within the mid pole of the right kidney, unchanged from prior study, and too small to fully characterize.there is no hydronephrosis.there are no enhancing renal mass lesions.the stomach, duodenum, and small bowel are unremarkable.there is no small bowel distention or wall thickening.the colon, however, appears slightly abnormal.it is mildly distended and diffusely fluid-filled.there are segments where the wall appears minimally thickened (i.e., splenic flexure).however, the mucosa enhances normally, and there is no frank wall edema, and no pneumatosis.there is no free air in the abdomen and no portal venous air.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.there is no large ascites, although small free fluid is identified in the cul-de-sac.the aorta is diffusely calcified, including the ostia of the mesenteric vessels; however, the major mesenteric arteries are patent.the superior mesenteric vein is similarly patent without clot.
summary: left lower lobe volume loss and consolidation, which may in part reflect hypoventilation secondary to right mainstem intubation, though additional infectious process is not excluded.endotracheal tube positioned with the tip in the right main stem bronchus and should be repositioned.small bilateral effusions.moderate hiatal hernia, within which is coiled the nasogastric tube.resolution of pneumobilia, with mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.diffuse mild distention of a fluid-filled colon with minimal wall thickening identified in the region of the splenic flexure.these findings are nonspecific, though early inflammatory change (which could be due to infectious, inflammatory, or ischemic etiologies) is not excluded.close clinical and imaging followup as indicated is recommended.multiple bony findings, including fractures of the lateral left ribs, and innumerable compression deformities in the spine with underlying severe degenerative change, unchanged from ___.this was discussed with dr.___ ___ (surgery)

text: there is minor linear scarring at the right base.there is interval increase in size of the previously noted multiple metastatic liver lesions.a biliary stent seen to traverse the pancreatic head mass is again noted.there is slight interval increase in size of the pancreatic head mass and diffuse proximal dilatation of the pancreatic duct is again appreciated.enlarged peripancreatic and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are again appreciated.no focal fluid collections or abscesses are seen.the kidneys, adrenal glands, gallbladder, stomach, and bowel loops are normal and unchanged.multiple bilateral simple renal cysts are noted.there are newly identified hypodensities within the periphery of the spleen.there is no free air.multiple calcifications in the spleen are again noted consistent with prior granulomatous infection.also, left sided pneumobilia in the liver is again noted, unchanged consistent with prior stent placement.
summary: metastatic pancreatic cancer with interval increase in size of multiple metastatic liver lesions.newly identified peripheral hypodensities within the spleen which likely represent new metastatic foci, although small peripheral infarctions cannot be excluded.no abscesses identified.

text: evaluation of the lower lungs reveals a left pleural effusion measuring simple fluid.geographic areas of low attenuation throughout the transplanted liver are consistent with fatty infiltration.there is a stent seen adjacent to the liver that is within the hepatic artery as described previously.evaluation on this study is not possible as there is no iv contrast.the gallbladder is absent secondary to surgical removal.the spleen is absent.no contour deformities are identified within the visualized pancreatic body and tail.no adrenal nodules are seen.the kidneys are atrophic.the bladder is collapsed.the uterus is unremarkable, however, evaluation is limited without contrast.there is new simple fluid layering within the pelvis.the transplanted kidney in the right pelvis is stable without any contour deformities.contrast is seen extending to the rectum.there is no evidence for obstruction.there is a small ventral hernia in the upper abdomen containing a portion of the transverse colon.adjacent to the transverse colon, there is a 4 x 2 cm hypodense structure containing a circular hyperdensity.this appears to communicate with adjacent small bowel loops that extend inferior to the liver and likely represents the hepaticojejunostomy of the transplant surgery.there is a second nonobstructing ventral hernia in the pelvis that contains small bowel loops and a small amount of fluid.the neck measures approximately 5.5 cm.there is intrabdominal and pelvis ascites.small lymph nodes are seen in the mesentary.there is a grade 1 anterolisthesis of l5 on s1 with associated spondylolysis.additional degenerative changes are seen in the lower thoracic spine, including a calcified disc.
summary: status post liver and kidney transplant.generalized anasarca with new intra-abdominal and pelvic ascites.no evidence of ivc compression.two nonobstructing ventral wall ic hernias are identified as described above.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, rectum appear unremarkable.small bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias are noted.there are no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes.there are scattered diverticula involving the sigmoid colon without associated inflammatory changes.there is no free air or free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: marked gallbladder distention and wall edema with small amount of pericholecystic fluid.there is intraluminal sludge and possibly a gallstone.the cystic duct appears collapsed.the extrahepatic cbd measures 7 mm, upper limits of normal.the most distal portion of the cbd measures 3 mm, normal in caliber.the constellation of the above findings is highly concerning for acute cholecystitis.persistent mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, which appears unchanged from ___ exam, but significantly improved from ___ 14, ___ exam.these findings are consistent with patient's known history of cll.splenomegaly, unchanged.diffuse bilateral ground glass opacities, likely infectious or inflammatory in nature, unchanged from ___ exam.small loculated pleural effusion, likely sequela of prior pleurodesis, stable.diverticulosis without associated inflammatory changes.findings discussed with dr.___ by dr.___ at 5:50 p.m., ___.

text: small bilateral pleural effusions are present, left greater than right.minor bibasilar compressive atelectasis is also present.the noncontrast enhanced liver, pancreas, spleen, right adrenal gland, kidneys, stomach, and loops of small bowel all appear within normal limits.the gallbladder is somewhat distended, but there is no intra- or extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation identified.the left adrenal gland appears full, and likely represents an adenoma, but this is not fully evaluated on this noncontrast enhanced study.there is no free air or free fluid.multiple small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified, specifically within the para- aortic region, none of which meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.a colostomy is identified within the left lower quadrant.there is an extensive amount of subcutaneous emphysema identified adjacent to the ostomy site with soft tissue stranding identified.the loop of colon within the ostomy demonstrates mild bowel wall thickening and pericolonic fat stranding within the subcutaneous tissues.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction and contrast is seen flowing into the ostomy bag.the remaining loops of large bowel otherwise appear unremarkable.additionally within the left anterior abdominal wall, anterior to the spleen, there appears to be a focal fluid collection with an air-fluid level identified, measuring approximately 3.6 x 7.0 cm.this fluid collection appears to connect with the loop of colon involved in the ostomy.
summary: extensive subcutaneous emphysema within the soft tissues adjacent to the ostomy site in the left lower quadrant.surrounding soft tissue stranding is present as well as bowel wall thickening and pericolonic inflammation of the loop of bowel involved in the ostomy.no bowel obstruction seen.these findings are concerning for an infectious process and necrotizing fasciitis cannot be fully excluded.abscess within the abdominal cavity which contacts the left anterior abdominal wall and appears to connect with the loop of bowel involved in the ostomy.small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right.left adrenal lesion, likely representing an adrenal adenoma.

text: a 2.0 x 1.6 cm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule is not significantly changed in size.no new pulmonary nodules are seen at the lung bases.there is minimal right basilar scarring.previously seen small hypervascular lesions within the liver on ct from ___, are not identified on the present study, possibly secondary to differences in contrast bolus timing.there is no intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.tiny stones are seen within the dependent portion of the gallbladder, as before.there is no gallbladder wall thickening.the spleen is unremarkable.the pancreas is grossly normal.the adrenal glands are normal in appearance.the kidneys are grossly normal, aside from unchanged tiny left upper pole and right lower renal hypodensities, too small to characterize but statistically simple cysts.the stomach and small bowel are grossly unremarkable, aside from a small duodenal diverticulum.there is scattered colonic diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.note is made of interposition of the colon between the liver and ventral abdominal wall.the appendix is normal in appearance.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria.
summary: no evidence of aortic rupture.no significant change in size of known infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm, measuring up to 5.1 cm.no significant change in size of bilateral common iliac and internal iliac artery aneurysms.unchanged right lower lobe pulmonary nodule, measuring up to 2.0 cm.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.

text: well-positioned endotracheal tube and nasogastric tube are seen.a central line is seen with its tip ending in the inferior border of the svc.the heart is within normal limits regarding size and configuration.small calcification is seen in the course of the lad.no pericardial effusion is seen.no concerning mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy is observed.reidentified are bibasilar consolidations, grossly unchanged from prior examination.no pleural effusion is seen on current examination.new ground-glass opacities are seen in the left upper lobe and the lingula that were not clearly seen on prior examination.
summary: bibasilar consolidation, grossly unchanged from prior examination, might represent aspiration pneumonia.new ground-glass opacities that are seen in the left upper lobe and lingular portion might represent an infectious process or an ards.necrotizing pancreatitis high-density fluid within the peritoneum and the retroperitoneum with no fluid-fluid level - might represent pancreatic contents.no organized fluid collections or rim-enhancing fluid collections are seen.the splenic artery and splenic veins are patent.no extravasation is seen.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, prostate, rectum, and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are noted.
summary: no intra-abdominal fluid collections or abscesses.status post right adrenalectomy with small amount of residual fluid noted within the operative bed.bilateral l5 spondylolysis without spondylolisthesis.

text: a rectal tube is in place.the sigmoid colon demonstrates diverticulosis, and there is persistent fat stranding adjacent to the sigmoid colon, where the tract leading to the previously described, dramatically decreased abscess is still seen (301b:23).the bladder is inseparable from this.there is a moderate amount of pelvic fluid, some of which is loculated, the largest area in a presacral location but without an enhancing rind (301b:39).osseous structures appear unremarkable except for moderate degenerative change of the spine at multiple levels as well as an s-shaped scoliosis of the thoracolumbar spine, levoconvex in the thoracic spine and dextroconvex at the lumbosacral junction.
summary: resolution of fluid collections post surgical drainage of large anterior abdominal wall abscess.small amount o free fluid in the pelvis.dramatic reduction in the subcutaneous/fascial gas in comparison to the prior study.persistent large abdominal wall hernia with nonobstructed loops of bowel increased large pleural effusions with bilateral lower lobe collapse.

text: as seen on concurrent chest radiographs, there are diffuse nodular opacities in the lung bases, increased in size and number compared to the prior ct, with the largest in the right middle lobe measuring 2.4 x 1.7 cm and the second largest in the lingula measuring 1.5 x 1.3 cm (2:1).interlobular septal thickening has worsened from the most recent ct, likely due to volume overload, though lymphangitic spread of tumor is also a possibility.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right larger than left.the visualized portions of the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.there is moderate volume ascites, new from prior examination of ___.in addition, there is a new peripherally enhancing lesion in segment ivb of the liver measuring 2.2 x 1.5 cm (2:23).the hepatic and portal veins are patent.the gallbladder is distended, but there is no wall edema.a pelvic left kidney is noted.the kidneys are atrophic with multiple small cysts, many of which are too small to characterize.peripherally calcified lesion with internal heterogeneity arising from the upper pole of the right kidney measures 7.3 x 5.7 cm (2:34), unchanged.the pancreas, spleen, and adrenals are normal.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.there is no free intraperitoneal air.abdominal aorta is normal in caliber.extent of retroperitoneal and retrocrural lymphadenopathy has improved compared to the prior study.there is diffuse anasarca.
summary: new enhancing hepatic mass and increased number and size of pulmonary nodules at the lung bases compatible with worsening metastatic disease.several osseous metastatic lesions with soft tissue components are not significantly changed in the interval.worsening diffuse septal thickening, likely reflective of worsening pulmonary edema, though lymphangitic carcinomatosis is not excluded.small bilateral pleural effusions, right larger than left.new moderate volume ascites.atrophic kidneys with multiple cysts, likely related to dialysis.dominant, peripherally calcified complex cystic lesion in the right upper pole of the kidney could reflect the patient's primary renal carcinoma.___

text: the bladder, rectum, prostate gland, and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.there is diverticulosis without diverticulitis of the sigmoid colon.there is no free fluid, free air, or lymphadenopathy in the pelvis.
summary: status post esophagectomy with gastric pull-through with no evidence of recurrence hypodense lesion in the left lobe of the liver, too small to characterize, but may represent a cyst thickening of the adrenal glands bilaterally likely due to hyperplasia.atherosclerosis.

text: included views of the lung bases demonstrate small bilateral pleural effusions and moderate bibasilar atelectasis (2:6).there is massive intraabdominal and intrapelvic free fluid, with layering hyperdense contrast coating peritoneal surfaces, likely representing barium from the ___ esophagram.less-dense contrast pooling more focally about the spleen (2:14, 301b:68) represents more recently administered oral contrast; close proximity to the nissen fundoplication (300b:53) is highly suspicious for leak at the surgical site.a large amount of pneumoperitoneum (2:56) is present.small pocket of air seen next to the esophagus just above the diaphgragm with minimal associated fluid, likely communicated from the peritoneum.there is moderate subcutaneous emphysema surrounding the abdominal wall laterally and anteriorly (2:37).no bowel obstruction is seen.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys appear normal.
summary: significant free air and coating of peritoneal surfaces of the abdomen and pelvis with barium indicates significant leak, likely from the nissen fundoplication site.different densities of barium likely represent barium from the prior esophagram as well as the oral preparation for this study.small pocket of air adjacent to the esophagus just above the diaphragm is presumably associated with the same leak, and does not have significant associated fluid collection.moderate subcutaneous emphysema overlying the anterior and lateral abdominal walls.

text: again seen are several pericardial nodes, not significantly changed in appearance from prior study.inferior aspect of the central venous line is again seen within the right atrium.bibasilar airspace opacities and consolidations again noted.allowing for limitations of the non-contrast study, the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.high-density material is seen within the gallbladder, possibly representing sludge versus vicarious excretion of contrast.native pancreas and kidneys again appear atrophic.there has been interval decrease in the amount of subhepatic fluid.pigtail catheter seen within the collection which has decreased in size compared to ___.small amount of persistent fluid and gas is seen in the collection.previously described two small collections in the region of the native pancreas head are again identified, containing decreased amount of fluid.there appears to be an interval granulation of these areas.bowel appears of normal caliber.again seen is a small fluid collection in the anterior abdomen, just beneath the abdominal wall, not significantly changed in appearance from prior study.scattered lymph nodes again seen throughout the mesentery and retroperitoneum.ivc filter again seen in place.transplanted kidney seen within the right lower quadrant, grossly unremarkable allowing for non-contrast study.
summary: interval decrease in size of subhepatic fluid collection, with pigtail catheter in place.small amount of fluid and gas still noted within this collection.stable fluid collection in the anterior abdomen, just beneath the abdominal wall.slight decrease in small fluid collections near the native pancreas head with interval granulation of tissue.

text: the urinary bladder and rectum are normal.there is no pelvic free fluid or adenopathy.bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias are seen.dural ectasias extending from the bony foramen along the anterior portion of the sacrum (tarlov cysts) are stable.nonspecific stranding is seen within the anterior subcutaneous tissues of the lower abdominal wall, which may reflect the cellulitis stated in the history.no discrete fluid collection or abscess is identified.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal process identified.non-specific stranding within the anterior subcutaneous tissues of the lower abdomen, compatible with given history of cellulitis.no abscess identified.small bilateral pleural effusions, new from ___.resolution of pericardial effusion.

text: the previously seen collection in the right lower quadrant, identified on the scan from one day prior, has significantly decreased in size.no drainable fluid collection remains in this region.a few small air bubbles are noted at the site of the previously seen collection, adjacent to suture material in the right lower quadrant.there is soft tissue stranding in the right lower quadrant anteriorly at the site of previous collection.the imaged portion of the inferior aspect of the liver, gallbladder, and lower poles of the kidneys are unremarkable.there is residual contrast material seen in the colon.multiple diverticula are noted in the sigmoid colon.the small bowel loops are normal in caliber without evidence to suggest obstruction.residual contrast material is noted in the bladder.degenerative changes are seen on bone windows.it should be noted that when the patient's dressing was taken down over the previous site of the catheter in the right lower quadrant, the gauze was soaked with serosanguinous fluid.
summary: decompression of the previously seen right lower quadrant collection through the wound site.no drainable fluid collection remains in this region, therefore a catheter was not placed.

text: distal ureters and bladder are within normal limits.there is a foley within the bladder.bowel loops are unremarkable; there is good opacification of distal small bowel, proximal and distal colon to the junction of the sigmoid and left colon.free fluid is seen tracking into the pelvis from the intraperitoneal space.no discrete fluid collections are identified.the uterus and adnexa are grossly normal.there is anasarca.bone windows show no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions.there is a nasogastric tube coursing below the stomach.multiplanar reformats were essential in delineating the findings above.

text: evaluation of the abdomen is severely limited by barium contrast within the entire colon causing streak artifact.multiple hypodensities are seen within both left and right lobes of the liver.within segment vi/vii, a lesion measures 3.6 x 2.6 cm.within segment vii, a lesion measures 1.9 x 2.2 cm, previously 2.0 x 2.2.multiple hypodense lesions are seen to have vessels coursing through them.the spleen is unremarkable.the gallbladder appears unremarkable.the pancreas appears normal.the adrenals are normal bilaterally.the kidneys appear to enhance symmetrically, though again their evaluation is limited by streak artifact.there is right-sided hydronephrosis, and hydroureter which extends to the level of the pelvic inlet where it becomes normal in caliber; no stone is seen.there is somewhat delayed excretion of contrast from the right kidney.the left kidney demonstrates contrast excretion, without hydronephrosis.the stomach appears normal, though is distended by positive contrast.evaluation of the duodenum is made impossible by the streak artifact from adjacent high-density material within the colon.the small bowel appears decompressed throughout its course; its mesentery is unremarkable.
summary: exam interpretation limited by dense barium within the entire colon.there is hydronephrosis and hydroureter on the right, increased compared with comparison outside ct, with a point of relative decompression at the pelvic inlet.recommend urologic consultation for further management.multiple hypodensities seen within the liver, similar in appearance in comparison with prior.vessels are seen coursing through this, which is not a typical appearance for metastasis, and recommend correlation with prior imaging studies if available.these imaging findings may represent treated disease.air in bladder, recommend correlation with recent instrumentation.small bilateral pleural effusions.diffuse osseous metastases.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at 4:40pm on ___.

text: there is no parenchymal opacity or pleural effusion at the lung bases.heart size is normal.there is no pericardial effusion.slightly limited evaluation of solid organs due to lack of iv contrast.with this limitation in mind, the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are within normal limits.the stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of small bowel are unremarkable.there is no small bowel dilatation or wall thickening.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.post-surgical changes in the right lower quadrant at the site of prior ostomy are noted with no evidence of fluid collection or other complication.within the left upper quadrant of the abdomen is a focal area acute diverticulitis involving the transverse colon (series 2, image 35), with surrouding fat stranding and edema.no perforation or fluid collection is noted.this area of acute diverticulitis is new from prior.

text: the lung bases demonstrate a calcified granuloma in the right lower lobe (s-2, i-5).with the limitation of the noncontrast study, the liver appears slightly heterogeneous.the gallbladder demonstrates gallstones.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands are within normal limits.both kidneys appear unremarkable.no evidence of hydronephrosis or kidney stone.the patient is status post ileocecectomy and right colectomy with ileo-colic anastomosis in the right upper abdomen and scattered surgical clips.there is circumferential bowel wall thickening with submucosal edema involving the distal neo-ileum, continuously involving the colon, with relative sparing of the remainder of the transverse colon and the rectum.the sigmoid colon demonstrates similar, but less marked, involvement by this process, suggestive of "skip" lesions.there is also relatively mild inflammatory fat-stranding and mesenteric edema with geographic distribution, adjacent to the distal neoileum.borderline enlarged regional lymph nodes are also seen.there is no free air or free fluid.no evidence of abscess.
summary: while circumferential (with antemesenteric) involvement, the findings most likely represent recurrent crohn's ileocolitis, with involvement of the neo- terminal ileum, as well as the sigmoid colon.however, the rather extensive and circumferential bowel wall thickening raise the possibility of superimposed toxic (ie.c.difficile) or infectious process.no evidence of bowel obstruction, fluid collection, abscess or perforation.fatty liver, gallstones and sacroileitis, all consistent with underlying ibd.

text: several nodules at the left lung base up to 7 mm in diameter are unchanged from multiple prior cts.the pigtail catheter is again seen entering the right lobe of the liver via an intercostal approach and terminating within a right hepatic lobe collection, decreased in size (2.8 x 5.1 cm, previously 3.1 x 5.6 cm).the small area of hypodensity in the subdiaphragmatic recess adjacent to the dome of the liver, traversed by the catheter, is unchanged and likely represents granulation tissue at the site of the previously present collection.a left lobe collection measuring 2.9 x 2.2 cm also shows continued decrease in size (previously 2.7 x 3.9 cm).streak artifact arising from embolization coils in the right lobe of the liver is unchanged.the imaged portion of the remainder of the abdominal organs is unchanged, including multiple nodules of the left adrenal gland and a hyperdense focus in the upper pole of the right kidney.there has been prior splenectomy and distal pancreatectomy, and right adrenalectomy.bone windows are unchanged from most recent examination one week ago.since the catheter had been capped for three days prior to the examination and the size of the collection was decreased, the catheter was aspirated with a 10 cc syringe yielding only 1 cc of aspirated material and was subsequently cut to release the pigtail and removed.the patient tolerated this procedure well and remained stable throughout his stay in the ct suite.
summary: continued decrease in size of the right hepatic lobe collection.drainage catheter removed.continued decrease in size of the left lobe hepatic collection.otherwise unchanged ct of the abdomen.

text: please note that evaluation of the abdomen and pelvis is significantly limited by the non-contrast technique of this study.the visualized portions of the lung bases demonstrate minor atelectasis.visualized portions of the heart and pericardium demonstrates coronary artery calcifications and pacemaker wires.also noted is stable marked polychamber cardiomegaly.there is also dense calcification of the mitral annulus as previously described.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.the liver demonstrates multiple small hypodensities, which are too small to characterize definitively.a small subcentimeter hypodensity of the posterior right hepatic lobe is more prominent on today's exam, but this is likely secondary to technical differences between the studies.overall, the appearance of the liver is stable.there are stones within the gallbladder, but no evidence of acute cholecystitis.the spleen, pancreas, stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel appear unremarkable.the patient is status post left nephrectomy and surgical clips are identified in the nephrectomy bed.the left adrenal gland is not visualized on this study.the right adrenal gland appears normal.the right kidney demonstrates a tiny residual calcification in the collecting system, but otherwise is unremarkable.given the limitations of this noncontrast technique, there is no apparent masses, hydronephrosis, hydroureter, or perinephric stranding.there are extensive calcifications of the abdominal aorta, iliac arteries, and splenic artery.there is no pathologic mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.

text: limited examination of the lung bases displays numerous small hyperdense foci scattered within the lung bases bilaterally, suggestive of aspirated oral contrast material from prior examination.no focal consolidations are identified and there are small bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent compression atelectasis (left greater than right).slight prominence to the posteromedial effusion at the right base may suggest underlying loculation.heart and great vessels appear unremarkable.the liver parenchyma displays a small hypoattenuating lesion within the liver dome, which displays no enhancement.there is a mild- to- moderate amount of periportal edema along with enhancement of the hepatic capsule and peritoneal cavity.gallbladder distention does not appear significantly changed since prior mri, with wall edema, a small amount of pericholecystic fluid and layering stones/milk of calcium bile within the neck.the spleen displays a heterogeneous perfusion on both the early and delayed phase images that may suggest underlying infarcts.there is moderate gastric distention, but no evidence of outlet obstruction and the intra- abdominal loops of small bowel are mildly dilated with prominent mucosal enhancement, suggestive of shock bowel.there is pneumoperitoneum within the right and left upper quadrants; however, the exact source of the free air is not well localized.the kidneys again demonstrate bilateral simple renal cysts, but enhance and excrete contrast normally.the adrenal glands are within normal limits.the celiac axis, sma, smv, and ___ appear patent and there is unchanged appearance to marked atherosclerotic disease/ulcerative plaque predominantly involving the infrarenal aorta.a moderate amount of ascites is noted within the abdominal cavity tracking into the paracolic gutters bilaterally.
summary: pneumoperitoneum, likely from bowel perforation without a definitive source identified.no significant interval change to markedly thickened and diseased distal jejunum/proximal ileal bowel loop with enteric-rectal fistula and pelvic phlegmon.diffusely dilated loops of small bowel with hyperemic wall enhancement suggestive of shock bowel.no pneumotosis identified.hepatic capsular and peritoneal enhancement with moderate amount of free peritoneal fluid suggests underlying peritonitis.small-to-moderate bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent compression atelectasis.multiple hyperdense foci within the lung bases bilaterally suggest aspiration of previously administered contrast material.heterogeneous perfusion pattern to the spleen may relate to splenic infarcts.stable appearance to dilated and distended gallbladder with wall edema, biliary sludge and stones.findings were discussed with dr.___ and the surgical team, drs.___ and ___ after exam acquisition.the patient is being prepped for intraoperative exploration given the pneumoperitoneum and hemodynamic instability.

text: there is a caliber change of the dilated descending colon at the transition to the sigmoid colon but no definite obstruction can be seen and there is fluid and air in the rectum.no free pelvic fluid is seen.no pelvic lymphadenopathy is seen.the bladder is unremarkable, containing a foley catheter.the prostate is not clearly visualized.note is made of some high density material in some of the colonic loops which may represent old contrast material.
summary: dilated colon and particularly dilated cecum and ascending colon filled with loose fecal material (>12 cm) without evidence of cecal volvulus or direct evidence of ischemia.free intraabdominal air, likely due to the recently placed peg tube.no pneumatosis or bowel wall thickening to suggest bowel ischemia.the colonic dilatation may represent an ileus.simple cyst in right kidney.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar atelectasis.the liver is unremarkable.there is a small amount of perihepatic fluid just inferior to the liver as noted previously and not significantly changed, and the drain has been removed.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys appear normal bilaterally.
summary: decreased size but persistent multiloculated fluid collection in the pelvis as described above.two penrose drains remain in place.the sigmoid colon has mass effect upon it from these fluid collections with a somewhat distended colon proximal to this.therefore, this is likely a colonic ileus due to these fluid collections.small bilateral pleural effusions.stable minimal amount of fluid below the inferior tip of the liver.

text: a foley catheter is seen within the bladder lumen.again seen is a large mass in the anterior pelvic wall, with a similar appearance to the prior study.the distal colon is fluid filled, and difficult to distinguish from what are likely some cystic lesions particularly adjacent to the distal right ureter.the appendix is of normal size, and demonstrates either contrast or calcification within it.
summary: mildly dilated loops of proximal small bowel; however, contrast is seen within the ostomy bag.a low grade partial small bowel obstruction or ileus is possible.progression of the pleural abnormalities on the left, with total collapse of the left lung, and multiple enhancing nodular left pleural structures very suspicious for pleural tumor.large right-sided pleural effusion, some regions of which demonstrate higher density, which could represent hemorrhage or exudate.ground-glass opacity in the aerated right lung likely represents pulmonary edema, less likely infection.stable soft tissue in the anterior pelvis along the bladder dome, consistent with local tumor spread.fullness of both collecting systems unchaged from the recent ultrasound.

text: there is beam hardening artifact limiting evaluation.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas appear unremarkable.the gallbladder is unremarkable, without visualization of the known stones.there are low attenuations within both kidneys, in the region of the prior described cyst.there is atherosclerotic calcification of the descending aorta.large and small bowel are not dilated.there is no lymphadenopathy or free air.there is a small amount of free fluid in the lower abdomen in the pericolic gutters.focal fluid collections.there is diffuse anasarca.
summary: scan limited by severe beam-hardening artefact.no definite intrathoracic or intra-abdominal mabscess.large bilateral pleural effusions, small pericardial effusion, and anasarca.small amount of ascites.

text: as mentioned above, there is mild wall thickening without pneumatosis of the sigmoid colon.the rectal wall may be also thickened minimally.pelvic small-bowel loops appear unremarkable.the terminal ileum appears unremarkable.there is no free pelvic fluid and no lymphadenopathy is seen.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted of the iliac arteries bilaterally.
summary: continuous concentric mild bowel wall thickening from the splenic flexure distally involving the entire sigmoid colon and perhaps mildly also the rectum.no evidence of bowel obstruction, pneumotosis, or portal venous gas.considerations would include inflammatory bowel disease such as colitis ulcerosa or an infectious etiology.given the distribution of the bowel wall thickening, an ischemic origin seems less likely.since ___, the left kidney demonstrates new atrophy and decreased/delayed excretion, likely due to atherosclerotic involvement of the left renal artery.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.grossly distended stomach despite ng tube.the pertinent findings have been discussed with dr.___ after completion of the study.

text: there is bibasilar dependent atelectasis with small bilateral pleural effusions.the heart appears enlarged.lack of iv contrast limits solid organ evaluation.given these limitations, the spleen, adrenals, pancreas, and gallbladder appear normal.there are multiple hypodensities in the liver, notably in the left lobe (2:25), and within segment iv (2:25, 2:29) which are too small to characterize by ct, but were previously described on ultrasound as a cyst.the kidneys appear unremarkable without stones or hydronephrosis.the abdominal aorta and its branches appear normal without aneurysmal dilatation.there are innumerable retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes.the largest is a periportal lymph node measuring 16 mm (2:29).stomach and abdominal loops of small bowel appear normal in caliber.
summary: large left psoas abscess similar to the previous study.the margins of abscess are poorly defined due to lack of iv contrast.no definitive drainable collection.status post lumbar laminectomy with extra-axial gas and soft tissue stranding.intrathecal contents are not well evaluated.bibasilar atelectasis and small pleural effusions.a small component of infection in the lung bases cannot be excluded.liver hypodensities, compatible with a cyst described in prior ultrasound.mesenteric and retroperitoneal adenopathy as well as inguinal adenopathy, likely reactive.

text: dependent changes are seen within the lung bases.there are no pleural effusions.atelectasis or scarring is seen in the left lower lobe.evaluation of intra-abdominal organs is limited without iv contrast.allowing for the limitations, no focal lesions are seen within the liver.there is no evidence of pneumobilia.multiple surgical clips are seen throughout the abdomen.a g-tube is present, along with a ventriculoperitoneal shunt with the tip in the left pericolic gutter.an ivc filter is also present.the spleen and pancreas are unremarkable allowing for the noncontrast technique.there is no hydronephrosis.extensive renal vascular calcification is present bilaterally.there are changes from prior aortobifemoral grafting for an irregular aortic aneurysm just above the iliac bifurcation.there is a midline abdominal wall defect, which contains nonincarcerated, nonobstructed colon.small bowel loops are all normal in caliber.
summary: limited study without iv contrast.no biliary ductal dilatation or air within the biliary tree.no evidence of intra-abdominal abscess.foley catheter with large amount of air within the bladder.ventral wall hernia containing nonincarcerated, nonobstructed transverse colon.

text: tiny small right pneumothorax (se 2, img 9) and focus of mediastinal air (2,4) which could be explained by attempted line placement.there is a left pleural effusion, new since ___ with associated small left basilar atelectasis.small amont the atria are enlarged and the interventricular septum is visible indicating anemia.there are no focal hepatic lesions on this non-enhanced ct.a large gallstone is seen in the gallbladder neck, unchanged from prior exam, but no evidence of acute cholecystitis.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys are normal, without evidence of hydronephrosis or obstructing stones.left lower pole hemorrhagic renal cyst.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.moderate atherosclerotic calcifications of the abdominal aorta and iliac arteries.the esophagus, stomach, and small bowel are normal.the patient is status post abdominoperineal resection of the rectum with end-colostomy in the left lower quadrant.there is an unchanged left lower quadrant parastomal hernia without evidence of bowel obstruction.
summary: no acute process of the abdomen and pelvis including no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.no splenic injury and no left lower rib fractures.small left pleural effusion.tiny small right pneumothorax and focus of mediastinal air which could be explained by attempted line placement.

text: the prostate contains multiple small calcifications.the rectum and bladder are normal.there is no free fluid or adenopathy of the pelvis.
summary: complex multiloculated collection adjacent to stoma, too small to drain under ct guidance.the medial portion of this collection communicates with the area of drainage identified along the ventral wound.

text: lung bases are clear without effusions or focal consolidation.again demonstrated within the liver is a well defined round 1.6 cm hypodensity, unchanged in size and appearance from the prior exam.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, stomach, and loops of large and small bowel are all within normal limits.previously identified 5 mm stone in the midpole in the right kidney is no longer visualized.instead demonstrated are multiple calculi throughout the right ureter.the largest ureteral calculus is noted within the proximal ureter and measures approximately 5 mm.there is mild dilatation of the proximal ureter upstream to this calculus, and mild associated periureteral stranding.additionally multiple, approximately 2 mm in size, calculi are demonstrated within the right distal ureter, just proximal to the ureterovesical junction.several 1 mm calculi are also scattered within the right renal collecting system and mid- right ureter.compared with the prior study, there is minimal increase in perinephric stranding around the right kidney.again demonstrated within the right kidney is a large cyst which is relatively stable since the prior exam.a left renal cyst remains unchanged in the interval.there is no free air or free fluid.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.no pathologically enlarged retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph nodes are demonstrated.the aorta is heavily calcified.the gallbladder is not visualized.
summary: multiple calculi within the right renal and ureteral collecting system, with the largest calculus seen in the proximal ureter measuring 5 mm.there is minimal increase in right perinephric stranding and right proximal periureteral stranding with mild hydroureter.several tiny stones are also demonstrated within the right distal ureter.the previously seen 5 mm right renal stone is no longer demonstrated, and these findings are most consistent with patient's history of recent lithotripsy with formation of tinier stones that are now transiting through the collecting system.stable bilateral renal cysts.stable appearance of liver hypodensity.

text: there is a new large left rectus sheath hematoma with a central area of high attenuation.the inferior drainage catheter extends through the lateral portion of the left rectus muscle.the tip of the catheter is present within a lobular high-attenuation collection within the pelvis.the pelvic bowel loops abut this fluid collection.the prostate and urinary bladder are unremarkable.there is no significant pelvic adenopathy.the osseous structure demonstrate no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.there is moderate degenerative change of the lumbar spine.
summary: there is decrease in size of the fluid collection within the left lobe of the liver.no new well-defined collections are present.there is a new left rectus sheath hematoma with a central area of high attenuation which may indicate acute hemorrhage.the fluid collection within the pelvis appears to be a mixture of blood products of varying ages.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is a small low-attenuation lesion within the spleen which is unchanged compared with the prior study and may represent a splenic abscess.

text: visualized lung bases show moderate dependent bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there is a solitary enlarged right cardiophrenic lymph node, measuring 2.4 x 1.3 cm, increased in size since previous exam, when it measured 1.6 x 0.8 mm.the liver is nodular in contour, consistent with reported history of cirrhosis.no focal liver lesions are seen.there is no biliary ductal dilatation.there is a moderate-to-large rim-enhancing subhepatic fluid collection, measuring 7.7 x 6.0 cm in greatest axial dimension, 6.6 cm in craniocaudal dimension.the surgical jp drain is situated directly within this collection.a few tiny punctate densities are seen in the dependent portion of this collection, likely representing dropped gallstones.pancreas is unremarkable.spleen is surgically absent.adrenal glands are normal.there is a small-to-moderate amount of ascites around the liver, and throughout the abdomen, greatest in the right lower quadrant.no other discrete fluid collections are noted.there is mild mesenteric enhancement, consistent with reported history of peritonitis.prominent periportal and peripancreatic lymph nodes are not significantly changed.kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.mild bilateral hydronephrosis is slightly increased since previous exam, without obvious cause for obstruction.there is no sign of renal stone or mass.there are a few tiny foci of pneumoperitoneum, which may represent residual post-operative air, versus air related to the indwelling jp drain.
summary: 7.7-cm subhepatic rim-enhancing fluid collection.surgically placed jp drain is situated directly within the center of this collection.probable tiny dropped gallstones in the dependent portion and immediately adjacent.cirrhotic liver, with ascites, and mild mesenteric and peritoneal enhancement, consistent with reported history of peritonitis.increased size of now 2.4-cm right cardiophrenic lymph node.slightly increased mild bilateral hydronephrosis.fat and fluid-filled small paraumbilical hernia.findings discussed by telephone with dr.___ at 8:15 p.m.on ___.

text: moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions are increased since the ___ study with adjacent compressive atelectasis.no pneumothorax is present.there is a pacer wire within the heart.there is a small pericardial effusion which is larger than on the prior study.within the limits of this non-contrast examination, the spleen, adrenals, pancreas and liver appear normal.there is a large gallstone within the gallbladder which is less distended than on prior examination, particularly compared to study from ___.a 16-mm hyperdense nodule arises off the upper pole of the left kidney which is unchanged (2:23).no stones or hydronephrosis are present in the kidneys.there is an air filled tract extending through the ventral abdominal wall into the stomach with a thin catheter within the stomach that appears to extend into the duodenum where there is a bulb, likely the patient's g-tube.remaining loops of bowel appear normal.no free air is present.there is a small-to-moderate amount of simple ascites seen adjacent to the liver and spleen.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are present.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber.

summary: decreased size of peripancreatic fluid collections.improved enhancement of residual pancreas.probable perfusion anomaly in anterior segment of right hepatic lobe.

text: there are foci of fluid and air insinuated between the muscles of the right groin, likely related to recent percutaneous intervention.there is a discrete collection just anterior to the right acetabulum, measuring approximately 2.2 x 2.1 cm.there are foci of air within this collection.more superiorly, within the anterior inferior portion of the right iliacus, there is a smaller hypodense collection with a couple of foci of air measuring 1.6 x 0.7 cm (series 2, image 70).slightly more superiorly, posterior to the right common iliac vessels and medial to the right psoas, there is a small collection measuring 2.0 x 1.1 cm, also containing foci of air.these collections are concerning for multifocal abscesses.there is stranding of the fat adjacent to the right iliacus and right psoas inferiorly.there is a foley catheter within the bladder, and air within the bladder likely related to instrumentation.the uterus, adnexa, rectum, and sigmoid are normal.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: foci of fluid and air within the right groin and within the right retroperitoneum that are concerning for multiple foci of infection.in this patient with fevers and chills and an elevated white count, these tiny foci are concerning for abscesses.there is stranding of the fat surrounding the right iliac iliacus and right psoas muscles.fatty infiltration of the liver.hyperdense material within the gallbladder which may represent gallstones.the findings were relayed to the ed dashboard at the immediate conclusion of the exam.

text: there is a new right sided pleural effusion.again are noted calcified granulomas at the right lung base.there are no focal consolidations.the liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenals, kidneys are unchanged in appearance and unremarkable allowing for noncontrast technique.an ng tube is again seen coursing through the stomach and terminating in the proximal duodenum.there has been an increase in the amount of ascites within the abdomen.fat stranding is again seen throughout the mesentery.there are several small nonpathologically enlarged lymph nodes scattered throughout the mesentery.

text: the liver is normal in appearance without focal lesions.the portal veins are patent.the spleen is normal in appearance.the adrenals are normal bilaterally.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric contrast enhancement and brisk bilateral excretion without hydronephrosis.the pancreas is normal in appearance.the gallbladder is unremarkable without stones or wall thickening.the stomach and visualized loops of small bowel are normal in caliber and enhancement.there is no intraperitoneal free fluid or free air.there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: ascending aortic aneurysm is stable in size compared with prior.better appreciated on this study, though also stable in appearance is a penetrating ulcer and dissection extending along the anterior surface of the ascending aorta probably into where the aaa was previously wrapped around the graft.this does not involve the arch or descending aorta and thus is ___ type a.findings were discussed by phone with dr.___ at 4:15pm.

text: again demonstrated is a small amount of fluid within the pelvis.there is no significant abnormality within the pelvis.the intrapelvic bowel loops are unremarkable.osseous structures are unremarkable.

text: evaluation of solid organs is limited by lack of intravenous contrast.there is no focal liver lesion or biliary ductal dilation.the gallbladder is decompressed and appears normal.the adrenal glands, spleen, kidneys, and pancreas appear normal.the numerous splenic lesions seen on prior contrast-enhanced ct are not apparent on this non-contrast study.there is no hydronephrosis.there are two nonobstructing kidney stones on the left, alternatively these may represent vascular calcifications (2:87).there is no abdominal or retroperitoneal free fluid or fluid collection.the abdominal aorta contains sparse calcifications and is of normal caliber.there are two paraaortic lymph nodes previously shown to demonstrate fdg avidity, which are unchanged in size within the limitations of differing ct technique (2:78, 81).another prominent 7-mm left paraaortic lymph node does not meet ct size criteria for pathological enlargement and did not demonstrate fdg avidity (2:81).no other intra-abdominal lymphadenopathy is identified.the stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are normal in caliber, without mass or thickening.
summary: no occult hematoma or hemorrhage identified in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.a precarinal lymph node and two paraortic lymph nodes in the abdomen, which previously demonstrated fdg avidity are stable in size.focal liver and splenic lesions identified on prior contrast-enhanced ct are not seen on this study.

text: the pigtail catheter within the left retroperitoneal region is unchanged in position.there is a persistent, small 3.2 x 2.1 cm area with fat stranding and internal air compatible with sequela from previous retroperitoneal hematoma.the appearance of this region and stranding extending from the level of the mid left kidney down to the area of the renal transplant in left lower quadrant is essentially unchanged when compared to the previous exam.there are again two separate areas within the left anterior abdominal wall fascia with enhancing rims which also appear stable when compared to the previous exam.the lateral one measures approximately 3.1 x 1.4 cm with the medial one measuring approximately 2.7 x 2.0 cm.the medial one appears to communicate with the skin through a small defect.the kidney transplant enhances unremarkably.
summary: stable appearance of small phlegmons within the anterior abdominal wall fascia within the left lower quadrant.stable appearance of pigtail catheter in the left lower quadrant with a small adjacent area of stranding with internal air.

text: the lung bases are clear.there is minimal bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.within the liver, there are multiple subcentimeter hypodensities which are too small to characterize but are similar in appearance (2, 15 and 2, 17).there is pneumobilia, unchanged.the portal vein is patent.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.within the right kidney, there is a 2.4 x 3.6 cm hypodense lesion which is not significantly changed and likely represents a cyst.a smaller hypodensity within the lower pole of the right kidney (2, 43) measures 1.2 cm and has increased in size when compared to prior exam.multiple scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified which are numerous, although measure less than 1 cm in short axis diameter.for example, there is a 7 mm lymph node within the root of the mesentery (2, 39).small amount of fluid surrounding the duodenum and pancreatic head is again identified and is improved in appearance.mesenteric fat stranding is unchanged.there is a large abdominal wall ventral hernia containing loops of bowel.there is no evidence of obstruction.there is no free air identified.the spleen and pancreas are unremarkable.the aorta contains mild atherosclerotic calcification.
summary: improved appearance of small amount of fluid surrounding the duodenum and head of the pancreas as well as extensive mesenteric fat stranding and numerous lymph nodes which are not pathologically enlarged as described above.anterior abdominal wall hernia.no evidence of obstruction.right renal hypodensity in the lower pole which has increased in size.stable hepatic hypodensities and pneumobilia.enlarged prostate with central hypodensity, unchanged.soft tissue stranding over the right anterior thorax subcutaneous soft tissues (2, 7) at site of prior tissue expander.

text: ct of the abdomen with contrast: the visualized lung bases demonstrate bilateral fibrotic changes, related to prior radiation treatment for breast cancer.no suspicious pulmonary nodules are identified.centrilobular emphysema is seen in the lung bases.no pleural effusions are detected.the visualized heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.the liver shows homogeneous attenuation without focal lesions.the gallbladder is fluid filled and appears unremarkable.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.both adrenal glands are normal.spleen is normal in appearance.both kidneys show symmetric opacification and excretion of contrast.the pancreas is normal in appearance.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph nodes are detected.the stomach, small bowel and large bowel appear normal in appearance without evidence of obstruction, focal wall thickening, or masses.there is no intra-abdominal free fluid or air.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is seen.there is diffuse atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta, without aneurysmal dilatation.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal pathology, especially no intra-abdominal abscess is identified.bibasilar fibrotic changes related to prior radiation therapy.diffuse centrilobular emphysematous changes in both lung bases.diffuse atherosclerotic disease of the abdominal aorta, without aneurysmal dilatation.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, uterus, and adnexa are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or lymphadenopathy.
summary: double pigtail biliary stent extending from the right hepatic biliary system to the duodenum.no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.13-mm low-attenuation lesion in the body of the pancreas.per report, patient has a history of pancreatic serous cyst, which is compatible with the lesion currently idenitified.without prior imaging, stability cannot be confirmed.if there is any clinical concern or said diagnosis has not been previously established, mri can be obtained.___ appearance of the mesentery with mildly prominent mesenteric lymph nodes which is a nonspecific finding, however, given its association with lymphoma, three-month followup is recommended.

text: the large bowel appears unremarkable, although there is a moderate amount of stool within the descending colon.there is a lippes loop iud present.multiple low-density lobulated structures are seen within the uterus, measuring up to 3.6 cm in diameter, some of which are intramural and others which are subserosal with appearance of multiple uterine fibroids.there is also a loculated rim of fluid along the right-sided uterus, probably a small amount of pelvic free fluid which may be physiologic in a patient of menstural age.the ovaries are not well appreciated.the bladder is quite distended.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.examination of osseous structures did not show suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.mild degenerative changes are seen at the lower lumbar spine.coronally and sagittally reformatted images were also reviewed, confirming the findings described above, as well as demonstrating marked degenerative disc changes at the l3-4 level with endplate sclerosis and disc degeneration.
summary: unremarkable appearance of the small and large bowel, without mural thickening, overt mucosal enhancement (in the non-opacified bowel), or evidence of obstruction.diffusely hypodense and enlarged appearance of the liver, consistent with hepatitis, fatty infiltration, and/or liver failure in this clinical setting.iud in place, with fibroid uterus.small amount of pelvic free fluid may be physiologic in patient of menstural age.

text: bilateral pleural effusions are noted, left greater than right with adjacent compressive atelectasis.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.the liver, spleen, pancreas, bilateral adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the gallbladder is not well visualized.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis or renal calculi.intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel appear within normal limits.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet size criteria for pathologic enlargement.intra-abdominal vasculature appears within normal limits.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent compressive atelectasis.focal stranding in subcutaneous fat with area of tiny locules of air just adjacent to the focal stranding (2, 50) may represent injection sites, correlate with history.no other intra-abdominal pathology to explain patient's symptoms.

text: ct abdomen w/o contrast: there is a small left pleural effusion with associated passive atelectasis.there is minimal right basilar atelectasis.otherwise, the lungs are clear with no evidence of focal consolidation or pneumothorax.the heart is normal in size without any pericardial effusion.evaluation of intra-abdominal organs is not optimal without contrast administration.liver is unremarkable with no focal lesions or evidence of fibrosis.the gallbladder is grossly unremarkable.adrenals, kidneys, spleen, and pancreas show no gross abnormality on this non-contrast study.there is scant perihepatic fluid consistent with transudative ascites.there is no additional fluid seen in the abdomen.there is no retroperitoneal bleed.intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.there is no evidence of obstruction.there is edema seen throughout the mesentery and evidence of anasarca diffusely throughout the subcutaneous tissues.
summary: left pleural effusion with associated passive atelectasis.diffuse subcutaneous anasarca as well as edema throughout the mesentery, likely representing aggressive hydration.no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.

text: there is no evidence of retroperitoneal or intraperitoneal hematoma.stranding within the right inguinal region is likely post-procedural.the descending aorta and iliac arteries are densely calcified.excreted contrast is present within the urinary bladder.the prostate is enlarged, measuring 6.6 cm in diameter, and demonstrates central coarse calcifications.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.no enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes are identified.

text: the visualized heart is unremarkable.small right lung base opacity is again seen and likely reflects atelectasis or scarring.the lung bases are otherwise clear without focal consolidation.no pleural or pericardial effusion is visualized.the liver parenchyma is normal without focal or diffuse abnormality.pneumobilia is again seen, similar to the prior study.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.there is no evidence of intra- or extra-hepatic bile duct dilatation.the patient is status post puestow procedure.pancreatic calcifications are consistent with known chronic pancreatitis.there is no evidence of pancreatic stranding, peripancreatic fluid, or pseudocyst.the spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.bilateral kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly.bilateral ureters are normal in course and caliber.the stomach contains oral contrast.the patient is status post roux-en-y bypass.a segment of small bowel in the right hemipelvis has a diffusely thickened wall and thickened folds, similar in appearance to ___.in the left hemi-abdomen, distended fluid-filled loops of small bowel measure up to 3.7-cm (3:40) and do not contain oral contrast.no definite transition point is identified proximal or distal to this segment of bowel.the colon contains a large amount of fecal matter and is otherwise unremarkable.no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.no abdominal wall hernia, pneumoperitoneum, or free abdominal fluid.the portal vasculature is unremarkable.the right common iliac artery contains a large atheroma and does not well-opacify, similar to prior and compatible with either severe stenosis or occlusion.right pelvic and femoral vessels distal to the common iliac artery are patent, though the right external iliac artery remains attenuated.the remainder of the intra-abdominal vasculature is unremarkable other than scattered atherosclerotic plaques.

however, there are no signs of acute diverticulitis.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.a foley catheter and a small amount of air are visualized within the bladder.there is no pelvic free fluid.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are identified.

text: there are no focal liver abnormalities.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the pancreas, adrenal glands and spleen appear normal.there is subtle hypoperfusion of the left kidney likely resulting from mixed arterial supply from the true and false lumina.no hydronephrosis or renal lesions.right kidney is normal.the stomach, duodenum and intra- the abdominal loops of small bowel are remarkable only for intramural fat deposition at the distal ileum, which can be seen in patients with chronic inflammatory bowel disease (2:169).there are regions within the transverse colon, which also feature this intramural fat deposition (2:131).the normal appendix is visualized (300b:37).there is no intra-abdominal free fluid or air.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.

text: in the anterior right lower quadrant, a jp drain is seen entering the lower abdominal cavity.there is surrounding soft tissue density and stranding, consistent with phlegmonous material.the drain is clearly within the phlegmonous material, however.the more superior portion of the inflammatory change is phlegmonous-appearing.in the midportion, there is a rounded collection containing soft tissue material and air.this measures 2.4 x 2.7 cm, and the jp drain is seen within it.at the inferior-most aspect of the inflammatory change, there is a second more discrete collection measuring 2.6 x 2.5 cm, containing soft tissue density material and air as well.the jp drain tip is oriented much more cephalic than this lower collection, though the inferior curvature of the jp drain courses through this lower collection.there is a tract of air extending through the anterior abdominal wall between the two collections, which likely reflects the area of wound opening.there is urine within the bladder.extending from the superior bladder is likely the remaining portion of ureter from the previous renal transplant.rectum and prostate are unremarkable.penile calcifications are noted.small bilateral hydroceles are partially imaged.
summary: phlegmonous material is seen within the anterior right lower quadrant of the abdomen, and a jp drain courses through the area of inflammation.there are two somewhat discrete collections containing fluid and air that are consistent with abscesses.the jp drain courses through each of these areas, though the tip of the jp drain is oriented cephalad with respect to both collections.previous renal transplant ureter stump is noted at the superior aspect of the bladder.this portion of remaining ureter contains air.small left pleural effusion.sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.small partially imaged hydrocele.

text: multiple liver masses are again seen and are showing interval increase in size, with formation of new liver lesions.for example, liver lesions, 2:46, measuring 46 x 46 mm, increased in size; liver lesion on 2:39, measuring 48 x 40 mm, increased in size; liver lesion on 2:31, 4 mm, unchanged; there is a new lesion, 2:46, measuring 12 x 7 mm; lesion on 2:47, measuring 23 x 18 mm, increased in size; lesion on 2:38, measuring 26 x 20 mm, increased in size; and lesion on 2:30, measuring 25 x 23 mm, increased in size; and a new lesion on 2:53, measuring 11 x 9 mm.the previously noted mid abdominal mesenteric mass has increased in size, now measuring 47 x 45 mm, 2:62.there are small retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph nodes, which do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.again seen are multiple small hypodensities in the kidneys bilaterally, not significantly changed compared to prior study.most of these lesions are too small to characterize.again seen is the aneurysmal dilatation of the abdominal aorta, unchanged, measuring 3 cm in diameter, 2:71.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, large and small bowel are within normal limits.previous noted abdominal wall lipoma on the right is unchanged from prior.
summary: interval increase in size of the multiple liver lesions, with new liver lesions, and interval increase in the appearance of the mid abdominal mesenteric mass, compared to prior study, showing interval worsening of the metastatic disease.new endobronchial soft tissue component which is enhancing, in the right main bronchus.new focal soft tissue opacity in the right lung base, might be focal consolidation; attention on next follow-up.small right pleural effusion.stable pulmonary nodule in the right upper lung.stable abdominal aortic dilatation.mild aneurysmal dilatation of the descending thoracic aorta.loss of vertebral body height on several level in thoracic spine, which has progressed compared to prior scan.
