summary: diffuse interstitial and alveolar densities within the lungs consistent with an infectious process.this is new from prior study.nonspecific cecal wall thickening.no evidence of pneumatosis.

text: evaluation of intra-abdominal organs is limited in the absence of intravenous contrast.within this limitation, the liver, spleen, atrophic pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys demonstrate no acute abnormalities.calcifications in the regions of the renal hila are likely arterial calcifications.the patient is status post cholecystectomy and surgical clips are seen in the gallbladder fossa.there is a moderate amount of ascites.visualized loops of bowel demonstrate no acute abnormalities; colonic diverticula do not demonstrate evidence for acute inflammation.calcification in the region of the splenic hilum may represent calcification of a tortuous splenic artery though splenic artery aneurysm cannot be excluded.there is extensive arterial atherosclerotic calcification along the abdominal aorta and iliac arteries with a suprarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm, which measures 3.7 x 4.2 cm in the axial plane, and an infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm that measures 5.0 x 4.9 cm (2:36).a crescent of relative ___ along the wall of this aneurysm (2:34) may represent mural thrombus, but evaluation is limited in the absence of intravenous contrast.there is no free intraperitoneal air.there is extensive diffuse subcutaneous edema.within an ascitic pocket in the left mid abdomen there is ill defined ___ that is located adjacent to bowel loops but does not clearly represent bowel (2:45, 301b:26).however, lack of any contrast opacification in this study severely limits assessment.the remainder of abdominal ascites is of low density.
summary: nodular opacities in the lung bases with right lower lobe cavitary nodule, concerning for infection.8.8 x 8.5 cm uterine mass that could represent a fibroid although its large size is atypical in a patient of this age and endometrial carcinoma cannot be excluded.further evaluation is recommended with pelvic ultrasound.ascites and anasarca.a region of ill defined ___ in left mid abdominal ascites is indeterminate due to lack of contrast and could represent bowel loops, though if malignancy were identified (such as after pelvic ultrasound) then omental density such as due to metastasis might be suspected.5.0-cm abdominal aortic aneurysm and 3.7 cm aortic aneurysm at the level of the diaphragmatic hiatus, both incompletely evaluated in the absence of intravenous contrast.these findings and recommendations were reported to dr.___ ___ by dr.___ by telephone at 10:54 p.m.on ___ at the time of initial review of the study.updated finding #2 and 3 were telephoned to ___ atiba by dr.___ on ___ at 1:08 pm after discovery at 1 pm.

text: comparison is made to a previous exam of ___.the lung bases are clear.the liver again shows multiple well circumscribed cystic lesions (___ less than 10) which have not significantly changed from the previous exam.the largest of these probable cysts measures approximately 6.5 x 6.4 cm.the pancreas is partially fatty-replaced.the spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the left kidney shows multiple sub-cm cysts, not significantly changed from the previous exam.there has been interval placement of a right-sided percutaneous nephrostomy catheter.there is no hydronephrosis or perinephric stranding bilaterally.there is no abdominal lymphadenopathy or free fluid.there is no evidence of hemorrhagic collections within the abdomen.

text: a foley is present in a collapsed bladder.rectum, sigmoid, and large bowel is unremarkable except for diverticular disease.note is made of right colon-containing right inguinal hernia without evidence for obstruction.fat-containing left inguinal hernia is also present.note of anasarca and diffuse muscular atrophy.bone windows demonstrate advanced degenerative changes and ill-defined sclerotic lesion in the left ischial tuberosity of doubtful clinical importance.no suspicious lesions are identified.

text: there is large amount of fluid in the pelvis with a hematocrit level consistent with a hematoma.the rectum and sigmoid colon appear grossly unremarkable.uterus and adnexa appear within normal limits.a foley catheter is seen in the bladder.there is no significant pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: active bleeding from the anterior liver causing a large hematoma in the right upper quadrant with extension of the hematoma into the pelvis.evidence of mass effect by the hematoma with displacement of the liver more centrally.fluid around the tail of the pancreas which may be consistent with the patient's history of pancreatitis.biliary catheter is seen in the porta hepatis.no significant fluid collection in the gallbladder fossa.small left pleural effusion and atelectasis house staff and angio have been informed of these findings immediately.

text: a moderate amount of free fluid is present within the pelvis.the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, distal ureters, uterus, and ovaries appear within normal limits.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes are noted.
summary: unchanged ill-defined mass centered within the porta hepatis compared to the ct of six days prior.minimal associated intrahepatic biliary dilatation.left portal vein involvement with thrombosis is unchanged.stable mild dilatation of the gallbladder.no wall edema, or pericholecystic fluid is present.small right pleural effusion.

text: bilateral lower lobe consolidations are again identified and overall unchanged compared to the 29th.no pleural or pericardial effusion is identified.again, evaluation of the abdominal organs is limited without iv contrast.allowing for this limitation, the liver, spleen, pancreas and gallbladder are unchanged.no new free intraperitoneal air is identified.linear dense material in each nephrectomy bed is again identified, likely representing fibrin net.the left-sided collection measures up to approximately 8.2 cm in greatest dimension (previously measuring up to 8.4 cm).this collection is noted to extend and encase the duodenum.the right nephrectomy bed collection measures up to approximately 7.0 cm.while these collections are not significantly changed compared to ___, they are smaller compared to ___.the internal density of these collections has not significantly changed compared to the prior study but are less echogenic than on ___, consistent with evolving hematoma.several small internal air bubbles are again noted bilaterally, less than on the study compared from 4 days prior.intraabdominal loops of bowel are unremarkable and stool is again noted throughout the colon.
summary: postsurgical changes in both nephrectomy beds with bilateral hematomas in evolution, which have not significantly changed in size compared to 4 days prior but are smaller and liquifying compared to ___.evaluation for supraimposed infection is limited without contrast though even with contrast this would likely be difficult.

text: the sigmoid colon demonstrates diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.there is thickening of the wall of the rectum which is new since the prior study, as well as involving the rectosigmoid junction, which may be evidence of proctocolitis given the history.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy, although non-pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are seen.there is no abnormal fluid collection in the pelvis.the vessels demonstrate severe atherosclerotic disease of the aorta and its branches.however, the vessels appear patent despite the apparent stenoses which are not fully characterized without cta technique.there is a focal infrarenal abdominal aorta aneurysm measuring 3.0 cm which is unchanged since the prior study, with a combination of plaque and/or mural thrombus with foci of ulceration (2:46).the coronary arteries demonstrate fairly extensive calcification.bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias are again seen.osseous structures demonstrate fairly severe degenerative change of the lumbosacral spine, with vacuum disc phenomenon, loss of disc height, and anterior greater than posterior osteophyte formation at multiple levels.
summary: atelectasis, but also likely infectious component at lung bases.rectal and sigmoid wall thickening; consider diagnosis of proctocolitis though this can be seen normally with bowel collapse.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.unchanged focal infrarenal aaa with ulcerative plaque/mural thrombus.mesenteric artery stenoses not quantified (non-cta) but vessels patent.findings posted to the ed dashboard.

text: there is interval increase in pelvic ascites.bladder, rectum and sigmoid remain unremarkable.

text: the imaged lung bases demonstrate mild segmental atelectasis in the right lower lobe with trace right pleural effusion.there is consolidation and volume loss involving the left lower lobe with a small left pleural effusion, these are slightly worse since the prior study and a superimposed infection cannot entirely be excluded.there is no pericardial effusion.the patient is status post esophagectomy with a gastric pull-through and roux en y gastro-jejunostomy.left upper quadrant jejunostomy tube is in place.there is thoracic herniation of the transverse colon and proximal small bowel loops as on prior study, with slightlly more colon and slighly less small bowel compared to the prior study.the liver demonstrates homogeneous enhancement without focal lesions.there is layering of hyperdense material within the gallbladder, which may suggest some tiny stones versus sludge.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the pancreas is atrophic and only a portion of the pancreatic head is visualized.both kidneys show symmetric opacification and excretion of contrast without evidence of hydroureteronephrosis.the abdominal aorta demonstrates mild atherosclerotic calcification without aneurysmal dilation.there is dilation and non-enhancement of the infra-renal ivc, as well as both common iliac veins extending up to the inferior-most imaged level of the common femoral veins, which is new compared to the prior study.this likely represents acute deep venous thrombosis inferior to the ivc filter.fat stranding is also seen around pelvic venous structures.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is detected.there is mild diffuse distention of the colon with the administered contrast material.there is no evidence of small-bowel obstruction.no intra-abdominal fluid collections or abscesses are detected.there is no intra-abdominal free air.

text: again noted is an infrarenal fusiform abdominal aortic aneurysm, which measures up to 3.5 cm above the level of the aortic bifurcation.the aneurysm extends into the bilateral common iliac arteries, which measure up to 2.5 cm in the right common iliac artery and 1.7 cm in the left common iliac artery.this overall appearance is unchanged.there is a small amount of simple-appearing free fluid noted in the pelvis (image 19 of series 2).the prostate is not visualized and may be surgically absent (provided history of prostate cancer).brachytherapy seeds are present.the bladder is partially collapsed but the wall appears circumferentially thickened.bowel loops in the pelvis are normal in caliber.there is extensive calcification of both the internal and external iliac arterial systems.
summary: no findings to suggest primary neoplasm as clinically questioned.extensive emphysema with 4 mm nodule in the right middle lobe as described above.diffuse atherosclerosis of the abdominal aorta and branch vessels, with a stable infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm which extends into the common iliac arteries.measurements are unchanged.small amount of simple-appearing pelvic free fluid, which is a nonspecific finding.circumferential bladder wall thickening, findings which may be related previous outlet obstruction, given the provided history of prostate cancer.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.lack of iv contrast limits evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs.a low attenuation lesion in segment vii of the liver is unchanged compared to prior study on ___ and of unclear etiology.there is pneumobilia, as expected with 3 common bile duct stents in place.there is a hepatic artery stent in place and stable.the spleen is enlarged and stable.the pancreas is unremarkable.the adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys are normal in contour bilaterally and there is no hydronephrosis or stone.the stomach is unremarkable.there is a significant increase in fluid within the peritoneal cavity, and the fluid appears to be loculated within the mesentery with slight mass effect on the surrounding small bowel which is decompressed.free fluid is also seen within the pelvis in the paracolic gutters.this fluid measures approximately ___ ___ and may represent bile, simple ascitic fluid, or possibly gi contents.there are scattered stable prominent retroperitoneal and periportal lymph nodes.
summary: significant increase in fluid within the peritoneal cavity, with a more loculated appearance within the mesentery which has mass effect on the decompressed small bowel.etiology of this fluid can be either simple ascitic fluid, bile, or possibly but less likely gi contents given recent intervention.can do hida scan or mri with hepatocyte specific contrast ___ to better assess for bile leak.three common bile duct stents and hepatic artery stent are in place.a low attenuation lesion in segment vii of the liver is unchanged compared to prior study on ___ and of unclear etiology.can be better assessed with mri or ultrasound.

text: there is a left-sided pleural effusion that is increased since the most recent prior examination with adjacent compressive atelectasis.opacification at the right lung base may represent atelectasis versus infectious process such as aspiration or pneumonia.visualized portions of the heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.again noted is collection within the right lobe of the liver measuring 10.7 x 5 cm (3:12) relatively unchanged compared to the most recent prior examination, previously 11 x 6.4 cm.the collection shows a teardrop shape coursing along the right hepatic lobe to a subhepatic portion which contains a pigtail catheter in appropriate position (3:40) decreased in size compared to the most recent prior examination, now measuring 5.7 x 0.7 cm, previously 5.7 x 1.2 cm.irregular hypodensity within the region of segment vii and viii of the liver (series 3:15) is similar to the prior examination.in the interim since the most recent prior examination, there has been placement of a biliary common bile duct stent in appropriate position.the portal vein remains patent.the spleen and bilateral adrenal glands appear unchanged.mildly thickened appearance of the right adrenal gland is similar to the prior examination.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis or renal calculi.in the interim since ___, there has been increased fluid within the abdomen with increased thickening of bilateral gerota's fascia, left greater than right, with fluid tracking from the pancreatic tail anteriorly into the lesser sac down the left paracolic gutter into the left iliacus muscle.there are locules of air at the splenic hilum (3:27).there is mild blurring of pancreatic margins.overall, these findings may represent infectious fluid in the setting of post ercp pancreatitis; however, given the history of ercp with unsuccessful placement of pancreatic duct, a pancreatic duct perforation cannot be completely excluded.there is generalized anasarca.the bladder demonstrates a foley.visualized osseous structures show no focal lytic or sclerotic lesions suspicious for malignancy.
summary: no interval change in size of larger hepatic abscess compared to the most recent prior examination.pigtail catheter remains in appropriate position within a subhepatic fluid collection which is contiguous with but possibly minimally communicating with the larger collection.this subhepatic collection has decreased in size compared to the most recent prior examination.new increased left pleural effusion with adjacent compressive atelectasis compared to the most recent prior examination.consolidation at the right lung base likely represents infectious process.interval new fluid within the abdomen with increased thickening of bilateral gerota's fascia, left greater than right, with fluid tracking from the pancreatic tail anteriorly into the lesser sac down the left paracolic gutter into the left iliacus.there are locules of air at the splenic hilum (3:27).there is mild blurring of pancreatic margins.overall, these findings may represent infectious fluid in the setting of post ercp pancreatitis; however, given the history of ercp with unsuccessful placement of pancreatic duct (per discussion with dr.___, a pancreatic duct perforation cannot be completely excluded.generalized anasarca.findings were discussed with dr.___ at 5:00 a.m.on ___ in person at the time of discovery of critical events and later at 6:50 a.m.(to discuss presence of locules of free air) on ___ via telephone.findings were also discussed with ercp fellow, dr.___ and with dr.___ at 8:00 a.m.and 8:10 a.m.respectively on ___ via telephone and in person respectively.

text: as noted on the prior study there is a heterogeneous mass involving the anterior mediastinum and extending into the right hemithorax.the mass is incompletely evaluated on this examination but appears grossly unchanged when compared to the recent prior study.the right sided chest tube remains in place.the pneumothorax is partially resolved however foci of air remain.right sided atelectasis and bilateral pleural effusions persist.a loculated pleural effusion is present in the right lateral and anterior hemithorax.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted within the coronary vessels, aorta and iliacs.a nasogastric tube is present with its tip in the small bowel.there is diffuse edema within the abdomen and pelvis limiting evaluation of the internal structures.the liver and spleen are grossly unremarkable.no parenchymal lesions are identified.the gallbladder is distended with the suggestion of sludge layering inferiorly.there is no intra or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.the pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance symmetrically are without evidence of hydronephrosis.oral contrast is noted within loops of small bowel and the colon.no dilated loops are present to suggest obstruction.however, diverticulae are present throughout the left and sigmoid colon.the endometrial canal is distended with a small amount of fluid.a foley catheter is noted within the bladder.there is a suspected right sided bladder diverticula.no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is present.evaluation of the osseous structures demonstrates an asymmetric focus of sclerosis in the medial posterior right iliac at the si joint.this is a unilateral finding and is non-specific.no other areas of abnormal sclerosis or lucencies are identified.degenerative changes are present throughout the spine and in both hips.

text: ct abdomen: bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left with associated linear compression atelectases within the right lung base are noted.otherwise, visualized lung bases are clear.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.the liver is homogenous in density without evidence of focal lesions.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the spleen, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable.the right kidney shows a 14 x 14 mm hypodense lesion which most likely represents a simple cyst.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.there is no evidence of renal stones.the visualized bowel loops are unremarkable.the visualized intra-abdominal vasculature is unremarkable.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.
summary: bilateral pleural effusion right greater than left with adjacent linear compressive atelectasis within the right lung base.air within the bladder, probably secondary to instrumentation.no evidence of hydronephrosis or renal calculi.nurse practitioner, ___ ___, was notified of the results at 11:54 a.m.on ___.

text: the visualized lung bases show moderate bilateral non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions, right larger than left, with adjacent right lower lobe atelectasis.the heart is enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs is limited without intravenous contrast.within the right upper quadrant, there is an 8.4 x 5.4 cm fluid collection, previously 8.7 x 5.5cm, with small foci of air and a pigtail catheter in appropriate position.this connects to an anterior pelvic collection which measures 3.6 x 4.5 cm, previously 3.7 x 4.8 cm, containing a catheter within it.a left upper quadrant collection measures 2.5 x 3.2 cm, previously 2.5 x 3.4 cm, unchanged.overall, the multiloculated intra- abdominal fluid collections are unchanged from ___.percutaneous drains are appropriately placed.no new fluid collection is identified although evaluation for small collections is limited by lack of intravenous and oral contrast.the unenhanced liver, pancreas and adrenals are normal.there is no hydronephrosis.a punctate hyperdensity in the left kidney (2:19) is unchanged.the patient is status post right colectomy and end ileostomy without evidence of obstruction.there is no free intraperitoneal air.multiple splenules are seen in the left upper quadrant.the aorta is of normal caliber throughout with mild atherosclerotic calcifications.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified.
summary: no significant change from ___ in multiloculated intra-abdominal fluid collections.bilateral non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions with associated right lower lobe atelectasis.left lower lobe atelectasis has improved from ___.

text: most prominent in the rectum but involving the entire large and small bowel, there is diffuse wall thickening and luminal narrowing, with regions of small bowel demonstrating a halo of hypoattenuation within their walls.these findings are suggestive of but not specific for graft versus host disease given this patient's history of allogenic bone marrow transplant.there is no free intraperitoneal air nor specific evidence of obstruction, though contrast is not seen to pass by the gastric antrum for this study.no free fluid in the deep pelvis.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes.bilateral nonobstructing fat-containing inguinal hernias.foley catheter in a nondistended bladder.
summary: diffuse wall thickening and luminal narrowing of the entire large and small bowel, with segments of small bowel demonstrating an intramural low attenuation rim; these findings are suggestive of graft versus host disease given the history of allogenic bmt.other differential considerations include other microvasculopathies and/or hypovolemic state.no free intraperitoneal air.distended stomach with no contrast seen to pass past the antrum; a delayed kub could be obtained to ensure passage of barium and exclude gastroparesis or obstruction.ground glass and tree-in-___ opacities involving the right middle lobe and left lower lobes.small bilateral pleural effusions.small pericardial effusion.4-mm focal nodule at the left lung base with a ground glass halo.findings are nonspecific, but most suggestive of an infectious process.cholelithiasis.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ immediately after the study.

text: the bladder contains a foley catheter.the uterus, rectum, sigmoid colon and opacified loops of small bowel are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air within the pelvis.there is no significant pelvic or inguinal adenopathy.note is made of multiple areas of soft tissue density within the anterior abdomen consistent with subcutaneous injections.osseous structures demonstrate no lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: normal abdominal/pelvic ct.percutaneous g-j tube is in satisfactory position.specifically, the kidneys are normal in appearance.there are no intra-abdominal fluid collections.

text: mild bibasilar atelectasis or consolidation is present, along with small bilateral pleural effusions.the heart is normal in size, with trace pericardial effusion.dense calcifications are noted in the thoracic aorta and coronary arteries.
summary: bilateral atelectasis or consolidation, with small pleural effusions.marked sigmoid distention up to 10 cm, likely secondary to fecal impaction, though other causes such as ischemia are not entirely excluded.hepaticojejunostomy changes, with intact roux-en-y limb and no evidence of obstruction.small amount of perihepatic free fluid, non-specific.pancreatic cystic lesion most likely representing ipmn.if clinically appropriate, given patient age, could be further evaluated on mrcp.diffuse atherosclerosis.

text: low-density fluid tracks into the pelvis with minimal peritoneal enhancement, reactive.the bladder, distal ureters, and uterus are normal.suture material is seen in the presacral region.metal clips are present in bilateral inguinal regions within superficial soft tissue.small inguinal and pelvic sidewall lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no loculated collection.
summary: no evidence of loculated fluid collection or abscess formation within the abdomen or pelvis.persistent ascites with simple fluid tracking along bilateral paracolic gutters into the pelvis.minimal pelvic peritoneal enhancement appears reactive.unchanged diffuse hepatic steatosis without focal lesion.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.unchanged pancreatic cystic lesions.unchanged anasarca.

text: multiple loops of large and small bowel are within normal limits, with scattered diverticulosis of the distal colon.the small bowel and colon enhance normally.there is no bowel wall thickening or bowel distention.there is no evidence of bowel ischemia.the lumen of the right proximal superficial artery is markedly narrowed with a "string sign", indicating very high grade stenosis.the prostate gland remains markedly enlarged and heterogeneous, again protruding into the base of the urinary bladder.the bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy by size criteria.
summary: small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.distended gallbladder with multiple gallstones, including one in the gallbladder neck.trace pericholecystic fluid and gallbladder wall edema, although without definite gallbladder free wall thickening.cholecystitis is a concern.this can be further evaluated via ultrasound or hepatobiliary scan.extensive atherosclerotic calcifications throughout the aorta and major mesenteric branches, although mesenteric arteries are without stenosis or thrombosis evident.due to suboptimal contrast administration, venous structures are not opacified.however, there are no secondary signs of venous thrombus.there is no evidence of bowel ischemia.very high grade stenosis of the proximal right superficial femoral artery.stable appearance of simple and hyperdense renal cysts.diffusely enlarged prostate gland with prominent median lobe, with multiple proteinaceous/hemorrhagic nodules.this is consistent with bph, although tumor is not definitively excluded.

text: the pelvic bowel, bladder, ureters, and prostate are unremarkable.multiple prominent pelvic lymph nodes are present, of unclear clinical significance.just inferior to the bifurcation of the aorta, there is a 1.3 cm lymph node.along the right pelvic sidewall, there are several lymph nodes, measuring up to 1.4 cm in size.there are bilateral small inguinal hernias.there is no definite obstruction at the level of the hernias.there are at least two large right inguinal lymph nodes, measuring up to 2.1 x 1.4 cm in transverse size.examination of the osseous structures show mild degenerative change.
summary: partial small bowel obstruction.there are both dilated and more distally decompressed loops of small bowel, but there is contrast filling through the dilated portions and passing through nondilated portions as well.contrast has not yet reached the ileocecal valve at the time of examination.bilateral inguinal hernias.large pelvic and right inguinal lymph nodes, of unclear clinical significance.the right inguinal lymph nodes are quite superficial though, adjacent to the femoral vessels, and are in a superficial position ammenable for biopsy if indicated.

text: a foley catheter is in place within the bladder.the uterus and adnexa, and pelvic loops of bowel appear unremarkable.small amount of free fluid in the cul-de-sac is of low density.
summary: no evidence of bowel obstruction, although mildly prominent loops of small bowel diffusely could reflect a component of ileus.improved bilateral pleural effusions after interval placement of bilateral chest tubes.left-sided small hydropneumothorax, new.unchanged bilateral pulmonary consolidation consistent with pneumonia with improved bibasilar atelectasis.interval development of pneumobilia.please correlate with possible history of sphincterotomy or other intervention.small amount of free fluid in the pelvis, a nonspecific finding that could relate to postoperative change.

text: the liver enhances homogeneously with no evidence of lesions, cysts, or biliary dilatation.its attenuation is relatively compared to the spleen, however, suggesting there may be fatty infiltration.the gallbladder is normal with normal wall thickness and no pericholecystic fluid evident.the spleen enhances homogeneously with no evidence of lesions; the pancreas, kidneys, and adrenals bilaterally are unremarkable.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.the mid to lower sigmoid colon exhibits slight wall thickening and mucosal hyperdensity, probably enhancement, suggesting an inflammatory or possibly infectious process.
summary: asymmetric fat stranding along the soft tissues of the lateral left hip and thigh suggesting edema or inflammation.deep fascial infection is not excluded by this study.the extent of deep compartment involvement of infection or inflammation is not well characterized and mr could be of potential value in further assessment if needed clinically.no gas or drainable collection is visualized.wall thickening and mucosal enhancement seen along the sigmoid colon suspicious for colitis.large quantity of scrotal fluid; clinical correlation is recommended and consideration of ultrasound if needed clinically.stable deep vein thrombosis.increased lung opacities; although not specific, these are suggestive of atelectasis.similar soft tissue defect at site of removed port.suggestion of fatty liver.

text: there is a small amount of low-density free fluid in the pelvis.the bladder is decompressed by a foley catheter.the prostate, seminal vesicles, and rectum are unremarkable.the remaining colon is collapsed.
summary: status post right hemicolectomy and ileostomy with small amount of expected pneumoperitoneum related to surgery.small amount of low-density free fluid around the liver edge and in the pelvis, but no focal fluid collection or abscess identified.diffuse wall thickening, hyperemia and mucosal enhancement of the small bowel could be related to liver disease and hypoalbuminemia, but ischemia cannot be excluded.however, no pneumatosis or portal venous gas.diffuse airspace opacity of both visualized lungs is nonspecific and may represent volume overload, infection or diffuse alveolar damage.cirrhotic liver and splenomegaly.findings discussed with dr.___ ___, surgery at 4:30 p.m.on ___.

text: extensive pericardial calcifications are again seen.this may relate to an episode of pericarditis or patient's surgery to correct an atrial septal defect.the lung bases are clear.the native pancreas and kidneys are atrophic.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.a small amount of ascites tracks down the right lateral abdominal wall.the small bowel is dilated with multiple air fluid levels.no areas of wall thickening are seen on this noncontrast study.the large bowel is filled with air and is partially decompressed.air is seen through to the sigmoid colon.some additional collections of free fluid are seen in the right lower quadrant and in the pelvis superior to the urinary bladder.
summary: dilated loops of small bowel with air fluid levels.no obvious transition point is seen.given the level of small bowel distention on the prior study, this likely represents a chronic ileus or a chronic partial small bowel obstruction.again, no focal transition point or stricture or compressing mass is seen.no obvious anastomotic leak at the pancreatic transplant site.slightly increased amount of pelvic fluid when compared to the prior study.

text: the right nephroureteral stent and percutaneous nephrostomies remain in unchanged appropriate position.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.the bladder is not overly distended and contains several bubbles of air.foley catheter is also present.
summary: no change in the amount of right subcapsular/perinephric hematoma.right nephroureteral stent and left nephrostomy tubes remain in place.no hydronephrosis.more rounded area with area of subcapsular hematoma in mid pole of right kidney.an underlying renal mass could have caused the area of hemorrhage.

text: there is a pancreatic transplant in the right lower quadrant.there is a fluid filled tubular structure just superior to the pancreatic transplant and adjacent to suture, likley fluid within a loop of bowel.there is a transplanted kidney within the left lower quadrant.no perinephric fluid collections are seen.there is a catheter extending from the transplant kidney into the bladder.a few tiny bubbles of free air are seen adjacent to the renal transplant, compatible with patient's recent surgery.there is a moderate amount of stranding in the pelvis, adjacent to the bladder, transplant pancreas and transplant kidney.again, this is compatible with recent postoperative changes.there is heavy calcification noted within the vas deferens.there is stranding within the subcutaneous tissues diffusely, suggestive of third spacing/anasarca.no suspicious osseous lesions are seen.
summary: trace amount of fluid adjacent to the liver.stranding in the pelvis, compatible with postoperative change.no definite, large peripancreatic transplant or perirenal transplant fluid collections are seen.anasarca.

text: the bladder, prostate, seminal vesicles and rectum are unremarkable.a fluid collection is as described above.no pathologic inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes are seen.atherosclerotic calcifications in the aorta and bilateral iliac vasculature.
summary: persistent perihepatic, perisplenic and intrapelvic fluid with layering hyperdensity adjacent to the spleen extending along the left paracolic gutter and into the pelvis concerning for recurrence of intraperitoneal hemorrhage.bilateral simple pleural effusions.these findings were discussed by dr.___ with dr.___ at 10:45 on ___.

text: the liver is again noted with diffuse fatty infiltration, but without suspicious focal lesion.no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation is noted.the gallbladder is partially collapsed, without focal abnormalities.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands are normal.there are multiple hypodense lesions in the kidneys, with the largest one seen in the left upper pole (image 3:59), exophytic and measures 14 mm in diameter, compatible with a simple renal cyst.a 7 mm hypodensity in the right upper pole (image 3:60) is too small to be fully evaluated, but statistically likely to be a simple renal cyst.the renal parenchyma otherwise enhances symmetrically, with prompt excretion of iv contrast into collecting system.there is no hydronephrosis, hydroureter or evidence of nephrolithiasis.no perinephric stranding or fluid collection is noted.the stomach, duodenum and loops of small bowel are normal.there are scattered mesenteric lymph nodes, but none of them are pathologically enlarged.there is no free air or fluid in the intra-abdominal cavity.
summary: new non-occlusive dvt in the right common iliac vein, appears to be emanating from the right internal iliac vein, and extends to just proximal to the confluence of the common iliac veins.recommend urgent dvt ultrasound examination to evaluate the extent of the clot in the lower extremities.interval decrease of lung metastatic disease burden.mild decrease of mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.post-radiation changes in the pelvis, with bladder thickening from radiation cystitis and presacral soft tissue stranding.end-colostomy intact without evidence of bowel obstruction or other surgical complications.dr.___ ___ has communicated the urgent findings of the new deep vein thrombosis to the ordering physician, ___.___ ___ at 10:30 a.m.on ___.

text: evaluation of the lung bases demonstrates a moderate left-sided pleural effusion, with trace of fluid seen at the lung bases on the right as well.there is also compressive atelectasis of the left lower lobe.there is some consolidation seen at the right lower lobe, possibly representing aspiration, although some degree of atelectasis may be present as well.coronary artery calcifications are present.there is an ng tube present.the tip of this lies within the stomach, although the side port appears to be above the gastroesophageal junction, and would be recommended advancing this catheter at least 10 cm.marked vasculopathy is present, with calcification of virtually every intra-abdominal vessel seen.the liver appears unremarkable allowing for non-contrast technique.there is a gallstone.the spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is an atrophic appearance of the pancreas.both kidneys also appear markedly atrophic.the stomach is distended with both air and food debris.there is a small amount of abdominal free fluid present.no significant abdominal lymphadenopathy is present.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage or explanation for the patient's hematocrit drop.ng tube tip is in the stomach, although the side port is probably above the gastroesophageal junction.recommend advancing this at least 10 cm to ensure that both the tip and side port are in the stomach.moderate left-sided pleural effusion.regions of consolidation in the right lower lobe, possibly representing aspiration.gallstone.

text: there is a large right pleural effusion with atelectasis of the adjacent right lower lobe.there is also a small left pleural effusion with left basilar atelectasis.as noted by ct ___, the left kidney is markedly atrophic with a prominent collecting system, measuring 23 x 31 mm.the right kidney also contains a 4.6 x 5.0 cm cyst arising from it's lower pole.in addition, there are two subcentimeter high attenuation foci within the parenchyma of the right kidney, unchanged in the interval, and most likely representing hemorrhagic renal cysts, but not well evaluated on this noncontrast ct.the right psoas hematoma has decreased in size in the 8 day interval, now measuring 6.8 x 6.5 cm, vs.9.0 x 9.8 cm previously.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, and bowel are unremarkable.there are several punctate calcification within the tail of the pancreas, possibly related to splenic artery calcifications or the residua of prior pancreatitis.
summary: decreased size of the right psoas hematoma in the eight day interval.large right, and small left pleural effusion with bibasilar atelectasis.markedly atrophic left kidney (3.2 cm in length), with a prominent collecting system, not well evaluated on this noncontrast ct.there is also a right lower pole renal cyst and two high attenuation foci within the right kidney, which probably represent hemorrhagic renal cyst.

text: the bladder is unremarkable.the prostate demonstrates prostatic calcifications.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.there is no free fluid in the abdomen.no pelvic lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: no evidence for an intraabdominal fluid collection.superficial inflammatory changes in the right upper quadrant, probably correlating to the site of patient's drainage.there is no evidence for discrete or drainable fluid collection underneath this site.

text: the rectum is normal.there are diverticula in the sigmoid colon.the bladder contains a foley catheter.the uterus and adnexae are unremarkable.bone windows show unremarkable osseous structures.
summary: gallstones within the gallbladder.diverticula without diverticulitis.air in the common bile duct, likely due to recent ercp.no abdominal abscess seen.

text: the rectum, sigmoid, distal ureters and urinary bladder are stable in appearance.a foley catheter is again present in the bladder.the previously identified filling defect in the left iliac vein cannot be assessed on this noncontrast study.
summary: interval placement of an ivc filter with the tip terminating below the renal veins.free fluid and changes consistent with anasarca, which are unchanged compared to the prior study.no high-density fluid is seen to explain dropping hematocrit.unchanged appearance of right lower lobe nodules as described on the recent prior studies.bilateral pleural effusions, unchanged.

text: there is linear atelectasis at both lung bases.within the left hepatic lobe, there are two calcifications.the larger area of calcification measures 8 mm, and this may represent the residua of prior granulomatous infection.there is also a tiny gallstone identified.the liver and gallbladder are otherwise unremarkable.the spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.incidentally noted is a small splenule.the pancreas is atrophic.both native kidneys are also atrophic and a 14 mm probable simple cyst is identified in the mid-portion of the right kidney.there is a 3 mm stone vs vascular calcification in the lower pole of the native left kidney.also noted is a small probable simple cyst at the lower pole.there is a small amount of free fluid adjacent to the liver.there are extensive atherosclerotic changes, including calcification at the origin of the right renal artery.
summary: large fluid collection which surrounds the transplanted kidney and extends to the deep right pelvis.this could represent a postoperative seroma or hematoma, although infection cannot be excluded.low density collection in the overlying abdominal wall subcutaneous tissues on the right.small gallstone.two calcifications in the left hepatic lobe.

text: size of the lymphocele now measures 4.4 x 1.1 cm which is reduced from 5.2 x 1.9 cm measured on ___.the pigtail catheter in the right inferior pelvis at the previous scan is no longer visualized.there is small amount of fat stranding along the lymphocele.surgical clips in the pelvis are again noted, consistent with a history of radical prostatectomy.sigmoid diverticulosis without underlying diverticulitis is noted.there is no free fluid or air in the pelvis.there is no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: further reduction in the size of the lymphocele, s/p removal of pigtail catheter.no evidence of new fluid collection.resolution of pleural effusion.

text: the visualized lung bases appear clear.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.evaluation of solid organs and intra-abdominal vasculature is limited by non-contrast technique.within this limitation, the liver, spleen, pancreas, bilateral adrenal glands, and both kidneys appear within normal limits.intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are within normal limits.the appendix is normal.retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathology.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.
summary: normal appendix.no acute pathology to explain patient's symptoms based on an unenhanced scan.

text: large amount of free fluid is seen within the pelvis.the rectum and sigmoid appear grossly unremarkable.the prostate appears unremarkable.
summary: interval increase in large amount of free fluid seen tracking from the abdomen into the pelvis.increase in size of small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right, with associated atelectasis.circumferential bowel wall thickening noted, likely secondary to patient's ascites and hypoproteinemia.

text: the bladder is near empty with foley catheter in place.the uterus, adnexa, and the rectum appear unremarkable.there is sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.free fluid in the pelvis measures intermediate density, 25 ___ anteriorly and 50 ___ in the cul- de-sac (2:68, 67).
summary: large complex fluid collection in the cholecystectomy bed is rim-enhancing and of intermediate fluid density.a calculus is seen posteriorly within the collection and an air-containing region within the fluid collection may represent surgicel (which should be confirmed with surgical history).inflammation of the hepatic flexure is likely secondary to the inflammatory process within the adjacent gallbladder fossa.however, the patient does have significant atherosclerotic disease and ischemic etiology for the inflammatory change cannot be excluded.patient also has colonic diverticulosis.morphology of the liver suggests underlying cirrhosis.1.7-cm area of heterogeneous attenuation in segment v of the liver adjacent to the gallbladder fossa could certainly be infectious from the adjacent inflammatory process.comparison with any prior imaging is recommended to determine whether this lesion was previously present.in addition, especially given the suggestion of underlying cirrhosis, followup after resolution of acute illness is recommended to exclude malignant etiology.asymmetric smaller left kidney which is hypoenhancing.findings are likely due to atherosclerotic disease involving the renal artery.patent aortobifemoral graft.fluid in the pelvis which measures higher density posteriorly likely represents fluid which has tracked into the pelvis from the abdominal process.bilateral small-to-moderate pleural effusions with atelectasis of the basilar lower lobes bilaterally.

text: there is a small amount of nonhemorrhagic free fluid within the pelvis.the uterus is unremarkable.the rectum is fecal loaded, but normal.the bladder is moderately distended.there is continued stranding and a small amount of soft tissue anterior to the left common iliac artery and vein (2:56), however it has decreased significantly since ___.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal pathology including no evidence of abscess or bowel obstruction.decreased fluid/soft tissue anterior to the left common iliac artery and vein, consistent with resolving hematoma in the retroperitoneum.small amount of free fluid within the pelvis, again likely resolving post-surgical changes.

text: a foley catheter is seen within a non-distended bladder.the uterus and rectum are unremarkable.pelvic loops of small and large bowel appear normal in caliber and contour.no enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified.note is made of air within the bladder lumen.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.the osseous structures do not demonstrate any concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: moderate-sized left-sided pneumothorax, as well as pneumomediastinum, pneumopericardium, and pneumoretroperitoneum.there is also air tracking in the subcutaneous tissues of the chest and abdomen.there is no free intraperitoneal air.bibasilar consolidative opacities are concerning for aspiration pneumonia.small lumen of the trachea.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.findings discussed with dr.___ at 11pm on ___.

text: the lung bases are free of focal opacities and there are no pleural effusions.the liver is small and contains innumerable large and small masses.ethiodol can be seen within many of these lesions.compared to the prior study the diffuse uptake of ethiodol is no longer seen.there has been no significant change in the size or number of the liver lesions.kidneys are normal in appearance on this noncontrast.there is free fluid or free air within the abodmen.no gallbladder is identified.no lymphadenopathy is identified within the abdomen.there are many sclerotic lesions throughout the thoracic and lumbar spine.these are unchanged from the prior study.
summary: interval change in the distribution of the ethiodol from diffuse to focal.ethiodol is seen localized within innumerable small hepatic lesions.unchanged appearance of the multiple sclerotic osseous lesions.

text: imaged lung bases demonstrate trace right pleural effusion.patchy ground glass opacities in the right middle and lower lobes could reflect aspiration or an atypical infection.there is no focal nodularity.no pericardial effusion is seen.nasogastric tube courses into the proximal duodenum.the liver is diffusely hypoattenuating, compatible with fatty infiltration.there is no focal lesion, intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is mildly distended without pericholecystic fluid or wall thickening to suggest acute cholecystitis.the common duct is not dilated.the pancreas, spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys are normal without hydronephrosis.the stomach is decompressed.there is a long segment of small bowel within the lower abdomen and pelvis which demonstrates wall thickening and peripheral stranding (601 b: 24, 28 as representative images).there may be a short segment which normalizes; however there is probable mural thickening as well of the terminal ileum, though evaluation is limited due to underdistention and lack of contrast enhancement.no pneumatosis is seen.the cecum and ascending colon are collapsed but show probable thickened walls with fatty deposition compatible with chronic inflammatory changes.the remainder of the large bowel is stool filled and unremarkable aside from diverticulosis without active inflammation.the appendix is seen and is normal.there is no free air in the abdomen.no free fluid is seen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.mild atherosclerotic calcification is seen along the aorta.
summary: abnormal small bowel, with segmental areas of wall thickening and mild peripheral stranding which may be contiguous (or separated by a small amount of normal small bowel) from inflamed terminal ileum.this picture is compatible with enteritis, which could be inflammatory, infectious, or, less likely, ischemic in etiology.probable colonic wall thickening and fatty infiltration consistent with chronic inflammatory changes in the proximal colon.fatty liver.right basal aspiration or atypical pulmonary infection.changes to the wet read were discusesd with dr.___ by dr.___ by phone at ___ on ___.

text: bibasilar atelectasis is noted.the enhanced liver and spleen appear unremarkable.the pancreas is within normal limits.there is no hydronephrosis.bilateral renal cysts are noted, the largest in the left renal mid pole measuring 3.8 cm in span.there is no bowel dilatation.there is no significant bowel wall thickening.the appendix is normal.there is no intra-abdominal abscess identified.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there is mild edema surrounding the rectum, though this is unchanged from the prior study.the osseous structures appear unremarkable.
summary: bibasilar atelectasis.no evidence for acute intra-abdominal pathology.

text: in this limited evaluation of the lung parenchyma, only one of the previously described lung nodules is visible (series 2, image 1) and is stable in size.otherwise, the visualized lung bases are clear.there is no pleural effusion.calcification is noted along the coronary arteries.stable soft tissue thickening anterior to the heart (series 2, image 2).the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear normal.the kidneys contain several stable cysts.pancreas presents with unchanged punctate calcifications.bowel loops appear unremarkable.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted along the aorta and iliac arteries, without aneurysmal dilatation.no free fluid or free air is noted within the abdomen.inflammatory changes can be noted in the left paracolic gutter, similar to prior study.improvement is noted in previously described inflammatory region along the left colon, now measuring 38 x 28 mm.unchanged small pocket of fluid in the anterior abdominal wall (series 2, image 58).there is again a protrusion of the intra-abdominal wall (series 2, image 28).
summary: improvement of the inflammatory changes along the inferior left colon, likely colonic epiploic appendagitis.persistent fat stranding in the pelvis, both posteriorly and along the right iliac chain.stable anterior abdominal wall fat stranding with small fluid pocket.

text: in the lung bases, again noted are innumerable nodules consistent with metastatic disease.again noted is mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, not significantly changed since the previous study.there is a confluent soft tissue density seen at the level of the porta hepatis (series 2, image 17) which causes narrowing of the main portal vein, not significantly changed since the previous study.no focal hepatic lesions are identified.there is mild cavernous transformation of the portal vein at the level of the porta hepatis, stable.patient is status post cholecystectomy.the spleen is borderline enlarged measuring 13.2 cm in size in the craniocaudal dimension.the hepatic veins are patent.the hepatic arterial anatomy is conventional.again noted is a large hypodense mass lesion involving the pancreatic body/tail measuring 5.4 x 3.1 cm in size, not significantly changed since the previous study.again noted are a few mildly prominent lymph nodes in the gastrohepatic ligament (2, 15).the adrenal glands appear within normal limits.since previous study, there is mild right pelvocaliectasis and mild proximal right hydroureter.the right ureter can be followed upto the pelvic inlet where there is a suggestion vague soft tissue density ( 2, 51).distally the ureter cannot be well followed.the left kidney appears within normal limits.there is significant contrast retention within the stomach with no evidence of opacification of the small bowel.there is again noted mild thickening involving the wall of the gastric antrum and pyloric region (2, 28).there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.evaluation of the bowel is limited due to lack of contrast opacification.there is minimal quantity of free fluid in the lower abdomen (2, 64).the uterus is slightly heterogeneous in appearance which could be related to leiomyomata.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber.atherosclerotic vascular disease of the abdominal aorta and its branches are seen.as mentioned on the previous study, the splenic vein remains thrombosed.nodular density is seen inferior to the tip of the right hepatic lobe measuring about 1.6 cm in size (300a, image 31) which has increased in size since previous studies.in addition new nodular soft tissue densities are seen around the liver ( 2, 25 & 27).a stable soft tissue denisty is seen at the level of the umbilicus.there are stable tumor implants in the pouch of ___.there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is again noted double ivc with left draining into the left renal vein, congenital variant.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.no suspicious osteolytic or osteoblastic lesions are identified.
summary: significant retention of contrast within the stomach with no evidence of emptying and thickening of the wall of the stomach in the region of the gastric antrum.this could represent gastric outlet obstruction.this can be further evaluated with nuclear medicine gastric emptying study.interval new right mild hydronephrosis and hydroureter.vague soft tissue seen at the level of the right pelvic inlet possibly compressing upon the right ureter.interval increase in size and number of peritoneal implants around the liver.additional findings of large hypodense pancreatic mass and extensive pulmonary and pelvic peritoneal metastases, stable.

text: oral contrast passes through the small bowel and colon to the rectum.the appendix is normal.the colon is normal in caliber.there is no free fluid, inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy within the pelvis.there are severe vascular calcifications of the aorta and iliac vessels.
summary: no finding to account for the patient's abdominal pain.stable pneumobilia, and small amount of free fluid within the abdomen.severe vascular calcifications.

text: the lung bases demonstrate bilateral patchy airspace opacities in a bronchovascular distribution which may represent pneumonia or possible aspiration.other entities cannot be ruled out.there is no pleural effusion.within the limitation of a non-contrast study, the liver, spleen, and right adrenal gland appear normal.there is thickening of the medial limb of the left adrenal gland.the pancreas is atrophic.the gallbladder demonstrates hyperdense material within.the kidneys appear hypotrophic.there is a 1.0- cm exophytic hypodense lesion in the interpolar region of the right kidney, likely represents a cyst, although not fully characterized in this non- contrast study.extensive vascular calcifications.infrarenal aortic aneurysm measuring up to 3.4 cm status post repair.aorto-femoral bypass.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.thickening of the distal small bowel wall and probably colon which could be related to inflammatory, infectious or ischemic process given the extensive atherosclerotic disease.fluid- filled mildly dilated descending colon and sigmoid.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: bibasilar patchy airspace opacities, left greater than right, may represent infectious process, possible aspiration.other entities cannot be ruled out.follow up study after appropriate treatment is recommended to document resolution.4.6 x 4.4 cm right adnexal cyst.if clinicaly indicated, us and or mri could be performed for further characterization.mild distal small bowel mucosal wall thickening may represent ischemia given the extensive vascular calcifications, infection or inflammatory process.fluid-filled mildly distended descending colon and sigmoid.infrarenal aaa status post repair.l3 compression fracture with retropulsion of the fracture fragments narrowing the thecal sac at this level.the findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of the interpretation.

text: there is minimal subsegmental bibasilar atelectasis.as before, patient has undergone aortic and mitral valve replacements.heart size is within normal limits.as before, the central intrahepatic bile ducts are mildly dilated and there is dilation of the common hepatic and common bile duct.the cystic duct remnant is seen and immediately adjacent to it is a roughly 2.7 x 1.5 cm fluid containing lesion with enhancing wall and some apparent septations or loculations.this has persisted since ___ and could represent pseudo-gallbladder formation of the cystic duct or a persistent loculated collection in communication with the cystic duct.there is decreased inflammation about it compared to the prior two studies.the pancreas remains normal in appearance and the main pancreatic duct is normal in caliber.the liver is without concerning abnormality.portal vein is patent.peripheral wedge-shaped splenic region of hypoattenuation may represent an old splenic infarct.cystic left adrenal lesion has decreased in size since ___ and is not concerning.right adrenal gland remains normal.as before, there is evidence of a right upper pole renal infarct that is small.no concerning renal lesions.contrast is excreted from both kidneys and the collecting system is without abnormality.no lymphadenopathy within the abdomen, though there are shotty portacaval lymph nodes.there is a small amount of free fluid adjacent to the fundus of the stomach and the spleen which is of uncertain significance.as before, patient has a small hiatal hernia.as before, there is a small ventral hernia containing fat and without complication.there is a small amount of free fluid within the right greater than left pericolic gutter and within the pelvis.this is a nonspecific finding and is of uncertain significance.no bowel abnormality within the pelvis.the appendix is not visualized, however was also not definitely seen on prior studies.there is no fat stranding within the right lower quadrant to suggest appendicitis.the cecum is filled with stool, but without definite abnormality.uterus and adnexa are normal in appearance.urinary bladder is collapsed but without abnormality.no pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: unchanged size of mildly dilated bile ducts and fluid collection within the gallbladder fossa adjacent to the cystic duct.this could represent pseudo-gallbladder formation of the cystic duct or a small collection in continuity with the cystic duct.inflammation about this area has decreased since ___.ascites within the pelvis and inferior aspects of bilateral pericolic gutters is a nonspecific finding.no cause of this is evident and though the appendix is not seen on the study, there are no secondary signs of appendicitis about the cecum.likely small splenic infarct, new since ___.

text: the lung bases are visualized.there is a small right-sided pleural effusion with associated atelectasis.there is a large multiloculated retroperitoneal hematoma extending from the inferior aspect of the right lobe of the liver in the right pararenal space down into the right hemipelvis with a hemorrhage into the right iliacus muscle.this hemorrhage extends down into the middle compartment of the right leg.there are hematocrit levels associated with this hemorrhage consistent with acute bleed.there is mass effect on the right kidney which is displaced towards the mid abdomen.it should be noted that the hematoma does appear to have fat plane between the major vessels.there is a 10.5 x 9.4 mm hypodense lesion within the right lobe of the liver at the dome that is too small to fully characterize.the kidneys are symmetric and there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.nasogastric tube terminates likely within the proximal duodenum.there is no free intraperitoneal air.the loops of bowel are unremarkable.the uterus demonstrates irregular contour, likely representing uterine fibroids.bone windows display sclerotic lesion within the l1 vertebral body that may represent a bone island.there is a sclerosis of the sacroiliac joints bilaterally.
summary: large retroperitoneal hematoma with evidence of hematocrit level suggestive of acute bleed.hypodense lesion within the liver that is too small to fully characterize but likely represents a cyst or hemangioma.likely uterine fibroids.sclerosis of the sacroiliac joints consistent with sacroiliitis.these results were discussed with the ordering physician in person.

text: retroperitoneal hematoma is seen again, as described previously, though is decreased in extent.it originates in the region of a left common femoral arterial stent and extends superiorly to the level of the third portion of the duodenum and inferior right renal pole.there is no abnormal enhancement, or drainable collection.there is no active extravasation.the lung bases demonstrate atelectasis bilaterally.there is redemonstration of a moderate-sized pericardial effusion.minimal bilateral pleural effusion is present.a hypodensity in the liver dome (4a:4), and in segment viii (4a:7) are too small to characterize.the spleen appears normal.the pancreas is largely fatty replaced.the adrenals are normal in appearance bilaterally.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric contrast enhancement and brisk bilateral excretion.stranding around the right kidney is likely related to extension of retroperitoneal hematoma.hematoma extends around the anterior and posterior right pararenal space and into the left anterior pararenal space.the stomach is decompressed.the duodenum appears normal.the visualized loops of small bowel are normal in caliber and enhancement.
summary: resolving right retroperitoneal hematoma without radiographic evidence of superinfection, or active extravasation.moderate-sized pericardial effusion, stable.

text: the evaluation of major organs and vessels are limited due to lack of intravenous contrast ___.
summary: diffuse colonic wall thickening surrounded by fat stranding and new moderate amount of fluid, representing pancolitis.etiology is nonspecific, however, is most likely due to c.diff colitis.other etiology cannot be totally excluded.tiny foci of air in the anterior upper abdomen, likely extraluminal.calcification adjacent to the distal cbd, likely in the pancreatic parenchyma, unchanged since prior study.increased bilateral pleural effusion with increased patchy peribronchial opacities in both lungs, likely due to infectious or inflammatory process, especially aspiration given mucous secretion in the central airway.diffuse anasarca.the finding was discussed with dr.___ ___ by telephone at the completion of the study, and referring surgery resident as well.

text: ct of the abdomen without iv contrast: there is bibasilar atelectasis.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys are diminutive in size but are symmetric.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.clips seen within the gallbladder bed.there is no free intraperitoneal air or free fluid.oral contrast is seen within the colon.there is no focal bowel wall thickening or evidence of bowel obstruction.
summary: no evidence of hemoperitoneum.scattered subcutaneous nodules of uncertain clinical significance and recommend clinical correlation.these may represent sebaceous cysts.

text: small hypodensities are seen in the liver, one in the right liver lobe, (2:56), and one in the left liver lobe, (2:52), and possible hypodensity at the porta hepatis, (2:57), too small to characterize.the gallbladder is seen filling with hyperdense material could be due to the vicarious secretions.spleen measures 16 cm, (300b:42).the stomach, loops of large and small bowel appear normal, with no evidence of bowel obstruction.vessels are patent.there is atrophic right kidney, and similar in size compared to prior study, more are in pelvic location which is better appreciated on the coronal image (300b:27).there is heterogeneous enhancement of the right kidney, new compared to prior contrast-enhanced ct from ___.the left kidney is absent.pancreas contains several cystic lesions, and multiple punctate calcifications, grossly stable compared to prior study.adrenal glands appear normal.there is small amount of free fluid in the abdomen, mostly in perihepatic and perisplenic distribution, and tracking along the left paracolic gutter, and mild amount of fluid in the mesentery.there is evidence of anasarca.there is massive lymphadenopathy in the mesentery and retroperitoneum with significant interval worsening compared to prior scan.there are conglomerates of lymph nodes, the largest at the paraaortic region measures 6.7 x 4.4 cm, (2:73).there is a large conglomerate to the right common iliac artery, measuring 4.7 x 4.6 cm, (2:91).scattered diverticula seen through the colon with no evidence of diverticulitis.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.
summary: significant interval worsening of lymph adenopathy in the mediastinum, right axilla, supraclavicular region, mesentery, retroperitoneum and pelvis splenomegaly.free fluid in the abdomen.bilateral small pleural effusion, with minimal bibasilar atelectasis.cardiomegaly, stable.anasarca.heterogeneous appearance of the right kidney is of uncertain clinical significance and may reflect diffuse involvement with lymphoma versus pyelonephritis.tunneled catheter in the right ij, and subclavian port-a-cath, with vascular collaterals at the right shoulder.

text: the pelvis also contains scattered ascites and inflammatory change consistent with the post operative period, but no other abnormalities.specifically, there are no well-defined fluid collections or masses present within the pelvis.both large and small bowel appear normal, as do the ureters.both examinations demonstrate fluid accumulation throughout the subcutaneous tissues.
summary: ascites and peritoneal inflammatory change, expected for the stated post operative period.no abscess or loculated collections identified within the abdomen or pelvis.bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar atelectasis vs.consolidation.these findings appear asymmetrically larger on the right, suggesting the possibility of co-existing pneumonia and atelectasis.subcutaneous edema of both the abdomen and pelvis.

text: there has been marked decrease in the right pleural effusion.small residual right pleural effusion is noted.there is bibasilar atelectasis.geographic area of low attenuation adjacent to the dome of the liver may represent fat.there are no focal liver lesions.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the pancreas is atrophic.the spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and bowel loops are within normal limits.there is no free air or ascites.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is apparent.linear area of stranding perpendicular to the abdominal wall in the right mid abdomen may be secondary to a prior laparoscopic port.scattered rounded high-attenuation foci in anterior subcutaneous tissues are also noted and may be injection granulomas.
summary: no ascites or intra-abdominal fluid collection.interval marked decrease in right pleural effusion.residual bibasilar atelectasis.

text: the bladder and distal ureters appear normal.the uterus is bulky likely secondary to fibroids.there is no free fluid, free air or pathologic pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: large left intraabdominal abscess with adjacent, adherent loops of small bowel and proximal small- bowel obstruction, with transition point in the region of the abscess.mildly dilated fluid filled esophagus.

text: the liver is shrunken with a nodular contour compatible with known cirrhosis.the spleen is not enlarged and measures approximately 11 cm in length.the gallbladder is distended.the non-contrast appearance of the pancreas appears grossly unremarkable.the adrenal glands are poorly visualized.the kidneys demonstrate no evidence of hydronephrosis or stones.there is a large volume of abdominal ascites.there is no free air.there is a small hiatal hernia.contrast is seen within the stomach.the duodenum is suboptimally assessed, but appears grossly unremarkable.
summary: cirrhosis with large volume abdominal ascites.no evidence of bowel injury from recent paracentesis (no evidence of extravasated oral contrast or free air).bibasilar opacities likely represent a combination of atelectasis and infection.small bilateral pleural effusions also present.diffuse body wall edema.

text: there is dependent atelectasis at the lung bases.otherwise, the lung bases are clear.heart size is within normal limits.liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.no abnormal abdominal loops of bowel, mass, or lymphadenopathy.there is a single 6 x 4 mm calculus within the left lower pole, with no resultant dilation of the collecting system.a central renal sinus cyst is seen within the right kidney measuring approximately 1.6 x 2.1 cm.there are no ureteral or bladder stones.the renal parenchyma enhances symmetrically.there is symmetric excretion without focal dilation of ureter.the bladder is normally distended.there is a single coarse calcification within the posterior aspect of the prostate.seminal vesicles and prostate are otherwise unremarkable.no urethral calculi are seen.the vascular system is nondilated with minimal atherosclerotic calcifications.pelvic bowel loops are unremarkable.no free air or free fluid in the pelvis.there are degenerative changes of the spine and si joints.a single slightly sclerotic 7mm focus with well-circumscribed margins is seen within the left iliac bone.
summary: left lower pole non-obstructing 6-mm calculus.no hydronephrosis.right renal sinus cyst.

text: there is ascites in the pelvis.the uterus and ovaries are visualized and are unremarkable.there is stool contained throughout the distal colon.the bones are unremarkable.
summary: bowel perforation and pneumatosis associated with dilated proximal small bowel loops and likely internal (paraduodenal) herniation of the small bowel.in addition there are secondary signs of shock.the clinical team was immediately notified.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, prostate and seminal vesicles appear unremarkable.there is calcification of the vas deferens bilaterally which might indicate diabetes.the rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.large amount of ascites is seen in the pelvis.
summary: new bilateral lower lobe and left upper lobe consolidation, consistent with pneumonia, and potentially suggestive of aspiration.large amount of ascites with free intraperitoneal air.free air is nonspecific in the setting of a paracentesis performed one day prior and there is no specific evidence of enteric leak such as oral contrast extravasation.clinical correlation is recommended.diffuse colonic edema extending from cecum to distal transverse colon, a finding that is nonspecific in the setting of background liver disease.clinical correlation is requested to assess concern for colitis.hypodense liver lesions in segment ivb measuring up to 5.6 cm, nonspecific on the single-phase ct.further evaluation with multiphase ct or mri is recommended.results were discussed with ___ ___-___ via telephone by dr.___ at 5:20 p.m.on ___, five minutes after discovery of findings.

text: the rectum, prostate, bladder and unopacified loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air.there is no abdominal aortic aneurysm.there is calcified atherosclerotic plaque within the abdominal aorta.there are bilateral iliac and a left external iliac stents which are unchanged in appearance although patency cannot be evaluated on a non-contrast enhanced examination.no inguinal or pelvic adenopathy is detected.
summary: there is no abdominal aortic aneurysm identified.bilateral iliac and left external iliac stents are identified and unchanged from previous study although patency cannot be assessed with a non-contrast study.unchanged chronic right lower lobe opacification adjacent to pleural thickening consistent with rounded atelectasis.

text: moderate right and small left pleural effusions have increased from prior examination.there is associated compressive atelectasis.the heart is normal in size, without pericardial effusion.note is made of a small sliding hiatal hernia.
summary: moderate right and small left pleural effusions, increased from prior examination.fatty liver.no acute abdominal pathology.

text: a foley is present within the urinary bladder.the urinary bladder contains air, likely related related to the foley catheter placement.the distal ureters, prostate and intrapelvic bowel loops are unremarkable.again, there is free fluid within the pelvis.no focal fluid collections are present.the osseous structures demonstrate diffuse osteopenia.no suspicious osseous lesions are identified.
summary: there is no evidence to suggest intra-abdominal abscess.there is free fluid within the abdomen.there is evidence of prior granulomatous disease with calcifications present within the liver.there are bilateral small pleural effusions, right greater than left, with bibasilar atelectasis.

text: there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.the rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder appear unremarkable.osseous structures appear unremarkable.there is a small fat-containing umbilical hernia.
summary: no change in anterior abdominal wall fluid collection.post-liver transplant with findings of portal hypertension.new small right pleural effusion.

text: inflammatory change is seen in the right lower quadrant has a stable appearance relative to the prior study noting that there has been interval removal of a right lower quadrant surgical drain.there is no residual drainable collection.the previously seen pelvic fluid has improved.the surgical defect in the subcutaneous tissues is again seen in the right lower quadrant.there are no dilated or thickened loops of pelvic bowel.no lytic or destructive osseous lesions.
summary: resolving inflammatory change in the right lower quadrant without drainable collection.

text: bibasilar atelectases are seen.there are no nodules or consolidations.there is some reflux of contrast into the lower thoracic esophagus.
summary: dilated loops of small and large bowel with paper thin walls.there are few regions of nondependent gas and possibly gas within the mucosal folds of the small bowel suspicious for pneumatosis intestinalis.there is no free intraperitoneal gas.these findings can be seen with mesenteric ischemia and can be further evaluated with ct angiogram.findings of cirrhosis and portal hypertension.cholelithiasis.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ on ___ at 5:30 p.m.

text: there are large bilateral pleural effusions and adjacent bibasilar atelectasis.the imaged portion of the heart and pericardium shows coronary artery and mitral annular and aortic valvular calcifications.sternal suture wires.nasogastric tube terminates in gastric fundus.hepatic cysts in the left lateral segment are unchanged.accessory left hepatic artery arising from the left gastric artery is noted.the liver, spleen, bilateral adrenal glands, and pancreas appear otherwise unremarkable.the gallbladder is edematous in appearance but appears contracted.the kidneys show cortical thinning bilaterally with patchy opacification suggestive of multiple areas of scarring from infection or infarction.there is atheromatous disease of the aorta, narrowing of the celiac artery at its origin and narrowing of the sma at its origin.there is narrowing in the mid section of the right renal artery due to atheromatous disease.abdominal aortic aneurysm is present, with the aneurysm sac measuring up to 3.1 x 3.3 cm (3b:252), slightly larger overall diameter than in ___, pre-evar.no other post-evar ct is available for comparison.there is type 2 endoleak arising from lumbar arterial branches (3b:247; 257).a left common iliac artery aneurysm sac measures 3.9 cm, unchanged from the pre-evar ct, and shows no specific evidence of endoleak, with some minimal hyperdensity in the sac being unchanged in comparison between pre- and post-contrast images.1.9-cm right common iliac artery aneurysm is unchanged.multiple metallic coils, and apparent occlusion of the left internal iliac artery, are new.there is diffuse ascites.diffuse stranding is present throughout the retroperitoneum and mesentery consistent with anasarca.no areas of direct contact of the bowel with the aorta, or focal inflammatory change, are noted to suggest aortoenteric fistula.no areas of active extravasation of contrast are identified.the large and small bowel loops are normal in caliber.high-density material is present throughout the bowel and colon and is nonspecific, although in the setting of reported gi bleed cannot exclude intraluminal hemorrhage.the ascites is nonhemorrhagic.there is no free intraperitoneal air.
summary: status post endovascular aortic aneurysm and left common iliac artery aneurysm repair, with type 2 endoleak in the aortic aneurysm sac.no evidence of aortoenteric fistula.high-density material within the bowel is nonspecific, although cannot exclude hemorrhagic component in the setting of reported significant gi bleeding.large bilateral pleural effusions, ascites, anasarca.hepatic cysts.bilateral renal cortical scarring.avascular necrosis of the femoral heads.
