text: there is fat stranding in the right lower quadrant with foci of air in the subcutaneous soft tissue and overlying clips consistent with postsurgical changes.there is no focal fluid collection in the subcutaneous soft tissues or within the pelvis.there is sigmoid diverticulosis with no evidence of diverticulitis.the uterus is unremarkable.there is fluid in the vagina.this is a new finding.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.on bone windows, there is no concerning osteolytic or osteosclerotic lesion.
summary: no evidence for postsurgical fluid collection in the abdomen or pelvis.fluid-filled vagina.this is a new finding, however, is of uncertain clinical significance.correlation with clinical examination is recommended.stable suprarenal aortic aneurysm.mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation in the left lateral segment is stable.

text: within the visualized lung bases, there is dependent atelectases, with a tiny right pleural effusion.visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable, without pericardial effusion.limited non-contrast views of the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.there is mild dilation of small bowel loops proximally, measuring up to 3-4 cm in maximal dimensions, with slight decompression of distal ileal loops.given recent surgery, this could reflect ileus.however, early or partial small bowel obstruction cannot be excluded.there is a small amount of nonspecific fluid seen within the mesentery in the mid abdomen, which may reflect post- surgical changes.there is no free air.there is no evidence for intraperitoneal or retroperitoneal hematoma.
summary: no evidence of intraperitoneal or retroperitoneal hematoma.dilated loops of small bowel proximally, may relate to post-surgical ileus.however, an early small-bowel obstruction cannot be excluded.small amount of nonspecific fluid and stranding seen within mid abdomen and pelvis, likely post-surgical.

text: the lung bases are clear.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the stomach and proximal small bowel are distended with contrast material up to the level of the proximal jejunum, where a suture line is identified in the proximal small bowel (2, 51), at the site of at transition point to nondistended small bowel.this corresponds to the site of obstruction on upper gi of 2 days prior.no contrast is seen distally to this region and the remainder of the small bowel loops appears collapsed.the spleen, liver, gallbladder, adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable.there is extrahepatic biliary ductal dilation to the level of the ampulla with no obstructing mass identified in the pancreatic head, little changed from prior examination.a subcentimeter hypodensity in the upper pole of the left kidney (2, 24) likely represents fat within a parenchymal cleft.the pancreas is unremarkable.scattered lymph nodes within the mesentery and retroperitoneum are noted.for example, there is a 1.0 x 1.5 cm portacaval lymph node (2, 25), unchanged.within the anterior abdominal wall, there are multiple surgically placed drains.extensive fat stranding is seen within the anterior abdominal wall and surrounding the end colostomy (2, 55).multiple lymph nodes are also identified within the anterior abdominal wall (2, 52) within a mesenteric fat containing parastomal hernia.tiny foci of air, which may be extraluminal (2, 65) is noted and may be due to recent surgery.clinical correlation is recommended.there is no free fluid identified.there is no bowel wall thickening, pneumatosis or pneumobilia identified.
summary: proximal small bowel obstruction with transition point at site of prior anastomosis suture line in the left upper quadrant.findings are unchanged from ___ ugi.extensive fat stranding in the anterior abdominal wall and adjacent to the end colostomy.multiple lymph nodes within the anterior abdominal wall are also identified within a fat containing parastomal hernia.tiny foci of free air within the abdomen just inferior to the anterior abdominal wall, likely related to postoperative state.presacral fluid collection measuring approximately 3.8 x 6.3 cm, may represent postsurgical change although infected fluid collection cannot be excluded.borderline enlarged mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes as described above.extrahepatic biliary ductal dilation, not significantly changed and without obstructing lesion identified.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ via telephone at 6:30 p.m.and with dr.___ ___ at 9:30 pm.

text: the patient is status post a right colectomy with end ileostomy, and gastrostomy after a cecal perforation.
summary: several areas of loculated fluid/organizing collections within the abdominal cavity, some of which exhibit minimal rim enhancement, as above.these may represent post-operative seromas, but superinfection/developing abscesses are not excluded.hematomas are felt less likely given the predominant low-density appearance, but also possible.no evidence of oral contrast extravasation into the abdominal cavity.

text: imaged lungs demonstrate mild bibasilar atelectasis and emphysema.partially visualized heart and pericardium are normal.a hiatal hernia with fluid contents in the sac is unchanged.the liver enhances homogeneously without focal lesion.the portal and hepatic veins are patent.clips in the gallbladder fossa indicate prior cholecystectomy.decreased extra-hepatic biliary dilatation, now mild.the spleen, adrenals, stomach, and loops of small bowel are normal.bilateral multiple renal subcentimeter hypodensities are too small to characterize and most likely represent simple cysts.a 17 x 11 mm exophytic cyst in the left lower pole (2:32) is without significant change from ___.the kidneys demonstrate unchanged mild cortical thinning with normal contrast enhancement and excretion without hydronephrosis.there is no free air, free fluid, or lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval resolution of large presacral abscess.1.7-cm soft tissue density lesion in the right lower pelvis may represent residual phlegmon, high-density fluid collection or a lymph node, unchanged from ___.

text: again identified is a large fluid collection tracking along the left anterior psoas muscle and into the left inguinal region.a pigtail catheter is centered within this fluid collection (2, 25).the fluid collection measures approximately 4.2 x 6.0 cm (2, 30), not significantly changed from most recent exam performed five days prior.a smaller fluid collection in the subcutaneous soft tissues at the post-surgical site (2, 34) is not significantly changed in size and now contains foci of air.a 1.8 x 2.6 cm fluid collection anterior to the left proximal femur (2, 42) is unchanged.post-surgical changes in the left groin following resection of sarcoma with reconstruction flap are similar in appearance.filling defect within the left common femoral vein with expansion of the lumen is unchanged, consistent with thrombus (2, 44).the prostate and bladder are unremarkable.a tiny focus of air within the bladder is likely due to recent instrumentation.the rectum, sigmoid colon are unremarkable.
summary: fluid collection tracking along the left iliopsoas muscle and extending into the left inguinal canal with pigtail catheter in place.no significant change when compared to most recent exam performed on ___.smaller fluid collections in the subcutaneous soft tissue as well as anterior to the left proximal femur are unchanged.no significant change in thrombosis of the left common femoral vein.

text: there are diffuse calcifications of the descending aorta and its branches.aneurysmal dilatation of up to 3 cm is noted within the infrarenal portion of the abdominal aorta (3, 76) is unchanged when compared to prior exam.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.within the bladder, there are tiny foci of air (3, 110).
summary: bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right with associated atelectasis.focal area of consolidation within the right lower lobe, concerning for infection.diffuse ground-glass opacities with diffuse nodular opacities throughout both lung fields.differential diagnosis includes infectious, inflammatory or neoplastic causes.diffuse anasarca and pericholecystic fluid.this may be secondary to hypoalbuminemia.infrarenal aortic aneurysmal dilatation up to 3 cm, stable in appearance.foci of air within bladder.differential diagnosis includes urinary tract infection versus recent instrumentation.left adrenal fullness, unchanged.lytic lesion within left iliac ___, unchanged.

text: there is a small effusion at the left base with atelectasis of the left lower lobe, not significantly changed from prior exam.there is a large pericardial effusion, also unchanged.there is an 8 mm simple cyst within the left lobe of the liver.no other focal liver lesions are identified.patient is status post cholecystectomy.the pancreas, spleen, and right adrenal gland are unremarkable.there is a 2.8 x 2.1 cm left adrenal lesion which needs further characterization.a few small simple cysts are noted within the left kidney.the right kidney is unremarkable.multiple diverticula are noted throughout the colon, without evidence of diverticulitis.evaluation of pelvis is somewhat limited due to artifact from the right hip prosthesis.foley catheter is noted within the bladder.bone windows demonstrate severe degenerative change throughout the lumbar spine, laminectomy changes and postsurgical changes within the left iliac ___.
summary: no evidence for septic emboli or abscess.left adrenal lesion, incompletely characterized.further evaluation is recommended with mri examination.no significant change in the large pericardial effusion and left basilar effusion.

text: there is increased amount of free fluid noted within the pelvis from the prior study.the sigmoid colon, rectum, and bladder are unremarkable in appearance.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes seen.there are no malignant-appearing lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions identified.
summary: persistent fluid collection containing gas within the head, uncinate process, neck, and proximal body of the pancreas with new fluid collection conatining gas in the distal body and proximal tail of the pancreas.status post pancreaticojejunostomy with roux-en-y formation and percutaneous biliary drain placement with subsequent decrease in intra- and extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.increased amount of intra-abdominal ascites and persistent moderate-sized right pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis.unchanged attenuation of the portosplenic confluence likely reflective of thrombosis with occlusion of the smv .

text: a large amount of stool is seen throughout the colon.no bowel obstruction present.the bladder is markedly distended.uterus is displaced somewhat to the left and demonstrates irregular coarse calcification likely in a fibroid, which was seen in ___.right superficial femoral artery occlusion is chronic and partially imaged with extensive calcification in the right common femoral artery.osseous structures are unremarkable except for an interval placement of a left hip total hip arthroplasty with streak artifact limiting evaluation, but no evidence of hardware complication.there is moderate degenerative change of the lumbar spine.
summary: no evidence of small-bowel obstruction.large amount of stool in the colon.overdistended bladder.emphysema.consolidative bibasilar opacities in the lung bases, which may be due to infection or atelectasis.findings posted to the ed dashboard.

text: there is interval resolution of the pelvic ascites.small and large bowel loops, bladder, and prostate appear unremarkable.no lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of disease recurrence.complete interval resolution of fluid collection along the hepatic resection site.near complete resolution of ascites.stability of multiple hypoattenuating lesions in both kidneys, too small to characterize.stable hiatal hernia.

text: there is minimal bibasilar dependent atelectasis with some linear atelectasis in the left lower lobe.a feeding tube terminates within the stomach.on this unenhanced scan, the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas, and gallbladder are normal.the right kidney is normal.there is a tiny 2-3 mm left renal stone.there is prominence of the left renal pelvis, which could represent an extrarenal pelvis or a peripelvic cyst.the ureters are normal.there is calcification of the descending aorta, which is normal in caliber.no identified pathologically enlarged lymph nodes.no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.the large and small bowel are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of abscess or colitis or other significant pathology on this unenhanced scan.small nonobstructing left renal stone.

text: there are atelectatic changes in the left base.there is no evidence of pulmonary nodules, pleural effusions or focal consolidations.there are multiple gallstones within the gallbladder.there are also some calcifications in the fundus of the gallbladder which could also represent calcification of the gallbladder wall.ultrasound could be performed for better evaluation.there is a hyperdense exophytic area in the left kidney that measures 1.2 x 1.1 cm there is also a simple cyst in the upper pole of the left kidney that measures 2.8 cm.there are two left adrenal nodules that are unchanged when compared to the prior study.the largest one measures 2.0 x 1.6 cm.the smaller one measures 1.3 x 0.9 mm.within the limitations of this noncontrast study, the liver is unremarkable.the pancreas is also unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.
summary: there is a small left groin hematoma measurin 2.5 x 2.5cm, but no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma to explain the hematocrit drop.left groin us could be performed to r/o pseudoaneurism.hyperdense exophytic lesion in the left kidney is not completely evaluated in this study.althought it is unchanged when compared to the prior study from ___, us is recommended for further evaluation.there are 2 nodular densities within the left adrenal that are unchanged when compared to the prior study.multiple gallstones within the gallbladder.there are also calcifications in the fundal portion of the gallbladder which could represent adherent stones versus calcification of the gallbladder wall.this could be better evaluated with an ultrasound.diverticular disease without evidence of diverticulitis.calcification of the coronary arteries.

text: there is a large hematoma in the proximal/medial right thigh.the hematoma is located in the adductor compartments of the right proximal thigh.it measures at least 11.5 cm (anteroposterior) x 11.4 cm (transverse) x 12 cm (craniocaudad) in dimensions.the inferior-most aspect of the hematoma is not completely included in the imaged field of view.the large hematoma demonstrates layering of more dense material related to posterior, dependent component compatible with a hematocrit effect.there is also evidence of stranding of the overlying subcutaneous fat.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.there is a filter in the inferior vena cava.there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.the liver, adrenal glands and kidneys are normal in appearance on this non- contrast study.there is a small calcified granuloma in the spleen.the spleen is normal in size.the pancreas appears normal.there is no evidence of free air or free intraperitoneal fluid.there is no bowel dilatation.there is degenerative change in the lumbar spine.there is superior endplate depression at the vertebral body of l2.this is unchanged compared to prior mri.there is grade 1 retrolisthesis of l2 with respect to l3.there is intervertebral disc space narrowing at multiple levels in the lumbar spine including l1-2, l2-3 and l3-4.there is vacuum phenomenon at these three levels in addition to osteophyte formation.there is a lesion measuring approximately 2 cm in diameter in the l4 vertebral body.this was previously characterized on mri in ___ and is compatible with a benign hemangioma.
summary: large right proximal/medial thigh hematoma, located in the adductor compartment.no intra-abdominal retroperitoneal hematoma.degenerative change in lumbar spine.superior endplate depression at l2 which is unchanged from prior mri.report was phoned to dr.___ ___ at 1:45 p.m.on ___.

text: visualized portions of the lungs show trace bilateral pleural effusions with surrounding atelectasis.as seen on the concurrent chest x-ray, this may represent aspiration pneumonia in the correct clinical setting.there are no nodules or masses within the lungs.no pneumothorax is seen.the cardiac size is top normal and there is no pericardial effusion.a hyperdense collection is seen within the body of the stomach and is thought to represent blood.although this study was not a cta, there is no blush to identify the location of an active bleed.a feeding tube is seen terminating in the antrum of the stomach.within the proximal ileum is a hyperdense structure which is within the lumen of the bowel and thought to be a foreign body (2:48) in the absence of a surgical history.the liver enhances homogeneously without masses.perihepatic and periportal fluid likely relates to volume status.the spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast without hydronephrosis.there has been fatty infiltration of the pancreas.the portal vein, superior mesenteric vein and splenic vein are patent.there is mild-to-moderate atherosclerosis of the aorta and at the origin of the celiac and superior mesenteric arteries, however, these vessels are patent distal to the stenoses.there is no free air to suggest abdominal perforation.the bowel loops are normal in size, although there has been fecalization of the small bowel loops which likely relates to slow transit.the colon is normal.
summary: no evidence of perforation.trace bilateral pleural effusions with surrounding consolidations would be compatible with aspiration pneumonia in the correct clinical setting.hyperdense material seen in the proximal ileum could represent a foreign body.air seen within the femoral veins likely relates to line placement.free fluid within the pelvis

text: since the previous examination, the low density peripherally hyperdense structure just adjacent to the rectosigmoid anastomosis (2:89) has decreased in size somewhat measuring 1.8 x 1.6 cm (previously 2.4 x 1.8 cm).the peripheral enhancing collection which was previously present along the right pelvic side wall has resolved nearly completely as has hydronephrosis on the right.pelvic loops of large and small bowel appear otherwise unremarkable.bladder and distal ureters appear unremarkable.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: interval near complete resolution of a previously present right pelvic side wall collection and associated hydronephrosis on the right.decreased size of a cystic-appearing focus adjacent to the colorectal anastomosis.continued attention on followup imaging is recommended.multiple hypodense lesions in the pancreas unchanged from previous studies, one of which may represent a cystic focus or dilated side branch containing a freely mobile calcification in the pancreatic head, and one of which may represent a dilated side branch or focus of fatty infiltration in the pancreatic body.these could be further assessed with mrcp if clinically indicated.status post left partial pneumonectomy and left-sided mastectomy and reconstruction without evidence of recurrence of disease in the chest.

text: extensive calcifications along the aorta and its branches are noted.there is no evidence of a retroperitoneal fluid collection.bowel loops are normal in caliber and without focal wall thickening.a right femoral line has been placed.tiny foci of air is seen within the overlying subcutaneous soft tissues (2, 20).a foley catheter is seen within the bladder.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the uterus is unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid.there is no inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes identified.diffuse anasarca noted.
summary: no evidence of a retroperitoneal bleed.extensive atherosclerotic calcifications.diffuse anasarca.

text: the visualized heart is normal.the pericardium is intact without pericardial effusion.peribronchovascular ground-glass and nodular opacities are seen in bilateral lower lobes, right greater than left.this may represent small airway disease versus aspiration, given the lower posterior lobe location of these lesions.the pleura is intact without pleural effusion.the liver enhances homogeneously without focal lesion.no radiographic evidence of cirrhosis.the hepatic vasculature is unremarkable.the intra- and extra-hepatic bile ducts are normal.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the spleen is mildly enlarged and enhances homogeneously without focal lesion.the splenic artery is patent and arises as a separate branch off of the aorta.the splenic vein, however, is not well visualized, compatible with a thrombosed splenic vein.the portal vein is normal without dilation or filling defect.a pancreatic pseudocyst, measuring up to 6.5 cm in length, is present along the body of the pancreas.no peripancreatic stranding or other evidence of acute pancreatitis.the bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys are normal with normal ureters.the esophagus and stomach are unremarkable.the small bowel and the colon follow a normal course and are of normal caliber.several colonic diverticula are present without diverticulitis.there are extensive splenic and gastric varices without esophageal varices.as previously mentioned, the splenic vein is not well visualized and the splenic artery arises directly from the aorta.intra-abdominal vasculature is otherwise within normal limits.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.no ascites, pneumoperitoneum, or abdominal wall hernia.
summary: splenic vein thrombosis with pancreatic pseudocyst is compatible with sequela of previous pancreatitis.extensive splenic and gastric varices without esophageal varices are likely secondary to splenic vein thrombosis.no radiographic evidence of cirrhosis or acute pancreatitis.bilateral posterior lower lobe peribronchovascular nodules, compatible with small airway disease or aspiration.prostate nodule protruding into bladder may represent isolated hypertrophy of the middle lobe of the prostate.however, recommend correlation with psa.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, and uterus appear unremarkable, except for a likely calcified fibroid of the left uterus (2:73).there is a small amount of fluid in the uterine cavity.there is an unchanged right adnexal cyst measuring 4.2 x 3.1 cm (2:68).there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.the bladder appears unremarkable.osseous structures demonstrate moderate degenerative change of the lumbosacral spine.
summary: no evidence of bowel ischemia.persistently midly dilated gallbladder.severe mesenteric atherosclerotic disease; unchanged.numerous incidental lesions previously described, unchanged.

text: there is a transplant kidney within the right hemipelvis.the transplant kidney contains multiple low attenuation foci likely representing cysts.contrast is seen within the collecting system.a small amount of ascites is present within the pelvis.the bladder and rectum are unremarkable.surgical sutures are noted within the mid-pelvis anterior to the sacral vertebral bodies consistent with known pancreatic transplant.there are dense vascular calcifications.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar partial collapse/consolidation, as noted on the prior study.ascites.prominent loops of large and small bowel consistent with ileus.multiple cysts within the transplant kidney.vasculopathy.

text: the distal ureters, rectum and sigmoid are unremrkable.a foley is present within the bladder which is unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no significant injury identified to the abdomen or pelvis.left lower lobe collapse/consolidation.

text: no prior imaging is available for comparison.minimal bibasilar atelectasis is seen.there is significant thinning of the apical portion of the left ventricle, as on prior cardiac mri dated ___.also, there is an apparent filling defect in the left ventricular lumen on image #9 of series 2.this finding may be artifactual in nature however thrombus in this area is also a consideration.simple-appearing cyst is seen within the left lobe of the liver.also, several calcifications are seen within the left lobe of the liver possibly related to prior infection or trauma.the spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas, and gallbladder are grossly unremarkable.small, 1-mm non-obstructing renal calculi seen bilaterally.simple-appearing right renal cyst is identified.there is no evidence of intra-abdominal hemorrhage.the bowel is grossly unremarkable.pelvic structures are grossly normal.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.
summary: no evidence of intra-abdominal hemorrhage identified.questionable filling defect seen adjacent to a markedly thinned left ventricular apex.these findings are discussed with ___ ___ at the time of dictation.

text: there is a moderate left pleural effusion and a small right pleural effusion.a small pleural calcification is noted at the right lung base within the pleural effusion (2:10).there is bibasilar atelectasis.the liver is nodular in appearance.there is mild ascites.cholelithiasis is present.there is a small simple right renal cyst with additional renal hypodensities bilaterally, too small to characterize.splenic varices are present, and there is a dilated varix posterolateral to the left kidney measuring 2.3 cm size (2:33).the solid and hollow abdominal organs are otherwise within normal limits.no lymphadenopathy is seen.there are extensive calcifications of the abdominal aorta and its major branch vessels.there is posterior spinal fusion extending from the t9 through l2 level.for further evaluation, please refer to the lumbar spine study performed the same day.a surgical clip is noted in the right paracolic gutter (2:35).
summary: left common femoral vein dvt, extending proximally to the external iliac vein, terminating at a cluster of pelvic wall surgical clips.the common iliac vein is patent.bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right.cirrhosis, with evidence of portal hypertension, including splenic vein varices with a dilated varix measuring up to 2.3 cm in size.cholelithiasis.mild ascites.well-circumscribed lucent left ischium lesion, likely a bone graft donor site for the spinal fusion.stable mixed lytic/sclerotic appearance of the l4 vertebral body.athersclerosis involving the abdominal aorta and its major branch vessels.

text: limited evaluation of lung bases displays known underlying emphysema and linear scarring and/or atelectasis within the right and left lower lobes, but no pleural or pericardial effusion.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, stomach, small bowel, kidneys, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.multiple small hypoattenuating lesions within the pancreatic head display no significant change and were previously characterized as probable underlying ipmt on prior mri.atherosclerotic disease is noted within the aorta.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes or free fluid is noted within the abdominal cavity.
summary: findings are consistent with perforated appendicitis with surrounding phlegmonous or early abscess collection.small locules of extraluminal air are noted within the pelvic cavity with free fluid and air also noted to track into the right inguinal ring.edema of the terminal ileum is presumed to be reactive.known underlying emphysema and extensive atherosclerotic disease.stable hypoattenuating pancreatic head lesions likely representing side branch ipmt.findings were discussed by phone with dr.___ shortly after exam acquisition at approximately 11:15 p.m.

text: a cyst with a diameter of 11 mm in segment 4 of the liver.otherwise no focal lesions are noticed in the liver.there is a vicarious excretion of the contrast material from previous iv injection.the intra and extrahepatic bile ducts are not dilated.the pancreas is homogeneous with no fat stranding or around it.no pseudocysts are seen.the spleen is normal.both adrenals are unremarkable.there is some enhancement of the cortex of both kidneys and excretion of contrast material.this is status post previous iv injection of contrast material.small cyst with diameter of 1 cm is seen in the lower pole of the right kidney.no free fluid is seen.no enlarged lymph nodes are observed.the bowel loops in the abdomen are unremarkable.
summary: bilateral lung opacities which may be consistent with aspiration pneumonia.reflux of contrast material inside the esophagus.there are no signs of pancreatitis.signs of diverticulosis without diverticulitis.cyst in the left ovary.further evaluation of this cyst is prudent.it can be done by pelvic and intravaginal ultrasound.

text: the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the prostate is enlarged and measures 5.8 x 6.8 cm.bladder is decompressed and contains a foley catheter.prominent bilateral pelvic sidewall lymph nodes are present, incompletely assessed.no free fluid is identified.
summary: ill-defined mass within liver, for which further with dedicated mri is recommended.bilateral hydronephrosis and hydroureter.obstruction at uvj secondary to bladder mass cannot be excluded on this non-contrast exam.recommend correlation with urine cytology and/or cystoscopy.extensive retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy concerning for metastatic disease.patchy sclerosis and anterior wedging of the t10 vertebral body concerning for pathologic fracture.evaluation for further osseous lesions may be performed with a nuclear medicine bone scan.

text: there is right basilar atelectasis.a more rounded confluent opacity at the right lung base, (2, 6) is identified and may represent atelectasis, aspiration, or infection.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.ng tube is seen terminating in the stomach.the spleen, adrenal glands are unremarkable.the liver is fatty.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.small soft tissue density next to right lobe of liver is likely of no significance.the pancreatic uncinate process contains a cystic lesion measuring 2.7 x 1.8 cm (2, 37), which is incompletely characterized.the kidneys contain bilateral hypodense lesions, which are incompletely characterized.for example, there is a 1.6 cm lesion off the lower pole of the left kidney and a 1.1 cm off the mid pole of the right kidney.there is a 5.2 x 5.2 cm abdominal aortic aneurysm.patient is status post stenting of this aneurysm.there is occlusion of the right common iliac artery, which reconstitutes at the level of the femoral-femoral bypass (2, 73).small bowel loops are normal in caliber and without focal wall thickening.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.nonspecific perirenal fat stranding is noted.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.there is no abnormal fluid collection identified.
summary: right lung base atelectasis with possible aspiration or infection.renal hypodensities, incompletely characterized.non-urgent renal ultrasound is recommended.pancreatic cystic lesion, incompletely characterized.mri is recommended for further evaluation.occlusion of the right common iliac artery with reconstitution of the fem-fem bypass.diverticulosis.enlarged prostate gland.

text: there is a tiny hypodensity in the dependent area of the right lung base, likely dependent atelectasis.there is a tiny trace pleural effusion on the right.the left lung base appears clean.the hypodense area in the liver seen on the previous scan is not appreciated on the current non-contrast ct study.the spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, ureters, pancreas, gallbladder and common bile duct are within normal limits.the duodenum, small bowel, and large bowel are within normal limits.there is no free air or fluid in the abdomen.
summary: small atelectasis at the right lung base with a minimal trace of right pleural effusion.segmental fracture of the right inferior pubic ramus, right sacral alar fracture, and bilateral fractures of the transverse process of s1.small amount of simple free fluid in the pelvis.

text: again seen is a left iliac vein stent.the stent is open and there is no evidence of collateral venous drainage to suggest residual clot or thrombosis.there has been no change in the appearance of the lower abdomen or pelvis since the prior day's exam.
summary: no evidence of left iliac thrombosis.venous stent is patent.

text: a small left pleural effusion is appreciated, along with minimal dependent bibasilar atelectasis.the liver, spleen, and kidneys are unremarkable, and are not significantly changed from prior exam.multiple fluid collections are again demonstrated around the pancreas, consistent with pancreatic pseudocysts.there is a left abdominal pigtail catheter has not changed in position in comparison to the prior study.again the tip does not appear to be within a pseudocyst.residual oral contrast is seen in the colon and residual iv contrast is seen within the collecting system of both kidneys.a moderate amount of fluid is again demonstrated within the abdomen.the osseous structures are unchanged.
summary: exam unchanged from seven hours previously, with multiple pancreatic pseudocysts.the drainage catheter tip is not positioned within the pseudocyst/abscess collection.

text: ct abdomen: the visualized lung bases show mild bibasilar atelectasis.the visualized heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.the liver is unremarkable with no focal lesions identified.the gallbladder is normal.the spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas appear unremarkable.the bilateral kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.the stomach and the small bowel appear unremarkable.cortically based hypoattenuating foci are noted within bilateral kidneys, which are stable since ___ and likely represent cysts.fat containing midline hernia is noted.the left renal vein is retroaortic.calcified atherosclerosis is noted within the abdominal aorta and iliac branches.no abnormal lymphadenopathy is noted.no free fluid or free air is noted.
summary: sigmoid diverticulitis and microperforation.follow up imaging or colonoscopy is recommended after treatment to ensure resolution.unchanged left adnexal cyst.second cystic lesion adjacent to the known left adnexal cyst may be a secondary additional cyst, and was present on the prior study.can consider ultrasound on a non-urgent basis for further evaluation of adnexa.

text: oral contrast reaches the rectum, which is normal in appearance.there are calcifications of the uterine vessels.the bladder is likely collapsed and not well assessed.there is a moderate-to- large amount of free pelvic fluid, slightly increased from the prior exam.no enlarged pelvic or inguinal nodes are seen.again extensive subcutaneous edema is appreciated.no suspicious osseous lesions are detected.multiplanar reformatted images were essential in delineating the anatomy and pathology in this case.
summary: interim development of circumferential wall thickening of the colon, most pronounced in the cecum through the hepatic flexure.the remainder of the colon is likely thickened to a lesser degree.while infectious/inflammatory colitis such as c.diff remain in the differential, ischemic colitis is of concern, given the vascular distribution of the findings (right sided predominance and elevated lactate) .the patency of the mesenteric vessels was not assessed on this non- contrast exam.no free air, portal venous gas or obstruction.extensive third spacing of fluid including subcutaneous fluid, pleural effusions and ascites.known enlargement of the common bile duct is not well assessed on this study.followup imaging was advised on the prior exam.atrophic kidneys.moderate-to-severe atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal vasculature.nodule of the subcutaneous fat of the left lower abdomen.this could be related to injections.attention on followup studies will be helpful.the findings were called to dr.___ on the afternoon of ___.

text: there is a small right-sided pleural effusion with reactive atelectasis at the right lung base.there are scattered airspace opacities at the left lung base.allowing for the lack of iv contrast, the liver, spleen and pancreas are unremarkable.there are likely simple cysts within the left kidney which are not completely evaluated on this non-contrast study.the kidneys and adrenal glands are otherwise unremarkable.the gallbladder contains multiple stones.there is no free air, fluid, or significant lymphadenopathy within the abdomen.
summary: right-sided anterior abdominal wall rectus sheath hematoma.scattered air-space opacities at the left lung base.clinical correlation is recommended.

text: there is mild right lower lobe atelectasis with a small right effusion.the partially imaged heart is unremarkable.
summary: large 9.8 x 12.1 cm right retroperitoneal hematoma with evidence of active arterial extravasation, the largest of which is in the right iliacus.an ir consult should be obtained.moderate multifocal stenosis of the right common iliac, external iliac and common femoral artery with possible focal areas of high grade stenoses.likely moderate focal stenosis in the distal left common iliac artery.diffuse calcific atherosclerosis in the the distal external iliac arteries is also noted bilaterally.these findings were discussed with ___ ___, md in person at 10:00 a.m.the time of discovery was 9:59 a.m.

text: as discussed above again seen are the left and right pelvic fluid collections unchanged in the interval.the fluid collection is contiguous with the fluid collection seen in the retroperitoneum and fascia surrounding the left kidney.the left common femoral dvt is again identified.a hartmann's pouch is seen without abnormality.
summary: interval development of a large right-sided pleural effusion occupying at least half of the hemithorax.a drain is identified within this fluid collection, however the size of the pleural effusion suggests the drain is not functioning.stable exam when compared to previous study of ___.again demonstrated are multiple loculated fluid collections within the left retroperitoneum extending to the left hemipelvis as well as into the right hemipelvis.left common femoral dvt with ___ ___ filter in position.status post left hemicolectomy with hartmann's pouch.stable left-sided pleural effusion with associated passive atelectasis.subcutaneous emphysema seen in the anterior abdominal wall.no significant inflammation is identified, therefore no abscess is suspected at this location.

text: the rectum is unremarkable.surgical staples are seen in the region of the anastomosis.there are no adjacent fluid collections.multiple metallic seed implants are seen within the region of the prostate gland.the seminal vesicles, distal ureters and partially- distended urinary bladder are unremarkable.there is no free air, free fluid or lymphadenopathy within the pelvis.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: interval subtotal colectomy with the formation of an ileostomy within the right lower quadrant.postoperative changes within the subcutaneous tissues and mesentery, as discussed above.interval decrease in the amount of abdominal ascites.no solitary fluid collections to suggest the presence of an intraabdominal abscess.stable postoperative appearance of the right kidney with a residual small amount of perinephric fluid, not significantly changed since the exam of ___.

text: direct comparison is made to plain radiograph dated ___.there appears to be a calcified gallstone.within the pelvis, there is a large homogeneous slight high density (20 ___) collection dependently within the pelvis, immediately anterior to the rectum.this measures 8.4 x 11.9 cm in axial dimension.areas of peripheral calcification are noted posterolaterally on the left.differential considerations include longstanding hydrometrocolpos.alternatively, this may represent a postoperative fluid collection if the patient has had a pelvic surgery.the uterus is not definitively visualized.also, the ovaries are not clearly seen, though less like, would be a differential consideration as well.also, evaluation of the bladder reveals a small, soft tissue attenuation focus along the posterior/inferior aspect measuring 12 x 11 mm (series 105b, image 64).differential considerations for this soft tissue attenuation focus within the bladder do include a small clot related to the patient's trauma, as well as neoplasm.no significant pelvic hematoma is identified.incidental note is made of diffuse anasarca.fractures of the inferior and superior pubic rami are seen.also, fracture noted to extend through the leftward aspect of the sacrum.
summary: no significant pelvic hematoma identified.multiple left-sided pelvic fractures as noted above.cystic area seen within the pelvis dependently anterior to the rectum.also, soft tissue attenuation focus seen inferiorly within the bladder.pelvic mri could provide further characterization of these findings as clinically indicated.these findings are discussed with dr.___ at the time of dictation.

text: the lung bases demonstrate minimal subsegmental atelectasis.there is no pleural effusion.pacing wires are partially imaged within the heart.the liver and spleen demonstrate tiny punctate calcifications which may represent calcified granuloma.the pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys demonstrate a somewhat thinned appearance of the cortex, but otherwise appear unremarkable.the ureters demonstrate segments which appear mildly dilated, but no obstructing calculus is seen and there is no hydronephrosis or perinephric stranding.the large bowel and small bowel are unremarkable, except for surgical sutures at the cecum which is related to the patient's known prior appendectomy.the gallbladder is absent.anterior abdominal wall staples in a right paramedian location are seen with no evidence of dehiscence.the abdominal aorta and its branches demonstrate calcification.there is also focal aneurysmal dilatation of the celiac artery which is calcified and measures approximately 14 mm (2:26).evaluation of the vessels is limited given non-contrast technique however.there is no abdominal gas or fluid collection.
summary: no evidence of acute abdominal process.right lateral ninth rib sclerotic lesion appears nonaggressive, but correlate with any history of prior malignancy or bone scan.abdominal aortic atherosclerotic disease, with focal celiac artery aneurysm.degenerative change, spinal stenosis, and compression fracture of t11.findings posted to the ed dashboard and discussed with dr.___ ___ at that time.dfddp

text: a nasointestinal feeding tube courses through the stomach with its tip in a post-pyloric position.there is a drainage catheter through the right anterior abdominal wall.the drainage catheter in the right anterior abdominal wall at the site of a large fluid collection on the prior examination now appears resolved.there is a large fluid collection around the liver, in a subcapsular distribution, which appears larger than on the prior examination, best appreciated on the coronal reformats (200b:38).there is a loculated collection posterior to the spleen (2:47) that appears similar in size to the prior examination.in a subdiaphragmatic region (2:35), there is an 8.6-cm loculated fluid collection, similar in size to the prior examination.there is a moderate amount of free fluid throughout the abdomen, most pronounced in the central abdomen and in the region of the left paracolic gutter.pancreatic parenchyma is difficult to discern and largely appears replaced by fluid collections.this appearance is similar to the prior study.the kidneys enhance symmetrically.there is a low-density lesion within the interpolar region of the right kidney (2:52) not well characterized on this examination.no hydronephrosis is present.the abdominal aorta and its branches appear widely patent.the splenic artery and vein both appear patent.no pseudoaneurysm is present.the stomach and abdominal loops of small bowel appear within normal limits without dilation or obstruction.there is no free air present.the gallbladder appears normal, although visualization is limited.there is minimal biliary ductal dilatation.
summary: right posterior segmental pulmonary embolism.at the site of anterior abdominal drainage, the fluid collection has resolved.a loculated, subcapsular, fluid collection around the liver has increased in size.free fluid in the left upper abdomen, tracking into the pelvis is moderate to large in volume.additional loculated fluid collections in the region of the pancreas and posterior to the spleen appear grossly stable.pancreatic parenchyma difficult to fully evaluate but appears predominantly replaced by fluid pseudocyst collection, but unchanged.abdominal vasculature appears patent without thrombus, or pseudoaneurysm formation.small to moderate bilateral pleural effusions.extensive bibasilar atelectasis.anasarca.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 4:45 p.m.on ___.

text: there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.there is no evidence of thrombus in the bilateral iliac veins or ivc.the visualized portions of large and small bowel, and the bladder are unremarkable.osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of ivc or iliac vein thrombosis.moderate bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis.

text: there has been an interval small bowel resection and the neo terminal ileum appears normal.on the colonic side of the anastomosis there is wall thickening, probably postoperative in etiology.there is a right fat-containing inguinal hernia.a small amount of presacral fluid is demonstrated but there is no abscess demonstrated.there is no pathologic pelvic or inguinal adenopathy.
summary: wall thickening on the colonic side of the anastomosis which likely represents post- operative changes; recommend interval ct follow-up in ___ weeks.no ct evidence for a rectal abscess.persistent segment iv hepatic hypodensity.

text: there is bibasilar atelectasis.heart is borderline in size.no pericardial effusion.coronary artery calcifications are noted.there is also calcification involving the aortic valve.lack of intravenous contrast limits evaluation of the solid intra-abdominal organs.however, liver and spleen are grossly unremarkable in appearance.there is diffuse fatty infiltration of the pancreas.otherwise, the pancreas is unremarkable in appearance.right adrenal gland is unremarkable.there is a 1 cm adrenal nodule of the lateral limb of the left adrenal gland, which does not definitely meet the criteria for an adrenal adenoma.hyperdense material within the dependent portion of the gallbladder may be related to sludge versus vicarious excretion of contrast from patient's recent angiogram.there is a splenule.kidneys are grossly unremarkable in appearance.there is a simple cyst involving the upper pole of the right kidney.non-obstructing right renal stone is noted.visualized bowel is grossly unremarkable in appearance without bowel wall thickening, inflammatory changes, or obstruction.post-surgical changes in the right lower quadrant are noted, with suture material surrounding the ascending colon.there is extensive calcified atherosclerotic disease involving the abdominal aorta extending into the iliac arteries bilaterally.there is dense calcification at the origins of all major branch vessels in the aorta, including the celiac, sma, and bilateral renal arteries.there is no free fluid within the abdomen or pelvis.no enlarged intraperitoneal, retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph nodes.no enlarged pelvic lymph nodes.no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.degenerative changes are noted throughout the spine.there are no osseous destructive lesions.the patient has diffuse osteopenia.
summary: extensive vascular calcifications, as described above.no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.left adrenal nodule does not meet the ct criteria for a simple adrenal adenoma, however, this statistically likely represents an adrenal adenoma.

text: the urinary bladder is normal.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or pelvic free fluid.
summary: no acute ct findings in the abdomen or pelvis.

text: a small right pleural effusion is unchanged from the prior study.adjacent right lower lobe atelectasis has increased.although a tiny left effusion is slightly larger than on the prior study, left lower lobe atelectasis is unchanged.small amount of pneumomediastinum has decreased from the prior study.there is no focal liver lesion.a small amount of air is seen in the decompressed gallbladder, likely related to the biliary stents with the proximal end in the common duct and the distal end in the duodenum, unchanged in position.small pericholecystic fluid is nonspecific in the setting of ascites.the spleen, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly.the right kidney is anteriorly displaced by retroperitoneal fluid, but is slightly more posterior than on the prior study.small and large bowel are normal in course and caliber without obstruction.the duodenum is medially displaced.there is no obvious leak of oral contrast.the abdominal aorta is normal in course and caliber.intraperitoneal free air has slightly decreased in the peritoneal cavity and the retroperitoneal spaces.a large amount of slightly complex fluid (___ 27-35) in the right retroperitoneum cause anterior displacement of the right kidney.no rim-enhancing fluid collection is seen.
summary: decreased but persistent large intraperitoneal and retroperitoneal free air.a large amount of fluid in the right retroperitoneum is seen with anterior displacement of the right kidney.no rim-enhancing fluid collection is seen.decreased pneumomediastinum.bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis as described above.

text: a large amount of ascites is again noted extending into the pelvis.a foley is present within the collapsed bladder.the rectum, sigmoid are within normal limits.there is no pelvic or deep inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval development of worsened pulmonary opacities, most pronounced in the right base.this appearance is concerning for aspiration, with note of reflux of oral contrast into the esophagus.interval development of a large amount of ascites throughout the abdomen with decrease in the previously seen free fluid.this may reflect underlying sepsis, chf or low albumin state, particularly given the associated anasarca and edematous changes in the bowel as noted above.these results were discussed with the emergency room team immediately following completion of the study as well as recommendation to remove the gastrografin contrast from the stomach, given reflux into the esophagus.

text: lung bases demonstrate mild dependent atelectasis.heart is not enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.as compared to prior study, there is stable hydronephrosis of the right kidney with multiple nonobstructive renal calculi within the renal calices.previous large proximal ureteral calculus has resolved.at the location of the previous stone, there is a 2-mm linear calculus (2:47).the ureteral wall is thickened at this location likely secondary to chronic irritation; however, underlying infection cannot be excluded on the basis of this exam.there is no left-sided hydronephrosis.a few non-obstructive renal calculi with the largest measuring 4 mm (2:28) are noted, stable.the unenhanced liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenals are unremarkable.there are few subcentimeter retroperitoneal lymph nodes which are stable since prior exam.there is no bowel obstruction or bowel wall thickening.normal appendix is seen in the right lower quadrant.urinary bladder, uterus, adnexa and rectum are grossly unremarkable.
summary: despite the interval resolution of large right proximal stone, there is persistent moderate-to-severe right hydronephrosis.at the site of the massive prior obstructing stone, there are two tiny residual 1-2 mm stones in the proximal right ureter.multiple stable nonobstructive right renal calculi.two tiny stable non-obstructive left renal calculi.no left hydronephrosis.

text: the terminal ileum, cecum, ascending colon, and transverse colon again demonstrate marked wall thickening and edema, consistent with colitis.in particular, there has been increase in mucosal irregularity involving the cecum and ascending colon, with luminal narrowing, overall worse compared to the prior study.the descending colon, sigmoid colon and rectum remain relatively spared.distal small bowel is normal in caliber, with no real wall thickening or edema.ascites collects in the pelvis dependently.the urinary bladder contains a foley catheter and a small amount of air.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy by size criteria.
summary: persistent bowel wall thickening, edema and luminal narrowing involving the terminal ileum, cecum, ascending and early transverse colon, consistent with colitis.overall appearance is somewhat worse than prior study of ___.increased wall thickening of the stomach and proximal small bowel, likely related to edema rather than an infectious or inflammatory cause.cirrhotic liver with interval increase in ascites.no new bowel obstruction, perforation or abscess formation.

text: the visualized portion of the lung bases demonstrate patchy areas of ground-glass opacity which are better characterized on the chest ct with contrast from ___.trace bilateral pleural effusions are seen, simple in nature.the liver demonstrates an ill-defined hypodensity that dominates most of segments ii and iii of the liver that is present even without iv contrast.it measures approximately 5 x 5 x 5 cm (2; 19 and 105b; 13).other scattered much smaller hypodensities are seen in the right lobe in segments ___ (2; 14), segment vii (2; 16).in the superior aspect of the left hepatic lobe lesion there is a focus of arterial enhancement that measures 17 mm in the transverse dimension (3a; 36).on the venous phase contrast continues to puddle peripherally in this lesion, making it most compatible with hemangioma.the remaining hypodense lesion in the left lobe of the liver as well as the other two lesions in the right lobe of the liver show no appreciable enhancement on the arterial, venous, or delayed phases.the hepatic vessels are noted to course through these areas of hypodensity and there is no intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder is decompressed.a prominent lymph node is seen in the porta hepatis that measures 26 mm in its short axis (3b; 189).the spleen is enlarged measuring 21 cm in its long axis (105b; 23).the imv is prominent in caliber, suggesting a degree of portal hypertension.there is no pancreatic duct dilatation.the adrenal glands are normal appearing bilaterally.the kidneys enhance with and excrete contrast symmetrically; a focal area of cortical thinning in the upper pole of the right kidney may represent a prior area of infection or infarction.the small and large intestine show no signs of obstruction.the aorta, ivc, portal vein and major branches are all patent.scattered paraaortic lymph nodes are noted but none meet pathologic size criteria.there is no free air.small amount of free fluid is seen around the liver and in the paracolic gutters bilaterally.
summary: multiple ill-defined hepatic hypodensities without appreciable enhancement, and porta hepatis lymphadenopathy.these findings may be compatible with infiltrative hepatic lymphoma, and a lesion in the lower aspect of segment ___ may be amenable to percutaneous biopsy as long as the hemangioma in that segment is avoided.

text: as noted above the transplant kidney is located within the right iliac fossa and the transplant pancreas within the left hemipelvis.bladder, prostate, rectum, and sigmoid colon are unremarkable in appearance.there is no free fluid or lymphadenopathy within the pelvis.there is diffuse arterial vascular calcification.a filter device is visualized within the ivc.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: large anterior abdominal fluid collection which likely represents seroma.there is no evidence of abdominal hernia.

text: the sigmoid colon, rectum, and urinary bladder are unremarkable.there is no lymphadenopathy, free fluid, or fluid collections.the infrarenal aorta is completely occluded as previously described with collateral circulation through the retroperitoneum and through the inferior epigastric arteries.
summary: no evidence of abscess or other acute infectious process seen within the torso.mediastinal lymphadenopathy of uncertain etiology.differential diagnosis includes inflammatory and neoplastic processes.clinical correlation and 3 months follow- up ct scan is recommended.complete occlusion of the infrarenal aorta as described in previous reports with collateral circulation as described.cholelithiasis.

text: chronic atelectasis or scarring at the right lung base appears essentially unchanged from ___.similar finding in the left lung base is seen to a lesser extent in this partially imaged in ___ likely unchanged.the atrio-biventricular pacing device is in unchanged position.there is significant cardiomegaly.the liver and both kidneys demonstrate innumerable cysts.an exophytic 1 cm right renal lesion is not clearly a cyst, however (2:21).the spleen appears unremarkable.within the limits of a non-contrast examination, the pancreas, adrenal glands, large bowel, and small bowel appear unremarkable.there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of metastatic disease.chronic scarring and/or atelectasis at both lung bases appear similar to ___.innumerable renal and hepatic cysts.additional exophytic right upper-interpolar renal lesion (5:40) not completely characterized.given contraindication to mri (aicd), ultrasound should be considered for further evaluation.likely pagetoid change of left iliac bone with small bone islands.

text: the pulmonary vasculature at the lung bases appears prominent.there is no pleural effusion.the heart is enlarged and there is no pericardial effusion.detail within the upper abdomen is severely limited due to streak artifact from the patient's spinal hardware and due to lack of intravenous contrast.no gross abnormalities are seen within the liver, spleen, splenule, pancreas, gallbladder.the adrenal glands are not well visualized.there is bilateral hydronephrosis and hydroureter, slightly more prominent than on the previous exam.the bowel appears grossly unremarkable.no free abdominal fluid.
summary: markedly distended bladder bilateral hydroureter and hydronephrosis.foley catheter appears to be positioned within the prostate gland and may benefit from repositioning.no sign of urinary tract stone.

text: there is moderate free fluid within the pelvis, not significantly changed since the prior study.there is, however, extensive penile and scrotal thickening and edema, new since the prior study.there is extensive subcutaneous edema.there is suggestion of mild thickening of a portion of the transverse colon, though this portion of the colon is partially collapsed.there may be mild wall thickening of the sigmoid colon; however, this area of colon is collapsed.clinical correlation is advised.the findings should be watched on future examinations.a foley catheter is seen within the urinary bladder.a fat-containing open left inguinal ring is seen.prostate and seminal vesicles appear normal.
summary: necrosis of the pancreatic tail, with surrounding small fluid collection, but overall less inflammatory changes since ___.no vascular complications identified.

text: the urinary bladder, uterus, rectum, sigmoid colon are unremarkable.
summary: cirrhotic liver with marked amount of ascites significantly increased compared to prior study.new large right pleural effusion and small left loculated pleural effusion.cholelithiasis with no evidence of cholecystitis.

text: the unenhanced liver, gallbladder, pancreas and spleen are normal.again visualized are atrophic native kidneys with multiple large simple cysts, with the largest measuring 4.6 x 5.6 cm on the left.the adrenal glands are normal bilaterally.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.there is free intraperitoneal air consistent with the patient's history of peritoneal dialysis.there is a small hiatal hernia.the stomach and small bowel are normal.a peritoneal dialysis catheter is visualized entering through anterior abdominal wall at the left rectus abdominis muscle.
summary: left lower lobe pneumonia.unchanged hiatal hernia.sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.free air secondary to peritoneal dialysis catheter.sesha

text: there is a small amount of simple free fluid within the pelvis, which may be physiologic or related to splenic injury.the bladder is unremarkable in contour.a foley balloon catheter is demonstrated within the bladder which is decompressed.the bowel within the pelvis is normal in caliber.there is no lymphadenopathy or free intraperitoneal gas.there is loss of the fat planes involving the proximal right thigh and stranding of the fat in this region which may be secondary to acute hemorrhage into the thigh, clinical correlation is recommended.
summary: linear low density within the spleen as described above, which may represent splenic laceration, although evaluation for intraabdominal injury is limited due to lack of iv contrast.tiny bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar atelectasis.loss of the fat planes involving the right proximal thigh musculature as well as stranding of the fat in the region which may be secondary to hemorrhage into the right thigh, clinical correlation is recommended.findings were discussed with the surgery team by dr.___ ___ at completion of the examination.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, and intrapelvic loops of small and large bowel are normal.the appendix is surgically abscent.suture material is present at a prior small bowel resection site (5:314).there is no intrapelvic lymphadenopathy.the bladder, uterus, and adnexa are normal.
summary: large anterior intra-abdominal air and fluid collection concerning for an abscess.focally dilated small bowel loop is concerning for internal hernia and closed loop obstruction.area of of free air and adjacent fluid within the right lower quadrant, separate from the primary abscess.multiple seromas overlying the groin incision sites bilaterally.no appreciable contrast enhancement across the femoral-femoral bypass.status post aortobifemoral bypass, which appears patent, with flow demonstrated in the superficial femoral and profundus branches bilaterally.unchanged mild extra- and intra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the findings were discussed by dr.___ with dr.___ at 9 p.m.on ___, ___.

text: linear atelectases are seen in the right lower lobe and left lower lobe.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.
summary: extensive stranding, phlegmonous change and fascial enhancement in the expanded right extraperitoneal space along the right abdominal wall and flank, concerning for fasciitis.there is no evidence of localized fluid collection or air.fluid in the subcutaneous tissue in the incisional line.fluid in the anterior extraperitoneal space in the pelvis measuring 2.7 x 8 cm.this may be contiguous with the changes in the right abdominal wall previously mentioned.small amount of nonorganized intraperitoneal pelvic fluid as well.bilateral linear atelectases in the lung bases.results were discussed with the resident caring for the patient, dr ___, by dr ___ on ___.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions and atelectasis vs.consolidation at both lung bases.a small amount of fluid tracks along the posterior liver edge.within the limits of this unenhanced scan, the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unchanged.there is moderate sized hiatal hernia.an ng tube is present.oral contrast material is noted within the hiatal hernia.the small bowel loops are dilated to greater than 4cm and contain stool.there is pneumatosis of several bowel loops.
summary: dilated, stool-containing small bowel loops.pneumatosis.findings discussed with the surgery team at the time of the study.

text: the patient is rotated toward the right.within the right lung base, there is a calcified granuloma as seen on prior studies.the remainder of the lung bases are clear with the exception of mild bilateral atelectasis.coronary artery calcifications and aortic calcifications are present.there are no gross lesions seen within the noncontrast enhanced liver.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys appear grossly unremarkable in this noncontrast exam.the stomach, small bowel and large bowel appear within normal limits.there is a moderate amount of stool seen throughout the entire colon.there is no free air or free fluid.there are no grossly pathologically enlarged lymph nodes present.
summary: no radiographic evidence to explain abdominal pain.status post cholecystectomy.unchanged right lower lobe calcified nodule.aortic and coronary calcifications.

text: a foley catheter is seen within a partially distended urinary bladder.there is no extravasation of the iv contrast.again noted is a mild to moderate amount of free fluid within the dependent portion of the pelvis, likely representing acute blood, not significantly changed in size/appearance since previous exam.the rectum and visualized loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is no free air within the pelvis.bone windows demonstrate no evidence of acute fractures.
summary: minimal, if any progression of the previously described injuries within the abdomen.again noted are left renal and splenic lacerations, as well as a possible tiny laceration of the right hepatic lobe.the amount of free fluid/acute blood adjacent to the liver, spleen and left kidney has not significantly changed since the previous outside scan.no new injuries within the abdomen.tiny left anterior pneumothorax, not seen on the outside scan.free fluid within the pelvis, not significantly changed in appearance.above findings were discussed in detail with the trauma surgery housestaff at time of examination.

text: there is a midline scar.the bowel is of normal caliber.the uterus is present.there is no ascites, lymphadenopathy, or free intraperitoneal gas.surgical clips are seen within the region of the rectum, unchanged.review of bone windows demonstrates degenerative changes of the lower lumbar spine.there is a right-sided sacroiliitis.there is a disc bulge at level of l5-s1 and slight disc bulge at l4-l5.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are demonstrated.because the collection has resolved, the drain was removed today by radiology.
summary: interval resolution of the right-sided retroperitoneal collection.no iv contrast was used, limiting evaluation of this collection, however, it appeared unchanged since prior examination and due to lack of drainage from this collection, the drain was pulled today.right lower quadrant ostomy.nonobstructive 2 mm right renal stone.degenerative changes of the lower lumbar spine with disc bulges at l4-5 and l5-s1.

text: urinary bladder, distal ureters, rectum and sigmoid colon have normal appearance.no free air or fluid is noted within the pelvis.
summary: interval decrease in the size of large pancreatic pseudocyst within the pancreatic bed and interval decrease in the size of pseudocyst located in the right upper quadrant area.no new focus of fluid collection is noted.no vascular compromise is noted including no pseudoaneurysm and no thrombosis.slight decrease in the bibasilar atelectasis.unchanged small left pleural effusion.

text: no prior examination for comparison.there are bilateral calcified pleural plaques, compatible with prior asbestos exposure.small left-sided pleural effusion, and atelectasis within the left lung base.no consolidation or pulmonary mass in the visualized lung fields.evaluation of the liver demonstrates numerous hypodense lesions, the largest measuring 1.5 cm within the liver dome, with central density measurements of-5 hounsfield units.findings most compatible with simple cysts, however, some of the smaller lesions are too small to characterize.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.there is a trace perihepatic fluid.calcified gallstones are identified.there is minimal amount of low density fluid surrounding the posterolateral aspect of the spleen.in addition, there is a focal cleft within the posterolateral splenic body, which could represent a tiny laceration, however, could represent normal anatomic cleft.no active extravasation is seen.there is a large left-sided perinephric hematoma, which measures 10.2 x 6.3 x 8.9 cm.there is anterior displacement of the left kidney, however, no active extravasation is identified.the left kidney opacifies well with contrast.the renal vein is patent, and the collecting system is intact.the right kidney is grossly normal.the pancreas and adrenal glands are normal.there are no dilated loops of large or small bowel.no free intraperitoneal gas.there is a small amount of fluid tracking along the left pericolic gutter.the patient is status post prostatectomy and nodal dissection, with numerous clips within the pelvis.there is a foley catheter within a decompressed urinary bladder.small amount of fluid is identified within the right inguinal ring.evaluation of osseous structures reveals degenerative change amongst both hip joints, right side greater than left.there is also degenerative change and osteophyte formation within the thoracic and upper lumbar spine.no displaced rib fractures are identified.vertebral body height is preserved throughout.
summary: large left perinephric hematoma with associated mass effect on the left kidney.no active extravasation identified.possible tiny splenic laceration, without evidence of active extravasation.gallstones.

text: there is a foley catheter within the urinary bladder.the rectum, prostate, seminal vesicles, and pelvic loops of bowel are within normal limits.there is no free pelvic fluid.
summary: no evidence of intra-abdominal traumatic injury.er dashboard wet read placed at 5:50 a.m.on ___.

text: the enteric contrast is seen within the large bowel.the small bowel appears grossly normal.there are innumerable diverticula throughout the large intestine.there is subtle stranding and thickening along the sigmoid colon and a more focal area of stranding is seen along the descending colon (series 2, image 38).the remainder of the mesentery surrounding the large intestine appears normal.there is no free air or ascites.the bladder is collapsed.there are no pelvic masses or enlarged of the lymph nodes.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are seen within the osseous structures.the coronal reformats confirm the above findings.
summary: multiple diverticula throughout the large intestine.mild sigmoid and descending colon diverticulitis without abcess or free fluid.no evidence of ischemic bowel.

text: bladder, prostate, and intrapelvic large bowel are normal, with moderate sigmoid diverticulosis noted.no retroperitoneal hemorrhage is identified.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are present.there is extensive high-attenuation fluid collection with fluid-fluid levels noted within the anterolateral aspect of the right thigh, beginning slightly below the lesser trochanter and extending down the femur to the included most distal third of the shaft on todays exam.the overall size is difficult to measure accurately and measures approximately 10 x 20 x 5 cm and may have grown from the recently performed ultrasound when it was estimated to measure 14 x 13 x 5 cm.there is asymmetrical induration of the subcutaneous tissues of the right lower extremity, which is swollen in comparison to the left extending up into the posterior lateral right flank and lower back.mild asymmetry induration of the right gluteal muscle is also noted, likely reflective of a small component of hematoma within this region as well.
summary: large predominantly intramuscular right thigh and right gluteal hematoma likely accounts for the drop in hematocrit in this anticoagulated patient has probably enlarged from prior ultrasound exam.cannot evaluate for active extravasation without the use of intravenous contrast.no retroperitoneal hemorrhage is present.the right lower extremity/thigh is asymmetrically swollen in comparison to the left.punctate nonobstructive right renal calculi.slightly atrophic appearing left kidney.cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.d/w dr.___ at 5:30 p.m by dr.___ via phone

text: there is a small right pleural effusion and associated atelectasis or pneumonia in the right lower lobe.linear atelectasis with a focus of calcification is present in the left lung base.there is heavy atherosclerotic calcification involving the abdominal aorta and the mesenteric and splenic vessels.intraluminal detail cannot be assessed by this study.assessment of the solid abdominal organs is also limited without iv contrast.allowing for the limitations, the liver, spleen, and pancreas are grossly unremarkable.there is redemonstration of a large calcified stone in the mid pole of the right kidney which measures 9 mm.a 1- mm stone is present in the lower pole.there is no hydronephrosis.there is a tiny 1-mm stone in the mid-to-lower pole of the left kidney.there are several probable hyperdense cysts in the left kidney.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is high density stranding and expansion of the anterior wall and right flank musculature, likely indicating a hematoma.given interdigitation among muscle groups, exact measurements are difficult, but the area of high density stranding/expansion measures up to 12.3 x 3.4 cm.stranding to a lesser degree is present in the left anterior abdominal wall.
summary: large right anterior abdominal wall/flank hematoma.findings called to dr.___ ___ at approximately 4:15 pm on ___.no evidence of acute intra-abdominal hemorrhage.small right pleural effusion and associated atelectasis or pneumonia in the right lower lobe.bilateral nephrolithiasis without evidence of obstruction.heavy atherosclerotic calcifications.moderate bladder distention.consider foley catheter placement.

text: there is no evidence of diverticulitis.the sigmoid, rectum, prostate, and seminal vesicles are within normal limits.a foley catheter is present within the bladder.there is evidence of a penile prosthesis.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: no evidence of diverticulitis or abscess.no ct explanation for left lower quadrant pain.extensive vascular calcifications.splenomegaly of undetermined etiology.cholelithiasis.horseshoe kidney.

text: there are large bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent lung base atelectasis.there is pericardial fluid measuring up to 10 mm in maximum dimension.compared to the previous exam of ___ there is redemonstration of a hypertrophied left hepatic lobe with colonic interposition between the right lobe of the liver and the diaphragm.there is a large amount of abdominal ascites, increased from previous exam.the bowel wall thickening which previously involved the stomach and proximal duodenum has resolved since the previous study.the celiac artery is patent and free of filling defect, however, there is a mild stenosis involving the proximal celiac trunk.the superior mesenteric artery is also patent with no evidence of stenosis or thrombosis.however, there is a tiny, 2-3 mm, nonocclusive thrombus involving the left hepatic artery.there is patent flow beyond this partial thrombus into the distal left hepatic artery.the spleen, pancreas, and atrophied native kidneys are unchanged.there is no free air seen.there is a suggestion of bowel wall thickening involving the ascending colon which is surrounded by ascites.a few small lymph nodes measuring less than 1 cm are present in the mesentery and there is a 10 mm lymph node in the anterior mid abdomen.oral contrast is seen in the stomach and nasogastric tube reaches the gastric body.there is diffuse soft tissue edema.
summary: diffuse abdominal and pelvic ascites, diffuse anasarca, bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis and pericardial effusion as described.there is patent flow involving the celiac trunk and superior mesenteric arteries however, there is a small nonocclusive thrombus seen in the left hepatic artery.there is a suspicion of edema involving the wall of the ascending colon.good perfusion.

text: evaluation of the lung bases is limited due to respiratory motion artifact.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the right kidney is normal in appearance for a non-contrast examination.the left kidney is atrophic and contains a large calcified calculus in its pelvis.there are small amounts of gas contained within and about this stone.there is a modest degree of stranding in the perirenal fat and some thickening of gerota's, zuckerkandl's and the lateral conal fascia laterally.
summary: atrophic left kidney with a large stone and associated gas within the collecting system.this is associated with some perinephric stranding.the overall picture is of concern for emphysematous pyelonephritis.

text: the entire upper abdomen is not imaged.allowing for lack of iv contrast the liver, spleen, pancreas and adrenals are unremarkable.there is a small splenule, unchanged.there is some high attenuation material within the gallbladder, which could represent sludge or vicarious excretion of contrast (prior cardiac catheterization).the native kidneys are small, unchanged.there are a few shotty nodes, but no pathologic adenopathy is seen.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.unchanged appearance of transplanted kidney in the left lower quadrant.

text: coronary artery calcifications are noted.otherwise, the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.dependent atelectases are present within the lower lobes bilaterally.a 3-mm pleural-based nodule within the right middle lobe (2:5) is unchanged from as far back as ___.there is no pleural effusion.a moderate-sized hiatal hernia is noted.the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the gallbladder is mildly distended, with a gallstone present.additionally, the common bile duct is dilated, measuring up to 1.5 cm, though similar in appearance compared to prior study.increased soft tissue is suspected at the porta hepatis, though limited in assessment without contrast.this suggests presence of lymph nodes, and is similar to prior study.both kidneys demonstrate a markedly nodular contour with more focal hypodensities bilaterally which are incompletely characterized.no hydronephrosis is identified.there is mild prominence of small bowel loops, without a discrete transition identified, and is nonspecific and similar in appearance to the prior study.there is no free air or free fluid.atherosclerotic calcifications of the abdominal aorta are noted.few mesenteric lymph nodes are not enlarged by ct size criteria.
