summary: cholelithiasis with stable dilatation of the cbd.unchanged soft tissue fullness at the porta hepatis, suggests lymph nodes.assessment is limited without iv contrast.diffusely nodular contour of the kidneys bilaterally, similar to prior study.if clinically indicated, this can be evaluated by ultrasound.non-acute inferior pubic rami fractures.

text: there is sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.the bladder and rectum are unremarkable.the prostate gland is markedly enlarged measuring 7.8 x 6.9 cm.enlarged lymph nodes extend along the iliac chain, the largest on the left measuring 1.2 cm.there are small fat-containing bilateral inguinal hernias.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.osseous structures demonstrate grade i retrolisthesis of l3 on l4.
summary: interval removal of surgical drain.the remaining two drains are in unchanged position.stable appearance of pancreatic necrosis and peripancreatic fluid collections, some of which contain air.enlarged prostate gland.severe coronary artery calcifications.prominent lymph nodes extending along the iliac chain bilateral to which attention can be paid on follow-up examinations.

text: direct comparison is made to prior examination dated ___.bilateral moderate-sized pleural effusion and areas of adjacent passive atelectasis are again noted.evaluation of the pancreas reveals significant areas of necrosis within the region of the head and neck.multiple peripancreatic fluid collections are identified.the largest collection, inferior to the liver is significantly decreased in size, measuring 7.7 x 8.9 cm on the current examination.pigtail catheter is noted in place within this collection.also, a collection identified posterior to the pancreatic tail measures 2.8 x 8.2 cm, also decreased in size since the prior examination.percutaneous cholecystostomy tube is seen within the lumen of the gallbladder.significant peripancreatic stranding is again seen on this examination.hematoma adjacent to the patient's gastrostomy tube site is slightly decreased in size since the prior exam.spleen and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the kidneys appear unchanged, noting multiple hypoattenuating foci with imaging characteristics consistent with simple cysts.moderate ascites is again noted.the pelvic structures are grossly unremarkable, noting an enlarged prostate.diverticulosis noted throughout the descending and sigmoid colon.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.
summary: overall decrease in size of the peripancreatic fluid collections with a percutaneous catheter in place in the largest subhepatic collection.significant pancreatic necrosis is identified.percutaneous cholecystostomy tube with its distal tip within the lumen of the gallbladder.moderate ascites is again noted.moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions with areas of adjacent passive atelectasis.

text: there is a moderate-to-severe amount of artifact related to the patient's right total hip replacement.there is a foley catheter within the bladder, which is decompressed.the rectum and uterus are unremarkable.there is likely sigmoid diverticulosis.there is no definite pelvic free fluid.no pelvic or inguinal adenopathy.small bowel loops are seen adjacent to the medial aspect of the right common femoral artery and vein, possibly a nonobstructed femoral hernia.as bowel loops are normal, there is no obstruction.
summary: no new findings in the abdomen/pelvis today.multilevel compression deformities of the vertebral bodies are again noted, acuity unknown.no clear evidence of solid organ injury.subcentimeter hepatic hypodensities, rounded and too small to characterize.moderately severe atherosclerotic disease.emphysema.probable right femoral hernia containing a small bowel loop, nonobstructed.5 mm left adrenal nodule, not characterized on this exam.

text: there is a large amount of fluid in the pelvis, increased since the previous exam.this fluid demonstrates higher density in the dependent regions, consistent with sedimentation from hemorrhage.there is a foley catheter within the urinary bladder.no enlarged lymph nodes are seen in the deep pelvic or inguinal regions.
summary: extravasation of oral contrast into the peritoneal cavity, likely from a leak at the patient's gastrojejunustomy.interval increase in hematoma surrounding the proximal jejunum in the site of the prior doudenal resection.this hematoma compresses the proximal jejunum quite markedly.there is also an increase in hematoma in the left mid abdomen adjacent to proximal small bowel loops, as well as an increase in fluid in the pelvis.these results were telephoned immediately to the intern in the surgical icu.

text: the urinary bladder is near empty, with foley catheter in place.the prostate, seminal vesicles, rectosigmoid colon, pelvic loops of bowel, and appendix appear normal.no pelvic free air, free fluid, or adenopathy is noted.no acute fracture is noted within the visualized osseous structures.
summary: no acute traumatic injury seen.stomach is somewhat distended, with layering fluid.

text: there is a foley catheter within the bladder.there is air in the bladder.there are degenerative changes in the spine, as well as bilateral hips.there is a prior median sternotomy.there are bilateral inguinal hernias which contain fluid.findings were discussed with surgical team.
summary: heterogeneous low attenuation lesions in the right lobe of the liver with air suggesting liver abscesses.air in the biliary system probably related to prior surgery.ascites.thickening of the small bowel wall which is a nonspecific finding in a patient with ascites, ischemia cannot be excluded.there is no pneumatosis.there is a change in caliber in the splenic flexure.this finding is also worrisome for ischemia.pneumoperitoneum.

text: rectum, sigmoid colon, and pelvic bowel loops are fluid-filled, otherwise unremarkable.free fluid is noted within the pelvis.there is high-density material within the pelvis in the left adnexal region could reflect surgical/suture material, correlation with prior surgical history is recommended.the uterus is unremarkable.contrast is noted within the bladder.
summary: multifocal abscesses involving the bilateral psoas and paraspinal muscles and left flank.extension into the central canal cannot be excluded for which mr is a better modality.left ureteral leak/injury with active contrast extravasation into the left retroperitoneum.post-surgical changes from l3 to l5 posterior spinal fusion and laminectomy.left pleural effusion and compressive basilar atelectasis.

text: the bases of the lungs are clear.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.
summary: apparent filling defect in the collecting system of the lower pole of the left kidney is unchanged and most likely represents an anatomic variation of prominent papillae.however, inflammatory polyp or urothelial tumor such as transitional cell carcinoma cannot be completely excluded.followup imaging in six months to ascertain stability is recommended.alternatively, imaging with another modality such as focused mru could be considered to resolve this finding.no evidence of nephro- or ureterolithiasis.subcentimeter hypodensity in the upper left kidney is unchanged and likely represents a cyst.enlarged prostate gland, unchanged in size since the prior study.

text: redemonstrated is the complex collection within the right hemipelvis containing fluid and gas, between the right ovary, rectosigmoid bowel, and small bowel.no contrast is within this collection from the recent ct to suggest open fistula from bowel.final images show the pigtail catheter within the collection and the collection smaller in size.small amount of subcutaneous and subgluteal gas is evident from anesthesia.approximately 20 cc of bloody pus-like fluid was aspirated and sent to the lab for gram stain and culture.the remainder of the fluid was left in the drainage bag.
summary: successful placement of 8-french pigtail catheter drain within the right pelvic fluid collection.

text: imaged lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis without pleural or pericardial effusion.the liver is normal in attenuation without focal lesion, intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.focal area of irregular enhancement in segment v is likely a transient perfusion anomaly.the gallbladder, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable.hypodensity in the spleen likely reflects cyst, hemangioma, or sequela of prior trauma.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically with hypodensities in the kidney which are too small to be characterized.interpolar region hypodensity on the left kidney measuring 2.1 cm is larger than on the prior with a punctate focus of possible enhancement versus septation (2:25).within the body of the stomach is a 7.3 (ap) x 7.9 (tv) x 10.2 (cc)-cm ovoid hyperdense mass with corticated edges and a slightly denser exterior rim is located in the gastric body and is suspicious for ingested material.the gastric body itself is displaced into the left upper quadrant with a slight swirled appearance suspicious for at least partial organoaxial volvulus.the displacement of the typical proximal small bowel loops medially raises the suspicion for internal hernia.the remainder of the small bowel is unremarkable.the patient appears to be status post appendectomy with suture material and surgical clips seen in the right lower quadrant.a hyperattenuating focus in the base of the cecum is shown to be an intact button on the scout examination.remainder of the large bowel is unremarkable aside from a portion of the descending colon which is also compressed and displaced by the partial gastric volvulus.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.the aorta and major branches appear patent.
summary: 10.2-cm ovoid, hyperdense, likely foreign body within the gastric body.given the appearance of the corticated edges and peripheral increased metal density, possible etiologies include foreign material wrapped in aluminum foil.leftwardly displaced gastric body suspicious for volvulus perhaps with an internal hernia.no free air or small-bowel obstruction is seen.hypoattenuating left renal lesion for which non-urgent ultrasound is recommended.this was discussed with dr.___ by dr.___ by phone at 21:10 on ___.

text: within the imaged portions of the base of the chest, a small pericardial effusion is seen.additionally, there is a small left-sided pleural effusion with associated atelectasis.incidental note is made of bilateral fat-containing diaphragmatic hernias.within the abdomen, there is a large heterogeneous mass which appears to be arising from the anterior colonic wall in the region of the distal transverse colon/splenic flexure.intra-abdominally, the mass measures approximately 8.7 x 5.2 (2:39) x 7.5 cm (300b:24).the lumen of the colon is narrowed; however, oral contrast is seen in the distal large bowel.the wall of the colon in the region of the mass is thickened and there is pericolonic stranding seen.there is extension of the mass into the anterior abdominal wall with expansion and inflammation of the left rectus abdominis musculature.there are several areas of low attenuation within both the mass and the anterior abdominal wall with circumferential enhancement which could represent areas of necrosis and/or possible infection.a few prominent lymph nodes are seen adjacent to the mass (300b:30, 2:61).no extravasation of oral contrast from the colon is identified.no free air is seen.there is stranding of the adjacent mesentery.loops of small and large bowel are nondilated.there is diverticulosis.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys appear grossly unremarkable.the bladder and distal ureters appear unremarkable.a hypodensity measuring 9 mm in the uterus (2:69) may represent a small fibroid.
summary: large heterogeneous mass arising from the anterior wall of the distal transverse colon/ splenic flexure with resultant luminal narrowing.no extraluminal contrast or free air identified.the mass extends to and invades the anterior abdominal wall where there is expansion of the abdominal musculature and multilobulated hypodense areas with rim enhancement in the subcutaneous tissues, compatible with a complex fluid collection.findings are most concerning for a neoplasm such as metastasis, gi stromal tumor or, less likely, adenocarcinoma.presence of superimposed infection is not excluded, particularly with regards to the anterior abdominal wall collection.small pericardial and left pleural effusions.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, prostate gland, seminal vesicles, rectum, and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is no free pelvic fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.bone windows again demonstrate old right 11th and 7th ribs healed injuries.there are degenerative changes with no suspicious lytic or sclerotic foci.
summary: cirrhotic liver with no focal liver lesions identified.large splenic varices with apparent splenal renal shunt.prominence of the pancreatic duct with intraductal calcifications and atrophic appearance of the pancreatic tail, unchanged compared to the prior study.status post apparent mesh anterior abdominal wall hernia repair.stable hypodense lesions in the spleen.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, though the foley catheter appears within the right lateral aspect, uterus containing degenerated partially calcified fibroid which is unchanged and adnexa are unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no definite ct evidence of colitis.top normal in size pancreatic and common bile ducts, also seen previously.cholelithiasis without secondary signs of acute cholecystitis.stable fibroid uterus.foley catheter within the right lateral most aspect of the bladder, which can be withdrawn within the bladder lumen for more optimal positioning.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.calcifications are noted within the prostate gland.there is no free pelvic fluid.pelvic lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: a soft tissue mass in the base of the right neck with osseous destruction of c7 right lamina and extension of the lesion into the right neural foramen is stable compared to prior scan.interval enlargement of hypoenhancing left lobe hepatic lesions concerning for progression of metastatic disease.interval decrease in size of portacaval lymph node.stable bulky retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.

text: there is a very tiny amount of patchy opacity within the medial-most right middle lobe.remaining lung bases are unremarkable.there are small pericardial and diaphragmatic lymph nodes, unchanged.a pigtail drainage catheter is again seen within the anterior portion of the right lobe of the liver, in unchanged position.the hypodense areas within the parenchyma and subcapsular region of the liver are unchanged in size and appearance compared to ___.assessment is somewhat limited by the lack of iv contrast.there is slightly less air in the region of the pigtail catheter.precise measurement of the abscess is not possible, but the hypodense areas within the liver are unchanged in size and appearance.no new lesions are identified on this non-contrast enhanced study.the biliary stent extending from the common hepatic duct into the duodenum is in unchanged position.the spleen, pancreatic head and body, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unchanged.soft tissue is again noted between the expected location of the pancreatic tail and the spleen.the soft tissue rounded lesion adjacent to the left side of the smv is also unchanged.the stomach, small bowel and remaining colon are unremarkable in appearance.the aorta is of normal caliber.the assessment of lymphadenopathy is limited given the lack of iv contrast.
summary: limited exam given the lack of iv contrast.the hypodense areas within the right anterior liver parenchyma and within the subcapsular region are unchanged in size and appearance.there is slightly less air in the region of the indwelling pigtail catheter.soft tissue densities in the region of the pancreatic tail and adjacent to the smv are unchanged.

text: the lung base images reveal small consolidation in the left lung base with a small pleural effusion.there is 8 mm calcified granuloma within the left lung base.minor atelectatic changes are seen within the right lung base.there are few calcified stones layering within the gallbladder.the native kidneys are atrophied and contain several cysts.there is extensive vascular calcification within the aorta, mesenteric arteries, and renal arteries.otherwise, within the limitation of this noncontrast study, the liver, spleen, adrenal gland, and pancreas are unremarkable.
summary: large right perinephric fluid collection with hyperdense areas representing a complex hematoma.air within the collection raising the possibility of infection.ureteral stent coiling within the presumed area of the proximal ureter, surrounded by a collection, raising the suspicion of ureteral leak.small consolidation within the left lung base, aspiration pneumonia?.fracture within the greater trochanter, right femur.the information has been discussed with dr.___ at the time of the study.

text: bilateral small-to-moderate pleural effusions, with basilar opacities could be atelectasis, cannot rule out superinfection.there is a small pericardial effusion, similar to prior study.no iv contrast was administrated hence suboptimal evaluation of solid organs.within that limitation, the liver, pancreas, spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys are small in size with bilateral hypodensities, likely cysts, incompletely characterized on today's scan; however, on prior ultrasound were described as cysts.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.there are multiple gallstones in the gallbladder and gallbladder is distended; however, there is no fat stranding or gallbladder wall edema.there is no free fluid, or free air.there is no bowel obstruction.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the retroperitoneum or mesentery.there are moderate atherosclerotic changes in the thoracoabdominal aorta and iliac vessels.scattered diverticula in the colon; however, there is no evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: hematoma along right medial pelvic wall extending from right groin with retroperitoneal extension on the right.bilateral small pleural effusions with adjacent opacities at the lung bases, likely atelectasis, cannot exclude superinfection.small pericardial effusion similar to prior.moderate atherosclerotic changes in the aorta and iliac vessels.cholelithiasis with no evidence of cholecystitis.finding discussed with ___ ___ at 1:11 a.m.on ___.

text: there is high density material along the wall of the cecum most liekly representing old contrast material.there is extensive sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.distal ureters and bladder as well as prostate and pelvic small bowel loops are unremarkable.there is no free fluid.there is a right-sided fat- containing inguinal hernia.
summary: suggestion of soft tissue thickening around the distal cbd/ampulla causing increasing biliary dilatation.an ampullary neoplastic process cannot be excluded.further evaluation with mrcp or ercp is recommended.extensive diverticulosis of the descending colon and sigmoid colon without evidence of diverticulitis.status post partial gastrectomy.

text: bibasilar opacities are present at the lung bases which may represent atelectasis vs aspiration.bilateral calcified pleural plaques are present.a nasogastric tube is seen with tip in the distal esophagus.no pleural effusions are identified.coronary artery calcifications and aortic calcifications are present.the liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the native kidneys are both very atrophic.a large staghorn calculus is identified within the right native kidney, measuring approximately 11 mm.there is no significant mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no free fluid or free air.there is significant dilatation of both the small and large bowel, which are filled primarily with air.the small bowel loops measure approximately 3.6 cm in transverse diameter, while the maximal transverse diameter of the colon is 9.7 cm, within the ascending colon.the bowel wall is not thickened and there is no inflammatory fat stranding surrounding the bowel.definite transition point is not identified however the stomach and the proximal small bowel are not distended.
summary: significantly dilated air-filled loops of large and small bowel consistent with the patient's history of ___ syndrome.air is present within the rectum.unremarkable appearance of renal transplant.staghorn calculus within the native right kidney.nasogastric tube with tip in the lower esophagus, the ng tube should be advanced.

text: fine details in the pelvis are obscured by the patient's right hip prosthetic.the urinary bladder, distal ureters, rectum, prostate, and seminal vesicles appear unremarkable.the appendix is normal.the colon is notable for a short-segment area of mural thickening and trace pericolonic fat stranding around the sigmoid colon (300b:31).there is no free gas or fluid in the pelvis.there is no pelvic sidewall or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: minimal intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation, without definite etiology, though in the setting of gallbladder sludge.overall, the biliary system could be further evaluated via mrcp if clinical concern persists.new left lower lobe pulmonary nodular opacity.given the short-interval appearance, this is likely infectious or inflammatory, though a dedicated ct of the chest is recommended in three months' time in order to exclude an underlying lesion.mild area of fat stranding surrounding a segment of sigmoid colon with relative mural thickening.overall, this finding is nonspecific and though there is no evidence of diverticulosis, a mild uncomplicated diverticulitis may have this appearance versus focal uncomplicated colitis.nevertheless, recommend correlation to colonoscopy upon cessation of symptoms in order to exclude an underlying mass.small hiatal hernia.unchanged renal cysts and splenomegaly.

text: imaged lung bases demonstrate a focal area of atelectasis or scarring in the lingula which may correspond to infarct given the patient's recent history of pulmonary emboli.no pleural or pericardial effusion is seen.please note, assessment of solid and visceral organs in the abdomen is limited in the absence of intravenous contrast.the liver is hypoattenuating suggesting fatty deposition without focal lesion, intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adjacent splenule, and right adrenal gland are unremarkable.in the left adrenal gland is an intervally decreased 12 x 9 mm area of thickening which likely reflects continuing resolution of adrenal hematoma without evidence of focal underlying lesion.the kidneys are without hydronephrosis.the imaged stomach, small and large bowel within the abdomen are unremarkable.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy with a 9-mm left para-aortic node, unchanged (3:44).no free fluid or air seen in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.
summary: interval continued decrease in conspicuity of left adrenal hemorrhage.fatty liver

text: ct abdomen without contrast: moderate bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis are present.calcifications at the cardiac apex are compatible with old myocardial infarction.within the limits of the noncontrast exam, the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.stones are noted within the gallbladder.oral contrast has progressed to the cecum.there is no abnormal small bowel distention or thickening.the colon is distended symmetrically without a transition point.there is no abnormal colonic wall thickening or stricture.there are large scattered amounts of stool with a bolus of stool at the rectum.there is no pneumatosis.there is no free air or ascites.scattered atheromatous calcifications are noted in the aorta and iliac arteries.no significant mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy is detected.
summary: moderate bilateral pleural effusions.no bowel wall thickening or abscess is detected.colon diffusely distended with air and stool.cholelithiasis.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis.additionally, in the left breast again seen is a 3 x 2 cm spiculated mass with nipple retraction (3:9) which appears intimately associated with the underlying pectoralis muscles.within the limits of a non-contrast study, the liver demonstrates no focal lesion or intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder is decompressed without evidence of stones.the spleen is normal in size.the pancreas shows no masses.again, the right adrenal gland shows nodular thickening of the lateral limb (3:24) similar to prior exam.the kidneys demonstrate multiple exophytic circumscribed structures, some of which are cysts, but many of which are dense, possibly representing hemorrhagic cysts, although solid mass lesions cannot be excluded.the small and large bowel showed no evidence of obstruction or wall edema.again is noted an intramural fatty lesion of the right colon measuring 2 x 1 cm in the axial plane (3:42), most compatible with lipoma.there is no lymphadenopathy, free air, or free fluid.the aorta is of a normal caliber along its course.no retroperitoneal hematoma is present.
summary: no evidence of free fluid or retroperitoneal hematoma; normal size of the aorta.left breast mass as described above, indeterminate - correlate with prior breast imaging.multiple indeterminate renal lesions, some of which are cysts, but some of which are solid; mr may be considered if clinically warranted.

text: the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the patient is status post hysterectomy.the bladder is collapsed, with foley instrumentation and expected related air in the bladder.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy, and no pelvic free fluid is identified.there is a hemotoma in the right groin (2: 81, 4a: 43, 4b: 128).the hematoma measures approximately 1.8 x 5.1 cm in size, with adjacent associated inflammatory fat stranding.following the administration of iv contrast, the common femoral artery and its branches are well opacified, but distal to the hematoma, the superficial femoral artery does not opacify.this finding is likely chronic, given peripheral vascular disease and history of right lower extremity amputation.in addition, the size of the fluid collection does not increase.the left common femoral artery demonstrates poor opacification distally, which is likely a chronic finding and not related to cardiac catheterization, given lack of instrumentation on the left side (4a: 79).
summary: right groin hematoma.no retroperitoneal hematoma.no evidence of active extravasation or expansion of size of hematoma.right above-the-knee amputation.left common femoral artery occlusion distally.large hiatal hernia.

text: the bladder, prostate gland, seminal vesicles, and pelvic loops of bowel are grossly unremarkable.there is no inguinal or deep trace free pelvic fluid.
summary: four small low-density lesions within the liver, unchanged in size and appearance since 2/___.stable collection posterior to the right lobe of the liver.a 7 mm nodular density at the right lung base, is new in the interval.3 month follow-up chest ct is recommended to document stability or resolution.

text: there is an incompletely imaged simple right pleural effusion, with collapse of the imaged portion of the right lower lobe, and fluid in the right lower lobe bronchus.a small left pleural effusion is also simple in appearance, with minimal adjacent atelectasis.lymph nodes measure 13 mm in short axis adjacent the the left pulmonary artery and 15 mm in the subcarinal region.the liver is normal.a 5 mm low- attenuation focus in the posterior spleen is too small to characterize, but may represent a small cyst.the gallbladder is present.the pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.an 8 mm left upper renal cortical low- attenuation lesion is too small to characterize, but statistically, most likely a cyst.a gastrostomy tube is present, with the balloon inflated in the gastric lumen.there is no pathologic lymph node enlargement or free air within the abdomen or pelvis.calcification of the aorta is moderate.
summary: short segment uncomplicated sigmoid colitis, which is non-specific and may be infectious/inflammatory in etiology.incompletely imaged bilateral pleural effusions, with partial collapse of the right lower lobe which may be post-obstructive, given the presence of fuid in the right lower lobe bronchus.superimposed infection cannot be excluded.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.there is no evidence of pneumonia.trace pericardial effusion is present.there is coronary and mitral annular calcification.evaluation of the solid intra-abdominal organs is limited by lack of contrast.within this limitation, the liver appears normal.there is no biliary ductal dilation.gallbladder is free of stones, and there is no pericholecystic inflammatory change.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.a small splenule is seen in the splenic hilum.right kidney is unremarkable.there is no hydronephrosis or renal mass.there is no nephrolithiasis.on the left, there is a hyperdense lesion arising from the lower pole of the left kidney, compatible with a cyst seen on recent ultrasound.additionally, there is moderate left hydronephrosis and a proximal hydroureter, extending to the mid ureter, where the ureter is compressed by a large mass lesion.this mass abuts and likely arises from small bowel loops anteriorly, and abuts the ureter and iliac vessels posteriorly.the mass measures 6.8 x 5.5 x 4.9 cm (cc x tr x ap).there is no associated bowel obstruction.there is no free fluid or free air.there are no further small bowel or mesenteric masses.there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.the stomach and duodenum are unremarkable.a capsule is seen in the cecum.there is scattered colonic diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.more extensive diverticulosis is seen involving the sigmoid.the aorta shows moderate atherosclerosis.there is focal infrarenal ectasia measuring up to 2.3 cm.
summary: 6.8 cm abdominal mass, centered anterior/inferior to the aortic bifurcation, abutting small bowel loops anteriorly, and displacing the left ureter and left iliac vessels posteriorly.given the lack of associated bowel obstruction, this most likely represents small bowel lymphoma.other etiologies such as a gist could also be considered.adenocarcinoma is less likely.moderate left hydronephrosis and hydroureter, secondary to compression from aforementioned small bowel mass.small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.sigmoid diverticulosis.aortic atherosclerosis, with 2.3 cm infrarenal aortic ectasia.extensive lumbar degenerative change.

text: a small simple right pleural effusion with adjacent atelectasis is stable.band-like linear density in the left lower lobe is increased, compatible with atelectasis.a nasogastric tube terminates in the antrum.moderate intrahepatic biliary air is similar in degree, extending into the common duct, which measures 11 mm in the pancreatic head but smoothly tapers, as before.the liver is otherwise unremarkable.at least one gallstone measuring 11 mm in diameter is noted, with small amount of air in the gallbladder lumen.the spleen, adrenal glands and kidneys appear unremarkable.the configuration of the pancreatic head is similar in appearance when compared to the recent prior study.a pigtail catheter is appropriately positioned within a fluid and air collection in morison's pouch, which is unchanged in size, with persistent wall enhancement.a second pigtail catheter is appropriately positioned in the more caudal component of this right paracolic gutter collection, which appears decreased in size when compared to the study of ___, measuring 13 mm in greatest transverse dimension, compared to 24 mm on the prior study.there has been no interval change in multiple small loculated collections surrounding the kidney.there is no bowel dilatation or pathologic lymph node enlargement within the abdomen or pelvis.atheromatous calcification of the abdominal aorta is mild.
summary: two catheters within a right retroperitoneal fluid collection are in appropriate position, with interval decrease in the caudal component of the fluid collection.stable pneumobilia status post ercp.stable configuration of the pancreatic head.again, attention is recommended on followup studies.stable small right pleural effusion with adjacent atelectasis.

text: the lung bases are clear.the liver is unremarkable.there are dependent gallstones in the gallbladder, but no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is a small simple renal cyst in the left upper pole of 14 mm in diameter.there is also bilateral non- specific fat stranding adjacent to the kidneys, possibly due to prior inflammation.the stomach, small and large bowels are unremarkable.there is no mesenteric lymphadenopathy, or free air or free fluid.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.cholelithiasis.enlarged prostate.

text: small right greater than left low density pleural effusions are noted, with compressive atelectasis in the visualized lung bases.no pericardial effusion is noted.aortic valve, mitral annular, and coronary arterial calcifications are noted.a nasoenteric feeding tube terminates in the proximal stomach with side hole above the ge junction.note is made of a moderate- sized hiatal hernia.prominent paraesophageal lymph node measures 12 mm in short axis and contains a normal fatty hilum.percutaneous biliary drain remains in place, and contrast remains opacifying the dilated common bile duct as well as the right intrahepatic biliary tree.the contrast obscures evaluation of biliary stone; however, rounded relative hypodensity in the proximal common duct in the dependent position may represent a stone.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.small locules of gas in the left hepatic lobe may represent a small amount of pneumobilia.fluid and fat stranding is noted surrounding the second-to-third portion of the duodenum where there appears to be a duodenal diverticulum, although evaluation is limited by lack of oral or iv contrast administration.two curvilinear areas of high density (2:30, 33) could be located within the diverticulum although its margins are poorly defined and the possibility of extravasated contrast from the biliary system cannot be excluded.there is extensive free air about the duodenum in addition to the probable diverticulum with retroperitoneal tracking of free air about the aorta and ivc and right pararenal space and paracolic gutter.free air is noted in the abdominal cavity as well and within the porta hepatis.a trace amount of fluid is noted surrounding the liver, which tracks inferiorly along the right paracolic gutter; also a small amount of fluid is seen in the deep pelvis.the remainder of the non-opacified and non- enhanced stomach, and small bowel appear unremarkable except to note right anterior abdominal wall hernia containing a loop of small bowel, without evidence of obstruction.scattered diverticula are noted throughout the colon, without inflammatory change.the appendix appears normal and filled with oral contrast, which was apparently administered during a ct scan performed at an outside hospital.the non-enhanced spleen appears unremarkable.the body and tail of the pancreas appears unremarkable except to note punctate calcification which could be vascular; the head of the pancreas is not well evaluated due to region of inflammatory change surrounding the duodenum.evaluation for pancreatic mass is not possible in the setting of a noncontrast examination.the non- enhanced adrenal glands, kidneys, and ureters appear unremarkable.no definite retroperitoneal or mesenteric adenopathy is noted; a single paracaval node measuring 8 mm in short axis (2:24) does not meet ct size criteria for adenopathy.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted in the abdominal aorta and iliac arteries.curvilinear calcifications noted within the lumen in the infrarenal aorta, just above the level of the ___ takeoff, is incompletely assessed due to lack of iv contrast and could represent either thick partially calcified atherosclerotic plaque or displaced intimal calcification in aortic dissection.
summary: free air in the abdomen and retroperitoneum, with fluid and stranding particularly surrounding the second-to-third portion of the duodenum where there appears to be a duodenal diverticulum.findings consistent with provided history of duodenal perforation.cannot exclude extravasation of contrast from biliary system where hyperdensity is seen medial to the second portion of duodenum (vs.intra-diverticular contrast).fluid tracks about liver and into the pelvis.biliary obstruction with persistent contrast in the biliary tree, although obstruction is likely incomplete as there is some passage of contrast into proximal small bowel.status post cholecystectomy.percutaneous tranhepatic biliary drain in place.moderate-sized hiatal hernia.small right greater than left pleural effusions with related atelectasis in visualized lung bases.colonic diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.right anterior abdominal wall hernia containing a loop of small bowel, without evidence of obstruction.curvilinear calcifications within lumen of the infrarenal abdominal aorta.finding incompletely assessed due to lack of iv contrast and could represent thick, partially calcified atherosclerotic plaque versus displaced intimal calcifications associated with dissection.no aneurysmal dilatation seen.prostatic enlargement.bladder incompletely assessed, with intermediate density within the superior bladder possibly representing proteinaceous material, hemorrhagic fluid, or collapsed bladder wall; clinical correlation recommended.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ from surgery at 7:40 p.m.and at 9:28 am on ___.

text: new small bilateral pleural effusions are identified at the lung bases, right greater than left.minimal subsegmental atelectasis is seen at the lung bases.the heart remains mildly enlarged.evaluation of the intra-abdominal viscera is limited due to the non-contrast technique and streak artifact from the spine hardware.the liver is normal in size with no definite focal lesion.prominence of the common bile duct is again noted measuring 10 mm.no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation is identified.the gallbladder, spleen, and pancreas are within normal limits and unchanged from prior.prominence of the pancreatic duct is not clearly identified on this examination likely due to technique.the adrenal glands are normal.a 3.4 x 4.5 cm cystic lesion in the upper pole of the left kidney is unchanged compared to prior.attenuation valued are indeterminate and may represent a hemorrhagic cyst.additional too small to characterize hypoattenuating lesions within both kidneys appear stable.
summary: stable abdominal aortic aneurysm without signs of acute rupture.no retroperitoneal hematoma.fluid-filled distended loops of small bowel, without discrete transition point, findings suggestive of ileus.cystic lesions within the kidneys, the largest in the left upper pole of indeterminate attenuation.followup renal ultrasound should be considered.stable ventral hernia without evidence of acute obstruction.stable severely mottled pelvic bones of uncertain etiology.new small bilateral pleural effusions.

text: again noted are the extensive diverticula, some of which contain retained contrast.there is a moderate amount of free pelvic fluid which is not significantly changed since the prior study.this appears to track within the right inguinal canal.there is no apparent deep pelvic lymphadenopathy.the bladder is unremarkable.again noted are the multiple bilateral rib fractures, as previously described.
summary: no significant change in the extensive anasarca.there are no focal drainable collections.although the right pleural effusion is slightly increased status post chest tube removal, there has been interval resolution of the previously-described pericardial effusion.

text: absence of intravenous contrast limits evaluation of the solid organs and vascular structures.the liver is grossly unremarkable.multiple calcified gallstones are seen within the gallbladder, which is otherwise unremarkable.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 16.5 cm in greatest axial dimensions.the pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, ureters, stomach, and intraabdominal loops of bowel are unremarkable.no free fluid is seen within the abdomen, and there is no evidence of abnormal mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval increase in size of loculated right pleural effusion.unchanged appearance of chronic left pleural effusion.unchanged appearance of right upper lobe ground glass opacity.cholelithiasis, without evidence of cholecystitis.splenomegaly.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions.there is severe cardiomegaly.there is a small pericardial effusion (2, 7).there are coronary artery calcifications identified.the spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the right kidney enhances and excretes contrast appropriately.the left kidney contains a 1.7 cm hypodense lesion which is incompletely characterized.within the left lobe of the liver, there are linear hypodense areas consistent with lacerations.foci of high-density material within these lacerations are consistent with active extravasation (2, 18-22), possibly from the left portal vein.there is extensive amount of hemoperitoneum with blood identified in the perihepatic space as well as surrounding the stomach and retroperitoneal bleeding along the left flank.there is no evidence of free air.the gallbladder is unremarkable.small bowel loops are normal in caliber.there is no evidence of free air.there is a markedly tortuous and ectatic aorta with mural calcifications.there is focal aneurysmal dilatation of the infrarenal abdominal aorta measuring 2.4 x 3.4 cm (2, 39).there is a penetrating atherosclerotic ulcer along the anterior margin of this aneurysm (2, 39).in addition, there is a short segment dissection flap identified posteriorly (2, 33-42) which measures approximately 5 cm in length.contrast is identified within both lumens.there is severe left renal artery stenosis with atherosclerotic calcifications.increased density surrounding the aorta is unchanged and extends along the left flank consistent with retroperitoneum hematoma.
summary: complex liver laceration of the left lobe of the liver to the left portal vein with active extravasation.moderate amount of hemoperitoneum.2.blood within the left pararenal and perirenal spaces and along the left side of the aorta, consitent with retroperitoneal hemorrhage.however, no definite retroperitoneal organ injury.focal abdominal aortic aneurysm with short segment chronic dissection.severe left renal artery stenosis.left renal hypodensity, incompletely characterized.markedly enlarged prostate gland with increased enhancement in the peripheral zone at the left apex.correlate with psa and dre because of the concern for prostate cancer.small pericardial effusion and moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly.small pleural effusions, bilaterally.bilateral rib fractures as described above.no evidence of pneumothorax.findings were discussed with surgery resident on call.

text: the lung bases are normal.below the diaphragm and the liver, two poorly circumscribed low-attenuation lesions are seen in segment v measuring 8 mm and 14 mm (series 2, images 26 and 29 respectively).a third lesion is seen in segment vii measuring 22 mm in maximum diameter (series 2, image 21).these lesions were identified on the previous ct from ___ and are unchanged, but are incompletely characterized on both of these studies.a hypodense lesion is seen in the anterior aspect of the spleen superiorly measuring 21 mm.again, this is incompletely characterized on this study.a splenule is identified just anterior to the superoanterior aspect of the spleen.the adrenals are normal.the kidneys demonstrate hypodensities bilaterally, likely representing cysts.the patient is status post cholecystectomy with surgical clips in the gallbladder fossa.extending from the splenic hilum, again identified is a cystic collection in the bed of the pancreas in the body and tail, which contains locules of air.this collection measures 15 cm in transverse x 2.9 cm in ap diameter.the size is relatively unchanged when compared with the previous ct, but there appears to be a greater amount of air within this collection.there is also some oral contrast within this collection.this is secondary to oral contrast passing through the cyst-gastrostomy.inflammatory change is seen to extend into the neck of the pancreas.there appears to be some normal appearing enhancing parenchyma in the head of the pancreas and extending down into the uncinate process.a more simple fluid collection begins anterior to the uncinate process and extends to the right of the duodenum and inferiorly.this measures 7 cm in transverse x 4 cm in ap diameter.this was also identified on the however, still is less than 3 cm, measuring 2.4 cm.

text: upon additional review of patient's record, the patient is also noted to be hiv positive.ct of the abdomen with intravenous contrast other than dependent atelectasis, the lung bases are clear with no focal consolidations, pleural effusions, or pulmonary nodules.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, both adrenal glands, both kidneys, both ureters, and visualized portions of intra-abdominal small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no intra-abdominal free air or free fluid.note is made of a significant amount of fluid within the colon that may indicate a component of nonspecific fluid within the small bowel and colon that may indicate a component of enteritis.there are multiple scattered retroperitoneal lymph nodes numerous in quantity, though none that meet size criteria for pathologic enlargement.

text: evaluation of the abdomen is limited by lack of intravenous contrast, but there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.note is made of pneumobilia, as seen on prior, possibly the result of prior sphincterotomy.the gallbladder is surgically absent.within the limitations of a non-contrast study, the pancreas is normal.previously described cystic mass in the tail of the pancreas is not well evaluated without contrast.the stomach contains oral contrast and is distended, the inferior portion of the stomach is not visualized as it extends below the imaged portion of the abdomen.the adrenals are normal in size bilaterally.the kidneys are normal without hydronephrosis or stones.the spleen is unremarkable.there is no intraperitoneal free fluid or free air.coarse calcification is again noted along the anterior surface of the liver.visualized aorta is normal in caliber.
summary: distention of the stomach, which may be the result of gastroparesis, or the rate of contrast consumption.no mass is seen.pneumobilia status post cholecystectomy, probably the result of prior sphincterotomy.

text: there is a 7-mm hypervascular lesion within segment vii of the liver which may represent a hemangioma though evaluation is incomplete on a single- phase study.no additional lesions are seen within the liver.the gallbladder appears only partially distended and there is no evidence of biliary ductal dilatation.the pancreas appears unremarkable without evidence of ductal dilatation.the spleen and adrenal glands appear normal.a tiny hypodensity in the lower pole of the left kidney may reflect a cyst but is too small to adequately characterize.there is asymmetric excretion of contrast with a slight delay on the left.the left ureter is not dilated though may be partially tethered posteriorly along the levels of spinal surgery.the abdominal aorta and major branch vessels are widely patent.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes are noted.the stomach and duodenum appears unremarkable.a small focus of gas anterior to the ivc on series 5 image 34 is likely contained within the third portion of the duodenum.
summary: extensive peribronchovascular opacities within the lungs compatible with pneumonia.small bilateral pleural effusions and scattered areas of atelectasis.no pe.post-surgical changes in the lower thoracic and lumbar spine as described above.small collection along the anterior left psoas muscle is likely a post-operative seroma though infection of this collection cannot be entirely excluded.small amount of free fluid in the pelvis is likely related to surgery.mild asymmetry in left renal excretion without hydronephrosis or hydroureter likely related to mild tethering of the left ureter along the operative bed.subcentimeter hypervascular lesion within segment vii of the liver which may represent a hemangioma though evaluation is incomplete on a single-phase exam.sesha

text: the inferior portion of the liver and portions of the kidneys are visualized, which are unremarkable, although not optimally visualized because of the late phase of contrast administration.likewise, the status of bilateral aorto-bifemoral grafts cannot be assessed.there are kissing stents within each common iliac artery, beginning in the lower aorta and the aorta is again calcified.there is a fibroid uterus, including a densely calcified fibroid of 21 mm in diameter with the fundus.a pessary is present.compared to before, the anastomotic suture line in the mid-rectum is not well visualized.previously, the rectum was relatively ___ in caliber and thickened with considerable presacral soft tissue stranding, which was consistent with post-operative and radiation-related fibrosis.fat spaces could be seen about the residual rectum previously.however, now the fat spaces are effaced, and there is a patulous area in which barium pools along the posterior and lateral margins of the residual rectum, and the presacral soft tissue thickened space is much thinner.the overall appearance suggests breakdown of the rectal wall with a contained collection of barium.
summary: at the anastomotic site in the mid-rectum, breakdown of the rectal wall is suspected, with a contained collection of barium lying posterior and lateral to the neorectum.

text: there is again a large 15.4 x 11.1 x 8.2-cm anteverted fibroid uterus (series 501b, image 43).the displaced bladder and distal ureters and pelvic loops of bowel appear normal.adnexa appear unremarkable.there is no pelvic free air, free fluid, or pathologic lymphadenopathy.
summary: right lower lobe nodule has apparently increased in size over one year.recommend dedicated chest ct to characterize this lesion and to determine if any other lesions are present.persistent enlarged fibroid uterus with mild right hydroureter with contrast seen to layer dependently.no nephrolithiasis.no striated nephrogram to suggest pyelonephritis.correlate clinically.right renal hypodensity, simple in attenuation, is likely a simple cyst.could consider outpatient ultrasound for further characterization.

text: the rectum, urinary bladder, uterus, adnexa, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is free passage of oral contrast through to the rectum.there is no free pelvic fluid or lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval improvement in pancreatitis with decrease in size of large phlegmonous/fluid collection of the neck and body of the pancreas.no new fluid collections or abscesses are identified.mesenteric fat necrosis also appears mildly improved.

text: there is a foley catheter in the bladder.the prostate and rectum appear unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymph adenopathy.there is no free fluid.
summary: no abscess.no ct evidence of intra-abdominal or pelvic infection.two subcentimeter low-attenuation liver lesions, which are too small to characterize but likely represent cysts.

text: the liver is heterogeneous, compatible with cirrhosis.the spleen is mildly enlarged measuring 13.7 cm.the pancreas is normal in appearance on this non-contrast examination.the gallbladder fundus is thickened and demonstrates an area of intramural calcification.this likely represents an area of gallbladder adenomyomatosis though this could be further evaluated with targeted ultrasound.it is noted recent ultrasound did not directly visualize this region of the gallbladder fundus.no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is seen in the abdomen.no bowel obstruction is seen.though incompletely assessed on this unenhanced study, a number of anterior and right lateral abdominal wall venous collaterals are seen.there is large volume fluid in the peritoneal cavity.the fluid predominantly measures low hounsfield units, but there is an area of layering hyperdensity in the right paracolic gutter (series 2, image 52) and further layering hyperdensity in the fluid within the pelvis.findings are compatible with intraperitoneal hemorrhage superimposed on ascites.
summary: large volume ascites with superimposed layering hyperdensity within fluid in the right paracolic gutter and in the pelvis compatible with ascites with superimposed hematoperitoneum.thickening of the left rectus muscle within the setting of a clotting deficiency is compatible with rectus hematoma.multiple right rib fractures, which appear healing.multiple left rib fractures, which appear more acute.probable gallbladder adenomyomatosis, could be further assessed with targetted ultrasound.findings discussed with dr.___ at approximately 8 p.m.on ___.dr.___ ___ ___

text: a small amount of high density free fluid is seen in the pelvis, decreased from the prior exam.the ureters are nondilated.the bladder is not thickened.there is diverticulosis but no diverticulitis.there are no pelvic masses or enlarged inguinal lymph nodes.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic osseous lesions.
summary: stable appearance of subcapsular hepatic hematoma.interval worsening of bilateral pleural effusions and associated atelectasis.decreae in amount of high density (likely bloody) ascites.continued presence of biliary stents, pneumobilia, and mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation.

text: the patient is status post right hemicolectomy.there are prominent loops of small bowel and colon indicative of ileus.the anastomotic site is well seen and there is no evidence of extravasation of contrast; however, only a small amount of contrast is seen beyond this point.there is scattered ascites throughout the abdomen consistent with recent surgery.no walled off collections are seen.the urinary bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.skin staples are present.there is diffuse anasarca.bone windows are unchanged.
summary: prominent bowel loops throughout the abdomen both pre and post anastomosis consistent with post op ileus.the anastomotic site is seen and there is no extravasation of oral contrast; however, only limited contrast has gone beyond this point.given this finding a delayed scan in three hours to evaluate for leak.subtle enhancement of the ascitic fluid while this could be post operative in nature, superimposed infection cannot be excluded.

text: the bases of the lungs are clear.some dependent changes are seen.there is mild intra and extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation without obvious cause.there are no focal intraparenchymal liver lesions.there is mild splenomegaly.the adrenals and gallbladder are unremarkable.the pancreas is atrophic.native small kidneys present with multiple cortical hypodense cystic lesions.there is a small 3mm hyperdense lesion in the gallblader (polyp vs.non-dependent gallstone).there is no free air within the abdomen.the bowel loops are unremarkable.the aorta is normal in caliber, there is important atheromatosis of the wall of the aorta and its main abdominal branches.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes.
summary: there are no intraabdominal abscess or collections.mild splenomegaly.mild intra and extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.diffuse widespread atheromatosis.polyp versus nondependent gallstone in the gallbladder.heterogeneous hypoenhancing renal transplant.

text: small bilateral pleural effusions are seen at bilateral lung bases, with compressive atelectasis.the patient is status post left hepatic lobectomy.the remaining right liver lobe enhances appropriately, without nodules or masses.a collapsed, peripherally enhancing gallbladder contains air and debris, consistent with patient's cholecystenterostomy.the pancreas enhances somewhat heterogeneously, particularly within the pancreatic body.there is significantly less peripancreatic stranding than on prior exam.the spleen, bilateral adrenal glands, and left kidney appear normal.within the upper pole of the right kidney, there is a stable 8.0 x 7.6 cm simple cyst.___ ___ filter is located within the infrarenal ivc.the stomach is grossly distended, and there are multiple tensely dilated loops of intra-abdominal small bowel.an abrupt caliber change within the right mid abdomen is located approximately 12 cm proximal to the jejunojejunostomy.proximal to the transition point, the bowel wall is slightly thickened and edematous, with small bowel fecalization.distally the samll bowel loops are collapsed.there is a small amount of intra- abdominal free fluid.all mesenteric vessels appear patent.
summary: mechanical small bowel obstruction with transition point located within the right mid abdomen, possibly related to adhesions.

text: there are moderate bilateral pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis, volume increased as compared to ___.there is probable concurrent consolidative change in the right lower lobe, concerning for aspiration versus infection.calcified pleural plaques are present bilaterally.mild cardiomegaly is stable.dual-chamber cardiac pacer leads terminate in the right atrium and right liver demonstrates no focal lesion, although its contour is slightly lobular, raising question of cirrhosis, as previously seen.the gallbladder contains hyperdense material, which could either represent sludge.there is no tense gallbladder distention.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.kidneys are miniscule in size but without hydronephrosis or hydroureter.there is summary: no focal fluid collection or free air to indicate new perforation.limited evaluation of diverticulitis due to marked mesenteric induration and mild anasarca.apparent mural thickening in the cecum may be related to underdistension.attention on followup is recommended.diverticulosis.unremarkable post-hartmann's and sigmoid colostomy anatomy, without obstruction.increased moderate bilateral pleural effusions.more confluent appearance of right lower lobe consolidation, raising question of aspiration versus infection.persistent ascites.foley catheter with balloon appearing to be in prostatic urethra.recommend clinical correlation and repositioning.calcified pleural plaques.nodular hepatic contour, raising question of cirrhosis, unchanged.findings reported to dr.___ ___ at pager ___ at 4:30pm on ___, ___.

summary: ___-pancreatic fistula formation in the region of the necrotic pancreatic head extending into the hepatic flexure.stable-sized walled-off necrosis involving the retroperitoneal regions bilaterally with large-bore catheters in place with extension into the pelvis and right inguinal regions.unchanged mild right hydronephrosis secondary to compression of the right ureter by the right retroperitoneal walled-off necrosis.findings were discussed with dr ___ ___ by radiology fellow over telephone on ___ at 3:35 pm.

text: marked asymmetric stranding in the right groin is consistent with patient's described hematoma after catheterization.while there is no large organized hematoma, a 2.3 x 3.4 cm confluent area of hemorrhage just adjacent to the femoral artery and vein (2:84) is present consistent with a small hematoma, and there is high-density material tracking along the iliopsoas musculature in the right pelvic side wall consistent with extension of hematoma (2:77).the bladder contains contrast consistent with previous administration, possibly from the prior cardiac catheterization.the prostate and seminal vesicles and rectum appear unremarkable.multiple diverticula are present in the sigmoid colon without evidence of inflammatory change.
summary: right groin stranding and hematoma extending into the right pelvic side wall without evidence of large retroperitoneal bleed or hemoperitoneum.5-mm hypodensity in the right lobe of the liver, too small to characterize.1-mm right middle lobe pulmonary nodule.if there is no history of risk factors for lung cancer, no further followup is required.6-mm exophytic lesion arising from the left kidney is incompletely characterized.colonic diverticulosis.hiatal hernia.a wet read was provided to ___ ___ on ___ by dr.___ describing local stranding and hematoma in the right groin without evidence of retroperitoneal bleed or other acute abdominal or pelvic pathology.

text: urinary bladder is collapsed around foley catheter.rectum contains stool, smaller in amount when compared to the prior study.the uterus is not visualized and may be surgically absent.there is no free fluid in the pelvis, and no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.

text: consolidation mainly involving the left lingula, and left lower ___ are increased since prior exam.new patchy areas of ground glass opacification are seen within the right lung base.there is a new small/moderate left-sided pleural effusion, and a small pericardial effusion.within the abdomen, the pancreas is prominent, but enhances.a few focal areas of decreased enhancement are seen within the pancreatic body and tail (___, ___) which may represent early pseudocysts, or focal areas of early necrosis.focal masses are less likley.the pancreatic duct is smooth along it's course and measures upper limits of normal at 3 mm.there is diffuse peripancreatic fluid, extending throughout the retroperitoneum and into the pelvis.the liver enhances normally.a new 8 mm hypodensity within segment ___ of the liver may have been present on prior study dated ___, but appears more prominent today.the gallbladder, spleen, bilateral adrenals glands, both kidneys, and abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.all vessels enhance homogeneously.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no free air.

text: a moderate amount of ascites layers around the liver, around the spleen, and in the pericolic gutters.a hiatal hernia is small.the unenhanced liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands demonstrate no focal lesions.a tiny 2-mm calculus is located in the lower pole of the left kidney (image 2:34).no hydronephrosis is present.

summary: chest tube on the right with bilateral atelectasis in both lobes.irregularity of the right lobe of the liver with generalized ascites and subcutaneous edema.no evidence for abdominal collections.

text: there is left basilar atelectasis versus scarring, unchanged from ___.there is minimal atelectasis at the right base.there is a small pericardial effusion.the examination is slightly limited by the lack of iv contrast.however, the noncontrast appearance of the liver, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.there is a focus of splenic hyperdensity which may represent a splenic granuloma, unchanged.the native kidneys are atrophic with surrounding stranding.the gallbladder is surgically absent.the stomach, small and large bowel are normal.there is no free air in the abdomen.the aorta is of normal caliber, with atherosclerotic calcification.there is low density within vascular structures indicating anemia.there are small retroperitoneal lymph nodes.

text: the cavitary lesion within the right apex now appears to be more air filled.it measures approximately 2.6 x 2.9 cm.also, the region of septal thickening and nodularity within the right apex appears somewhat less prominent.within the right upper lobe (series 2, image 15), there is a nodule which appears slightly smaller in size, now measuring 5 mm, previously measuring approximately 6 mm.within the superior segment of the right lower lobe (series 2, image 18), there is a nodule measuring approximately 1 cm x 1 cm which also appears slightly smaller.it previously measured approximately 12 x 13 mm.again seen is right hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy.this is stable in extent.adenopathy encases the right hilar vessels and airways.this finding is unchanged from the previous exam.heart has normal appearance.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber.again noted is an aberrant right subclavian artery.
summary: slight decrease in the size of right upper lobe lung nodules.there has been no substantial change in the appearance of the hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy.slight increase in the size of the bilateral adrenal lesions.increase in confluence and increase in size of some of the bilateral renal lesions.retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymphadenopathy as before.

text: the visualized portions of the lung bases are clear.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, small bowel, and colon are within normal limits.right-sided hydronephrosis appears unchanged when compared with the prior examination.right-sided hydroureter is also stable when compared to ___.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis on the left.no renal stones or masses are seen on the study limited by the lack of iv contrast.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, distal ureters, bladder, uterus, and adnexa are normal in appearance.there is right retroperitoneal hemorrhage along the right psoas muscle with fat stranding within the mesentery in the right lower quadrant.the intrapelvic loops of small and large bowel are normal in appearance and caliber.there is no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: large acute right retroperitoneal hemorrhage demonstrating active extravasation of contrast,.these findings indicate active arterial or venous bleeding.clinical correlation is recommended.distended gallbladder measuring 11 x 7.5 cm without evidence for cholecystitis.tips stent within the liver.findings relayed to ed dashboard and discussed in person with dr.___ ___, the surgical resident caring for the patient.

text: there is significant rectal wall thickening with adjacent fluid.sigmoid colon also appears thickened with associated fat stranding.the small bowel loops are relatively spared with no evidence of bowel wall thickening or distention.bone windows reveal diffuse osteopenia with cortical defects, consistent with with patient's known multiple myeloma.there are bilateral femoral neck fractures.the lateral scout view also demonstrates multiple compression deformities of vertebral bodies.
summary: diffuse colonic wall thickening extending from cecum to rectum with small ascites.most likely representing pancolitis caused by an inflammatory or infectious process, such as c.diff.colitis.this could also be caused by bowel wall edema associated with renal failure, but is less likely, considering normal appearing small bowel.another differential diagnosis is hemorrhage into colonic mucosal folds, such as in ischemia, but is less likely considering the diffuse involvement of the entire colon.diffuse osseous changes consistent with patient's known multiple myeloma.bilateral femoral neck fractures and multiple compression deformities of vertebral bodies.

text: the lung bases reveal small bilateral pleural effusions which are likely slightly larger compared to recent prior with associated dependent atelectasis.partial evaluation of the heart demonstrates cardiomegaly with pacemaker leads in place.again, no focal hepatic lesions are identified and there is no evidence of intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder and the spleen appear unremarkable.the adrenal glands are within normal limits.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast normally without evidence of hydronephrosis.small cyst-like renal hypodensities are again noted bilaterally but are too small to fully characterize, although they demonstrate no significant short interval change.atherosclerotic mural calcification of the aorta and its branches is again noted though the aorta is of normal caliber.again, the large and small bowel is of normal caliber.there are two percutaneous drainage catheters in place.the left-sided drainage catheter terminates in a large peripancreatic collection which is heterogeneous and contains small locules of gas with a thin hyperenhancing rim most consistent with a pancreatic pseudocyst.this collection obscures most of the pancreatic parenchyma and measures approximately 55 x 90 mm (previously 58 x 94 mm).an oval similar appearing fluid collection just posterior to the spleen may communicate with this peripancreatic collection and measures 51 x 39 mm (previously 51 x 36 mm).a multilobulated heterogeneous collection along the right lateral abdominal and pelvic wall again identified.this more superior fusiform component of this collection measures 67 x 31 mm (previously 76 x 37 mm).the more inferior larger component currently measures 102 x 65 mm (previously 100 x 62 mm).this fluid collection appears to communicate with the peripancreatic fluid collection through a small fluid tract.a 28 x 35 mm fluid collection abuts the proximal transverse colon (2:35) which causes some mild colonic wall thickening, though this appearance is unchanged compared to recent priors.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified.the rectum, sigmoid colon, uterus, adnexa are unremarkable.the bladder contains a foley.a small amount of fluid is noted along the right external iliac vessels not significantly changed compared to recent prior.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes are identified.diffuse streaking of soft tissues in the abdominal and pelvic wall is suggestive of anasarca, unchanged.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions.there is a healed fracture of the right inferior pubic ramus.
summary: mild decrease in some of the multiple pancreatitis related intra- abdominal fluid collections as described with pigtail catheters in place.no new collections seen.small bilateral pleural effusions slightly increased compared to recent prior.

text: interval increase in size of moderate right pleural effusion with overlying basilar atelectasis.persistent moderate left pleural effusion with overlying atelectasis.no pulmonary nodule is identified.the heart is normal in size.there is a small pericardial effusion (2:16).the patient is status post right hepatectomy and whipple procedure with pancreaticojejunostomy and hepaticojejunostomy.persistent subdiaphragmatic collection which does not appear changed in size from previous ct measuring approximately 6.3 x 9.5 cm.there are multiple foci of air present within the collection.these could be consistent with leak from bowel.the source of the leak is not identified.the hepatic flexure of the colon adjacent to the collection is thickened (2.17).the remaining liver parenchyma is normal in appearance.no focal liver lesions are identified.the spleen is normal in size.pancreatic drain is present within the pancreas.no collection identified adjacent to the pancreaticojejunostomy.the residual pancreas is normal in appearance without significant pancreatic ductal dilation.the pancreatic drain in situ extending to the jejunum (2:33).there are two drains in situ, one of which lies superior to the liver (2:15), which is a drain placed more laterally of the two jp drains.the more medially placed drain lies inferior to the subdiaphragmatic collection (2:18).both adrenal glands are normal in appearance.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis.there are no suspicious renal lesions.there are subcentimeter retroperitoneal lymph nodes.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are identified.the visualized small bowel loops are mildly distended and filled with oral contrast measuring up to 3 cm in diameter.there is a moderate amount of intra-abdominal free fluid.
summary: subdiaphragmatic collection which appears unchanged from previous ct of ___.multiple foci of air present within the collection suggestive of leak from bowel.the source of the leak is not identified.two jp drains present, one of which lies in a suprahepatic location and could be pulled back approximately 5-6 cm to lie within the subdiaphragmatic collection.thickened large bowel in the region of the hepatic flexure adjacent to the subdiaphragmatic collection.moderate amount of intra-abdominal ascites.bilateral moderate-sized pleural effusions.findings #1 and #2 were discussed with dr.___ ___ in person at 4:30 p.m.on ___.

text: the urinary bladder, distal ureters, prostate, seminal vesicles, rectum are unremarkable.the colon is notable for scattered diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis and is decompressed.there is no free gas or fluid in the pelvis and there is no pelvic sidewall lymphadenopathy.the loop of bowel in the right inguinal hernia has already been described and note is made of a fat-containing left inguinal hernia.

text: the colon is normal appearing with fecal matter and bowel gas.there is a small amount of simple fluid pooling in the dependent portion of the pelvis, within physiologic range for female of childbearing age.the uterus is noted with mild endometrial fluid.bilateral adnexal cysts are noted with the largest one in the left adnexa, measuring approximately 2 cm, also within normal limits.there is no free air.there are scattered mesenteric lymph nodes, but none of them are pathologically enlarged.the urinary bladder is noted with an indwelling foley catheter with excreted contrast pooling in the dependent position.there is no focal abnormality in the urinary bladder.

text: the urinary bladder is nondistended with a foley catheter in place.the uterus, adnexa, and rectum are within normal limits.there is evidenc of sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.there is no free fluid or free air identified in the pelvis.bone windows demonstrate bilateral nondisplaced fractures through the anterior/superior aspects of the acetabulum of the hip joints bilaterally.no other fractures or suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions were identified.

text: note is made of bilateral pleural effusions, right more than left with associated atelectasis.a left pneumothorax is noted which is reduced in size.an ng tube is in situ.below the diaphragm, the liver is visualized and a granuloma is identified in segment iii.a second granuloma is identified in the tip of the right lobe of the liver posteriorly.the intrahepatic bile ducts are prominent.some fluid is seen around the spleen.this was identified on the previous ct.however, the parenchymal injury is not seen on this study.this may be perhaps due to the patient's inability to raise her arms over the head and causing artifact over this area.the adrenals are normal.a cyst is seen in the upper pole of the left kidney, which measures 3.3 cm in maximum diameter.several other smaller subcentimeter low- attenuation lesions are seen in the kidneys that are too small to characterize.the pancreas is visualized and is normal.some free fluid is seen in the left paracolic gutter and to a lesser extent in the right paracolic gutter.the bowel where visualized is normal.calcification of the aorta is noted.some free fluid is seen extending down into the pelvis.
summary: slight increase in size in bilateral pleural effusions and atelectasis.perisplenic hematoma but no definite splenic injury identified.reduction in hematoma in extraperitoneal space in prevesical space anterior to the bladder extending along the sidewalls of the pelvis and into the presacral space.multiple fractures involving the left side of the pelvis, the ribs and the transverse processes of some of the thoracic spine.small left-sided pneumothorax.

text: there has been interval opening of the midline ventral surgical wound.a surgical drain is again noted in the pelvis, however, there has been interval resolution of the previously noted stool collection.there is minimal mesenteric fat stranding and edema, however, no drainable fluid collections are seen.the rectum is unchanged.no significant lymphadenopathy or free fluid is noted in the pelvis.bone windows reveal no significant lytic or sclerotic lesions, yet there is degenerative disk disease involving the thoracolumbar spine.also noted on the soft tissue windows are atrophic kidneys with two large fluid density cysts in the mid and lower pole of the right kidney, as before.
summary: interval improvement in the previously noted pelvic collection with no drainable residual fluid collection.atelectasis or pneumonia involving both lung bases, as described.findings suggestive of ileus, probably with some obstructive component at the level of the ileostomy as well.findings were discussed in person with the surgical team.

text: as noted above, there is a large amount of intraperitoneal free fluid.the bladder has a foley within it; it is compressed by the large amount of ascites.the anteriormost aspect of it has nondependent air.there is no lymphadenopathy or free air.vessels are heavily calcified.
summary: large amount of ascites.no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.bilateral small pleural effusions and associated compressive atelectasis.radiopaque cholelithiasis in shrunken and nodular liver.similar appearance of right adrenal adenoma.

text: the lung bases demonstrate a 3-4 mm ground-glass nodule in the left lower lobe (series 2, image 2), not previously seen.additionally, a focal nodular atelectasis and/or scar is seen at the right lung base, smaller in comparison to prior exam.no effusions.moderate sized hiatal hernia, similar to previous exam.normal heart size, without pericardial effusion.multiple hypodensities are seen dilated up to 4 mm, similar to previous study.coarse calcifications are noted in the distal body of the pancreas (series 300b, image 27) superimposed on the main pancreatic duct.the pancreatic duct appears increasing distended distal to this, raising question of a main pancreatic duct calculus.no acute inflammatory changes or new cystic lesions are seen.extrahepatic common duct is normal in caliber.stable bilateral adrenal nodules.the right adrenal nodule measures 1.3 cm, stable in size and remains indeterminate.the left adrenal nodule measures 1.3 cm and contains macroscopic fat, likely representing a myelolipoma.at the upper pole of the left kidney, a 4-mm macroscopic fat-containing lesion is seen, likely a small angiomyolipoma.at the posterior interpolar region of the left kidney, a simple cyst is present measuring 1.4 cm.at the lower pole of the right kidney, a partially decompressed cystic lesion is seen, smaller in comparison to prior exam.nonspecific bilateral perinephric
