seen.significant stool retained in the right colon, correlate for constipation.fat-containing periumbilical hernia with stranding, similar to previous exam.no acute collections.no free air or abnormal fluid collections are seen in the abdomen.
summary: previously drained pelvic collection has resolved.no residual fluid or collections in this region.a collection at the proximal right external iliac artery has decreased in size, now measuring 2.4 x 1.7 cm.no new collections or new complications are seen.stable cystic lesions of the pancreas, largest measuring 1.7 cm.main pancreatic ductal dilatation with possible ductal calculus as above.consider mrcp in 3 months to assess stability over time.stable bilateral adrenal nodules, indeterminate on the right.stable scattered hepatic cysts.moderate hiatal hernia.

text: again noted is moderate amount of fluid attenuation free intraperitoneal fluid in keeping with peritoneal dialysis.the peritoneal dialysis catheter enters through the left lower quadrant with its tip located in the presacral area.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenals are unremarkable.atrophic kidneys are again visualized.there is unchanged appearance of multiple small nonobstructing calculi bilaterally.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.no free air is seen.
summary: stable appearance of peritoneal ascites in keeping with peritoneal dialysis.there are no localized fluid collection.the low density fluid suggests the absence of hemorrhage.no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.multiple small nonobstructing calculi in kidneys bilaterally, unchanged in appearance.atrophic native kidneys.consistent with given history of end- stage renal disease.

text: the rectum and sigmoid appear unremarkable.small amount of air is seen within the bladder, likely secondary to foley catheterization.free fluid is seen within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: scattered areas of free air and fluid seen within the mesentery, consitent with perforation.questionable areas of pneumatosis suggesting ischemic versus inflammatory cause.dilated loops of small bowel, without definite evidence of decompressed distal bowel, which could represent early versus partial small-bowel obstruction.no definite transition point identified.areas of bowel narrowing suggesting stricture, consistent with history of crohns.pneumobilia again seen.dependent changes seen at the lung bases, with likely consolidation at the left base.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, intrapelvic loops of small and large bowel, uterus, adnexa, and distal ureters are unremarkable.the bladder contains a foley catheter.there is no free air or free fluid.again, there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.there is mild stranding overlying the left common femoral artery and vein.there are no focal fluid collections to suggest a hematoma.the right groin is unremarkable.there is no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence for retroperitoneal or intra-abdominal hemorrhage to explain the patient's dropping hematocrit.mild inflammatory stranding within the left groin likely secondary to recent vascular access device in this region.no frank fluid collection is identified.bilateral pleural effusions with bibasilar compressive atelectasis.

text: bladder wall is slightly thickened.prostate, seminal vesicles, bowel loops are normal.distal ureters are within normal limits, given lack of iv contrast.no free fluid or free air.no lymphadenopathy.
summary: mild airspace opacity in left lower lobe which may reflect an infective process in the correct clinical setting.slight stranding of the retroperitoneal fat, of uncertain and doubtful clinical significance.left renal cyst.thickened bladder wall which may reflect neurogenic bladder.please correlate clinically.

text: a foley catheter is noted within the lumen of a collapsed bladder.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without definite evidence of diverticulitis.dense pelvic fluid is noted to a mild degree anteriorly which is likely secondary to oral contrast mixed with ascites.total body anasarca.
summary: evidence of bowel leak at the small bowel anastomotic site in the anterior aspect of the mid abdomen just right of midline.there is a small amount of dense pelvic fluid likely secondary to oral contrast mixed with mild ascities.small fluid collection anterior to the liver which is presumed postoperative after liver transplant possibly representing a seroma.bilateral small pleural effusions with left lower lobe atelectasis/consolidation.three-vessel coronary artery calcifications and aortic valve calcifications of unknown hemodynamic significance.anasarca.sigmoid colon diverticulosis.findings relayed in person to dr.___ ___ (surgery) at the time the study was performed.

text: the rectum, prostate, bladder, and intrapelvic loops of bowel are within normal limits.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: normal appearance of post-transplant liver with no focal abnormalities identified.stable splenomegaly with splenorenal shunts.no evidence of metastatic disease within the torso.

text: bilateral moderate pleural effusions, right great than left.these are unchanged in size from previous.there is overlying atelectasis.no pulmonary nodules.the heart is enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.no coronary artery calcification.evaluation of the intra-abdominal viscera is limited by lack of iv contrast.allowing for this, there are multiple coarse calcifications within the liver and spleen consistent with a calcified granulomata.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic duct dilation.the spleen is normal in size.the pancreas and both adrenal glands appear normal.both kidneys are atrophied.there is persistent hydroureter bilaterally.mild hydronephrosis bilaterally.no renal stones.there is calcification of the intra-abdominal aorta.the intra-abdominal aorta demonstrates focal dilation measuring 2.9 cm which is unchanged from previous ct.allowing for the lack of oral contrast, the visualized stomach, small and large bowel are normal.persistent perihepatic fluid which is decreased in amount from previous.there is persistent mesenteric edema.multiple enlarged left paraaortic lymph nodes are again identified, the largest measuring 12 mm in diameter.these are unchanged from previous ct (2:27).
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.volume overload with anasarca, moderate bilateral pleural effusions, and mesenteric edema.bilateral inguinal hernias with a large right inguinal hernia.both inguinal hernias contain nonobstructed small bowel loops.moderate prostatic enlargement.stable focal aortic dilation to 2.9 cm.renal atrophy and persistent mild-to-moderate bilateral hydroureteronephrosis.osseous changes of renal osteodystrophy.

text: there is a large left anterior wall hematoma overlying the pelvis which measures 17.4 cm(transverse) x 9.2 cm (ap) x 13.1 cm (cc).this is stable in size since the previous study.there are multiple areas of high density within this hematoma, consistent with clot.however, there is no evidence of active extravasation and hounsfield units remain the same between the non-contrast, arterial and venous phases.there is a small left-sided pleural effusion, stable.again seen are ground-glass opacities in the right lower lobe and left lower lobe, unchanged.non-contrast appearance of the adrenal glands, kidneys, and intra-abdominal loops of bowel are within normal limits.there is splenomegaly and a small cirrhotic-appearing liver.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.small-to-moderate amount of free fluid is noted within the abdomen and pelvis.a foley catheter is noted within the decompressed bladder.air within the bladder is likely from recent instrumentation.there is diffuse anasarca within the visualized soft tissues.
summary: large left anterior wall hematoma, stable in size since ___.no evidence of active extravasation.2 stable left-sided pleural effusion.ground-glass opacities in the lung bases, unchanged, likely due to aspiration.diffuse anasarca.stable ascites.

text: the urinary bladder and rectum are unremarkable.the uterus and adnexuus are not definitely visualized.there is a solitary surgical clip in the low pelvis, as before.no free fluid or pelvic lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: residual, but smaller, fluid collection anterior to the left lobe of the liver at the site of prior surgery, with apparent retained surgical sutures, which do not appear significantly changed form the prior ct study (was suture material actually removed from this site, during the interval surgery?).focal hypodensity within the liver subjacent to the collection is unlikely to represent direct transcapsular extension into the liver, but may reflect retractor injury.diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.stable small pericardial effusion.rounded high attenuating lesions within the subcutaneous tissues of the lower anterior abdominal wall, which could reflect sites of subcutaneous injection, perhaps of anticoagulant.recommend close correlation with history.findings were entered into the ed dashboard at the time of interpretation.

text: there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or pelvic free fluid.the uterus and urinary bladder are normal.the patient is status post left intramedullary femur nail fixation.there is no acute pelvic fracture.there is partial right sided sacralization of the l5 vertebral body on the left side.there is moderate scoliotic change at the lumbar spine and moderate-to-severe degenerative changes with facet arthropathy at the lower lumbar spine.
summary: small right pneumothorax, right sixth through ninth rib fractures with worsening bilateral lung opacities, which may be due to contusions and/or aspiration, and small right pleural effusion.no acute ct findings in the abdomen or pelvis.mild aneurysmal dilatation/ectasia of the distal abdominal aorta measuring up to 2.9 cm and moderate-to-severe atherosclerotic disease.moderate degenerative changes at the lower lumbar spine.

text: the study is limited by lack of intravenous contrast as well as patient motion.given this no obvious lesions within the liver are identified.the gallbladder is peripherally calcified.the right adrenal gland is not definitely seen due to motion.the left adrenal gland appears unremarkable.no gross abnormalities of the spleen or pancreas is noted.the right kidney is malpositioned, partially calcified and atrophic.the left kidney appears unremarkable without evidence of hydronephrosis.contrast within the bowel is quite dense and creates artifact which limits evaluation however no dilated loop of small bowel is identified.there is a large amount of inspissated stool dilating the rectum.the remainder of the colon is relatively decompressed.no definite ascites is seen.a gastrostomy tube is seen entering the distal stomach anteriorly and terminating in the mid portion of the stomach, oriented cephalad.contrast is within the fundus of the stomach.an ivc filter is located at the l1 through the superior portion of l3 level.no aneurysmal dilation of the aorta is noted.there is a small amount of extraluminal air consistent with recent procedure.there is a moderate levoscoliosis involving the lumbar spine centered at approximately l3.there is degenerative changes in the spine involving multiple facets and involving the upper thoracic spine particularly.
summary: gastrostomy tube within the body of the stomach, which is not in an intrathoracic position.bilateral lower lobe airspace opacity most suggestive of aspiration although pneumonia cannot be excluded.porcelain gallbladder.this is a risk factor for gallbladder carcinoma.shriveled, malpositioned, calcified, and scarred right kidney consistent with chronic process.stool-filled distended rectum without evidence of proximal bowel dilation.

text: the urinary bladder, prostate, and rectum are unremarkable in appearance.no free fluid seen.no pelvic lymphadenopathy is seen.bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernia is noted.
summary: dilated small bowel, most likely due to postoperative ileus; however, the collapsed distal loops of ileum are atypical, this could alternatively represent an early small-bowel obstruction and clinical correlation is advised.bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias.exophytic cyst in the upper pole of the left kidney.small low-attenuation lesion, too small to characterize in the mid pole of the left kidney.calcification of the aorta is noted without aneurysmal dilatation.

text: in the visualized lung bases, there are small-to-moderate bilateral pleural effusions, slightly decreased on the right, but slightly increased on the left.there are bibasilar atelectasis.small hazy opacities in the left lung are non-specific but likely atelectatic in etiology.attention should be paid in followup study.the heart is normal in size.baseline anemia is evidenct as blood appears hypodense to the adjacent myocardium.the absence of iv contrast significantly limits evaluation of intra-abdominal parenchymal organs.allowing for the limitations, the liver is grossly normal.again noted is marked splenomegaly, measuring up to 23.3 cm craniocaudally.small rounded hypodensity in the inferior splenic tip measures 13 mm in diameter (image 2:48), grossly unchanged from prior.the gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, and right kidney are normal.the enlarged spleen has mass effect on the adjacent left kidney, resulting a medial displacement of the left kidney, but there is no acute gross abnormality.a 7-mm hypodense area within the left kidney is incompletely assessed and too small to characterize (image 2:37).the stomach, duodenum and loops of small bowel are grossly unremarkable.oral contrast freely traverses to the distal small bowel.small perihepatic and perisplenic fluid is noted.there is no free air or definite lymphadenopathy.
summary: moderate colonic wall thickening at splenic flexure, compatible with colitis.differential diagnosis consideration includes infection and inflammation.ischemia is not excluded.no intra-abdominal fluid collection to suggest abscess.mild-to-moderate amount of ascites, unchanged.diffusely sclerotic bones, compatible with the known myelodysplastic syndrome.persistent marked splenomegaly.persistent mild-to-moderate bilateral pleural effusion, decreased on the right and increased on the left.

text: the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach and bowel loops are unremarkable.a nasogastric tube is identified within the stomach.there is no free air or free fluid.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: 2-cm spiculated focus in the right lung base which most likely represents a pulmonary contusion.followup is suggested to exclude an underlying lesion.left lower lobe atelectasis.extravasation of approximately 12 cc of contrast into the right forearm.no fractures or intra-abdominal injuries identified.

text: ivc filter is identified just below the level of the kidneys.there appears to be an aortic tube graft, just superior to the bifurcation.the left adrenal gland is mildly full, however measures less than 5 ___, and likely represents an adenoma.the remaining intrapelvic bowel is unremarkable.there is diffuse calcification of the prostate.seminal vesicles are unremarkable.no enlarged adenopathy within the pelvis.no free fluid in the pelvis.
summary: no evidence of metastatic disease within the chest, abdomen, or pelvis.emphysema, with diffuse ground-glass opacity and mild septal thickening possibly consistent with mild congestive heart failure.clinical correlation is recommended.much less likely would be lymphangitic spread of cancer.cholelithiasis.mild prominence of the descending aorta, measuring approximately 4 cm in diameter.extensive arterial calcification.multiple nonobstructing stones in the left kidney.right kidney is not visualized; it is unclear whether this is due to prior resection or congenital absence.ivc filter.probable left adrenal adenoma, measuring -2 hounsfield units.

text: there are moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions with associated dependent atelectasis.there is a 1 cm low density lesion within the anterior aspect of the liver which is too small to definitively characterize.no other focal liver lesions are seen.within the limits of this unenhanced scan, the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is dense splenic artery calcification.vicarious contrast excretion is noted within the gallbladder.the kidneys are hyperdense bilaterally.the bowel is not well assessed without oral contrast material.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.there is no free abdominal fluid or free air.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.small hematoma in the right groin.moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions.hyperdense kidneys on this unenhanced exam.

text: there is a stable, small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.the rectum, visualized loops of bowel, uterus, adnexal regions, and urinary bladder are unremarkable.lung windows show persistent hazy ground-glass opacities within the imaged portions of both lung bases.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: interval decrease in the size of a left upper quadrant fluid collection, as discussed above, with interval insertion of a pigtail catheter.stable small pleural effusions with persistent ground-glass opacities seen within the imaged portions of both lung bases.the above findings, and the possibility of re-imaging the left upper quadrant collection, were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 14:15 on ___.

text: the scout films show pacemaker leads in the right atrium and ventricle, and sternal wires.there is a nasogastric tube whose tip lies in the stomach.the previously noted left lower lobe opacity, possibly a small consolidation or atelectasis, is slightly more prominent.there are also atelectatic changes at the right base.the calcified region of pleura at the right base is unchanged.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the right kidney is atrophic with an unchanged 3.2-cm diameter renal cyst.the stomach, small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is a similar appearance to the infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm with mural calcifications measuring 3.3 x 4.6 cm in axial dimensions.there is no evidence of hematoma surrounding the aorta.however, since the prior study, there is new evidence of bilateral hematomas involving both psoas muscles, with a heterogeneous attenuation, including areas of hyperdensity suggesting acute blood in the left psoas.there are in fact multiple new pockets of hematoma with fluid-fluid levels, notably anteriorly and laterally to the right psoas muscle.the largest collection, anterior to the right psoas, measures 4.9 x 8.1 cm in diameter.a smaller collection is adjacent and in continuity with the left psoas, which is greatly expanded.there is overlying stranding bilaterally as well, especially on the left.a small rectus sheath hematoma is also seen.
summary: large new bilateral retroperitoneal hematomas since the prior study, also a small anterior rectus sheath hematoma.given the bilaterality, and lack of evidence of hematoma surrounding the aortic aneurysm, the appearance is most consistent with spontaneous retroperitoneal hemorrhages.the findings were discussed with several members of the team caring for mr.___ on ___.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, prostate, and bladder appear unremarkable.free fluid from the abdomen extends into the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymph nodes are identified.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: multiple bilateral pulmonary masses likely represent patient's known lymphoma, however priors are not available to evaluate disease progression.evidence of patient's known cirrhosis with splenomegaly, varices, and moderate to large intra-abdominal ascites.multiple scattered mesenteric lymph nodes measuring up to 13 mm in short axis diameter, of unknown chronicity without comparison to priors.attention to these should be paid on followup imaging.

text: there is a small fat-containing right inguinal hernia with a small amount of fluid tracking into it.there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis, unchanged from the previous exam.
summary: persistent, focal pulmonary opacities involving the left lower lobe.slight interval improvement of mild cecal wall thickening.stable appearance of segmental biliary dilatation involving the posterior right lobe of the liver with persistent periportal edema and perihepatic fluid.

text: there is small bilateral effusion (right greater than left) with associated subsegmental atelectasis.there is no pneumothorax.the liver is unremarkable with no attenuation lesions.there are calcific densities within the spleen probably represent the old granulomatous disease.the spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys and pancreas are otherwise unremarkable.there is vascular calcification throughout the aorta consistent with atherosclerotic disease.the small and large bowel are grossly unremarkable.there is suboptimal opacification with oral contrast.there is a large amount of fluid attenuation within the anterior aspect of the peritoneum.this is fluid attenuation with no increased attenuation to suggest hemorrhage or proteinaceous material.there is no air within it to suggest abscess.there is increase attenuation in the omental fat with an associated nodular density.this may represent lymph nodes or a mass with omental caking (2b/015).
summary: there is a large predominatly anterior intraabdominal fluid collection with no surrounding inflammation or air to suggest abscess.there is increased attenutaion withn the omentum with a nodular density, which worrisome for omental caking and ovarian pathology.there is also subcutaneous edema within the anterior abdominal soft tissues with no focal fluid collections.significant vascular calcification throughout the aorta consistent with advanced atherosclerotic disease.

text: small bibasilar pleural thickening/small effusions are identified.there is a small amount of atelectasis at the lung bases.trace pericardial effusion is demonstrated.liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and visualized bowel loops are all within normal limits.a nephroureteral stent is identified within the left collecting system extending from the upper pole calix to the bladder.air is identified within the left collecting system, and there appears to be probable mild hydronephrosis, however, the extent of hydronephrosis cannot be fully evaluated on this non- contrast examination.a left extrarenal pelvis is identified.the proximal and mid portions of the left ureter are dilated and distended with gas, and an apparent caliber change is identified within the distal ureter (series 2, image 60) because of an obstructing 8- mm calculus.there is periureteral stranding demonstrated proximal to this point of obstruction in the ureter.no other renal or ureteral calculi are demonstrated.there is mild bilateral perinephric stranding, left greater than right.no focal fluid collections to suggest an abscess are present.bilateral simple cysts are also seen within both kidneys.the right kidney does not demonstrate any hydronephrosis.visualized bowel loops are within normal limits.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber but demonstrates a somewhat tortuous course.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen.there is no free fluid within the abdomen.
summary: 8-mm obstructing calculus within the left distal ureter causing mild- moderate ureteral dilatation and probable mild hydronephrosis.extent of hydronephrosis cannot be well characterized on this non- contrast study.air within the left collecting system and ureter is consistent with recent instrumentation.nephroureteral stent in place.no evidence for renal abscess.multiple simple bilateral renal cysts.dfddp

text: a small roughly 3.7 x 2.1 cm extraluminal collection is again identified in the left hemipelvis containing several small foci of air as well as thickening of the sigmoid mesocolon.a _____ extensive sigmoid diverticulosis is again noted.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.the rectum, distal ureters, urinary bladder are normal in appearance.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: findings again consistent with sigmoid diverticulitis with unchanged focal collection in the left hemipelvis containing small foci of air.interval resolution of free fluid adjacent to the liver.findings consistent with cirrhosis.

text: the distal ureters, urinary bladder, prostate gland, seminal vesicles, rectum and sigmoid colon are all within normal limits.there is no free fluid in the deep pelvis.there are a few small inguinal lymph nodes, the largest of which is located in the left inguinal region and measures approximately 11 mm in short axis dimension.
summary: calcified pleural plaques consistent with prior asbestos exposure.no evidence of ascites, intra-abdominal masses or bowel dilatation to explain the patient's increasing abdominal girth.

text: there is a port-a-cath in the right anterior chest wall with its tip terminating at the svc/right atrial junction.the visualized thyroid gland appears within normal limits.there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the great vessels appear within normal limits.the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber.the cardiac ___ appear within normal limits.no central filling defects are seen in the pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary thromboembolism.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the lungs are clear without evidence of nodules or masses.the patient is status post left mastectomy.there is a region of fluid attenuation along the medial aspect of the left anterior chest wall (series 3, image 19), measuring about 3.2 x 1.5 cm in size, which likely represents a postoperative seroma.surgical staples are also seen along the left anterior chest wall.again noted is very heterogeneously dense-appearing right breast tissue, unchanged since previous studies.
summary: innumerable enhancing nodular densities within the liver, highly concerning of metastatic tumor.evidence of peritoneal carcinomatosis, new since pet-ct of ___.interval small pelvic ascites.worsening osseous metastatic disease since previous pet-ct with morphologic changes from osteoblastic/osteosclerotic changes to osteolysis.

text: the heart is enlarged and cardiac pacing wires are partially imaged.the lung bases demonstrate moderate emphysematous changes bilaterally.there is no evidence of pericardial or pleural effusion.non- contrast evaluation of intra-abdominal organs is limited; however, a 16 mm central intrahepatic hypodense lesion is not significantly changed compared to ___ and likely represents a cyst.the gallbladder demonstrates sludge and stones within, also unchanged.the spleen, adrenal glands, and pancreas are unremarkable.non- contrast evaluation of the kidneys demonstrates an exophytic cyst projecting from the interpolar region measuring approximately 49 x 42 mm.a more solid appearing rounded lesion projecting from the upper pole of the right kidney could not be characterized as a simple cyst on prior ultrasound; however it appears unchanged in size dating back to ___.the same can be said for a smaller similar appearing lesion projecting exophytically from the midpole of the right kidney near the previosuly mentioned cyst.non- contrast evaluation of the left kidney is unremarkable.there is a moderate amount of intra-abdominal ascites.there is a suggestion of wall thickening involving the gastric pylorus which could represent underlying peptic ulcer disease.limited evaluation of the small and large bowel are unremarkable.no free air, pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified.atherosclerotic mural calcification of the abdominal aorta is noted though it is of normal caliber throughout.a small ventral umbilical hernia containing fat is identified.
summary: suggestion of circumferential wall thickening of the gastric antrum which may represent underlying peptic ulcer disease.this could be further evaluated with egd.no definite small or large bowel pathology is identified.cystic lesions with the right kidney, one of which appears to represent a simple cyst; however, other lesions cannot be fully characterized, though they are stable when compared to ___.cholelithiasis and gallbladder sludge.moderate ascites.

text: again demonstrated is a markedly distended sigmoid colon measuring approximately 10 cm in diameter which appears slightly smaller in caliber.there are air- filled loops of colon with borderline distention, however, with no transition point identified.oral contrast is seen extending into the splenic flexure of the colon.the rectum is filled with air and stool.the urinary bladder is catheterized.detailed evaluation of the pelvis is limited secondary to left hip prosthesis artifact.
summary: distended loop of sigmoid colon with no transition point is again identified.there is no evidence of obstruction.diagnostic considerations include ileus or early small bowel obstruction.there is no evidence of perforation.bilateral lower lobe dense consolidations.given bilateral appearance and volume loss, atelectasis is favored.other considerations include aspiration or pneumonia.hypodensities within the kidneys are not completely characterized with this non-contrast enhanced-study.central venous catheter tip extending into intrahepatic inferior vena cava.standard positioning of central venous catheter is within the superior vena cava.

text: a collection is seen in the left upper abdomen with air fluid level within it.it lies lateral to the stomach and occupies the splenic bed.a drain is seen in the dependent part of this collection.a small pleural effusion is noted on the left.the liver and kidneys are unremarkable.the area lateral to the remenant of the pancreas is indistinctively seen.
summary: exchange of a drain to a larger 16 g.drain was performed under ct guidance.no complications occurred.

text: urinary bladder and rectum are unremarkable.
summary: dilated loops of small bowel, with two transition points identified that are in very close proximity to each other.an abnormal, edematous loop of small bowel between the two transition points are seen, concerning for a closed loop small bowel obstruction.large intrathoracic stomach.cholelithiasis.findings were discussed with dr.___ immediately at the time of interpretation.

text: streak artifact from the left total hip replacement limits detail in the pelvis.no abnormalities of the bladder, seminal vesicles or rectum are seen.the prostate is not well assessed.there is sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.there is no free fluid in the pelvis, and no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: no short interval change in the appearance of the torso compared to ___.the exophytic left renal mass, appearance of the spine, left proximal femur, pulmonary nodules, small left pleural effusion, hepatic lesion and mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation are not significantly changed.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions of low density with patchy lower lobe opacities compatible with atelectasis.the heart is moderately enlarged.vascular calcifications are widespread among the coronary arteries.the aorta is calcified.there is a pacemaker/icd device in place.the density of the liver is somewhat elevated at 80 hounsfield units.a large stone is present within the gallbladder, measuring 19 mm in diameter.the pancreas and spleen appear within normal limits.slight thickening of the adrenal glands is stable without definite discrete nodules.the right kidney is markedly atrophic with a large calculus in the central right renal collecting system measuring 19 mm in diameter, similar to prior findings.there is also a small non-obstructing stone in the right lower pole, which measures 4 mm.in the mid to upper pole of the left kidney, a low density lesion is not completely characterized, but appears unchanged and suggests a cyst.a small hyperdense focus located centrally in the left kidney measures 7 mm in diameter is too small to characterize but suggests a hyperdense cyst.an additional small hyperdense focus in the left upper pole of 6 mm suggests an additional hyperdense cyst or perhaps developing calcification.the wall of the gastric antrum is mildly thickened, which can probably be attributed to underdistension although an inflammatory process is not excluded.the small bowel appears within normal limits.the stomach, small and large bowel are otherwise unremarkable.the appendix is not clearly demonstrated, but there is no evidence for appendicitis.
summary: no definite evidence of acute disease.cholelithiasis.similar large stone in the central right renal collecting system with marked asymmetric renal atrophy.mild apparent thickening of the gastric antrum, commonly due to underdistension, but sequelae of fluid overload or potentially an inflammatory process could be considered.right adnexal mass versus fibroid for which ultrasound evaluation is recommended when clinically appropriate.malignancy cannot be excluded by this study, but in addition to a fibroid or ovarian mass, a uterine anomaly could be considered.high liver density which can be seen with iron overload states or amiodarone administration.

text: extensive diverticular disease involving the sigmoid colon with marked wall thickening and luminal narrowing is noted.there is pericolonic stranding consistent and thickeing of the sigmoid mesocolon compatible with diverticulitis.this is complicated by a linear intramural area of hypoattenuation measuring 3.2 x 0.6 cm with enhancing rim consistent with an intramural abscess.rectum is distended with fecal content.the patient appears to be status post hysterectomy with small amount of air in the vaginal cuff.urinary bladder is unremarkable.there is a small area of low attenuation with suggestion of ring enhancement in the left perineal region measuring approximately 1.3 x 1.2 cm, and this could represent a bartholin gland cyst or could be a focal localized infection, for which correlation with clinical features is recommended.if further imaging is necessary, pelvic mri should be considered.
summary: acute sigmoid diverticulitis, complicated by a sigmoid intramural abscess.follow up imaging or colonscopy is recommended to exclude underlying mass lesion.multiple pancreatic low-attenuation lesions, the largest in the tail, likely representing side branch ipmn or sequela of prior pancreatitis.calcifications suggesting chronic pancreatitis is identified.one intraluminal calcification is seen in the proximal pancreatic duct causing obstruction with upstream duct dilatation.these findings should be correlated with mrcp.sub-centimeter hyperattenuating focus in the gallbladder, possibly a polyp.small hypoattenuating focus in the left perineal region could reflect a bartholin cyst or focal infection.clinical correlation is recommended, and if further imaging is desired, pelvic mr can be performed.

text: the lung bases are clear.the kidneys, pancreas, and gallbladder are normal in appearance.again noted is a wedge-shaped area of low density peripherally within the spleen, which is consistent with the patient's known splenic infarct.the spleen is stably enlarged measuring 20 cm.there is a trace amount of associated stranding noted around the inferior edge of the spleen, which has not significantly changed when compared to the prior study.several prominent periportal lymph nodes are identified but not enlarged by size criteria.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.the adrenal glands are unremarkable in appearance.there is no free fluid or free air within the abdomen.incidentally noted is a low-density lesion exophytically of the interpolar region of the right kidney, which is stable in appearance and most likely represents a tiny cyst, although of indeterminate nature.there is mild atherosclerotic disease of the descending aorta.

text: there is a small amount of ascites within the cul-de-sac as well as about the right lobe of the liver.arcuate calcifications about the uterus are striking and there is air within the endometrium, as seen previously.since the finding is stable it is probably of doubtful clinical significance and suggests patency of the cervical canal.the partly full bladder is unremarkable.there is diastasis rectus, inflammatory fat stranding and ill-defined fluid throughout a large lower anterior pannus.the appearance includes a small round nodule along the left side of the pannus measuring 13 mm in diameter (2:88).centered in the interface between the superficial and deep subcutaneous tissues posterior to the right iliac crest is a lesion of intermediate density measuring up to 49 x 79 mm in axial dimensions (2:55) which extends toward the right s3-s4 and s4-s5 neural foramina.it has increased somewhat in size.
summary: findings suggesting panniculitis, noting ill-defined fluid and soft tissue stranding associated with a large pannus including slight skin thickening; correlation with physical examination is recommended.bilateral pleural effusions and ascites.widespread vascular calcifications.persistent hypodense lesion residing in the posterior subcutaneous fat to the right midline, increased in size with a new adjacent calcification.possibly this represents a hyperdense fluid collection.however, it does not appear entirely established that this is a fluid collection and differential considerations may include a solid mass such as a neurogenic tumor in the appropriate setting.if clinically indicated evaluation with mr could be considered for a thorough assessment although since the lesion is superficial, ultrasound may of potential value in assessing for a solid versus cystic lesion.mild splenomegaly.

text: the rectum and bladder are unremarkable.no pelvic free fluid, pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is present.there is mild sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: massive hepatosplenomegaly with the spleen causing mass effect on the left kidney.sludge within the gallbladder with mild gallbladder wall edema is nonspecific given patient's hepatic disease.

text: ct abdomen w&w/o contrast: the lung base on the right is clear.the left demonstrates small posterior atelectasis.the liver with iv contrast demonstrates a lateral low attenuation defect extending superiorly.this is likely consistent with focal injury.there is adjacent high attenuation fluid in a lenticular fashion suggestive of hematoma likely extracapsular but position and shape could be subcapsular.there is also perihepatic fluid collection extending inferiorly.a larger collection is immediately visible below the right lobe of the liver.this subhepatic fluid collection measures 3.6 x 7.5 cm and is possible contiguous with the perihepatic fluid collection.this likely represents hematoma.the biliary drainage and ducts appear normal.the pancreas enhances uniformly.given position of the common bile duct and pancreatic duct there is suggestion of pancreatic divisum.the spleen is not enlarged.the stomach, small bowel and large bowel show no dilatation or wall thickening.there are no adrenal masses.both kidneys are symmetric without masses.there is no stone or hydronephrosis.there is no retroperitoneal lymph node enlargement.
summary: lateral liver defect low attenuation likely consistent with liver injury.perihepatic fluid collection likely consistent with hematoma.subhepatic fluid collection.possible pancreatic divisum.fibroids.posterior pelvic high density fluid likely consistent with organizing hematoma.

text: there is dependent atelectasis at the bilateral lung bases, with pleural thickening noted medially in the right lower lung.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.within limits of a non-contrast study, the liver appears normal in appearance.there are no focal liver lesions identified.there is no evidence for intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is unremarkable with no cholelithiasis.the spleen is unremarkable.there is fatty replacement of the pancreas.there is slight nodularity of the medial limb of the right adrenal gland.the left adrenal gland is unremarkable.kidneys demonstrate no contour-altering masses, no nephrolithiasis, and no hydronephrosis.there is a prominent extrarenal pelvis noted on the left.stomach is again somewhat distended and fluid-filled, similar in appearance to prior study dated ___.intra-abdominal loops of small bowel are unremarkable, with no bowel distention or bowel wall thickening identified.new since prior study is diffuse colonic dilitation.there is no associated wall thickening or adjacent inflammation.a moderate amount of fecal material is noted in the sigmoid, but there is no evidence of mechanical obstruction.in the right lower quadrant, the appendix is again prominent and appears fluid-filled, with maximal dimension of up to 11 mm.however, there is air filling of the appendix at its base (2:66 and 300b:35), and previously noted peri-appendiceal inflammatory change is now absent.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber, with mild atherosclerotic calcification.vessel patency is not assessed without intravenous contrast.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal nodes are not pathologically enlarged by ct size criteria.
summary: new pronounced colonic dilatation, without wall thickening.there is no evidence for mechanical obstruction, although there is some stool noted in the sigmoid colon.while this is a nonspecific finding that could represent colonic ileus, colonic ischemia cannot be excluded.clinical and laboratory correlation and surgical consultation are recommended.prominent appendix again noted, though now with decreased surrounding inflammation compared to prior study.thick-walled bladder, decompressed by a foley catheter, with enlarged prostate, in keeping with finding of recent ct cystogram.these findings were communicated to dr.___ ___ at 1720 hours on ___, by dr.___ ___.

text: again noted is bibasilar discoid atelectasis and a trace left pleural effusion.there is a stable 7-mm low-density lesion within the hepatic dome which is too small to characterize and unchanged from the prior study.also noted is a calcified granuloma within the dome of the liver.there is no intrahepatic biliary dilatation or hepatic masses identified.the liver contour is nodular in appearance, consistent with the patient's history of cirrhosis.the spleen is again noted to be mildly enlarged measuring 13.6 cm in craniocaudal dimension.the pancreas and adrenal glands are normal in appearance.several low-density lesions are noted within the left kidney, which are unchanged compared to the prior study but are too small to characterize and likely represent tiny cysts.the gallbladder is again noted to be distended.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are noted to be prominent, but unchanged.there is a moderate amount of intra-abdominal ascites, which has slightly decreased compared to the prior study.there is a suggestion of colonic wall edema likely secondary associated third-spacing.also noted has been marked interval increase in subcutaneous and full body subcutaneous edema.visualized arterial and venous systems are patent.
summary: marked interval increase in diffuse subcutaneous edema and slight interval decrease in moderate ascites.no organized fluid collection identified to suggest abscess.nodular liver and enlarged spleen consistent with cirrhosis and portal hypertension.diffuse colonic wall thickening likely reflecting third spacing.bibasilar airspace disease, likely atelectasis, and a tiny left pleural effusion.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear, without consolidation or effusion.there is a mitral valve prosthesis is noted.evaluation of the solid intra-abdominal organs is limited by the lack of intravenous contrast.within this limitation, the liver is unremarkable, without focal lesions, and without biliary ductal dilation.gallbladder is similarly normal in appearance, but there is a small amount of hyperdense material seen layering dependently, compatible with sludge versus small stones.there is no wall thickening or adjacent fat stranding to suggest cholecystitis.the spleen is normal in size and appearance.there is no pancreatic mass or pancreatic ductal dilation.the adrenal glands are normal.there is nonspecific perinephric stranding bilaterally, without hydronephrosis or contour-altering renal mass lesion.there is no nephrolithiasis.the stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of small bowel are normal in caliber and configuration.there is no bowel distention or bowel wall thickening.the colon is similarly unremarkable, without evidence of colitis.a rectosigmoid anastomosis is noted in the pelvis.there is a ventral hernia, containing fat and multiple loops of bowel.there is no evidence for complication, including no evidence for obstruction or strangulation.there is no fluid identified within the hernia sac.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.the aorta is normal in caliber, with mild atherosclerosis.
summary: no radiographic explanation for the patient's symptoms.specifically, there is no evidence for colitis or diverticulitis, as questioned.uncomplicated ventral hernias are redemonstrated.minimal sludge is seen within the gallbladder, without evidence of cholecystitis.

text: a transplant kidney within the right lower quadrant of the abdomen demonstrates uniform enhancement.the uterus, adnexae, and rectum are normal in appearance.the urinary bladder is not opacified.there is sigmoid diverticulosis with no fat stranding or wall thickening to suggest diverticulitis.there is a trace amount of free fluid within the pelvis that is unchanged when compared to prior exams.there is evidence of cystic change within the superior aspect of the left hip is unchanged when compared to ___ and could represent subchondral cysts.
summary: moderate right sided pleural effusion that is improved when compared to the prior examination.atelectasis within both lungs has also improved.hepatomegaly with no evidence of hepatic mass or biliary ductal.stable trace pericholecystic fluid, free fluid within the pelvis and sigmoid diverticulosis with no fat stranding or wall thickening to suggest diverticulitis.resolution of gas within the transplant kidney that was described on the prior study.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.there is a wedge shaped area of nonenhancement and hypoattenuation within the periphery of segment 2 of the liver.there remains a rim of normally enhancing hepatic tissue.this finding is consistent with a focal hepatic infarction.there is no biliary dilatation.the gallbladder, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.several small cysts are seen within the cysts.there are multiple areas of hypoattenuation within the spleen consistent with splenic infarct.the pancreas enhances homogenously.there are no peripancreatic fluid collections.the mesenteric vessels are patent and there are no arterial pseudoaneurysms.there is no free air, ascites, or enlarged mesenteric/retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no ct evidence of pancreatitis.please note that clinically mild cases of pancreatitis may have no ct findings.no free air or fluid within the abdomen.no evidence of bowel inflammation.evidence of focal infarction within the periphery of the liver and spleen.does this patient have a history of embolic disease?

text: there are no renal calculi or ureteral calculi.there is no hydronephrosis.central venous catheter tip terminates at the superior cavoatrial junction.the heart is borderline enlarged.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.mild bronchiectasis and linear stranding at bilateral bases is similar to the prior examination, if not slightly improved.non-contrast technique limits evaluation of the solid abdominal viscera.the collapsed gallbladder, liver, spleen, adrenal glands and pancreas are grossly unremarkable.there is no upper abdominal, mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.aortocaval lymph node measuring 6 mm is noted along with smaller retroperitoneal lymph nodes.just inferior to the aortic bifurcation, there is a new area of fat stranding with a 5-mm lymph node.ill-defined margins makes this area difficult to measure, however, area measures approximately 4.5 x 2.6 cm in transverse and craniocaudal dimensions respectively.loops of small and large bowel are grossly unremarkable.the appendix is within normal limits.multiple pills are present within the cecum and descending colon.there is a small 1.9 x 2.5 cm paraumbilical hernia with mesenteric fat.there is asymmetric subcutaneous fat stranding along the left flank (2:53).this may relate to positional anasarca.there is significant muscle atrophy given the patient's age.
summary: no renal or ureteral calculi or hydronephrosis.no acute vertebral compression deformity.stable multilevel compression deformities.new ill-defined fat stranding in the retroperitoneum, just inferior to the aortic bifurcation with a probable 5 mm associated lymph node.lymphatic involvement of known cll is considered.

text: there is a large left-sided hematoma measuring 11.4 x 7.6 cm in the lower left pelvic region adjacent to the left pubis bone fractures.this hematoma appears slightly larger when compared to the prior study from ___.there are multiple fractures within the left pelvis with a large comminuted fracture of the left iliac bone, fractures of the superior and inferior pubic rami on the left, as well as several rib fractures on the left.there is evidence of a retroperitoneal hematoma in the iliopsoas region on the left adjacent to the large comminuted left iliac bone fracture which appears stable in size.there is no evidence of free air or free fluid within the abdomen or pelvis.the urinary bladder is displaced to the right by the large hematoma in the left pelvic region.the urinary bladder is nondistended and there is a foley catheter in position.there is evidence of air within the urinary bladder.the rectum is unremarkable.there is no evidence of free fluid within the pelvis.

text: no retroperitoneal or intraperitoneal hematoma.urinary bladder appears normal.the prostate is enlarged, invaginating into the bladder base.the seminal vesicles appear normal.there is extensive diverticulosis of the colon, without evidence of acute diverticulitis.mild stranding is seen within the right groin near the common femoral artery, without hematoma identified.note is made of an open left inguinal ring, which contains fat.

text: there is a moderate right pleural effusion with associated relaxation atelectasis.there is a small left pleural effusion.mild coronary atherosclerosis is noted.the heart size is top normal.the liver is shrunken with a nodular border, consistent with history of cirrhosis.areas of hypodensity noted within the liver are less apparent than on 10/___.marked splenomegaly is noted measuring 15 cm, unchanged since ___/___.the pancreas, kidneys, adrenal glands, stomach are unremarkable.several small gallstones are noted in the gallbladder neck, unchanged since ___/___.numerous collaterals within the peritoneal cavity are unchanged since ___/___.there is wall thickening and pericolic stranding, especially prominent in the cecum and ascending colon, consistent with focal colitis.given the amount of ascites and third spacing, assesment of the stranding in the pericolic fat planes is difficult.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions.there is extensive ground-glass opacity in the dependent lungs bilaterally, with patchy areas of consolidation.the liver, spleen, adrenals, pancreas, gallbladder, large and small bowel have a normal non-contrast ct appearance.there is no ct evidence of pancreatitis.there is no free fluid within the abdomen and there is no pseudocyst.the left kidney contains a tiny non-obstructing renal stone in the upper pole, and there are punctate high-density foci within the left kidney lower pole, which may represent developing stones.the right kidney is normal.the osseous structures are unremarkable.

text: there are multiple tiny pulmonary nodules at the visualized lung bases, many of which were not seen on the prior abdominal ct examinations which only included lung bases.coronary artery atherosclerotic calcifications are incompletely imaged.evaluation of the solid abdominal organs is somewhat limited without contrast.renal cysts on the prior studies are not well seen.no significant abnormality is detected of the spleen, adrenal glands or pancreas.a drainage tube enters from the left mid abdomen and terminates in the central abdomen.there has been free passage of oral contrast through small and large bowel to the rectum.there are numerous colonic diverticula but no evidence of acute diverticulitis.there is an open wound along the midline ventral incision with multiple small locules of gas underlying the ventral wound (2:71, 68).a thin tract of gas crosses the peritoneal lining adjacent to transverse colon (2:64-66) concerning for colocutaneous fistula.there is no drainable fluid collection at this site.a small locule of subcutaneous gas along the lower right anterior abdominal wall is probably related to injection of medications (2:54).

text: the right lung base is clear.again noted is a bochdalek hernia on the left containing stomach and the tail of the pancreas.characterization of liver lesions is impossible without iv contrast; a 5-mm hypodensity is present in the right lobe.within the limitations of a noncontrast examination, the pancreas, gallbladder, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.there is nonspecific stranding around the kidneys bilaterally, which is new since the prior study.there are two dense calcifications in the spleen, which are unchanged, probably representing granulomas.within the limitations of a noncontrast study, the stomach, large and small bowel are unremarkable.there is extensive sigmoid diverticulosis.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes are present, and there is evidence of progressive adenopathy, with a new 12-mm node medially to the right of the aorta near the renal hilum.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.there is no free air, and although ascites is not seen, there is diffuse stranding.

text: no focal consolidations, nodules, or pleural effusions are seen within the visualized lung bases.again seen is an approximately 5.4 x 6.4 cm rounded structure arising from the left mediastinum, possibly representing a duplication cyst, not significantly changed in appearance from chest ct performed ___.several punctate calcifications are seen within the liver most likely representing calcified granulomas.small hypodensity again seen at dome of liver, unchanged from prior.otherwise, the liver appears unremarkable.there is evidence of sludge and possibly tiny stones within the gallbladder.however, the gallbladder does not appear distended and there is no evidence of pericholecystic fluid.pancreas appears unremarkable.punctate calcifications are seen within the spleen, also likely representing calcified granulomas.adrenal glands appear unremarkable.several rounded hypodense areas are seen within the right kidney most likely representing a simple cyst.the left kidney appears relatively enlarged compared to the right kidney.there is also evidence of perinephric stranding and hydronephrosis.the left ureter appears dilated to the level of the aortic bifurcation.no definite stone or obstructing mass is identified.small and large bowel appear unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric lymph nodes are identified.there is no evidence of free air or free fluid within the abdomen.atherosclerotic disease is seen within the aorta.again seen is relatively fusiform aneurysmal dilatation of the abdominal aorta, measuring approximately 4.7 cm in largest diameter at the t12-l1 level.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs is limited without intravenous contrast.the unenhanced liver, spleen, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.gallstones are seen within the gallbladder.there is no hydronephrosis.the patient is status post total colectomy with an ileoanal pouch.the proximal small bowel loops are dilated to 4.0 cm.distal to the ileo-ileal anastomotic site in the mid pelvis (2:66), the small bowel loops are of normal caliber.oral contrast reaches the ileoanal anastomosis.no extraluminal oral contrast is seen.subcutaneous air and pneumoperitoneum are due to recent surgery.a moderate to large amount of simple ascites is new from mri ___.the ivc filter and left iliac venous stent are in place.the aorta is of normal calibur throughout.evaluation of mesenteric lymph nodes is limited due to ascites, but no definite lymphadenopathy is identified.
