text: the distal ureters, urinary bladder, seminal vesicles and prostate are unremarkable.the intrapelvic bowel loops are unremarkable.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: postsurgical changes.no intra-abdominal or pelvic abscesses identified.there are small bilateral pleural effusions with bibasilar atelectasis.

text: small bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent relaxation atelectasis are mildlely larger.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable.the aorta is normal in caliber.the celiac, sma, ___ are patent as is the portal, splenic and superior mesenteric vein innumerable enlarged lymph nodes present throughout the mesentery are enlarged.the patient has had oral contrast administered via his ng tube and is status post billroth ii procedure.there is extensive thickening of the jejunal bowel loops.oral contrast proceeds through the gastrojejunostomy, but there is then a long segment of bowel which has essentiazlly no oral contrast within its lumen.the bowel can be traced throughout its length, however, and this non-opacified segment apppears to then become contigous with opacified loops of bowel.the appearances are likely due to intermittent administration of oral contrast via the ng tube, but fistulization could also have a similar appearance.there does not appear, on this exam hwever to be evidence of fistula formation.there is no free contrast within the abdomen.tiny pockets of air in the mesentery likely relate to recent surgery.patient is s/p gastrojejunostomy(old) and small bowel resection.two drain catheters are seen in the left flank and one catheter is in the subhepatic region.ng tube with tip is in the stomach.jejunostomy tube in the right lower quadrant is folded within the jejunal loop.also seen on the right side is an intraduodenal drainage catheter:reference to the operative notes describes creation of a duodenal biliary reservoir with external drainage and a blind ending loop of duodenum with drainage catheter-corresponding to the described surgical procedure is seen.no overt evidence of complications are seen in this area.several pockets of fluid are seen within the abdomen, the largest one in the right lower quadrant.there are no organized complicated fluid collections.pelvic ct.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is free fluid.foley catheter is within the bladder lumen.there is no lymphadenopathy.there is and open wound in the anterior abdominal wall.there are bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias.
summary: status post extensive surgical repair, there is no evidence of significant intrabdominal fluid collection or free contrast within the abdomen 3 surgical drains, one draining duodenal reservoir catheter and a feeding jejunostomy tube appear in good position.the feeding tube is probably coiled within a loop of jejunum moderate amount of fluid within the abdomen without complicated organized collections.reasonably long segment of nonopacified proximal jejunum is though likely to reflect bolus administration of oral contrast.no evidence of jejuno- jejunal/ileal fistula is seen .thickening of bowel loops may reflect underlying crohns versus post- operative edema/change 6.bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias.

text: extensive colonic diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis is again noted, as well as bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias.the distal ureters and bladder appear unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymph nodes or free fluid is identified.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions.thoracolumbar spondylosis is again noted.
summary: no abnormal intra-abdominal fluid collections identified status post hepaticojejunostomy.decreased postoperative inflammatory fat stranding.decrease in size of bilateral tiny pleural effusions.extensive colonic diverticulosis, without diverticulitis.bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias.

text: bilateral small pleural effusions and atelectasis are seen.there are extensive coronary vascular calcifications.the aorta is normal in caliber, with mural calcifications.extensive mesenteric vascular calcifications are seen.small hiatal hernia is seen.within the limits of this non- iv contrast scan, liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenals, and kidneys are within normal limits.gallbladder is not identified.stomach and small bowel loops filled with contrast and are normal in caliber.however, the colon is diffusely thickened, particularly in the mid transverse to left colon; this difference in thickening is partially due to differences in degrees of distention.no free fluid or free air.no lymphadenopathy.
summary: since ___, pancolitis most likely reflecting infectious etiology; consider c.difficile infection.inflammatory causes also possible.due to its global nature, ischemic colitis is considered less likely.stigmata of atherosclerotic disease including calcified coronary vessels and aorta.preliminary findings were relayed to the ed dashboard at the time of interpretation.

text: mild dependent atelectasis is present bilaterally.the heart is enlarged.extensive coronary artery calcifications are present.the liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is detected.severe atherosclerotic calcifications are present throughout the abdominal aorta, the celiac trunk (particularly the splenic artery), the sma, and the bilateral renal arteries.the iliac branches are also heavily calcified.
summary: large subcutaneous hematoma overlying the left groin access site, extending superiorly to the level of the left iliac crest and the left scrotum, and inferiorly to the medial-superior aspect the left thigh.no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.initial findings were discussed by dr.___ with dr.___ at 4:20 p.m.on ___.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear without pleural effusions.in the liver, there are two hypodense lesions, measuring 11 mm in the right inferior tip (image 2:32) and 7-mm in segment vii (image 2:11), unchanged since ___.the third tiny lesion in segment vi is not visualized in the current study.there are no new intrahepatic lesions.the portal veins are patent.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and gallbladder are normal.multiple gda clips are again noted.the kidneys are normal in size and symmetric in enhancement.there is prompt excretion of iv contrast into the collecting system.a circumaortic left renal vein is again noted.the patient is status post cystoprostatectomy with an ileal conduit.there is no evidence of obstruction.the stomach and the duodenum are normal.a ___ hernia is noted in the ventral midline abdominal wall (image 2:52).there is no evidence of small bowel obstruction.there is no free air, fluid, or lymphadenopathy in the intra-abdominal cavity.
summary: no evidence of recurrence of bladder or prostate cancer.interval resolution of the seroma at the cystoprostatectomy bed.otherwise, stable post-operative appearance of cystoprostatectomy with ileal conduit.no hydronephrosis.two small hypodense liver lesions, unchanged since ___.

text: urinary bladder, distal ureters, rectum, sigmoid colon, prostate, seminal vesicles are unremarkable, given lack of oral or intravenous contrast.
summary: no retroperitoneal hemorrhage, worsening of now severe l1 compression fracture deformity with anterior loss of at least 75% of vertebral body height.findings were communicated to the eu via ccc.

text: the lung bases demonstrate minimal atelectasis at the left lung base.there is calcification of the aorta with marked calcification of the iliac vessels.again seen is significant air within the colon, essentially unchanged from the study 2 days ago.however, there is more fluid within the abdominal and pelvic bowel.there may be mild hepatomegaly.on noncontrast views, the spleen, left kidney, adrenals, and stomach are unremarkable.there is a cyst within the right kidney.the uterus is unremarkable.no intra-abdominal free air.multiple phleboliths are present.multiple soft tissue calcifications are present within the buttocks consistent with injection granulomas.additionally, there is extensive degenerative change of the spine.
summary: no evidence of free air.extensive dilation of the bowel is unchanged from the prior study.there has been interval increase in the amount of enteric fluid, which may be related to enteritis or possibly the colonoscopy preparation.left-sided atelectasis.

text: within the limits of the delayed contrast phase timing, the liver appears unchanged.there is mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation, but no focal lesions are identified.there is no extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.there is minimal dependent hyperattenuating material within the gallbladder, which may represent either sludge or small stones.the gallbladder is not distended, and there is no wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid to suggest acute cholecystitis.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys are symmetric in size with unchanged nonspecific perinephric stranding.contrast is seen within the collecting systems, limiting evaluation for calculi.in the inferior pole of the right kidney, there is a hyperdense cystic lesion which appears unchanged from prior study.there are also scattered hypodense lesions within the kidneys bilaterally, likely simple cysts.there is no hydronephrosis and no hydroureter.intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel appear unremarkable.the stomach and duodenum are unchanged with a g-tube in adequate position traversing the anterior abdominal wall.there is no free fluid or free air.the ill-defined, infiltrating soft tissue mass in the mesentery and retroperitoneum appears unchanged from prior study.the precise margins are difficult to define.an enlarged lymph node medial to the right psoas muscle is unchanged from prior.
summary: limited evaluation for renal calculi, given the presence of contrast in the collecting system, however, there is no hydronephrosis or hydroureter.perinephric stranding and multiple renal cysts, some of which are hyperdense, are unchanged.minimal sludge or small stones dependently within the gallbladder with no ct evidence of acute cholecystitis.unchanged appearance of ill-defined infiltrative retroperitoneal/mesenteric soft tissue.

text: chest: there are post-surgical changes of the right lung as well as post-radiation changes of the upper lungs bilaterally.there is interval development of a small-to-moderate right pleural effusion.a tiny pulmonary nodule is seen anteriorly on the right, image 17 series 3, measuring 4 mm in size.there are emphysematous changes of the lungs bilaterally.post-surgical changes in the right lung extending into the mediastinum.no mediastinal lymphadenopathy or masses are seen.there is calcification of the coronary arteries.there are healing fractures of the right lateral fifth and sixth ribs.
summary: interval development of mild-to-moderate right pleural effusion, six new hepatic lesions measuring up to 3.0 cm in size, and a new mesenteric mass measuring 3.7 cm in size, and this constellation of findings is highly suspicious for significant progression of metastatic disease.two subcentimeter pulmonary nodules, too small to characterize.healing right lateral fifth and sixth rib and left superior and inferior pubic ramus fractures.abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring up to 3.3 cm in size.colonic diverticulosis.enlargement of the prostate gland.

text: the rectum, sigmoid are unremarkable except for scattered diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.there is no free fluid or free air.calcification in the uterine wall and right ovary noted, stable from ___.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.moderate multilevel degenerative changes are noted.subcutaneous opacities in the anterior abdominal wall likely reflect medication injection sites.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal pathology.cirrhotic liver.diverticulosis.

text: there is a tiny fluid collection measuring 2.8 cm anterior to the external iliac vessels in the right pelvis, unchanged from the prior study.there are no new collections identified.the bowel is unremarkable.there is no free fluid in the pelvis and there is no free intraperitoneal air.the bones reveal no suspicious lesions.
summary: interval reduction in size of fluid collection in the porta hepatis and gallbladder fossa, with only a minimal amount of fluid and gas remaining in the gallbladder fossa.no new collections identified.unchanged appearance of the remainder of the abdomen and pelvis--including a focal area early enhancement in the right lobe which on prior studies was shown to represent a hemangioma.

text: there are atelectatic changes at both lung bases, somewhat more focal at the left lung base.there is a small pericardial effusion.evaluation of the superior part of the liver is somewhat limited due to streak artifact from the patient's arms.the remainder of the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenals, and kidneys are unremarkable in appearance allowing for the lack of iv contrast.a minimal amount of stranding is seen just inferior to the pancreas in the mid abdomen.there is no focal fluid collection.a percutaneous gastrostomy tube is present.an inferior vena cava filter is present.no free fluid, free air, or pathologic lymphadenopathy is seen.the intra-abdominal large and small bowel are unremarkable.
summary: bibasilar atelectasis.more focal consolidation at the left base is not excluded.no evidence of pancreatitis or intra-abdominal abscess.

text: the urinary bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter and also contains a moderate amount of free gas.the prostate, seminal vesicles and rectum are unremarkable.a small amount of markedly dense material is seen throughout the colon, likely barium from previously administered study.there is no free gas or fluid in the pelvis.there is no pelvic sidewall or inguinal lymphadenopathy.incidental note is made of a right spermatic cord lipoma.
summary: persistent fluid and fat stranding seen in the region of the gallbladder fossa, corresponding to the extraluminal biliary leak seen during ercp.minimal stranding about the pancreatic tail, possibly related to uncomplicated pancreatitis.degenerative changes in the spine.results discussed over the telephone with dr.___ at ~16:55 on ___

text: the lung bases demonstrates minimal left basilar atelectasis.the liver is slightly irregular in contour with a tiny amount of perihepatic fluid consistent with cirrhosis.there is a single gallstone seen.the pancreas, spleen and adrenals are unremarkable.there is a punctate, non-obstructing calcification within the lower pole of the right kidney.there is a mild amount of left perinephric stranding and a prominent left proximal ureter with a mild amount of periureteral stranding.both kidneys demonstrates symmetric nephrograms and prompt excretion of iv contrast.visualized loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is no significant lymphadenopathy.
summary: probable left uvj calculus with secondary signs of left hydroureter, left periureteral and perinephric stranding.no evidence of pyelonephritis.cirrhotic appearing liver and a tiny amount of perihepatic fluid.fibroid uterus with bilateral ovarian cysts not significantly changed from prior study.an outpatient follow up ultrasound may helpful to further evaluate these persistent adnexal cysts in a perimenopausal patient.cholelithiasis.findings were discussed eu housestaff at time of exam.

text: 2 cm right lower lobe opacity is unchanged in size and stable since ___.there is bibasilar atelectasis.no other pulmonary nodules identified.moderate sized bilateral pleural effusions which are new.moderate atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications.the previously noted hypervascular lesions are seen as hypodense areas on the current ct and are unchanged in size, for example within segment ivb a 11 mm hypodensity, and within segment viia 7 mm hypodensity 2:26).stable hypodensity within segment ii measuring 10 mm.no suspicious liver lesions identified.no intra- or extra-hepatic duct dilation.there are small (< 5 mm) gallstones present within the gallbladder.the spleen, pancreas, both adrenal glands are normal in appearance.there are multiple hypodensities within both kidneys which remain too small to characterize and statistically likely represent cysts.persistent mild cortical scarring of the lower pole of the left kidney.no significant mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.there is no free fluid or free air.
summary: status post aortobiiliac stent graft.no evidence of endoleak.stable right lower lobe pulmonary opacity since ___, likely representing an area of rounded atelectasis or benign lesion.stable lesions within the liver which was previously characterized as hemangiomas.subcentimeter hypodensities within the remainder of the liver remain too small to characterize.multilevel degenerative disc disease.status post l2 vertebroplasty.persistent extension of part of l2 vertebral body posteriorly to the thecal sac.

text: again seen is a left pleural effusion.there are diffuse consolidation and ground-glass opacities in the lung bases bilaterally, not significantly changed.there is moderate ascites as previously seen.the liver parenchyma enhances homogeneously, and the portal and hepatic veins appear patent.contrast is noted again within the nondistended gallbladder, consistent with history of renal failure.the adrenal glands appear within normal limits.kidneys have similar appearance as prior scan.spleen remains enlarged, and again noted is the heterogeneous enhancement, with multiple peripheral areas of hypoenhancement, which likely represent areas of infarction.the splenic vein again appears partially thrombosed.the stomach, small bowel, colon, and appendix appear unremarkable.there is an og tube terminating in the stomach and gastrojejunostomy tube which tip terminates in the jejunum.there is homogeneous enhancement of the pancreatic parenchyma.peripancreatic fluid collection is noted again, with enhancing rim, extending anteriorly and inferiorly from the body and tail of the pancreas, with similar appearance compared to the prior study.
summary: bilateral diffuse pulmonary consolidation again compatible with ards, however, pulmonary edema or infection cannot be excluded.there is a large left pleural effusion.moderately large ascites, similar to that previously seen.anasarca.biliary excretion of contrast consistent with renal failure.peripheral areas of hypoattenuation in the spleen, unchanged, and consistent with infarction.findings consistent with at least partial thrombosis of splenic vein, as before.peripancreatic fluid collection with enhancing rim, similar appearance compared to ___.pancreas enhances homogeneously.no evidence of small-bowel obstruction or other bowel pathology.

text: other than bilateral dependent atelectasis, unchanged appearance of lung bases with emphysema.note is made of coronary artery calcification.other than a small amount of intra-abdominal free fluid adjacent to the inferior liver edge and layering dependently within the pelvis, there is no significant interval change since examination from ___.there are extensive metastatic lesions completely replacing the liver with associated hepatomegaly.the spleen is unremarkable.seen within the pancreatic tail is a rim calcified complex cystic lesion, stable in appearance, measuring 3.5 x 2.1 cm, with features most compatible with a pancreatic pseudocyst.both adrenal glands are unremarkable.scattered throughout both kidneys there are multiple hypodensities too small to characterize, stable in appearance since recent examination.in addition, there is a simple cyst seen in the interpolar region of the left kidney measuring 3.2 x 4.4 cm.note is made of atherosclerotic calcification involving the abdominal aorta and its major branches.in addition, there is an ill-defined hypodensity with more central hyperattenuating region seen in the mid body to tail of the pancreas compatible with known primary pancreatic cancer.the visualized portions of intra-abdominal small and large bowel are unremarkable with no evidence of dilation, bowel wall thickening, or pneumatosis.there is no intra-abdominal mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no intra-abdominal free air.
summary: other than interval development of small amount of intra-abdominal ascites, no significant change from ___.unchanged pancreatic cancer and extensive liver metastases and hepatomegaly.dfddp

text: there continues to be moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions, with associated atelectasis of the adjacent lung.visualized heart and pericardium reveal no pericardial effusion.the gallbladder continues to be distended and markedly irregular in appearance, with interval removal of a catheter.the overall appearance is grossly similar from ___, however, assessment is limited without iv contrast.additionally, there continues to be peripancreatic inflammatory stranding, as well as prominent regional lymph nodes, which may be minimally improved from the prior study.assessment for pancreatic necrosis, as well as assessment of the regional vessels is limited without iv contrast.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.the stomach and small bowel are within normal limits.there are scattered diverticula throughout the colon, without evidence of diverticulitis.there is a small amount of perihepatic free fluid.there is no free intraperitoneal air.
summary: continued pancreatitis and cholecystitis.the overall appearance of the gallbladder is grossly similar from ___, with slightly improved stranding surrounding the pancreas.no drainable fluid collection identified.small amount of ascites, with fluid tracking into the pelvis.moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions, with associated atelectasis of the adjacent lung.

text: there is a trace right pleural effusion and slight atelectasis at the right lung base.the ng tube extends into the stomach, where it makes a loop in the fundus.there is a large amount of fluid in the peritoneum.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, and ureters appear unremarkable.the gallbladder is distended without ct evidence of wall edema.the proximal small bowel is collapsed.the mid small bowel is distended with air-fluid levels.the distal small bowel is not distended.rectal contrast opacifies the colon, reaching the cecum.there is severe thickening of the cecal wall.the appendix seems to be normal in caliber although surrounded by inflammatory changes and fluid .these findings are most consistent with cecitis, which could be infectious or inflammatory.ischemic etiology is less likely.
summary: inflammatory changes in the rigth lower quadrant most likely consistent with cecitis, which could be infectious or inflammatory.ischemic etiology less likely.large amount of intraperitoneal fluid.dilated mid small bowel loops, likely secondary to ileus.fibroid uterus.

text: there is a small amount of ascites within the pelvis.adjacent to the right psoas muscle, there is a well-circumscribed mixed cystic and solid lesion that measures 4.0 x 4.5 cm in maximal ap x transverse dimensions respectively.this demonstrates a fat plane between it and the adjacent right psoas musculature and has a somewhat tubular configuration, most likely representing a nerve sheath tumor.this is incompletely characterized on the current examination and comparison with prior ct examinations is recommended to assess for stability.no significant pelvic lymphadenopathy is seen.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.a rectal tube is seen in place in the rectum.
summary: diffusely necrotic pancreas with only a tiny amount of residual functioning parenchymal tissue seen.two adjacent fluid collections are seen, one along the greater curvature of the stomach and one posterior to the splenic vein.the adjacent splenic vein, smv and sma are all patent-although they are involved with areas of inflamamtion and attention at follow-up examination is recommended.however, there is thrombosis of the posterior segment of the right portal vein.low- density fluid collection seen within segment viii of the liver that measures approximately 4 cm in size, incompletely characterized on the current examination but most likely related to vascular thrombosis of the right portal vein.this can be followed up with triphasic ct as this patient is unlikely to tolerate mri scanning.diffuse ileus of the small bowel.4-cm tubular cystic and solid lesion adjacent to the right psoas muscle that likely represents a tumor of nerve sheath origin.recommend correlation with prior imaging studies.

text: please note, lack of intravenous contrast limits detailed evaluation.the bladder, rectum, sigmoid colon, uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.there are a few surgical clips scattered throughout the pelvis.there is no enlargement of free fluid within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes.
summary: limited examination secondary to lack of intravenous and oral contrast.free intra-abdominal air within the upper abdomen is somewhat less in amount compared to the outside hospital ct exam from ___.evidence of extensive inflammatory changes in the upper abdomen, not well assessed on this non-contrast examination.no definte intra-abdominal collection..mesenteric adenopathy.left adrenal myelolipoma, stable.erosive changes involving the endplates of the l5 vertebral body and s1 portion of the sacrum concerning for osteomyelitis, better delineated on the recent mri of the lumbar spine.no other erosive changes evident throughout the visualized skeleton.right lower lobe consolidation versus atelectasis.findings were reviewed with dr.___ ___ on the afternoon of ___ by dr.___ over the telephone.

text: there is a foley catheter within the bladder.calcification is seen within the prostate gland.the distal ureters, seminal vessicles, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable in appearance.there is a small to moderate amount of free pelvic fluid.there is no inguinal or deep pelvic lymphadenopathy.calcification is seen throughout the aortoiliac system.
summary: no evidence of abscess or drainable collection.mild prominence of the small bowel, likely related to ileus.clinically correlate.small bits of free air within the abdomen, likely post operative residua.bilateral pleural effusions and atelectasis, worse on the left.interval splenectomy.

text: comparison with plain film examination dated ___, and fluoroscopic projections dated ___.there are numerous lytic lesions throughout the pelvis: within both iliac wings, a large lesion within the left sacral ala measuring 3.5 x 3 cm, as well as multifocal smaller lesions within the femoral heads, pubic symphysis, and rami.there is an obliquely oriented somewhat comminuted fracture through the distal right femoral diaphysis located 10 cm proximal to the distal femoral articular surface, transfixed with an intramedullary rod, which is held in position with two distal interlocking screws, and a single cannulated screw traversing the femoral neck and head.there is minimal posterior displacement of the distal fragment, without significant angulation.evaluation of the soft tissues reveals subcutaneous gas and soft tissue stranding in the proximal right thigh, in the region of the operative bed.there is also inflammatory stranding posteriorly, in the region of the proximal sciatic nerve.there is a somewhat hyperdense focus seen within the soft tissues of the posterior mid and distal right thigh, which originates 18 cm proximal to the level of the distal femoral articular surface, and extends to the level of fracture through the posterior femoral cortex.the lesion measures approximately 8 cm craniocaudad dimension x 2.5 cm transverse and ap dimensions, and is compatible with a hematoma, residing within the semimembranosus muscle.this hematoma is located directly anteromedial to and abuts the sciatic nerve, just proximal to the level of its distal bifurcation.incidental note is made of a small right knee joint effusion.no soft tissue hematoma is seen within the left thigh.
summary: hematoma within the semimembranosus muscle of the distal right thigh as described, which abuts the distal sciatic nerve.given patient's symptoms, this could be the causative etiology.post-surgical change within the proximal right thigh as described.lytic lesions compatible with history of multiple myeloma.findings conveyed to dr.___ on ___ at 4:30 p.m.

text: the urinary bladder, distal ureters, uterus, adnexa, sigmoid colon, and rectum are normal.there is a trace amount of free fluid in the pelvis, likely physiologic.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement is noted.
summary: within limitations above, normal enhancement of the transplant pancreas in the right lower quadrant without peripancreatic fluid collection or stranding.persistent abdominal rectus diastasis with paraumbilical hernia.no evidence of bowel obstruction.

text: the remainder of the bowel are of normal caliber and appearance.there is contrast extending all the way to the rectum.the bladder is normal.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.there is no free pelvic fluid.
summary: interval decrease in the size of pancreatic pseudocyst.pigtail drain previously inside the pseudocyst is no longer in the proper location with the coiled tail pulled against the posterior abdominal wall.findings were communicated with dr.___ ___ at 04:30 p.m.on ___, ___.

text: small retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is a new pancreatic tail mass measuring 2.6 x 2.4 cm.no mediastinal lymphadenopathy is seen.the right adrenal gland is not visualized and a surgical clip is again seen in this region.the liver, spleen, gallbladder, left adrenal, kidneys, visualized portions of the ureters, stomach, small bowel, and large bowel are within normal limits.no free intraperitoneal air or ascites is seen.note is made of an accessory left renal artery and accessory left hepatic artery.
summary: increased size of right upper lobe lung nodule and three subcutaneous nodules concerning for metastatic disease.new pancreatic and right 5th rib lesions consistent with metastases.new left subcutaneous nodule also consistent with metastasis.these findings were reported to the radiology communication dashboard on ___.

text: there is diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon, without evidence of acute diverticulitis.there is a foley in the urinary bladder.distal ureters, prostate, seminal vesicles are unremarkable.there is no free pelvic fluid, and no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymphatic nodes.
summary: no evidence of acute traumatic injury in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.hyoerdense or enhancing liver focus, may be further evaluated with mr ___ ___- emergent basis.

text: the right distal ureter and urinary bladder appear unremarkable.the left kidney demonstrates delayed excretion with no contrast in the left collecting system at this time of the study.the left psoas muscle appears to be increased in size since the prior study, area of relatively discoid margin measuring 5.8 x 3.2 cm of heterogeneous attenuation which is new since the prior study.this attenuation is higher than that of the fluid and there is no internal air pocket that is suggestive of abscess.it cannot be separated from the psoas muscle.at the inferior end of this collection, some heterogeneous high attenuation material is also noted along the left iliopsoas muscle adjacent to the left iliac vessels.these findings most likely representing retroperitoneal hemorrhage.a large amount of pelvic fluid is demonstrated.note is also made of right inguinal hernia containing fluid.bone windows reveal no significant abnormality.diffuse subcutaneous soft tissue edema is present, consistent with anasarca.
summary: significant interval increase in size of the ascites and pelvic fluid.relatively discrete heterogeneous collection which is not separable from the left psoas muscle and high attenuation material along the left iliac psoas muscle, probably representing retroperitoneal hemorrhage.there is no evidence of air or rim-enhancing discrete fluid collection to suggest abscess.however, superimposed infection of this retroperitoneal collection cannot be excluded.the left kidney demonstrates delayed nephrogram and excretion.the right renal artery is visualized, but the left renal artery is not well identified ? left renal artery injury.however, this is not a dedicated cta study.large bilateral pleural effusions with atelectasis.anasarca.

text: the bladder and prostate appear within normal limits.no free fluid is seen in the pelvis.no pelvic lymphadenopathy or inguinal lymphadenopathy is noted.there are bilateral inguinal hernias containing fat.
summary: parastomal hernia containing mesentery with mild surrounding fat stranding.small bilateral pleural effusions.degenerative changes in the thoracic and lumbar spine as described.the pertinent findings have been discussed with the surgical team at the time of the review of the study.

text: the visualized lung bases are unremarkable, without consolidation or effusion.the liver is normal in size and appearance.there is focal fatty infiltration adjacent to the falciform ligament.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation, and the gallbladder is unremarkable.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.there is symmetric renal parenchymal enhancement and contrast excretion, without hydronephrosis.the patient is status post gastric bypass.there is oral contrast seen within the gastric pouch, and passing freely through the gastrojejunal anastomosis into the roux limb.there is no contrast seen within the excluded stomach.the excluded stomach, duodenum, and proximal jejunum are normal in caliber and appearance.there is no evidence for afferent loop obstruction.however, there is an abnormal loop of small bowel identified in the mid abdomen, which involves the distal aspect of the roux limb.this loop is located below/posterior to the transverse colon and transverse mesocolon.it demonstrates wall thickening, and pronounced mesenteric vascular congestion.there is a sharply angulated transition from this abnormal loop to the distal bowel just proximal to the jejunojejunal anastomosis, best seen on coronal images (301b:20).the angulated appearance is suggestive of possible adhesion versus an internal hernia, though given that this loop remains below the transverse mesocolon it is less likely that this represents a herniation through the transverse mesocolon defect.the jejunojejunal anastomosis and distal small bowel are unremarkable.there is no evidence for mechanical obstruction, with oral contrast passing freely to the colon.the aorta and mesenteric vessels are patent.there is no free air in the abdomen.there is no pneumatosis of the above-mentioned abnormal loop or portal venous air identified.
summary: the patient is status post gastric bypass.the excluded stomach and afferent limb are normal in appearance.there is no evidence for leak.however, there is an abnormal loop of small bowel, comprising the distal portion of the roux limb extending to an abrupt, angulated transition just proximal to the j-j anastomosis, which has appearance that suggest the presence of either an adhesion or possibly an internal hernia.there is wall thickening and edema of this loop, with engorgement of the mesenteric vasculature.while there is no mechanical obstruction, evidenced by free passage of contrast to the colon, the overall appearance is suggestive a "closed loop" type of pathology.consideration of surgical exploration is recommended.small amount of free fluid in the pelvis, which may be physiologic.these findings were discussed extensively with the surgical team including the attending physician, ___.___, by dr.___.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectatic changes at the lung bases.these are essentially unchanged from the prior study.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, and pancreas are unremarkable.a small granuloma is seen within the spleen.low-attenuation lesions are seen in both kidneys, likely representing cysts.these are unchanged.the right adrenal is unremarkable in appearance.the left adrenal is somewhat full in appearance and contains a small 10 x 13 mm rounded lesion unchanged from the prior study and is likely an adenoma.the intra-abdominal aorta is heavily calcified.there is an infrarenal aortic aneurysm which measures 5.0 x 5.0 cm in greatest dimension and is unchanged from the prior study.there is no free air, free fluid or pathologic lymph adenopathy within the abdomen.a small pericardial effusion.
summary: unchanged appearance of infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.bilateral pleural effusions and associated atelectatic changes.

text: the significantly enlarged prostate is again noted measuring 7.3 x 8.6 cm.the rectum, sigmoid colon, urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are seen.no free air or free fluid is noted within the pelvis.
summary: progression of severe pancreatitis with extensive peripancreatic fluid collection extending into the anterior mesentery, lesser sac, anterior left pararenal space.infection within these fluid collection cannot be excluded.no pseudocyst or pseudo aneurysm is seen.part of splenic vein and smv are not seen and thrombosis in these veins cannot be excluded.part of pancreatic head and uncinate process appear hypodense.this appearance can be due to edema, however pancreatic necrosis cannot be excluded.cholelithiasis with no evidence of cholecystitis.multiple bilateral renal cysts; some small hypodense lesions in both kidneys that are too small to characterize.markedly enlarged prostate gland which is unchanged compared to prior study.

text: there are marked coronary artery vascular calcifications.there is a persistent right basilar opacity, which may represent atelectasis, although the possibility of pneumonia or aspiration cannot be excluded.there are tiny associated bibasilar pleural effusions.the liver appears normal within the limitations of a non-contrast study.again noted is a rim-calcified 13-mm stone within the gallbladder, which is non- distended and otherwise unremarkable.the spleen, adrenal glands are within normal limits, and the non-contrast appearance of the kidneys is unremarkable bilaterally.a weighted feeding tube terminates in the third portion of the duodenum.the stomach, small and large bowel are unremarkable without evidence of obstruction.contrast reaches the rectum.there is no lymphadenopathy.there is a small amount of ascites of low density, but increased since the prior study.for the most part, the appearance of the pancreas is unchanged with a similar overall contour of the partially necrotic pancreas with multiple large associated fluid collections.this appearance was better characterized on a recent study with intravenous contrast, but is probably for the most part unchanged.the only change is the appearance of a new fluid collection along the gastrohepatic ligament, without a discernable wall, measuring 6.4 x 3.0 cm in axial dimensions, which layers along the caudate lobe.diffuse mesenteric stranding and fascial thickening of the anterior pararenal fascia bilaterally is unchanged.
summary: persistent right basilar opacity with air bronchograms, which may represent atelectasis, although pneumonia cannot be excluded.new perihepatic fluid collection, perhaps a new pseudocyst, but otherwise the overall contour of multiple fluid collections associated with the partially necrotic pancreas do not appear significantly changed.increased ascites.

text: the rectum, distal ureters, and bladder are unremarkable.small amount of free fluid is present in the pelvis.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: increased size of left flank retroperitoneal fluid collection.given recent pancreatic intervention and low attenuation of the fluid, a pancreatic fluid collection is likely.left lower lobe collapse/consolidation, improved in the interval.mildly diffusely dilated bowel loops, consistent with ileus.

text: direct comparison is made to prior ultrasound dated ___.minimal bibasilar atelectasis is noted.also, trace right-sided pleural effusion is seen.there is no evidence of renal, ureteral, or bladder calculi.the kidneys are grossly unremarkable.the adrenal glands, spleen, pancreas, gallbladder, and liver are grossly unremarkable, given the limitation of a non-contrast ct.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.visualized bowel is grossly unremarkable noting diverticulosis within the descending and sigmoid colon.pelvic structures are grossly unremarkable.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.
summary: no acute abnormalities identified.specifically, no evidence of renal calculi or retroperitoneal hemorrhage.

text: imaged lung bases demonstrate right mild middle lobe opacities, which may represent acute infectious process.the visualized heart and pericardium appear normal.in the liver, there is a stable lower density region in the right lobe inferiorly with geographic pattern, likely represents focal fatty infiltration.there is no focal lesion.post-whipple procedure changes are noted.a right-sided percutaneous transhepatic cholangiographic (ptc) appears in appropriate position, with the catheter tip terminating in the duodenum.a left ptc is with pigtail formed within the left hepatic duct, unchanged.there is persistent mild left biliary dilatation on the left.a feeding tube traverses the stomach and the gastrojejunal anastomosis extending into the efferent (biliopancreatic) limb rather than the roux limb as might be expected.mild dilated proximal jejunal loops up to 4-5 cm, are of uncertain significance.the stomach, loops of small and large bowel appear normal.there is no small or large bowel obstruction.there has been interval increase in size and number of mesenteric lymphadenopathy.mild enlarged spleen (13 cm) is stable.there is no focal lesion.the adrenal glands and kidneys appear unremarkable.there is small amount of free fluid, unchanged.there is no free air.there appears to have significant narrowing of the portal vein confluence with the smv apparently draining via collateral vessels.there has been interval increase of abdominal collateral vessels.
summary: post-whipple procedure changes.two ptc catheters in place.stable mild left biliary duct dilatation.nj tube traverses the stomach towards the proximal loops of jejunum (biliopancreatic limb).there is no small or large bowel obstruction.mild amount of abdominal and pelvic free fluid is unchanged.interval increase in size and number of innumerable enlarged mesenteric lymph nodes.right middle lobe opacities, may represent acute infectious process--correlate clinically.these findings were discussed with dr.___ on the day of the study.

text: the visualized lung bases are within normal limits.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.non-contrast view of the liver failed to show any abnormality.evaluation of liver parenchyma and vasculature should be performed by mri or ultrasound due to inability to administer intravenous contrast material.there is no evidence of bile duct dilatation.gallbladder contains a small amount of contrast, most probably due to vicarious excretion.adrenals are unremarkable bilaterally.kidneys show thin parenchymal thickness bilaterally and a number of hypodensities in the cortex, unchanged from prior study.spleen is small.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes are demonstrated measuring up to 1 cm (series 2, image 41).there is no evidence of ascites.visualized bowel loops are unremarkable.
summary: on this non-contrast study, patency of the portal vein and liver parenchyma cannot be fully evaluated.further evaluation can be performed by mri or ultrasound.

text: extensive peripancreatic fluid is identified, without significant change in size or distribution since prior ct ___.fluid extends into the retroperitoneum in both sides of the abdomen as on prior scan.there is enhancement of pancreatic parenchyma in the head, body and tail.the celiac artery, superior mesenteric artery, superior mesenteric vein, splenic vein, splenic artery and portal vein are patent.there is mural thickening of the duodenum as on prior scan, consistent with inflammatory change.increased mural thickening is identified in the ascending colon (series 3b, image 122), which also contains intraluminal fecal material.there is mild gaseous distention of the transverse colon.the gallbladder appears unremarkable.there is no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.no focal abnormality is identified in the liver, spleen, adrenal glands or kidneys.
summary: extensive peripancreatic fluid is unchanged since prior study, consistent with history of acute pancreatitis.interval development of extensive consolidation and ground-glass opacity in both lungs, most likely due to ards or aspiration.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, intrapelvic loops of small bowel are unremarkable.a foley balloon is present within a decompressed bladder.a small amount of free fluid is evident within the pelvis.small, bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias are evident.
summary: inflammatory process appears to be centered in the ileocecal area at the site of recent appendectomy.no organized or drainable intra-abdominal fluid collection.assessment is somewhat limited by lack of distal ileal distention with oral contrast.a small amount of free fluid and scattered subjacent lymph nodes are additionally evident.equivocal diffuse colonic wall thickening.this finding raises the possibility of colitis and and infectious process such as c.difficile should be considered.small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.

text: moderate amount of fluid is present in the pelvis.the urinary bladder is not fully distended, but appears to be grossly unremarkable.the prostate gland is not enlarged and measures approximately 4.4 cm in transverse and 3.6 cm in ap dimension.there is a right inguinal fat-containing hernia.the kidneys enhance symmetrically.
summary: interval increase in size of both previously noted dominant pseudocysts.the pancreatic pseudocyst surrounds and encases the gastroduodenal artery.attention to this area should be paid during subsequent surgical procedures.interval increase in amount of parapancreatic fluid/inflammatory changes.interval increase in intrahepatic and extrahepatic biliary dilatation.interval increase in size of the left pleural effusion.new small pericardial effusion.

text: the patient is intubated with the et tube tip approximately 5.7 cm above the carina.the visualized thyroid gland appears within normal limits.there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial effusion.the cardiac ___ appear within normal limits.the great vessels and aortic arch appear within normal limits.there is evidence of atherosclerotic vascular disease involving the thoracic aorta.there are no pulmonary nodules or masses.there is evidence of bibasilar atelectasis.small left pleural effusion is seen.there is contrast within the left axillary and brachial veins with abrupt cutoff in the region of the left axillary vein after attempted contrast injection within the left upper extremity which could be related to a clot or patient positioning.foci of gas are seen within the left subclavian vein related to attempted injection.contrast is seen opacifying the right subclavian vein.
summary: no evidence of solid organ injury.bilateral simple renal cysts.infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.small left pleural effusion.bibasilar atelectasis.

text: the distal ureters and bladder are unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid and no pelvic lymphadenopathy.there is a descending colon colostomy which is located at the base of the hernia sac.stool and gas are present within the colon.the osseous structures reveal no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: mid small bowel obstruction with transition point at the abdominal wall in the upper portion of the hernia sac.gas and stool within the colon suggests early versus partial high grade obstruction.there is no evidence of perforation.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions.there is dependent atelectasis at the lung bases.these are new since the prior study.oral contrast reaches the mid-sigmoid colon.a delayed scan was performed to evaluate the distal bowel.of the bowel visualized, there is oral contrast in both the remnant and the gastric pouch limb of the gastric bypass.neither limb is dialated.there is no intra-abdominal abscess or collection.the spleen, liver, adrenals, kidneys and pancreas are within normal limits.
summary: no definite evidence of extravasation of oral contrast.please see a separate dictation for the delayed scan.s/p debridement of the abdominal soft tissues with an open abdominal wound.high density linear structure extending into the soft tissues of the left flank is presumably a drain.correlate clinically.no evidence of intra-abdominal abscess.

text: small amount of ascites visualized within the pelvis.the uterus is unremarkable.the bladder is slightly distended containing some intraluminal air, correlate with history of procedure/instrumentation.there is diverticulosis without evidence for diverticulitis.
summary: interval dehiscence of the patient's anterior abdominal wall with overlying vac seen.ileocolonic anastomosis appears intact with surgical drain seen surrounding inflamed loops of bowel.no drainable fluid collection is seen.no free oral contrast within the peritoneal cavity is seen to suggest an anastomotic leak.stable 4 cm suprarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.findings communicated to dr.___ at the time of dictation.

text: there is an expansile, destructive mass of the left pubic ramus with a large soft tissue component extending into the left hemipelvis.the mass measures up to 11.2 x 6.6 cm and displaces the urinary bladder, seminal vesicles and prostate to the right.there is an expansile mass of the right ischium with a large soft tissue component measuring 7.8 x 6.7 cm.evaluation of the osseous structures also demonstrate an expansile lesion of the l2 spinous process measuring 4.0 x 3.6 cm.
summary: no evidence of an acute abdominal process.status post left nephrectomy with no evidence of local tumor recurrence.expansile osseous metastases.

text: the imaged lung bases demonstrate small bilateral simple pleural effusions, with associated basal opacities likely representing atelectasis.there is no pericardial effusion.the nasogastric tube ends in the distal portion of the stomach.within the limitations of a non-contrast study, the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands are unremarkable.there are hyperdense foci within the gallbladder neck, suggestive of gallstones.there is no intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the kidneys are unremarkable, without evidence of hydronephrosis or nephrolithiasis.there is a moderate amount of ascites, which is simple in nature.there is no intra-abdominal free air.the patient is status post total colectomy, right lower quadrant ileostomy and hartmann's pouch.there is no evidence of small-bowel obstruction, with the administered contrast reaching the ileostomy bag.the abdominal aorta has scattered calcification, without aneurysmal dilation.there is diffuse mesenteric stranding and edema, which may be related to volume overload and recent surgery.
summary: no retroperitoneal hemorrhage.bilateral small pleural effusions and associated bibasilar atelectasis.moderate amount of simple ascites.no evidence of bowel obstruction.stable appearance of total colectomy, right lower quadrant ileostomy, with unremarkable appearance of the same.the hartmann's pouch is fluid filled.cholelithiasis.

text: consistent with the given history and the prior examination, there is abdominal aortic aneurysm.at the aortic hiatus, the aorta measures approximately 3.5 cm in diameter.at the level of the renal arteries, the aorta measures approximately 3.5 cm in diameter.in the caudal infrarenal abdominal aorta, there is a slight fusiform dilatation with maximal dimension of approximately 4.1 cm at the level of the superior endplate of l4.the aneurysm terminates at the bifurcation.the right common iliac artery measures 1.5 cm in diameter, and the left common internal iliac artery measures 1.7 cm.there is diffuse extensive calcified plaque noted throughout the aortoiliac vasculature.mural thrombus cannot be assessed given the lack of intravenous contrast administration.there is no paraaortic stranding or fluid to suggest leakage or impending rupture.there is no retroperitoneal hemorrhage.there has been interval development of bilateral pleural effusions, right slightly greater than left.adjacent relaxation atelectasis is evident in the dependent aspects of the included lung bases.no definite consolidation seen.within limitations of a non-contrast enhanced scan, the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands image normally.two small hyperdense foci are identified within the left kidney, interpolar and lower poles respectively.these are stable in otherwise too small to further characterize.no hydronephrosis or renal calculi identified.no small-bowel dilatation is evident.extensive predominantly left-sided diverticulosis is evident without findings suggestive of diverticulitis.a normal appendix is seen.stool is noted throughout the colon.a trace amount of free fluid is noted in the pelvis.no intra-abdominal free fluid is evident.there is no free air.a ventriculoperitoneal shunt is noted with the distal tip terminating in the right false pelvis.there is no soft tissue attenuation or fluid seen to suggest development of csfoma.ovoid calcifications are noted scattered throughout the extra abdominal soft tissues, predominantly in the gluteal and paraspinal musculature along the right lower flank.calcification is noted in the pericardium at the level of the apex of the right ventricle.extensive calcification is noted throughout and atrophied uterus.the bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter balloon.the bones are diffusely osteopenic.mild degenerative changes noted throughout the thoracolumbar spine.extensive facet arthropathy is noted at the lumbosacral junction.
summary: stable size of predominantly infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm with no ct evidence suggestive of leaking or impending rupture.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.presumed ventriculoperitoneal shunt.the distal tip terminates within the right hemipelvis with no adjacent mass lesion.scattered soft tissue calcifications in the extra-abdominal and extra- pelvic soft tissues.this may relate to prior infection or granulomatous exposure.does patient have a history of a phakomatosis? results posted to the ed dashboard immediately upon interpretation.

text: comparison is made with the study from ___.
summary: marked improvement in the previously seen sigmoidal wall thickening, and resolution of free fluid in the pelvis.extensive diverticular disease is present, but there is no evidence of acute diverticulitis.tiny left renal cyst.multiple splenic granulomas.

text: again seen are opacities in the right lower lobe consistent with aspiration, slightly improved compared to prior study.there is also evidence of linear atelectasis in the left lower lobe.small pericardial effusion is noted.there again appears to be fatty infiltration of the liver.no focal masses are identified within the liver.the gallbladder, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.multiple small dense foci are seen within the right kidney, possibly representing tiny stones or vascular calcifications.no evidence of hydronephrosis.the patient is status post splenectomy.the large and small bowel appear within normal limits.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is identified.there is no evidence of free fluid or free air within the abdomen.
summary: slight decrease in peri- penile, urethral, and scrotal stranding.suprapubic cutaneous stranding, relatively unchanged from prior study.air is seen within the bladder, likely secondary to repositioned foley catheter within the bladder.partial clearing of right lower lobe opacities consistent with aspiration.unchanged appearing sinus tract in right posterior subcutaneous tissue.fatty liver.

text: the urinary bladder is moderately distended with fluid; a foley catheter is in place.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.a rectal tube is in place.diverticula are noted in the sigmoid colon, without diverticulitis.the pelvic loops of bowel appear unremarkable.the appendix is not discretely identified; however, there are no secondary signs of appendicitis.there is no pelvic free fluid or pelvic or inguinal adenopathy.note is made of regions of dependent subcutaneous edema.a hemangioma is noted in l1.degenerative changes are most notable at the l1-l2 and the l5-s1 levels.there is grade 1 anterolisthesis of l4 on l5, likely degenerative in nature.no region of bony destruction concerning for metastasis or infection is demonstrated.
summary: slight decrease in moderate-sized right pneumothorax at the lung base.air space consolidation with multiple cavitating lesions again noted in the lung bases, consistent with septic emboli.interval improvement in aeration of the posterior right lung base.rectal tube, foley catheter, feeding tube and chest tubes in place.no other source for sepsis demonstrated.

text: there are small areas of atelectasis seen at the right lung base.there is a moderate-sized left pleural effusion, with thickening of the underlying pleura.small hiatal hernia is seen.there is a gastrostomy tube which is appropriately located.oral contrast does pass throughout the small bowel extending into the large bowel and eventually reaching an ostomy device which is in the left mid abdomen.there is a very large parastomal hernia which admits multiple loops of predominantly small bowel, which are nondistended and without inflammation.overall defect in the abdominal wall surrounding the stoma approximates 6.5 cm.non-contrast evaluation of the liver reveals no focal lesions.there is a nodular contour to the hepatic surface indicating underlying cirrhosis.the pancreas is markedly atrophic.spleen is not visualized and has likely been surgically removed.there are clips in the left upper abdomen presumably related to that, however the exact etiology is unknown.adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable, although the kidneys are shrunken and appear atrophic.small left renal cyst.there is dense atherosclerosis of the aortoiliac system without focal aneurysmal dilatation.foley catheter is seen within a nondistended bladder.the residual rectal pouch does contain fecal material.review of bone windows reveals no lytic or blastic lesions.there are degenerative changes of the hips and spine, with a dynamic compression screw in the right proximal femur.the alignment is atypical, and should be reevaluated with dedicated films.no acute fracture is seen.
summary: large parastomal hernia in the left mid abdomen without evidence of obstruction or acute inflammatory abnormality.left pleural effusion with pleural thickening.cirrhotic liver.dense atherosclerosis.atypical appearance to right hip and dcs fixation.plain film evaluation and comparison to prior imaging is advised.

text: sub-2-mm pulmonary nodules are noted at the lung bases.there is bibasilar atelectasis, without pleural effusions.the heart is normal in size, with trace pericardial effusion.
summary: roux-en-y gastric bypass, with gastrogastric fistula.no evidence of anastomotic leak or obstruction.

text: the prostate is mildly enlarged.the bladder contains air which could be seen in recent catheterization.the seminal vesicles and rectum are within normal limits.sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis is noted.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy, or free fluid.
summary: cholecystostomy tube and gallbladder, which contains a large quantity of dense non-layering material, perhaps a large sludge ball.right basilar opacity with air bronchograms, which could represent either atelectasis or, in the appropriate clinical setting, infection.diverticulosis.multiple renal cysts.enlarged prostate.ankylosis of the sacroiliac joints, with bridging transverse syndesmophytes in the lower spine, can be seen in seronegative inflammatory arthropathies.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, prostate, and bladder are unremarkable.no free pelvic fluid or pathologically enlarged lymph nodes.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions.multilevel thoracolumbar spondylosis and grade ___ anterolisthesis of l4 on l5 are unchanged.
summary: the etiology of the new periportal/peripancreatic fat stranding is unclear.diagnostic considerations include pancreatitis.in the setting of gallbladder wall edema and stones, clinical consideration of cholecystitits and correlation with hida scan is recommended.diverticulosis without acute diverticulitis.unchanged soft tissue deposit along gerota's fascia of the left.unchanged right lower lobe pulmonary nodule.unchanged hypodense pancreatic uncinate process lesion and unchanged cystic lesion in pancreatic tail, differential as noted in the ___ ct.

text: once again, there is a very large right inguinal hernia extending into the right scrotal sac which overall appears slightly smaller in size compared to ___.on today's exam, the hernia measures in the coronal plane 15 x 7 cm (301b:35).again, the descending colon and terminal ileum are contained within this hernia.mesenteric vessels are again found stretched within the sac.there is no evidence of ischemia or incarceration.there are no dilated loops that would suggest obstruction.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.there is a foley balloon present within the bladder.the bladder wall is thickened irregular and multiple small foci of air are seen within the anterior aspect of the bladder lumen.in addition, there appear to be several foci of air within the wall of the anterior aspect of the bladder which could represent emphysematous cystitis.a 1.7- cm calcification just adjacent to the anterior bladder wall is unchanged compared to the previous exam.no pathologic pelvic or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is identified.incidental note is made of atherosclerotic calcifications of the walls of the iliac vessels and distal aorta.the right common iliac artery is slightly enlarged measuring 1.8 cm in diameter.the left internal iliac artery is also slightly enlarged measuring approximately 1.8 cm in diameter.
summary: large, bowel-containing right inguinal/scrotal hernia without evidence of obstruction or ischemia.thickened, irregular bladder wall with possible small foci of air within the anterior aspect of the wall which could represent emphysematous cystitis.status post ivc filter, infrarenal.dilatation of the right common iliac and left internal iliac arteries respectively, as described above.unchanged appearance of the t12 compression fracture.

text: multiple sigmoid diverticula are present.the rectum is normal.the urinary bladder is collapsed and a foley catheter is in place.there is no lymphadenopathy and a trace amount of free fluid.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.there is a right inguinal hernia containing fluid.bone windows demonstrate marked scoliosis of the lumbar spine with degenerative changes.the aorta is calcified and tortuous.
summary: circumferential wall thickening and luminal narrowing in the distal transverse colon consistent with the typical applecore appearance of colon cancer.this appears to be partially obstructing.there is associated small amount of free peritoneal fluid.the cecum is 10 cm but there is no evidence of perforation and no definite evidence of pneumatosis coli.sigmoid diverticula.vasculopathy.

text: a fibroid uterus is again seen.a fluid within the endometrial cavity is redemonstrated c/w cervical stenposis.the rectum and urinary bladder and intrapelvic loops of small and large bowel are within normal limits.there is no intrapelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.focal thrombus and mild expansion of a deep branch of the left internal iliac vein is seen (2a:84), unchanged since the prior ct examination.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal or intrapelvic process.no acute hemorrhage detected, although ct has essentially no sensitivity for slow rectal bleeds.unchanged focal thrombus and mild expansion of a deep branch of the left internal iliac vein.

text: the previously seen pelvic wall fluid collections which extended along the pelvic floor and the right adductor mucle is no longer present.there is, however, persistent stranding of the soft tissues anterior pelvic wall.at the level just anterior to the pubic symphysis where there was a previously described 2.0 x 4.1 cm fluid collection, there is now what appears to be a small amount of fibrotic changes and fat stranding.the previously seen soft tissue air has also resolved.the patient's skin staples have been removed.complicated fractures of the left sacroiliac joint are again identified with disarticulation of the si joint.there is marked fragmentation of the bones in this region as well.fragmentation of the bones is also seen anterior to the pubic symphysis fractures.there is persistent diastasis of the pubic symphysis measuring up to 1 cm in width.a single fixation plate with two screws ____ pubic symphysis is unchanged in appearance.also unchanged in appearance is the fixation plate with two screws spanning the si joint.heterotopic ossification is noted around the left acetabulum, adjacent to the left iliac bone at the level of the l4 and l5 vertebral bodies as well as laterally within the left gluteus medius muscle.heterotopic ossification is also seen deep in the pelvis in the region of the right adductor muscles.these findings appear stable compared to the prior study.the rectum, sigmoid, visualized loops of small bowel, distal ureters, and bladder are normal.the prostate also appears normal though evaluation is somewhat limited due to streak artifact from the fixation plate in the pubic symphysis.
summary: resolution of previously seen fluid collections.no new abscess or drainable collection.persistent soft tissue stranding in the anterior pelvic wall soft tissues as well as within the deeper portions of the pelvis.heterotopic ossification which is also from the prior study.

text: there are surgical staples along the posterior aspect of the bladder.there is a small amount of gas within the bladder nondependently.has this patient's bladder been instrumented recently? there is no ascites or free air.there is no retroperitoneal adenopathy.the previously ill defined stranding and soft tissue attenuation which was distributed throughout the retroperitoneum on the prior study has resolved.the bones reveal some degenerative changes in the lower lumbar and thoracic spines.
summary: nonspecific "___" appearance of the small bowel mesentery with associated small mesenteric lymph nodes and without obvious accompanying abnormality in the bowel.___ be seen with mesenteric adenitis, or other diseases such as lymphoma, and follow up study in three months should be performed to confirm stability.small gallstones.small amount of gas within the bladder.has this patient's bladder been instrumented recently? diverticulosis without diverticulitis or colitis.

text: the initial images again demonstrate the presence of a pigtail drain within the bile collection adjacent to the resection bed along the residual liver.the collection is smaller and measures 68 x 32 mm on this study in axial dimensions following injection of 60 cc of contrast via the catheter, the cavity fills and a small linear projection of contrast into the liver consistent with a communication with the biliary system is demonstrated.additional images following 70 cc more of contrast via the tube again demonstrate the connection.there is a small right-sided pleural effusion and pleural thickening.otherwise, the lungs are clear.the post-operative appearance of the liver is unchanged.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands and visualized upper portions of the kidneys appear normal.there is no lymphadenopathy or free air or fluid demonstrated on these views.the visualized bowel is unremarkable, although a small bowel containing left-sided abdominal wall hernia is again noted without evidence of obstruction.
summary: pigtail drain in similar position within the biloma, which is smaller than on the prior study.upon injection of contrast via the catheter, communication with the biliary system is demonstrated.

text: dependent atelectasis is present at the lung bases.a femorally placed catheter is seen terminating in the right ventricular outflow tract.the liver, gallbladder, and adrenal glands are normal.some speckled calcifications are present in the spleen suggesting prior granulomatous disease.the pancreas is atrophic and a punctate calcification is seen within the head of the pancreas.the liver is grossly normal on this noncontrast ct examination.the aorta is ectatic and has rim calcifications.there is no significant adenopathy within the mesentery or retroperitoneum.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.the large and small bowel are nonopacified but adequately visualized and show no areas of abnormality.
summary: no retroperitoneal hematoma.some stranding with surrounding the femoral vessels in the right groin likely represents some blood leak but there is no large organized hematoma to explain a large hematocrit drop.results were relayed to the clinical house staff team.

text: linear opacities at the right lung base are unchanged, suggestive of scarring.there is a tiny right-sided pleural effusion.the liver is small with a nodular margin, consistent with history of cirrhosis.multiple geographic low attenuation areas throughout the liver are more extensive than on the prior study, suggestive of increased tumor involvement.multiple areas of high attenuation in the liver are consistent with intrahepatic hemorrage.the gallbladder contains a calcified gallstone.the pancreas, spleen, stomach, small and large bowel, intraabdominal great vessels, adrenals and right kidney are unremarkable.the left kidney contains a stable low attenuation area in its midpolar region, suggestive of a cyst.there is no hydronephrosis.there is a large amount of new ascites in the abdomen.no free air or lymphadenopathy are seen in the abdomen.
summary: cirrhotic liver.low attenuation areas throughout the liver represent worsening tumor involvement.intrahepatic hemorrage, probably from tumor extension and hepatic coagulopathy.large amount of ascites in the abdomen and pelvis.no small bowel obstruction.pelvic hematomas.

text: trace of free fluid in the pelvis.the urinary bladder and rectum are unremarkable in appearance.no enlarged pelvic lymph nodes seen.
summary: no pseudocyst formation around the visualized vp shunt.two small hypoattenuating liver lesions as described, the larger consistent with a cyst.a second lesion is too small to characterize.bilateral exophytic renal cysts, not further characterized in the absence of iv contrast.ivc filter.vascular calcification consistent with atherosclerotic change.

text: there is bibasilar atelectasis, right greater than left.visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.

text: in the lung bases, there are extensive nodular metastases, not substantially changed from study performed two days prior.there is no new effusion or consolidation.there is no pericardial effusion.also unchanged from prior study are numerous necrotic metastases throughout the right and left lobes of the liver.the portal vein remains patent.there is no new biliary ductal dilation.in comparison to prior study, there has been interval development of bowel obstruction at the level of the sigmoid stent.extensive soft tissue is seen filling the lumen of the stent, which is similar to prior study.however, there is now increased dilation of the small and the large bowel with multiple air-fluid levels identified.previously administered oral contrast (administered for study two days prior) is seen in the descending and proximal sigmoid colon, extending to the level of the stent, though not entering the stented bowel.findings are compatible with obstruction secondary to infiltration of tumor within the sigmoid stent.the spleen is unchanged in appearance.there is persistent prominence of the pancreatic duct, stable from prior study, without a clear obstructing mass in the pancreatic head.the kidneys enhanced symmetrically and there is no hydronephrosis.there is no adrenal mass.there is extensive retroperitoneal adenopathy, also stable.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.the aorta and mesenteric vessels are widely patent.
